TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Test Series 2021-22
PreMatchCommentary: Sunny day start to the Boxing Day Test at Centurion. India won the toss and chose to bat first.
PostMatchCommentary: And India starts off the test series with a win! A great way to end 2021! South Africa has won every Test match at Centurion since 2014, and India has managed to breach the fortress, much like they did at the Gabba! Join us in 2022 for the second match of the series in Johannesburg!

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Test Series 2021-22
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of the second test match between India and South Africa at the Wanderers, Johannesburg. Wanderers have been a happy hunting ground for team India which has never lost a test match in this venue. Out of the five matches that have happened in this venue between India and South Africa, India has won two games and has drawn the remaining three games. Historically, the pitch suits the seamers who have bagged 93% of the wickets in this venue. Teams are expected to go in with a pace heavy attack. In the last 5 test matches that have happened here, the team batting first has won 4 times and the team batting second has won only once. The team winning the toss will most probably decide to bat first. Virat Kohli averages 77.5 in four innings in this venue which is the highest amongst all Indians but unfortunately, he misses out in today's game because of an upper back spasm. KL Rahul makes his debut as India's Test captain in the absence of Virat Kohli. INDIA HAS WON THE TOSS AND THEY WILL BAT FIRST.

India (Playing XI): KL Rahul(c), Mayank Agarwal, Cheteshwar Pujara, Ajinkya Rahane, Hanuma Vihari, Rishabh Pant(w), Ravichandran Ashwin, Shardul Thakur, Mohammed Shami, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj.

South Africa (Playing XI): Dean Elgar(c), Aiden Markram, Keegan Petersen, Rassie van der Dussen, Temba Bavuma, Kyle Verreynne(w), Marco Jansen, Kagiso Rabada, Keshav Maharaj, Duanne Olivier, Lungi Ngidi
PostMatchCommentary: That's it from this test then. South Africa level the Test series and have started the year on a high. Since 2013 all Test matches at The Wanderers have produced a result. Onto the decider now at Cape Town on the 11th of January. See you then!

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Test Series 2021-22
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live coverage of the third and final test match between India and South Africa and what a blockbuster it promises to be. The series is poised at 1-1 after India comprehensively won the opening test at Centurion, while the Proteas fought back and levelled the series at the Wanderers, a match in which the result could have gone either way. History-hunting India will look for a first test series win in South African soil and a maiden test win at the picturesque Cape Town.

 

Virat Kohli is back for the Newlands test after an upper back spasm kept the Indian skipper out of the second game, and the pace attack will see a shuffle with Kohli confirming that Mohammed Siraj was unfit after picking up an injury at Wanderers. Jasprit Bumrah will be keen on spearheading the Indian attack in the same venue where he made his test debut 4 years ago.

 

South African skipper Dean Elgar called this the biggest test match we have had in 10 or 15 years in his pre-match press conference and South Africa are likely to stick to their winning formula.

 

TOSS: India have won the toss and elect to bat. 

Virat Kohli comes back in as Hanuma Vihari misses out, while Umesh Yadav replaces Mohammed Siraj. South Africa go in unchanged.

 

Playing XI:

India: KL Rahul, Mayank Agarwal, Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli(C), Ajinkya Rahane, Rishabh Pant(WK), Ravichandran Ashwin, Shardul Thakur, Mohammed Shami, Jasprit Bumrah, Umesh Yadav

South Africa: Dean Elgar(C), Aiden Markram, Keegan Petersen, Rassie van der Dussen, Temba Bavuma, Kyle Verreynne(WK), Marco Jansen, Kagiso Rabada, Keshav Maharaj, Duanne Olivier, Lungi Ngidi
PostMatchCommentary:
Handshakes all around, and credit to both sides for a terrific series across the 3 tests! It began with K L Rahul's century at Centurion, while Dean Elgar led from the front at Johannesburg to level the series. Newlands was a fascinating series decider as both sides went tooth and nail, but it was the hosts who came out on top with a splendid series win. Rishabh Pant scored a magnificent century for India to set the hosts a target of 212. India went into Day 4 boosted by the wicket of the South African skipper in the final ball of Day 3, but the bowling attack was thwarted by the partnership between Keegan Petersen and Rassie van der Dussen that primarily steered the chase, with Temba Bavuma providing the finishing touches.

 

Virat Kohli, India Captain: It's a great spectacle of Tests for everyone to watch, it was a hard fought series. Great first game but South Africa did amazingly well. In both Tests they won, they were clinical with the ball in crunch moments.

 

They applied pressure long enough for us to make mistakes. It's the understanding of conditions for them. The batting has to be looked into, no running away from that.

 

Obviously very disappointed, we know how far we have come as a team. That fact that people expect us to beat South Africa in South Africa is testimony to how far we've come. We haven't done it, that's the reality, accept it and come back as better cricketers. Got to credit the opposition where due. 

 

I think the way K L Rahul batted as an opener was heartening, Mayank got stuck in on a couple of occasions, bowling was outstanding, few crucial knocks from the guys in the middle period, Rishabh Pant's knock in this Test was special, obviously Centurion win was special too. Take the positives and move ahead."

 

Dean Elgar, South Africa Captain: "I am pretty elated. Obviously will sink in a day or two, maybe this evening. Cannot be prouder of the group. If you want to operate at a high performance level, have to have tough chats. 

 

If you want to compete in Test cricket and be no.1 someday, you have to beat the best in the world. I'm really happy that things went well for us. 

We are by no means a finished article, I can tell you that. I'm already thinking of the next series.

 

Keegan Petersen has dominated domestic cricket, great to see him have a great series. Even though he's someone older, he's willing to learn. He's a proper character within that team environment. Proud of what he has achieved."

 

Keegan Petersen is named man of the match and man of the series

 

Keegan Petersen: " Don't know how I feel, it has not sunk in yet. It's a mixed bag to be honest. Happy, emotional. It has been challenging surfaces, challenging bowling attacks. It's been a long journey. We knew it was going to be difficult, they are a high quality bowling attack, a high quality team. Just spending time at the wicket is crucial. Evident longer you bat, easier it gets. I enjoyed every moment of it."

 

The One Day Series starts on the 19th of January. Join us for that!

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Odi Series 2021/22
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to Paarl for the first ODI of the series between India and South Africa. It's bright, sunny and no rain is expected. 

South Africa won the toss and will bat first.
PostMatchCommentary: That brings an end to the first ODI of the series. India started off very well with the ball, but a fantastic partnership between Bavuma and van der Dussen propelled South Africa to 296. India started well with the bat, with Dhawan scoring a classy 79 and Kohli scoring a fine 51. However, South Africa managed to pick regular wickets in the middle overs and made it difficult for India to score. South Africa takes a 1-0 lead in the series. Catch us on the 21st of January for the second ODI of the series.

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Odi Series 2021/22

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Odi Series 2021/22
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to live coverage of the second ODI between South Africa and India. KL Rahul-led India will be aiming to level the 3-match ODI series after South Africa clinched the first game. Boland Park at Paarl, the venue for the first ODI, will host the second game as well and with a short turn around, the pitch is expected to play dry and aid spinners. It's a sunny day at Paarl and it's almost time for the toss with the skippers out in the middle. 

 

TOSS: India have won the toss and elect to bat first. India go in unchanged, while Sisanda Magala comes in for Marco Jansen for the hosts.

KL Rahul: " I think it's pretty straightforward, second game on the same strip and it is important to put runs on the board. We are guessing the wicket will get slower later on."

Temba Bavuma: "We probably wanted to bat first. I think there will be opportunity in the first hour with the ball swinging, if we can take a couple of wickets and put them under pressure."

 

PLAYING XI:

INDIA: KL Rahul(C), Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant(WK), Shreyas Iyer, Venkatesh Iyer, R Ashwin, Shardul Thakur, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jasprit Bumrah, Yuzvendra Chahal

SOUTH AFRICA:Temba Bavuma(C), Quinton de Kock(WK), Janneman Malan, Aiden Markram, Rassie van der Dussen, David Miller, Andile Phehlukwayo, Keshav Maharaj, Lungi Ngidi, Sisanda Magala, Tabraiz Shamsi
PostMatchCommentary:
Batting first on a scorching day at Paarl, Shikhar Dhawan and K L Rahul got India off to a good start, Pant powered through the  middle overs, while Shardul Thakur and R Ashwin anchored the final phase to set a target of 288 for South Africa. In response, Janneman Malan and Quinton de Kock shared a century stand for the opening wicket, while Rassie van der Dussen and Aiden Markram finished the game with 11 deliveries to spare as South Africa go 2-0 up in the 3-game series. Join us for the final ODI on Sunday! 

KL Rahul, India Captain. "Good learning for us. Obviously not great to be on the losing side two games in a row. We are a team that takes a lot of pride in winning, but good learning for us and hopefully we can grow. Credit to them, they are showing us the importance of partnerships and putting pressure early on. (On positives so far) The way Virat and Shikhar batted in the first game. The way Rishabh batted today. It is not easy to come in with two down. He is a really important member of the team. Shardul has been hitting the ball well at the end. Jasprit Bumrah is obviously phenonemenal."

Temba Bavuma, South Africa Captain: "Very happy. That was the objective for us starting the series, we wanted to win it. Lot of positives to take from our performances. Spinners have done a splendid job. It's a great thing. We pride ourselves on fast bowlers, but to see the spin bowlers winning the game for us that really makes us a side to be reckoned with."

Quinton de Kock, Player of the Match: "It was nice to be out there and score couple of runs,  I think me and Janneman Malan are both similar and have a great understanding. The more I batted, the more I felt my rhythm was coming back."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Odi Series 2021/22
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the live coverage of the final ODI between India and South Africa. Change of venues as we move to Newlands today. India will look to continue their good run with the bat, highlighted by Pant's counter-attacking fifty in the previous encounter, and will look to come good with the ball today and finish the series with a win.

 

TOSS: India has won the toss and elected to field first.

 

Four Changes for the Indian Team as they look to try out their options whereas South Africa brings in Pretorius for Shamsi.

 

PLAYING XI :

India XI: S Dhawan, K L Rahul (c), V Kohli, S Iyer, R Pant (wk), S Yadav, J Yadav, P Krishna, D Chahar, J Bumrah, Y Chahal

South Africa XI: Q de Kock (wk), J Malan, A Markram, R van der Dussen, T Bavuma (c), D Miller, A Phehlukwayo, K Maharaj, D Pretorius, S Magala, L Ngidi
PostMatchCommentary:
An incredible final game of the tour that went right down to the wire as South Africa come through by 4 runs! Deepak Chahar almost got India home with a special knock, but the hosts hung on to win the series 3-0. Both sides had momentum swing their way- with Quinton De Kock powering a fine century before India's bowlers pegged them back. Virat Kohli and Shikhar Dhawan led India's chase with well-made half-centuries with contributions from Suryakumar Yadav and a superb counter-attacking 54 from Deepak Chahar, but South Africa held their nerve and sealed the win in the final over. 

K L Rahul, Captain, India :" Deepak gave us a real chance. It was quite an exciting game, disappointing that we ended up on the losing side. We gave ourselves a real chance, something we can learn from and get better. What has always stood out for us is the energy and the passion. We have had a great time in South Africa, we were looked after really well, thanks to CSA."

Quinton De Kock, Player of the Match and Player of the Series:" The pitch wasn't flat at all, I tried to remain positive. Had a week of training after I came back after the break; was just trying to find some rhythm. "

Temba Bavuma, Captain, South Africa: "Things got a bit crazy at the end. Perhaps the complacency got to us, but we managed to get things back. Very satisfying, it's mission accomplished for us as a team. We are making good strides as a team. The Test series was the hardest series I was a part of, the Indian bowlers kept asking the hard questions. In one-dayers too it wasn't easy, very challenging."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: WEST INDIES TOUR OF INDIA ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the live coverage of the historic 1000TH ODI for India, where they face off against West Indies in Ahmedabad. Rohit Sharma is back and will take charge for the first time as the full-time Indian ODI captain.

 

INDIA HAS WON THE TOSS AND HAS ELECTED TO FIELD FIRST! Deepak Hooda gets his ODI cap and is all set to play his first match.
PostMatchCommentary:
A memorable 1000th ODI game for India as they beat West Indies by 6 wickets and take a 1-0 lead in the ODI series. After opting to bowl first, spin duo Yuzvendra Chahal and Washington Sundar did most of the damage with the ball, scalping 7-wickets between them to restrict West Indies to 176. Rohit Sharma top scored in the chase with 60, before debutant Deepak Hooda and Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten half-century stand guided the hosts to victory. 

 

Kieron Pollard, Captain, West Indies: "Losing with 22 overs to spare is not ideal, it is a heavy defeat . Have to take stock of that. Getting four wickets there shows if we put some runs we can compete. Toss is also a crucial factor, it is very wet out there now. The lower-order batting from Jason Holder and Fabian Allen, Alzarri Joseph and Akeal Hosein did the work for us with the ball - those were the positives from today. "

 

Rohit Sharma, Captain, India: "We want to keep getting better as a team it was a great effort from everyone. We ticked all the boxes. I'm open to a lot of things if we need to change. The goal is we should be able to achieve whatever the team wants. But, honestly, I don't think we need to change a whole lot. All I will ask of the players is to challenge yourself. I have been out for a while, haven't played for two months but I was back home hitting the balls. I knew there was a long season ahead. Had a good net session here and I was confident going into this game. Can take a lot of positives from today, the pitch had something in it. There was softness early on and in this particular game, the toss became important.  I honestly want to take it away from the play, but if you win the toss, you take advantage of it."

 

Yuzvendra Chahal is the Man of the Match for figures of 4/49! 

Yuzvendra Chahal: "Washington struck twice in an over, so the pressure was on them. and I just wanted to maintain that pressure. Watching Washington bowl, felt that the ball was gripping. Had a chat with Rohit, Virat, and they said the pace was important."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: WEST INDIES TOUR OF INDIA ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello, and welcome to the 2nd ODI between India and West Indies. West Indies won the toss and chose to bowl first. 

An Indian victory today will ensure that India will take an unassailable lead in this series.
PostMatchCommentary:
India wins the 2nd ODI and also wins the series! A fantastic performance by the men in blue! West Indies started off well with the ball, but the partnership between Suryakumar Yadav and KL Rahul brought India back into the game. Further contributions from Sundar and Hooda took India to 237. With the ball, Krishna was the standout bowler, taking 4-12 from 9 overs. He also had support from Chahal, Thakur, Sundar, and Hooda who were amongst the wickets.

Post Match Presentation:

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies captain:  "We let it slip with the bat. We weren't able to put up partnerships, we kept losing wickets. The more cricket we play together, hopefully, it will help us as batters. Odean is special. He is a strong guy, runs in can bowl 145. He is still young. With experience, the sky is the limit for him."

Rohit Sharma, India captain: "Winning the series is a good feeling without a doubt. There were some challenges that we had to face today. That partnership between KL and Suryakumar Yadav. That is the maturity we need. We got to a respectable total, which was important. With the ball we were outstanding. The entire unit came together and performed together as a unit. It is important for these guys to bat in those kind of situations. That is when you can judge them. Today's knock will give Surya a lot of confidence. The pitch was not easy. So he batted and did what the team wanted and not what he wants to do. KL too, and that little innings from Hooda in the end. I have been asked to do different things, so this was different. People will be happy seeing Rishabh open then, but yeah it is not permanent. We will get Shikhar back next game, and he need some game time. It is not always the results. We want to try a few things with the long term in the mind so we don't mind if we lose the odd game in the process. I was a little surprised to not see the dew but again I am not taking anything away from the bowling unit. I have not seen that kind of spell in a long long time in India. He bowled with skill, he bowled with pace. All in all a great bowling effort."

Prasidh Krishna, Player of the Match: "I have been striving to do this for quite some time now, so I am happy it came off and we won the match. Nothing special, I was just looking to hit the good areas. Even when I went to bat it was still seaming so I knew there was something in it for me when we bowled. I wanted to keep it tight, keep it simple, and let the ball do the talking. Be as consistent as possible, bowl straighter lines, bowl good lengths."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: WEST INDIES TOUR OF INDIA ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary: Welcome to the 3rd ODI between India and West Indies. India won the toss and chose to bat first.
PostMatchCommentary:
India wins by 96 runs and beats West Indies 3-0 for the first time in ODI's! India managed to score a competitive total of 265, largely due to contributions from Iyer, Pant, Chahar and Sundar. India was also clinical with the ball, with Prasidh Krishna being the pick of the bowlers again with 3-27.

 

West Indies captain, Nicholas Pooran: "Wonderful opportunity. Must say congratulations to Rohit Sharma and Rahul Dravid, first white ball series victory for them. The way we bowled in the series was wonderful. We have a lot of work to do with bowling and batting, more so batting this series. The way the boys bowled was fantastic. It seems like we are better at the shorter format, but we need to put in work in the longer format."

Player of the Match, Shreyas Iyer:  "To be honest, life was really tough for me last two months. Had an infection and Covid, but this day has summed up for all those days. I am flexible to bat anywhere but number 4 is the best number to bat at. If I am thrown into a pressure situation like today, I like to thrive on it and enjoy those moments. When I go in, like today's situation, I had to play off the new ball. For that, you need to have good skills and play close to the body. From there you need to set the rhythm through the innings. It's not easy, but if you focus on your skills you can do it."

Player of the Series, Prasidh Krishna: "Now that I've been practicing and played a few Vijay Hazare matches I have a few overs in me and am in rhythm. Anything going to the keeper or the slips, I like that kind of wickets. Today both wickets I got, it was quite nice to see the ball get the carry and good to have people behind who won't miss out when you create an opportunity. When you are running in and see the ball flying to the keeper, it's what any fast bowler wants. The kind of guys we have in the team, everybody is good and we've been learning from each other. Anybody who turns up can do very well - that's the team effort. Still being grounded that way, it's a team effort. If we look at the three games, we batted quite well even though the wicket had something."

India captain, Rohit Sharma: "Definitely not looking at those numbers (captaincy record). Have ticked a lot of boxes in this series. Whatever we wanted to get out of this series, we pretty much got. Noise will be around as long as we're playing. People look up to us, everybody watches us. As players, as individuals, we know what we need to focus on. Outside noise doesn't bother the dressing room. Said it in the last game as well - never seen something like that in India (Prasidh's spell). Good to have someone who can hit the deck and get that bounce. Although I didn't feel like this was Indian conditions, was good to see the fast bowlers actually. Was also impressed with Siraj. And then Shardul and Deepak did the job for us. Both Kuldeep and Chahal are crucial players for us. Especially Kuldeep. Chahal was very much in the plans and Kuldeep went off the radar. It was important to get him back slowly. Important to give them that confidence. We start expecting things early than expected, important to give them some cushion. Pretty sure we'll see them together soon. That was the biggest takeway for us - the middle-order batting. Today was again a great game for the middle order. We were 40/3. For me, that's the biggest takeaway."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: WEST INDIES TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 1st T20I between India and West Indies at Eden Gardens, Kolkata. India swept the ODI series 3-0 and will want to carry forward the momentum into this three-match series. India lead the head-to-head in T20Is 10-6 and an exciting series awaits us between the two big-hitting sides!

Toss: India won the toss and opt to bowl. Skipper Rohit Sharma confirms Ravi Bishnoi will make his debut. 

 

Playing XI: 

India: R Sharma (c), I Kishan, V Kohli, S Yadav, R Pant (wk), V Iyer, D Chahar, H Patel, B Kumar, Y Chahal, R Bishnoi

West Indies: B King, K Mayers, N Pooran (wk), K Pollard (c), R Powell, R Chase, F Allen, R Shepherd, O Smith, A Hosein, S Cottrell
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Ov) :- 

West Indies - 44/1 ||  India - 58/0

Middle Overs (7-11 Ov) :- 

West Indies - 30/3 ||  India - 31/1

Middle Overs (12-16 Ov) :- 

West Indies - 34/1 ||  India - 37/3

Death Overs (17-20 Ov) :- 

West Indies - 49/2 ||  India - 36/0


India chase the target with 7 balls to spare, and go 1-0 up in the 3-match T20I series! Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan got India off to a steady start, but West Indies fought back with some tight bowling and wickets before Suryakumar Yadav and Venkatesh Iyer shared an unbeaten 48*-run stand to take India home. Earlier, after being put in to bat, Kyle Mayers and Nicholas Pooran were the mainstays in the West Indies batting as they put on 157/7. Debutant Ravi Bishnoi scalped 2 wickets, while Harshal Patel also bagged 2. 

Kieron Pollard, West Indies Captain: "Between overs 6 to 15 we scored too few runs, if we had scored 15-20 more runs it would have been competitive. I thought the bowlers and fielders did really well to pull things back. The guys are working hard to get things right and again it's just a matter of setting it up properly."

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We should have finished that off. We wanted to be a bit clinical in the end. We can take a lot of confidence. It was a great effort by the bowlers to restrict them. Bishnoi is a very talented guy, we see something different which is why we drafted him into the squad straight away. We see something different in him. He's got a bright future and it's just about us now on how we use him. I'm happy to have that kind of challengers rather than not having players available and not in form."

Ravi Bishnoi is the man of the match on debut.

Ravi Bishnoi: "I was feeling very good, it's everyone's dream to play for India. West Indies is one of the best T20 teams and I got the chance to play against them. My strength is my length. It's a dream come true."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: WEST INDIES TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of the second T20I between India and West Indies at Eden Gardens. India have the chance to seal the series today following a 6-wicket win in the first game, where Ravi Bishnoi had a dream debut with a player of the match performance. West Indies skipper Kieron Pollard is all set to play his 100th T20I.

 

Toss: West Indies have won the toss and elect to field.

India XI: R Sharma (c), I Kishan, V Kohli, S Yadav, R Pant (wk), V Iyer, D Chahar, H Patel, B Kumar, Y Chahal, R Bishnoi

West Indies XI: B King, K Mayers, N Pooran (wk), K Pollard (c), R Powell, R Chase, J Holder, R Shepherd, O Smith, A Hosein, S Cottrell
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Ov) :- 

India - 49/1 || West Indies - 41/1

Middle Overs (7-15 Ov) :- 

India -75/3 || West Indies - 83/1

Death Overs (16-20 Ov) :- 

India -62/1 || West Indies - 54/1

 

India win a thrilling game and seal the T20I series 2-0 as they notch up their 100th T20I win. Rovman Powell and Nicholas Pooran's century partnership threatened to take the game away from the hosts but India's Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Harshal Patel held their nerve to see out the game. Earlier, Rishabh Pant and Venkatesh Iyer shared an attacking 76-run stand for the fifth wicket, while Virat Kohli was at his aggressive best with his 30th T20I fifty as India posted 186/5.

 

Kieron Pollard, West Indies Captain: "He (Rovman) was phenomenal today. He and Pooran almost took us over the line. Pleased with the guys. They have quality bowlers, you have to give credit where it's due. In the first game you could have said we were a bit slow in the middle overs but we corrected that here. We can look at it in different ways how we could have got those eight runs. We are a work in progress."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "You are always a bit scared when you are playing against these guys. In the end it was a phenomenal game. Right from the start we knew it wouldn't be easy, but it was great how we executed our plans under pressure. It was very critical at that point when Bhuvneshwar bowled. That's where experience comes into play, he has been doing it for many years. The way Virat started he took the pressure off me as well. It was a very important innings. And great finish by Rishabh and Venky Iyer. To see that sort of maturity from Iyer is very pleasing. He looks confident and towards the end he asked me if I wanted to give him an over."

 

Rishabh Pant is the player of the match

Rishabh Pant: "I am fine wherever the team wants me to bat. I think the more you practice, the better you get (on his scoop).  The only thing we were talking was that we will play according to every ball. He (Powell) was hitting bullets. At the back of my mind I was happy as well as Powell will be playing for Delhi Capitals, but we are playing for India now and we have to win every game."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: WEST INDIES TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
India and West Indies clash for the last time in Kolkata this evening after India took an unassailable lead in the series. The Men in Blue will look to complete a clean sweep whereas the Men in Maroon will try to get their first win of the tour. 

 

TOSS:- West Indies won the toss and elected to field. Avesh Khan is set to make his debut tonight!

India XI:- R Gaikwad, I Kishan (wk), R Sharma (c), S Iyer, S Yadav, V Iyer, D Chahar, H Patel, S Thakur, A Khan, R Bishnoi
West Indies XI:- S Hope, K Mayers, N Pooran (wk), K Pollard (c), R Powell, R Chase, J Holder, R Shepherd, F Allen, D Drakes, H Walsh
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Ov) :- 

India - 43/1 (7.2 rpo) || West Indies - 68/2 (11.3 rpo)
Middle Overs (7-11 Ov) :- 

India - 35/2 (7 rpo) || West Indies - 30/3 (6 rpo)

Middle Overs (12-16 Ov) :- 
India - 37/1 (7.4 rpo) || West Indies - 36/1 (7.2 rpo)
Death Overs (17-20 Ov) :- 
India - 69/1 (17.3 rpo) || West Indies - 33/3 (8.3 rpo)
 
For the second game in a row the West Indies batters took the game deep but the Indian bowlers stood up to the task to seal their ninth consecutive win in T20I's. Nicholas Pooran scored his third consecutive half century and was well supported by Romario Shepherd towards the end but Harshal Patel and Shardul Thakur used their variations perfectly to scalp 5 wickets between them. Deepak Chahar and Venkatesh Iyer also bagged two wickets. Earlier Suryakumar Yadav and Venkatesh Iyer lit up the Eden gardens with a power packed 91(37) run stand with the former scoring 65(31) with 7 sixes.
 
 
India are now the number 1 ranked T20I side.
 
 
Kieron Pollard, West Indies Captain : "We were in the game for 15 overs, but we gave them 80 odd in the last five. In the T20 series, Nicholas Pooran showed his consistency. Rovman Powell showing that he wants to be a part and parcel of the white-ball set up. These guys are getting opportunities and they are putting in the hard yards and they are learning on the go."
 
 
Suryakumar Yadav is named the Player of the Match and Player of the Series.
 
Suryakumar Yadav: "Just wanted to replicate what I did in the first game. Once Rohit got out, needed someone to stay. We had team meetings as to how we are going to react under pressure and it came out very well."
 
 
Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "The team that used to chase, there are not many people here from that squad. We wanted to bat first and chase as well, because our middle order is fairly new. Happy with the series. It is a good sign going forward as a group, something to be proud off. Getting the team out of difficult situations - that's what we wanted. The middle order making it count and we want to tick the boxes. I was impressed with our seam bowling in ODIs and even here Harshal is new, Avesh is on debut. Few guys miss out for the Sri Lanka series because we want to keep them fresh. But we have the World Cup in mind and we are trying to give game time for individuals. I am not someone who looks at the opposition, I would like to focus on what we can do."

GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
TossDetails: Sri Lanka won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: SRI LANKA TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to live commentary of the first T20I between India and Sri Lanka at Lucknow. Top-ranked India are coming off a 3-0 series whitewash win against West Indies as their preparation for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup continue. Suryakumar Yadav and Deepak Chahar have been ruled out due to injuries, while Sri Lanka will be without their star all-arounder Wanindu Hasaranga due to COVID. India lead the T20I head-to-head 14-7.

 

Toss: Sri Lanka won the toss and elect to bowl first. Deepak Hooda is set to make his T20I debut for India. 

Playing XI

INDIA: R Sharma (c), I Kishan (wk), S Iyer, S Samson, D Hooda, V Iyer, R Jadeja, H Patel, B Kumar, J Bumrah, Y Chahal

SRI LANKA: P Nissanka, K Mishara, C Asalanka, D Chandimal (wk), J Liyanage, D Shanaka (c), C Karunaratne, D Chameera, L Kumara, J Vandersay, P Jayawickrama
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Ov) :- 

India - 58/0 (9.7 rpo) || Sri Lanka - 29/2 (4.8 rpo)
Middle Overs (7-11 Ov) :- 

India - 48/0 (9.6 rpo) || Sri Lanka - 31/3 (6.2 rpo)
Middle Overs (12-16 Ov) :- 

India - 41/1 (8.2 rpo) || Sri Lanka - 38/1 (7.6 rpo)

Death Overs (17-20 Ov)

India - 52/1 (13 rpo) || Sri Lanka - 39/0 (9.8 rpo)

 

India begins the T20I series against Sri Lanka with a comprehensive win by 62 runs. After being put into bat, Ishan Kishan and Rohit Sharma got India off to a solid start with a century stand for the opening wicket, with the former going on to score 89, with 10 fours and 3 sixes. Shreyas Iyer took forward the momentum with a brisk half-century as India posted a mammoth 199/2 in 20 overs. Bhuvneshwar Kumar then got India off to a flying start with the ball, striking with the first ball, and Sri Lanka never really got going in their chase, with Charith Asalanka's 53 being the highlight of their innings. Chamika Karunaratne provided some big hits towards the end as Sri Lanka posted 137 on the board.


Dasun Shanaka, Captain, Sri Lanka: "We were really poor in all 3 departments, they batted beautifully and read the game very well. We are without our main spinners, Theekshana and Hasaranga, the replacements have not got the experience yet. Hope Asalanka carries forward in the next game and makes it count. Chamika Karunaratne is bowling beautifully, situation did not allow me to bowl long, he's our main strike bowler."

Rohit Sharma, Captain, India; "I know the mindset and ability of Ishan Kishan, just about getting the knock he played today, getting the rhythm, he constructed his innings very well, especially after 6 overs, he likes to play his shots. Very happy with Jadeja's comeback. We want more from him, I want him to bat up the order, we have seen in the last few years how improved he is in his batting especially, we want to use that. We are very clear in what we want to achieve with him in limited-overs. I love playing on big grounds, you are tested as a batsman, your mindset, here you got to use batsmanship you have to try and see areas you have to attack. We had a brief chat on how we want to approach this ground. It's something that's happening, quite consistently, it's not expected at this level. Our fielding coach has some work to do, it's something we want to keep improving and come Australia, we want to be the best fielding side, can't afford to make mistakes."

Ishan Kishan is named the Player of the Match

Ishan Kishan: "I got to learn from the last 3 games against West Indies, I didn't have that much intent. I wasn't that positive. Here I tried to keep it simple and what the team wanted. I think pull is my favourite and I really enjoyed that shot today. We have seen their videos and they love bowling short and heading into the World Cup, we know we need to get used to grounds like this, hitting the gaps and taking the ones and twos. Spoke to Shreyas about the mid wicket region and it went my way today."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: SRI LANKA TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the live coverage of the 2ND T20I between India and Sri Lanka at the picturesque Dharamsala stadium. India will aim to get their 11th straight T20I victory and seal the series whereas the Islanders will look to level the series. 

India have won the toss and elected to field.

India XI: R Sharma (c), I Kishan (wk), S Iyer, S Samson, D Hooda, V Iyer, R Jadeja, H Patel, B Kumar, J Bumrah, Y Chahal
Sri Lanka XI: P Nissanka, D Gunathilaka, K Mishara, C Asalanka, D Chandimal (wk), D Shanaka (c), C Karunaratne, D Chameera, L Kumara, B Fernando, P Jayawickrama
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Ov) :- 

Sri Lanka - 32/0 (5.3 rpo)   ||  India - 46/2 (7.7 rpo)
Middle Overs (7-11 Ov) :- 

Sri Lanka - 44/3 (8.8 rpo)   ||  India - 45/0 (9.0 rpo)
Middle Overs (12-16 Ov) :- 

Sri Lanka - 54/1 (10.8 rpo)  ||  India - 84/1 (16.8 rpo)
Death Overs (17-20 Ov) :- 

Sri Lanka - 53/1 (13.3 rpo)  ||  India - 11/0 (9.4 rpo)

 

 

It was not an easy chase, but top-ranked India showed their T20I prowess as they chased a target of 184 to secure their 11th consecutive T20I win. Shreyas Iyer was the mainstay in the batting, notching up his highest T20I score. He was well supported first by Sanju Samson and then Ravindra Jadeja, who powered an 18-ball 45-run unbeaten cameo. India thumped 84 runs in Overs 12-16 as they chased with 17 balls to spare. Earlier, opening bat Pathum Nissanka scored a fine 75, while Dasun Shanaka blasted 5 sixes in his 19-ball 47*-run innings to power Sri Lanka to a competitive 183.  
 

Dasun Shanaka, Captain, Sri Lanka: "It was a good score in the conditions, we started well. The ball did a bit during the powerplay, if we got another wicket it would have been better. The wicket was superb, the ball was coming on nicely and I was looking to play to my strengths."

 

 Rohit Sharma, Captain, India: "The middle order coming out and performing is good to see, these guys taking the responsibility and finishing off games. I don't want to be too harsh on the bowlers. We bowled well in the first few overs to restrict them. To finish the way they did was really good. I thought Sanju showed how well he could play with that knock, it's all about taking your opportunities. Jaddu came and looked positive from ball one and Shreyas also, could not have asked more from him. When you win the series, there are guys who haven't had the opportunities. We'll sit down and take a call tomorrow if we need to rotate. End of the day, we need to keep winning."


Shreyas Iyer is named the player of the match 

Shreyas Iyer: "The shuffle across is my go-to movement and I feel my body releases and I sight the ball well. Ishan started well, but when he got out, Sanju also got us going, and then Jaddu bhai came out to close the match for us. It was a bit flat, I thought stepping out would be a good option."

TossDetails: Sri Lanka won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: SRI LANKA TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to live commentary of the third and final T20I between India and Sri Lanka at Dharamsala. Shreyas Iyer notched up his highest T20I score as India's middle-order powered them to a brilliant win in the chase to seal the series 2-0. Ishan Kishan had an unfortunate hit on his helmet in the second game, and has been ruled out of the third T20I.

 

Toss: Sri Lanka have won the toss and chose to bat first

 

Playing XI: 

India: R Sharma (c), V Iyer, S Iyer, S Samson (wk), D Hooda, R Jadeja, H Patel, K Yadav, M Siraj, A Khan, R Bishnoi

Sri Lanka: P Nissanka, D Gunathilaka, J Liyanage, C Asalanka, D Chandimal (wk), D Shanaka (c), C Karunaratne, D Chameera, L Kumara, B Fernando, J Vandersay
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Ov) :- 

Sri Lanka - 18/3 (3.0 rpo)  ||  India - 47/1 (7.8 rpo)
Middle Overs (7-11 Ov) :- 

Sri Lanka - 34/1 (6.8 rpo)  ||  India - 46/2 (9.2 rpo)
Middle Overs (12-16 Ov) :- 

Sri Lanka - 38/1 (7.6 rpo)  ||  India - 43/1 (8.6 rpo)
Death Overs (17-20 Ov) :- 

Sri Lanka - 56/0 (14.0 rpo) ||  India - 12/0 (14.4 rpo)

 

Just like the second T20I, it was Shreyas Iyer and Ravindra Jadeja who guided India home to a comfortable 6-wicket win against Sri Lanka in the final T20I. Shreyas capped off a memorable series, anchoring the chase with an unbeaten 73, notching up his third consecutive half-century. India recorded their 12th consecutive win in T20I, as they record their third consecutive 3-0 T20I series win at home. After opting to bat first, Sri Lanka's batting was rattled as Avesh Khan and Mohammed Siraj scalped 3 early wickets to leave the visitors stranded at 29/4. Skipper Dasun Shanaka then played an excellent knock of 74 to lift them to 146/5.  

Dasun Shanaka, Captain, Sri Lanka: "I want to congratulate India for a wonderful series. Hopefully not a bad injury, it's an open one, need to put stitches on this. Tough tour, without our senior bowlers it has been tough, we should adapt to the condition. In the first 6 overs again the batsmen didn't capitalize. The pace attack was outstanding throughout, and over the last year. It's not about pace, it's about control, I am very much happy about my form, hopefully I can continue. This is international cricket, when it comes to cricket we need to adapt."

 

Shreyas Iyer is named the Player of the Match and Player of the Series.

Shreyas Iyer:  "All 3 knocks were special, yesterday one we won the series, came at a crucial time, helped the team win, so maybe the last one was the most special. You only require one ball to get into the form as long as you keep your eyes on the ball and play the ball on merit. The wicket was two-paced today compared to yesterday, wanted to dominate as well, wanted to punish the loose balls, just have to back your instincts. It's been a roller-coaster journey after injury. The Rehab phase was a real test, I am really glad I got through that phase."

 

Rohit Sharma, Captain, India: "Yeah, it's a factor of everything that comes together, we did it collectively as a team. A lot of positives came out of the series, happy where we stand at the moment. Individuals want to do well, wanted to understand our bench strength also, wanted to give opportunities and they did well. I wouldn't completely agree (we are a conservative T20 side), we do understand at times we have held back ourselves. It is important to tell guys not to worry about their position in the team, you are here to do the job, doesn't mean you always have to score runs and take wickets. Trying to fill whatever gaps we have and we want to move forward. Going to be a big challenge, nice to have guys in former rather than not in form. Always nice to see guys make opportunities count. You move from strength to strength."

GroundName: Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium
Commentss: India Won by an innings and 222 Runs
TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: SRI LANKA TOUR OF INDIA TEST SERIES 2022
Comments: India Won by an innings and 222 Runs
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the live coverage of the First Test between India and Sri Lanka, as Rohit Sharma starts his stint as captain in the longest format of the game. This Test also marks Virat Kohli's 100th appearance in the format, the second quickest Indian to this landmark. Opponents Sri Lanka have a 100% win record in this cycle of the World Test Championship and are top of the table. India have never lost a test at home to Sri Lanka and will look to hold that record.

TOSS:- India won the toss and elected to bat.

Playing XI:-
India XI: R Sharma (c), M Agarwal, H Vihari, V Kohli, S Iyer, R Pant (wk), R Jadeja, R Ashwin, M Shami, J Bumrah, J Yadav
Sri Lanka XI: D Karunaratne, L Thirimanne, P Nissanka, C Asalanka, D De Silva, A Mathews , N Dickwella (wk), L Embuldeniya, S Lakmal, L Kumara, V Fernando
PostMatchCommentary:
DAY 1:-
India - 357/6 in 85 Overs (4.2 rpo)
DAY 2:-
India - 217/2 in 44.2 Overs (4.9 rpo) || Sri Lanka - 108/4 in 43 Overs (2.5 rpo)
DAY 3:-

Sri Lanka - 244/16 in 82 Overs (3.0 rpo)

India win by an innings and 222 runs, their second-biggest margin of victory in Tests against Sri Lanka, to take a 1-0 Series lead at Mohali. Jadeja top-scored with the bat and remained unbeaten for India before shining with the ball again, picking up 9 wickets in the match. The second test of the series is a Day/Night game at Bangalore starting on the 12th of March. Join us then!

 

Dimuth Karunaratne, Sri Lanka captain: We never thought it would finish by day three. The batters need to put their hands up and bat longer innings. When you are playing against India you have to capitalize on the starts, once you get in you have to score big. We were too defensive or too aggressive with the bat, need to get a balance between both by rotating the strike and that's how you play big innings. As a batting unit, we have to put our hands up and score big. We did well for the first two sessions but could not execute when the ball got old and those are things we need to work on.

Rohit Sharma, India captain: It was a good start, it was a great game of cricket from our perspective. We ticked all the boxes we wanted to. To be honest I didn't think it is going to be that kind of a Test match that would get over in three days. It was a good batting pitch, there was some turn and some assistance for the seamers as well. A lot of credit to the guys, they bowled very well in tandem, kept the pressure, and never made it easier for the Sri Lanka batsmen. We just ensured we applied pressure from both ends. The highlight of the game was Jadeja. There was a question of whether to declare or not, it was the team's decision, Jadeja's decision to put them in, and shows how selfless he is. It will be our third pink-ball Test we will be playing at home and not many have played, it will be a challenge. Let's see what kind of pitch we are playing and then take it from there.

Ravindra Jadeja is the Player of the match!

Ravindra Jadeja, Player of the Match: I would say this is my lucky ground, whenever I come here I get positive vibes. I was looking to build a partnership with Rishabh, give him the strike and enjoy his batting from the other end. To be honest I don't know about any stat. Feeling very good, happy to score runs and pick wickets for the team. Obviously, as a player, you boost your confidence with such a performance. I have not done anything differently, just played to my strengths. I haven't played with the SG pink ball, so it is going to be different and I will practice for a couple of days, hopefully it comes good.

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: SRI LANKA TOUR OF INDIA TEST SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the live commentary of the 2ND Test between India and Sri Lanka at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru, as the city decks itself up for it's first-ever D/N Pink Ball Test. After an innings victory over the Islanders in the first Test in Mohali, the Men in Blue will look to maintain their unbeaten record at home against Sri Lanka.

TOSS:- India won the toss and elected to bat first.

Playing XI:-
India XI: R Sharma (c), M Agarwal, H Vihari, V Kohli, S Iyer, R Pant (wk), R Jadeja, R Ashwin, A Patel, M Shami, J Bumrah
Sri Lanka XI: D Karunaratne (c), L Thirimanne, K Mendis, A Mathews, D De Silva, C Asalanka, N Dickwella (wk), S Lakmal, L Embuldeniya, V Fernando, P Jayawickrama
PostMatchCommentary:
DAY 1:-

India - 252/10 in 59.1 Overs (4.3 rpo) || Sri Lanka - 86/6 in 30 Overs (2.9 rpo)
DAY 2:-

Sri Lanka - 23/4 in 5.5 Overs (3.9 rpo) || India - 303/9 in 68.5 Overs (4.4 rpo)  || Sri Lanka - 28/1 in 7 Overs (4.0 rpo) 

DAY 3:-

Sri Lanka - 180/9 in 52.3 Overs (3.4 rpo)

 

India win the Day/Night Test at Bangalore by 238 runs and seal the series 2-0, to move up to 4th in the World Test Championship table! A brilliant half-century from Shreyas Iyer helped India post a fighting total on board, after which Bumrah took the limelight, picking up his first 5-fer in home conditions to restrict Sri Lanka to 109. Fifties from Shreyas Iyer and Rishabh Pant in the third innings helped India set a mammoth target of 447. Dimuth Karunaratne and Kusal Mendis put on a fight with the bat for Sri Lanka but Ashwin and Bumrah picked up 7 wickets between them to give India the victory.

 

Dimuth Karunaratne, Sri Lanka captain - "I would have been happier if we had won, but it was a tough one, we batted under lights and it was tough. We have a good team, the batting didn't capitalize on these conditions, the bowling was good, but we kept bowling loose deliveries every now and then, that's what we need to work on going further. There have been several youngsters coming up and this was an experience for them. It has been special playing alongside Lakmal and I wish him well for the upcoming county season."

 

Rohit Sharma, India captain - "It's been a good run, enjoyed it personally and as a team, there were so many things we wanted to achieve and I think we did. Shreyas just carried on from the T20s, he didn't get out there a single time and he's carried it into the Tests. Pant seems to get better in every Test, especially in these conditions. The England series at home was challenging but looks like the confidence is back, with his catches and stumpings. Ashwin does something for the team whenever he's given the ball, gives a match-winning performance every time he's given the ball, so I think he's a legend of the game. The crowd coming back and celebrating with us has been so pleasing."

 

Shreyas Iyer is the Player of the Match.

Shreyas Iyer - "That wasn't my normal approach, but I saw the batters struggling, so I knew I had to be attacking and put the pressure back on the bowlers. I have always dreamt about playing Test cricket for India, good feeling to come and contribute, want to keep this going."

 

Rishabh Pant is the Player of the Series.

Rishabh Pant - "I think you need to keep evolving with both batting and keeping, I've made mistakes in the past and want to keep improving. It's not in my mindset, the wicket was difficult to play, so I thought I will look for quick runs. With regards to keeping I think it's more about confidence, previously, I used to think too much, now I'm only focusing on every ball."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India T20 Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the first T20I of South Africa tour of India. This match is to be held at Arun Jaitely Stadium, Delhi. The ICC top-ranked team - India is set to host South Africa for five T20I matches and it would be an exciting contest. Rishabh Pant will lead India for the first time in the absence of injured KL Rahul who was announced initially as the captain. If India wins this match, it will be a world record to win 13 T20I games on a trot. Will India win and register their record or will South Africa start well in this series? 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

When the last time South Africa faced India for the T20I series was in 2019. The three-match T20I series ended in a tie with both the teams winning one game.

 

VENUE STATS:-

The average first innings score at this venue is 195 in IPL 2021. This venue has favoured the teams batting second as the teams have won three out of the four matches in 2021's IPL. Will we see another high-scoring thriller tonight?

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Deep Dasgupta: "The last international game played here was way back in 2019. The dimensions are small here, only 61 meters on the western side and 63 on the eastern, straight down is 74. It looks like it has a bit of grass which is dry. It is a little patchy but the surface itself is quite firm. You can see the cracks here which might help the spinners but still seems a high scoring match. Dew is not a factor."

 

TOSS:-

South Africa have won the toss and they elect to bowl first!

 

Temba Bavuma, South Africa Captain: "We are going to have a bowl first.It was a bit slow and stoppy at the beginning, hopefully we can exploit that and restrict them to a decent score and chase it down. Aiden was not available for selection as he tested positive for Covid, Stubbs comes and it is a debut for him. We have two all-rounders, Dwaine and Parnell. It is an important series as we haven't been together as a group since the World Cup, it is a preparation for the World Cup coming up in Australia."

 

Rishabh Pant, India Captain: "I think it's a good surface and I don't mind batting first. Had I won the toss, I would have bowled. Captaining India is one of the proudest moments in my career. Thank you for the opportunity. We're trying to give roles to different players. We know our XI but at the same time we are giving different roles to players and see how they cope with that going forward. Ishan and Ruturaj will open. DK is back."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 51/0 (8.5 rpo, 6x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 61/2 (10.2 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 99/2 (11.0 rpo, 6x4, 7x6) || South Africa- 87/1 (9.6 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 61/2 (12.2 rpo, 4x4, 5x6) || South Africa- 64/0 (15.2 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)

 

The first match of the Paytm T20 series between India and South Africa comes to an end with SA chasing the highest total posted against them. After being put to bat first, the IND batters started off well with 51 runs in the powerplay. Ishan Kishan constructed 76 runs and the other middle-order batters took up on the spinners and scored 70 runs from the five overs of which the spinners bowled. R Pant (29 off 16) and H Pandya (31* off 12) played explosively and guided the team to a total of 211 which was the highest against SA. With a huge target to chase, D Pretorius bravely took on the bowlers and played an aggressive brand of cricket but the team lost two wickets within the powerplay. R Van Der Dussen (75* off 46) and D Miller (64* off 31) then partnered for 131* runs and chased the targets with still 7 wickets and five balls to spare!

 

Rishabh Pant, India captain: "We had enough runs on the board, but I think we were a little off with the execution. But sometimes you got to give credit to the opposition. Miller and Rassie batted well. Mostly we executed our plans to Miller but the wicket got better and better. We were very happy with the total but next time we are in a similar situation we will do better."

 

Temba Bavuma, South Africa Captain: "We expected the wicket to get better as the night went on. Fortunately the batting came through. Bit tricky to assess the bowling. It was fair considering how good that wicket was. They put us under pressure when our spinners were bowling. Proper batting display. David carried his form and well supported by Rassie."

 

David Miller is the Player of the match

David Miller: "Obviously a lot of hard work has gone in over the last few years understanding my game a lot better. You need two players playing a part while chasing. Rassie played phenomenally well at the back end with some big overs. Chuffed with the result. Just try and hang in there was the chat. Just about limiting dot balls and waiting for that loose ball. Understanding winning more games and more consistency gives you more belief. I am pretty open to bat anywhere. Just want to make a difference."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India T20 Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second T20I of South Africa tour of India. This match is to be held at Barabati Stadium, Cuttack. In the previous game, India posted the highest total against South Africa with Ishan Kishan contributing 76 runs. South Africa in reply, chased the target with Rassie van der Dussen scoring 75* and D Miller scoring 64*. Who will be the hero for their teams tonight and how intense will this match turnout to be?

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Deep Dasgupta: "It has a fair bit of grass but it is dry grass, it will not help the seamers too much. Fair amount of cracks as well but doesn't seem to grip too much as well. It is going to skid through and not much for the spinners. Because of the weather it has a little bit of moisture and can be two-paced. It is quite humid and dew hasn't been there in the last couple of nights. The par score is going to be 160-170,"

 

TOSS:-

South Africa have won the toss and will bowl first!

 

Temba Bavuma, South Africa Captain: "We will have a bowl first. We don't know how the wicket will play. It was easier to bat second in the last game. You can chase anything with smaller boundaries, You need to stay in the fight as bowlers. We have got two forced changes: Quinton and Stubbs miss out. Quinton has a hand injury. So, Reeza Hendricks comes in and will open the batting with me. Klassen will come in and keep wickets."

 

Rishabh Pant, India Captain: "We were also looking to bowl first on this surface. I think the track is looking nice so we are looking for a big score here. There weren't lots of casualties in the last game but unfortunately, we lost that game. We are playing with the same team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 42/1 (7.0 rpo, 2x4, 3x6) || South Africa- 29/3 (4.8 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 62/4 (6.8 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 86/1 (9.5 rpo, 10x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 44/1 (8.8 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 34/2 (10.2 rpo, 0x4, 3x6)

 

South Africa seal their second victory in the Paytm T20I series as they beat India by 4 wickets. After putting India to bat first, SA bowlers picked a wicket in the very first over. Ishan Kishan (34 off 21) and Shreyas Iyer (40 off 35) partnered for 45 runs and then the South African bowlers restricted the partnerships to grow. Dinesh Karthik's 30* off 21 steered the team to a total of 148. In the chase, Indian bowlers gained initial momentum by picking three wickets within the powerplay and restricting the team to a total of 29. The skipper T Bavuma (35 off 30) held the crease and steadied the batting after which H Klaasen (81 off 46) took off and scored his best individual score which carried the team over the line.

 

Rishabh Pant, Indian Skipper: "We were 10-15 runs short. Bhuvi and the fast bowlers bowled well in the first 7-8 overs. But after that, we weren't up to the mark. In the second half, we needed wickets, but we couldn't get those wickets. Klaasen and Bavuma actually batted really well. We could have bowled better, hope we improve in the next game. We need to win all the remaining three games now."

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Skipper: "It was a tricky chase, Bhuvi bowled well, he made the ball talk upfront. It could have been clinical towards the end, but we will take that. We really needed someone to take it deep. That's the role I play in the game, to close it off. We knew it wasn't going to be an easy chase, but we were confident. We knew we had to execute our plans, and we had to be clinical. Klaasen adds a lot of value to our batting."

 

Heinrich Klaasen is the Player of the match

 
Heinrich Klaasen: "It looked very difficult with the new ball, but I tried to target the spinners. I am glad it happened against India. I am honored to be here, and I am lucky to be here. Lot of staff members backed me, so pretty happy with that support."

GroundName: Dr YS Rajasekhara Reddy ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium
TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India T20 Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third T20I of South Africa tour of India which takes place in Dr. Y.S. Rajashekara Reddy ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium, Vishakapatnam. South Africa started off their tour with two victories in the two matches and are just a win away from bagging the series. While, it hasnt been the same for India as South Africa comfortably won both of the matches. This is a do or die match for India in order to stay alive in the series. Will India fight back tonight and register the first victory against South Africa this year?

 

VENUE STATS:-

Since 2019, this venue has hosted 3 T20 matches (2 IPL and 1 International) and all the 3 matches were won by the teams batting second. The average first innings score at this venue remains at 145/8. Will the toss be crucial here tonight?

 

PITCH REPORT:- 

Deep Dasgupta: "The outfield is cushy, soft and lush green. The spinners have got a lot of purchase before it looks a much better pitch tonight to bat on. It sounds firm, looks like it has been rolled in really well. I don't think this will be a low-scorer. 170-180 could be a par total. I don't expect the spinners to get great assistance. If you a batter, you would love to bat on this surface."

 

TOSS:-

South Africa have won the toss and they elect to bowl first!

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Captain: "We will bowl first. It looks good and we want to chase it here. I think we have done well in the first two games. We want to improve in the one-percenters and improve in all the departments. That's all I want from them. Same team for us."

 

Rishabh Pant, Indian Captain: "We would have bowled as well. But as an Indian team we are not looking at the toss too much. Same team. We spoke about getting better in execution and if we do that we will be fine. A must-win game for us, and trying to keep calm. The boys are up for it. Looks like a better wicket, but feels a bit soft underneath."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 57/0 (9.5 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 38/2 (6.3 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 81/3 (9.0 rpo, 5x4, 4x6) || South Africa- 64/4 (7.1 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 41/2 (8.2 rpo, 5x4, 0x6) || South Africa- 29/2 (4.2 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

 

India for the first time in the series wins this third T20I match against South Africa by defending the target. After being put to bat first, the Indian openers R Gaikwad (57 off 35) and I Kishan (54 off 35) partnered for 97 runs till the 10th over, and Hardik Pandya (31* off 21) in the end smashed some boundaries and took the team to a total of 179. In the chase, the bowlers of India contained the SA batters and took wickets in crucial intervals. H klaasen made 29 runs off 24 balls but couldn't capitalise on his start and W Parnell's 22 runs were late in the context of the game. South Africa was bundled out in the 20th over and India won the match by 48 runs and stays alive in the series!

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Skipper: "As a collective, it wasn't our best effort. With the ball, they put us under pressure. The fielding really didn't back us up. With the batting, we didn't really pitch up. The partnerships weren't there, there was no momentum. There have been a lot of improvements in the fielding department, this game wasn't up to the mark, in the first two games we were quite strong. Losing three early wickets, always puts us under pressure."

 

Rishabh Pant, Indian Skipper: "The execution was spot-on from the bowlers and the batters. We were 15 runs short, but we weren't thinking about that. Bowlers did a fantastic job for us. There is pressure on the spinners to perform well, when they come off nicely matches like this happen. When you get a good start, it's difficult for a new batter to come in and go big straight away. We lost too many wickets. We'll look to improve in the next match. We have to make sure that we finish the game with a bigger margin."

 

Yuzvendra Chahal is the Player of the match

 

Yuzvendra Chahal: "I bowled a lot of sliders and bowled quicker in the previous matches. Today, I changed my seam position. Spinning and getting the ball to dip are my strengths. Today I tried to get it to turn and bowl slower. Now I have a second plan and set fields accordingly. I didn't bowl well in the previous game, the coach asked me to back my strengths."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India T20 Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the fourth T20I of South Africa tour of India. This match is to be held at Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Rajkot. The series started with South Africa claiming victories in the first two matches after which in the third T20I, India defended and registered their first victory against South Africa this year. India need to win this match in order to equal the series and hence they can face the decider on Sunday. Will India win tonight and tie the series or will South africa claim the trophy with a win?

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of 12 International and IPL matches have been played here and the teams chasing have won the target seven times. The average first innings score is 170/6.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

In India, South Africa has won five matches and India has won two!

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Deep Dasgupta: "This is a big ground. Tonight when you look at the pitch there is a lot of grass and this grass has a thick root structure which indicates there might be spongy bounce tonight. Also, there are quite a few cracks running along the pitch and around those cracks the grass is more prominent. I have a feeling it might help the seamers with the new ball. Even though there is this layer of grass I think it will be a high-scoring game again. There isn't much dew and this has generally been a chasing venue."

 

TOSS:-

South Africa have won the toss and will bowl first!

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Captain: "We are going to have a bowl. To be honest we are not sure how the wicket is going to play. But we are chasing well and backing our strength. Par score is about 180 and we are hoping the wicket gets better. We have a couple of forced changes - Rabada and Parnell miss out due to injuries, Reeza Hendricks also misses out, Quinton de Kock has recovered and is back, Marco Jansen and Ngidi coming in."

 

Rishabh Pant, Indian Captain: "We were looking to bowl first. The only thing we are focusing on is our process and are not thinking this is a must-win game. We are trying to increase our run rate in the middle overs and that's what we are trying to achieve as a team. We are playing with the same team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 40/2 (6.7 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) || South Africa- 35/2 (5.8 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 56/2 (6.2 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 45/6 (5.0 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 73/2 (14.6 rpo, 10x4, 3x6) || South Africa- 7/1 (3.8 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 

India registers back-to-back victories and squares off the series with 2-2! After winning the toss, SA opted to bowl first and dismissed the top order batters back to back and took three wickets within the powerplay! Both Hardik Pandya (46 off 31) and Dinesh Karthik (55 off 27) carved their highest individual T20I score tonight and took the team to a total of 169! The Indian bowlers carried the momentum forward and dismissed 8 batters for single-digit! Avesh Khan accounted for four wickets. The team was all-out for 87 runs which is the lowest total for South Africa in T20I's and also this victory is special for India as this is the highest margin victory for India against the opposition! Who will win the final match of the series and lift the trophy? 

 

Keshav Maharaj, South Africa Stand in captain: "Didn't go according to plan in the last few overs, but we felt the pitch got a bit better at the end. It is the lack of adaptability on our side. We need to be a bit more proactive. Their bowlers bowled really well too. DK played really well at the end but we need to have better plans and adapt better. India is a tough place for spinners to bowl with small grounds. There will be a lot of buzz at the ground in Bangalore. Expect it to be a cracker."

 
 
Rishabh Pant, Indian Skipper: "We talked about execution and playing better cricket and here are the results. Whichever team plays better cricket wins the game. Really happy with the way Hardik put up a show. DK went for the kill right away and that gave us the positivity. As an individual, I can look to improve in certain areas. Looking to take the positives and looking to improve. Let's see what happens in Bangalore. Looking forward to giving our hundred percent."
 
 
Dinesh Karthik is the player of the match
 
Dinesh Karthik: "Just feels good. I am feeling very secure in this setup. In the last game things didn't go according to plan, but I went and expressed myself today. Credit to my coach. They bowled brilliantly upfront and made it tough for us. It was a tough pitch to bat on. It was hard to hit boundaries. Our openers have usually been kind enough to get us off to good starts. When I went in Hardik told me to take my time. It was important that players who have been around for long need to stand up on such pitches. It is good to see a bilateral series going down to the final match."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India T20 Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
UPDATE: THE PLAY IS STOPPED AGAIN DUE TO THE RAIN!

 

Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the final T20I of the South Africa tour of India which takes place at M.Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru. The series so far has been exciting and the competition is now neck to neck with the first two being won by South Africa and the next two by India. The final match today will decide the better of the two teams and the series would not have a better end! Will India beat South Africa and win the series against the opponents for the first time (In India) after 2011 or will South Africa change the record of India's unbeaten bilateral series home record since 2019?

 

VENUE STATS:-

In 2019, 7 IPL and 2 International matches have been played at the venue. Considering the stated matches in 2019, the average first innings total remains at 163 and the teams batting second have won five matches.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Deep Dasgupta: "This venue has been a nightmare for bowlers but we have seen a lot of fireworks from the batters. 67m side boundaries, the straight boundary is 77m. The pitch today is nice and firm, something the batters enjoy. There are some decent number of cracks where the spinners would land the ball and they are wide. The smaller pieces are wobbly too. So this might help spinners and the pitch seems abrasive to the touch. It's been overcast for the last 4-5 days, so haven't seen much of dew. Having said that the chasing side has benefited a lot in general here. The toss might be important for this decider."

 

TOSS:-

South Africa have won the toss and they elect to bowl first!

 

Keshav Maharaj, South African Skipper: "Looks a good wicket and we have decided to bowl first. Stubbs, Reeza Hendricks and KG Rabada are back, they replace Temba Bavuma, Marco Jansen and Shamsi.  We have gone for the extra batter, four-seamers, and one spinner. We will look to chase it down in the back end. We have to focus on our process. When we are bowling we have to bowl good line and lengths and in batting we have to apply ourselves."

 

Rishabh Pant, Indian Skipper: "Looks like a good wicket, we would like to get anything around 180-190. We just need to focus on the process and put in our 100% into the game. We are playing the same team."
PostMatchCommentary:
The decider and the final T20I of the South Africa tour of India which took place at M.Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru was abandoned due to rain. South Africa won the toss and they decided to bowl first. The match started at 7:50 after the delay from rain and the openers partnered for 20 runs after which L Ngidi dismissed both of them. With Shreyas Iyer and Rishabh Pant in the crease with 3.3 overs bowled, it started to shower again and the match was interrupted. There were no signs of weather improvements and in the end, the match was abandoned with the match and the series ending with No Result.

 

Bhuvneshwar Kumar is the Player of the Series

Bhuvneshwar Kumar: "Really proud. Winning the Man Of the Series is always special. Feels good, don't want to talk much about it. I am more focussed on playing well and keeping my fitness in shape. I am playing for years now. My role is always the same. Bowl two in the powerplay and then bow two in the back end. Being a senior, I always think about helping out the young guys."

 

Keshav Maharaj, South African Captain: "Very disappointed we didn't get a full game for the end of an exciting tour. I am sure the future series against India will be interesting like this one. We carried our confidence from past tours at the same time we didn't want to take anything for granted. Really exciting, I wish the game would have gone on and South Africa won that. I think we are bit disappointed with the last two matches. We pushed our chests a bit. That's a solid Indian unit and we couldn't quite take them lightly." 

 

Rishabh Pant, Indian skipper: "It might be a little frustrating but at the same time there are lot of positives. The whole team came back really well so a lot of positives rather than being frustrated. We are finding different ways to win matches. As long as we keep improving from our mistakes, we will be fine. The only thing is only giving 100 percent. We will want to win that one Test in England and contribute more with the bat."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF IRELAND T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
UPDATE: It will be a 12 over per side match and the play will start at 11:20pm with the powerplay being from one to four overs! Three bowlers can bowl two overs and two bowlers can bowl three overs. 

 

Hello and welcome to the live commentary of India tour of Ireland. India is all set to face Ireland for a two match T20I series at The Village, Dublin. India has faced Ireland thrice in T20I matches and has won all of those. When India visited Ireland in 2018, the Indian team batted first and posted a total of above 200 in both the matches. Hardik Pandya will lead India and Andy Balbirnie will be the captain of Ireland! Who will win tonight and lead the series?

 

TOSS:

India won the toss and opted to bowl first!

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "We will bowl first. Absolute honour to lead India. My role is simple, just back the players and ask them to play with freedom and express themselves. Umran Malik makes his debut today"

 

Andrew Balbirne, Ireland Skipper: "Probably would have bowled first because of the weather around. Guys are excited for the series. Really important to play against one of the best teams in the world. Conor Olpher is going to make his debut tonight."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay:-

Ireland - 22/3 (5.5 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)  || India- 45/2 (11.3 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs:-

Ireland - 47/0 (11.8 rpo, 3x4, 3x6) || India- 49/1 (12.3 rpo, 2x4, 5x6)

Death Overs:-

Ireland - 39/1 (9.8 rpo, 2x4, 2x6) || India- 17/0 (12.8 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

The first match of the India tour of Ireland comes to an end with India chasing down the target easily and winning the match by 7 wickets! After the continuous showers at the venue, the match was reduced to a 12-over game. With India winning the toss and deciding to bowl first, the bowlers took the wickets of the top three batters of Ireland within the powerplay and cooked up the pressure straight away. After which, the classy innings from Harry Tector (64* off 33) put the team in a better position with the score of 108 runs! With 109 to chase in 12 overs, the Indian openers Ishan Kishan (26 off 11) and Deepak Hooda (47* off 29) provided a fiery start. Craig young picked two wickets back to back but Hardik Pandya who came later smashed 24 off 12 and the team chased the target with still 16 balls remaining!

 

Andrew Balbirnie, Ireland Captain: "Never easy when you come to the ground, do your full warmup and it's delayed. Credit to the groundsman. It was high-class bowlers bowling with assisting conditions in the first innings. We weren't as good early on. Tector batted outstandingly well to get up to the total. We were good and we were bad. Against a team like India, you have to be good."

 
Hardik Pandya, Indian Captain: "Great to start the series with a win, fortunate we got a game. Important for our team to start with a win. Umran was kept back after I had a chat with him, he's more comfortable with the older ball and they batted fantastically. So hope he gets an opportunity. Some of the shots Harry played had me in awe."
 

Yuzvendra Chahal is the Player of the match

Yuzvendra Chahal: "It is very difficult in these cold conditions. Sometimes it's hard but you have to adapt to every conditions. The captain gave liberty to bowl whatever I want to bowl. The atmosphere is pretty chilled."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF IRELAND T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Second and final T20I of India tour of Ireland which takes place at The Village, Dublin. India won the previous fixture against Ireland and has already placed a hand on the trophy. Will the blue emerge victorious or will it be the green that wins against India in T20I for the first time and level the series?

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss elected to bat first!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 54/1 (9.0 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) || Ireland- 73/1 (12.2 rpo, 5x4, 7x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 123/0 (13.7 rpo, 10x4, 7x6) || Ireland- 92/3 (10.2 rpo, 8x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 50/6 (10.0 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || Ireland- 56/1 (11.2 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

 

The Pendulum finally settles on the Indian side as the team restricts Ireland and wins the match by 4 runs! After winning the toss and electing to bat first, the Indian opener Sanju Samson scored his maiden fifty along with the player of the match Deepak Hooda who blasted the bowling attack of Ireland with a brilliant century. The team in the end put up a high total of 225 runs. In reply, the Ireland openers Paul Stirling (40 off 18) and Andrew Balbirnie (60 off 37) provided a high-flying start after which the Indian bowlers got few breakthroughs. Then the brilliant display of batting from H Tector (39 off 28), G Dockrell (34* off 16), and M Adair (23* off 12) almost bought the team across the line but the Indian team contained the score and bagged the series!

 

Deepak Hooda is the Player of the Match and Player of the Series
