Deepak Hooda: "I am coming from a good IPL, I was trying to follow up the same performance here as well. I like playing aggressively. Batting up the order, I have the time, I try to play according to the situation. Ireland is very good, I enjoyed it a lot. Fans are superb here, I never feel like playing outside India.Thanks to all the fans for the support."

 

Andy Balbirnie, Ireland Skipper: "We did good with the bat and were in the game till the end. You feel disappointed when you come this close. The crowd was amazing in the past two days. Paul Stirling played brilliantly. I took some time to get going but the guys down the order did a great job. We are trying to figure out what's the brand of cricket we wanna play. At this moment we are disappointed but we have put up a decent performance against a team like India."

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "I was trying to keep all the pressure out of my equation. I wanted to be in the present and I backed Umran. He has pace, with his pace it's always going to get 18 runs. They played some amazing shots, they batted very well, credit to them and credit to our bowlers for holding their nerves. Great experience to experience this side of the word. A lot of support comes for us, we try to entertain them and hope we did that. Thanks to everyone who supported us."

TossDetails: England won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ENGLAND TEST SERIES 2021
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the rescheduled - fifth and the final test of the series between England and India at Edgbaston, Birmingham. Coming down the memory lane, India toured England in 2021 for a five-match test series. With the first match ending in a draw, the second test at Lord's cricket ground was won by India. Then in the third Test, it was England who won the match by an innings and 76 runs. India made a huge comeback in the fourth test and sealed the match after which, with India leading the series 2-1, the final match at Manchester was cancelled due to the covid-19 pandemic. Here, we resume from where we left behind and if India claims victory or draws this match, India will lift the trophy! If England wins this match, the series would end with both teams winning 2 games and it would be a draw. Both the teams are set to enter with new skippers from the previous encounter and it would be nothing short of entertainment and a true cricketing fan's experience. Who do you think will emerge victorious at the end of the fifth day?

 

Venue Stats:

Since 2018, in the three Test matches taken place at Edgbaston, the teams which batted first won all of them! 

The average scores innings-wise are:

1st Innings - 291

2nd Innings - 345

3rd Innings - 263

 

Toss:

England won the toss and elected to field!

 

Ben Stokes, England Skipper: "We're gonna have a bowl. We've done well chasing and it's also to see how the wicket will behave. It's obviously good to come into a new series so quickly. Gives us the opportunity to keep the momentum rolling. We're going to keep the same attitude going."

 

Jasprit Bumrah, Indian Skipper: "It's a good feeling to be the captain and is a big privilege. Can't get better than this. Excited and looking forward to this. Very happy with the preparation. Wanted to spend a lot of time and get used to the English conditions, as we came back from T20s. Happy with the preparation, now it's for the mental side to take over. Four bowlers - myself, Siraj, Shardul and Shami along with Jaddu as the all-rounder."
PostMatchCommentary:
Day 1:-

India - 338/7 in 73 overs (41x4, 4x6, 4.63 rpo)

Day 2:-

India - 78/3 in 11.5 overs (10x4, 2x6, 6.6 rpo) || England - 84/5 in 27 overs (9x4, 0x6, 3.1 rpo)

Day 3:-

England - 200/5 in 34.3 overs (24x4, 3x6, 5.8 rpo) || India - 125/3 in 45 overs (15x4, 0x6, 2.8 rpo)

Day 4:-

India - 120/7 in 36.5 overs (13x4, 1x6, 3.3 rpo) || England - 259/3 in 57 overs (32x4, 1x6, 4.6 rpo)

Day 5:-

England - 119/0 in 22.4 overs (17x4, 1x6, 5.3 rpo)

 

The final Test of the India Tour of England comes to an end on the final day of the Test match with England winning the match by 7 wickets! With England winning the toss, they forced India to bat first. After losing early wickets, R Pant and R Jadeja partnered for 222 runs and both scored brilliant centuries and guided the team to a total of 416 runs. J Anderson was the highest wicket-taker in the first innings as he added a fifer to his name. With the ball, the Indian bowlers bowled explicitly well and kept on taking wickets in regular intervals except for J Bairstow who was dismissed only after his reviving century. The England team was all out for 284 runs. In the third innings, the Indian opener C Pujara scored 66 runs after which R Pant continued his form and made 57 runs. The team was then all-out for 245 runs! With a target of 378 to chase, the English batters started off brilliantly and the rest was carried over by J Root and J Bairstow who put up centuries and the team chased down the target with still 7 wickets remaining! With this win, the series is drawn 2-2.

 

Jonny Bairstow is the Player of the Match

 

Jonny Bairstow: "It is great fun at the moment. The last month has been fantastic for the lads and the smiles on their faces when everyone does well is a massive part of it. I am stripping it back to the basics. The last few years have been tough on me but the last few months have been fantastic. The chase was all under control. They have some world-class bowlers and you just have to soak the pressure. There was a period when it started reversing as well. And today morning was a different morning. Special to play with Root."

 

Joe Root is England's Player of the Series:

Joe Root: "Love playing. It's as simple as that. The environment has been great and the guys are having fun in the last four weeks. There is absolute clarity that we were chasing it down and there was total belief. There are a bunch of lovely lads and Stokes has the backing of everyone. Our responsibility is to keep everyone entertained and keep it fun. Still watching Jonny bat is great, I just wanted to give him strike. We have been riding a brilliant wave of confidence after brilliant performances against NZ. The start the two openers got us off to was superb and they put the pressure back on. It made it a lot more easier for us and those scores were a lot more than what was seen on the scoresheet."

 

Jasprit Bumrah, India's Player of the Series:

Jasprit Bumrah, Indian Captain: "That's the beauty of Test cricket, even if you have three good days. We fell short with the bat yesterday and that is where we let the opposition in to let the match slip away from us. Ifs and buts can always be there. If you go back, if there was no rain in the first match, we could have won the series. But England played really well. We have drawn the series and both teams played very good cricket and it was a fair result. We were ahead in the game. Dravid is always there to guide us and back us. We could have been a little straighter in our bowling lines and use the variable bounce. The captaincy is not what I decide. I like the responsibilty. It was a good challenge, a new challenge. It was an honour to lead the team and a great experience."

 

Ben Stokes, England Captain: "When the lads play like this, it makes my job easier. When you have clarity like we have in the dressing room, it makes chasing totals like this easier. 378 would have been scary five weeks ago, but now it's all good. Jonny and Root will get all the credit, but the precedent was set up by the way the openers played against Bumrah and Shami with the new ball. It is all about taking wickets and taking ten wickets. There are no complaints. We are trying to rewrite how Test cricket is played in England. We know that we want to give some new life to Test cricket. The support we received has been fantastic in the short time that we've been around. Inspiring the next generation is what we want to do. We want to bring in new fans and want to leave a mark on Test cricket."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ENGLAND T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 1st T20I between England and India at The Rose Bowl in Southampton. India will welcome back their skipper Rohit Sharma after he had missed the Edgbaston test and Jos Buttler on the other end will take charge of the England side as full-time skipper for the first time. India has played four T20s in the last 10 days including the practice games, has won 13 of the 15 T20Is since the World Cup, and will look to build on this good form heading into the T20 World Cup later this year.

HEAD TO HEAD:-

The two sides have played 19 T20I's so far with India edging the head to head with 10 victories. The Men in Blue have also won the previous three T20I series between the two sides.

 

VENUE STATS:-

The average 1st innings score at the venue in T20Is is 167 and in the Vitality Blast this year it has been 165. Moreover, teams defending scores have won five of the seven games in the Blast this season.

 

TOSS:-
India have won the toss and will bat first.

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We are gonna bat first. Looks like a good pitch, the sun is out and better to bat first. Recovered pretty well, had a couple of hits before getting into this game, looking forward to the game as well. Exciting times, these guys have been here for a while playing in Ireland and played a couple of games here as well. We are making Arshdeep play. He has done well in the IPL and looks an exciting prospect."

 

Jos Buttler, England Skipper: "Very proud day, great honour to get to captain your country and looking forward to the challenges ahead. Gleeson, Willey, and Salt miss out. We have got a couple of all-rounders in Moeen Ali and Liam Livingstone, they give us a lot of options with both ball and bat."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6):-

India - 66/2 (9x4, 2x6, 11.0 rpo) || England - 32/3 (4x4, 0x6, 5.3 rpo)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15):-

India - 91/2 (10x4, 2x6, 10.1 rpo) || England - 83/4 (6x4, 4x6, 9.2 rpo)

Death Overs (Overs 16-20):-

India - 41/4 (4x4, 1x6, 8.2 rpo) || England - 33/3 (3x4, 1x6, 7.3 rpo)

 

India put on a stunning display with both bat and ball to win by 50 runs and take a 1-0 series lead. After skipper Rohit Sharma won the toss and chose to bat, India got off to a flyer in the Powerplay scoring 66 runs courtesy of quickfire innings from Rohit Sharma, Deepak Hooda and Suryakumar Yadav, after which Hardik Pandya continued with the run flow and registered his maiden T20I half-century to guide India to 198 on board at the end of 20 overs. In the chase, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Arshdeep Singh used the new ball to great effect and Hardik picked up two crucial wickets in an over to restrict England to 32/3 inside the Powerplay. Moeen Ali and Harry Brook put on a 50-run stand in the middle but India continued to pick up wickets in regular intervals and bowled out England for 148.

 

Jos Buttler, England Skipper: "They bowled well with the new ball and put us under pressure, we couldn't get away from that point. Probably a bit above par but we came back really well in the second half with the ball. We know the boys have the talent and we want to see them on the big stage."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Skipper: "Great performance from ball one, all our batters showed intent. Although the pitch was good, we played good shots and never got ahead of the game. You got to make use of those six overs in the powerplay and there is a certain approach we want to take in the powerplay. You got to back yourself in this game as sometimes it comes off, sometimes it doesn't. The whole batting unit needs to understand the direction the team is taking and the guys were spot on today. We were sloppy on the field, those catches should have been taken. Pretty sure we will field pretty well in the coming games."

 

Hardik Pandya is the Player of the Match

Hardik Pandya: "The last time I played a T20 in England, I think I took 4 wickets and scored some 30, so I kind of knew I was the first Indian to score fifty and take 4 wickets. I am enjoying my cricket right now. For me, a lot of time goes into preparation and getting my body ready. It is about giving your 100% and when you don't do that, there is no point playing, so I needed that break and now I am happy to be in this place right now."

TossDetails: England won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ENGLAND T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 2nd T20I between England and India at Edgbaston, Birmingham. India had taken a 1-0 lead in the series after an all-round performance from Hardik Pandya two days back and will look to welcome back Virat Kohli, Jasprit Bumrah, Ravindra Jadeja, Rishabh Pant, and Shreyas Iyer back into the squad, in an attempt to seal the series tonight.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India has won 3 of the 7 T20I's played in England and The Men in Blue have also won the previous three T20I series between the two sides. Can they make it four tonight?

 

VENUE STATS:-

The average 1st innings score in T20I's at the venue is 170 and in the 2022 Vitality Blast, it has been 161. Teams batting first have won five of the eight matches in the Blast this season.

 

TOSS:-

England have won the toss and will field first.

 

Jos Buttler, England Captain: "We are going to bowl first. Willey and Gleeson come in for Topley and Mills. It's a great chance to bounce back, expect us to come back harder today. It's a fantastic ground, India gets great support here as well."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We would have batted first. Looks like a good pitch, it has been used before for the Blast game. We just need to adjust quickly and adapt our game. We have four changes. Kohli, Jadeja, Bumrah, and Pant are back. These guys are one of the best teams in the world, so we want to challenge ourselves, we want to be fearless but we need to play according to the situation."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6):-

India - 61/1 (7x4, 3x6, 10.2 rpo) || England - 36/3 (6x4, 0x6, 6.0 rpo)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15):-

India - 54/4 (5x4, 0x6, 6.0 rpo) || England - 70/5 (6x4, 3x6, 7.8 rpo)

Death Overs (Overs 16-20):-

India - 55/3 (5x4, 1x6, 11.0 rpo) || England - 15/2 (1x4, 1x6, 7.5 rpo)

 

India wins by 49 runs in the 2nd T20I and gets their fourth successive T20I series victory against England. After being put in to bat first, India continued their dominance in the Powerplay scoring 61 runs in the phase, after which Gleeson on debut, and Chris Jordan picked up 7 wickets between them to restrict the scoring, but a fine knock from Jadeja ensured that India posted 170 on board. In the chase, Bhuvneshwar Kumar continued his magic with the new ball and dismissed both the English openers inside the Powerplay and India continued to pick up wickets in regular intervals to bundle out England for the second consecutive game and seal the series.

 

Jos Buttler, England Captain: "Very disappointing. We didn't play anywhere close to what we wanted. The bowlers were excellent, especially Gleeson and Jordan. Any time you lose three wickets in the powerplay it is hard to catch up. We don't have much time to reflect on it as the next game is tomorrow."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We know how good they are as a team, not just in England but everywhere they go. When you win games there is confidence in the group and it is important how the boys feel. I really wanted to see how we perform after a win and challenge ourselves as a group. We wanted someone to bat through and get us a score, Jadeja had scored a hundred here and he carried on from there, he was calm and finished it well towards the end. We understand the importance of the powerplay, be it scoring runs or taking wickets. We look forward to another game tomorrow. We need to keep ticking the boxes and move forward."

 

Bhuvneshwar Kumar is the Player of the Match

Bhuvneshwar Kumar: "When the ball swings you enjoy bowling. Buttler is a dangerous player and if he goes past the powerplay, he can score big. If the ball swings it motivates you to do well and I am confident right now."

TossDetails: England won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ENGLAND T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 3rd and final T20I between England and India at Trent Bridge, Nottingham. India has been at their very best in this series, claiming the series with a game to spare yesterday, and will look to continue their winning streak under captain Rohit Sharma with an eye on the T20 World Cup later this year.

 

VENUE STATS:-

The average 1st innings score in the 7 T20 matches played this year at the venue is 192 and the last 5 scores batting first were 183, 247, 170, 261, and 178. In the 7 games played, 5 have been won by the sides batting first.

 

TOSS:-

England has won the toss and will bat first.

 

Jos Buttler, England Captain: "We will bat first. Just looking for a changeup, looks like a great wicket. Two changes, Reece Topley and Phil Salt are in, Salt will bat at 4. Parkinson and Curran miss out."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We would have fielded first. Had batted first twice and wanted to chase at least once. Four changes for us - Ravi Bishnoi, Avesh Khan, Umran Malik, and Shreyas Iyer are in. They replace Bhuvi, Bumrah, Chahal, and Hardik. We don't want to miss out on the winning confidence, but there are a few things we want to have a look at before the World Cup, hence the changes."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6):-

England - 52/1 (4x4, 3x6, 8.7 rpo) || India - 34/3 (4x4, 1x6, 5.7 rpo)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15):-

England - 100/2 (6x4, 6x6, 11.1 rpo) || India - 116/0 (9x4, 7x6, 12.9 rpo)

Death Overs (Overs 16-20):-

England - 63/4 (4x4, 4x6, 12.6 rpo) || India - 48/6 (6x4, 2x6, 9.6 rpo)

 

India come close in the chase but falls short by 17 runs in the 3rd and final T20I at Nottingham and takes the series 2-1. After opting to bat first, England lost their skipper early on in the Powerplay, after which Dawid Malan scored 77 off 39 balls followed by a quickfire 42 from Liam Livingstone, taking England past the 200 mark and helping them post 215 on board. In the chase, India lost three early wickets inside the Powerplay but what followed was an absolute masterclass from Suryakumr Yadav, becoming the 5th Indian to score a century in T20I and notching up a 100-run partnership with Shreyas Iyer to take India within touching distance of the target, but wickets in regular intervals for England helped them hold their nerve in the end and win by 17 runs.

 

Jos Buttler, England Captain: "Good fun to play, fantastic game. I thought we had a slightly above-par score. Unbelievable innings from SKY. I thought Reece Topley bowled into the wicket and took pace off really well. It was pleasing to see Gleeson back up with another performance. Jordan was good too. We are blessed with options, a lot of all-rounders and we bat deep as well."

 

Reece Topley is the Player of the Match and Bhuvneshwar Kumar is the Player of the Series.

Reece Topley: "You just want to come out and restrict runs and we wanted to take early wickets. That was an unbelievable knock from Suryakumar Yadav. I was speechless by some of the shots played, unbelievable. I am absolutely fit and ready for the summer, long way to go."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "I thought it was a fantastic chase although we fell short. We are proud of the fight. Surya was magnificent to watch. Loves this format and has a wide range of shots. They put us under pressure with their batting. You back yourself to get this score. We have things to work on as a group. So far things are pretty good and we want to get better every game. Today was great learning for us, games like this will teach you."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ENGLAND ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the first ODI between England and India at Kennington Oval, London. India will face England for a three-match ODI series starting today. After clinching the T20I series, India would look forward to claiming the ODI series too, whereas the opponents England won the last T20I match and would want to continue their momentum in the extended version of the format. Who will start the ODI series on a high?

 

VENUE STATS:-

Since 2019, 7 matches have been played here of which five have been won by the teams batting first and two by the team bowling first. 78.85% of wickets are taken by the seam bowlers and the average first innings total remains at 273/7.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and England at this stadium, have played eight ODI's in which England have won 5 and India have won two. 

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "We are going to bowl first. There is some grass cover and it's overcast as well. We want to have a score in front of us. It's important to take wickets up front and put brakes on the scoring. We understand the importance of playing overseas, we want to do well outside India. Today is no different. We have five batters, two all-rounders, and four bowlers. Kohli is not playing this game, Shreyas will bat at 3."

 

Jos Buttler, England Captain: "We would have done the same thing, we would have bowled first. Looking forward to the ODI series, it has been a great learning experience. It's great to welcome those guys back. Root, Bairstow, Stokes are a few of the best players in the world. There are a lot of selfless guys in the team, that will be exactly the same today."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

England- 30/5 (3.0 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || India- 56/0 (5.6 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

England- 93/5 (6.1 rpo, 12x4, 1x6)) || India- 58/0 (6.7 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)

 

The Indian team displayed a dominating performance and beat England by 10 wickets for the first time in history! After winning the toss and electing to bowl first, the Indian bowlers Jasprit Bumrah (6/19) and Mohammed Shami (3/31) dismissed four key batters of the English side for a duck. Apart from the innings of Jos Buttler (30 off 32), the other batters couldn't settle much and the team was all out for a total of 110 in 25.2 overs. With an easy target to chase, the Indian openers Shikhar Dhawan (31* off 54) and Rohit Sharma (76* off 58) paired up for their 18th 100-run partnership and took the team to victory by 10 wickets! Bumrah was deservingly awarded the player of the match for his career-best figure of 6/18. With this win, India lead the series!

 

Jos Buttler, England Skipper: "Very tough day to take, but we've got to dust ourselves down quickly. Little surprised by the movement, bit muggy. India exposed the conditions superbly. They have bowled really well in the powerplay. It is something we need to discuss and work out. Jasprit is a great bowler to come up against. He has bowled well today and deserves these figures. It is never easy when you are forced to try and wickets. Isn't nice when your bowlers have to take as may risks and when you ask so much out of them."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "Looking at the overhead conditions and the pitch, the toss was a right call to make. We used the conditions upfront really well. We never worry about the conditions because we have got the guys who can just come out and use those conditions. There was some swing and seam up front and we exploited them well. When you play in such conditions, you have to understand the assistance and have field placements accordingly. The hook is a high-risk shot, I understand that, but as long as it comes out right, I am happy."

 

Jasprit Bumrah is the Player of the match

 
Jasprit Bumrah: "When there's swing and seam movement, it is very exciting in white-ball cricket to get that opportunity because you have to be defensive with the kind of pitches we usually get. When I bowled the first ball, I found some swing and we tried to exploit that. When it doesn't swing, I have to pull my lengths back. When the ball is doing something you don't have to try a lot. As soon as Shami bowled the first over, we had a conversation to go fuller. Very happy for him, he gets a lot of wickets. When the ball is moving around, the keeper and the cordon is very active. Very happy that Rishabh has been working hard on his keeping as well as his batting."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ENGLAND ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second ODI of India tour of England which takes place at Lord's Cricket Ground, London. India displayed all-around excellence and won the previous fixture against England and lead the three-match series. India have not won a ODI match at Lord's after 2004 and England have not lost a bilateral ODI series at home since 2014. Will India even the odds tonight and seal the series or will the English team take the decider to the final one?

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of six One Day International matches have been played here since 2019, and five have been won by the teams batting first and one by the team bowling first. The average first innings total is 274/9.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

At Lord's, England and India have locked horns 7 times in ODI's and the head-to-head here is equal with both having 3 victories!

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We're going to bowl first. Less grass for sure but looks like there is some moisture in the pitch. Looking at the size of the ground, we thought it's better to have a score on the board. Virat Kohli comes back in for Shreyas Iyer. He's (Bumrah) a proper bowler, no matter which the format is. GIves us a different dimension and can bowl in any phases of the game. Always nice to have a bowler like him in the squad. Pant did take some really good catches. They were very important for us."

 

Jos Buttler, England Skipper: "We would have bowled first as well. A 50-50 decision to be honest. Seems like a bit of moisture and might be tricky early on, if we can survive that, we should be fine. We're going with the same team. I think we've got to move on and just think it as one of those off-days. We always think that batting is our main strength and one game isn't going to change it. Anytime you're playing at Lord's, it's a great feeling."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

England- 46/1 (4.6 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) || India- 28/2 (2.8 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

England- 155/5 (5.2 rpo, 12x4, 5x6) || India- 118/8 (4.1 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

England- 45/4 (5.0 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)

 

England wins the match against India by 100 runs and the series is now leveled! After winning the toss and forcing England to bat first, the English openers Roy and Bairstow started to settle, after which the Indian bowlers came into the play and dismissed the batters in regular successions. The 62-run partnership between M Ali (47 off 64) and D Willey (41 off 49) put the team in a better position and the score, in the end, was 246. Y Chahal picked four wickets for just 47 runs in ten overs. In the chase, the English bowlers cooked up pressure on the Indian batters straight away by restricting runs and taking crucial wickets. There were a few partnerships between S Yadav-Hardik and R Jadeja-Shami but did not last long and the team was all out for 146 runs in the 39th over. R Topley was awarded the man of the match for his six-wicket haul!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "We bowled pretty well to start with. They had a partnership in the middle with Moeen and Willey. By no means that target wasn't chaseable but we didn't bat well. Have to take catches, something we've been talking a lot. All in all, we bowled pretty well. Thought the pitch will get better and better. Playing against a team like that, you need to get your five best bowlers and allrounder. Leaves a long tail. So have to ensure as a top-order, one of the guys bats long. Going to be an exciting one at Manchester."

 

Jos Buttler, England Captain: "Delighted with the response from the guys. Didn't bat our best, but got a challenging score. And the way the guys bowled was fantastic. Traditionally has been a bat-first wicket here. Willey and Ali put on a great partnership. Needed to take early wickets, put them under pressure straightaway. The team has been doing some great things over a number of years. Always a great place to go and play, especially with the series at 1-1."

 

Reece Topley is the Player of the match

Reece Topley: "Terrific team performance to bounce back from the other day. Happy to play my part. Means a lot, makes it all worthwhile. It's everyone's dream to play for England. Play my part to win games. Big game at the weekend, got to prepare for that, and then look back at the series."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ENGLAND ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third and final ODI of India tour of England which takes place at Emirates Old Trafford, Manchester. With India subjugating England in the first ODI, the second match in reply was won by England. Now, it has all turned on to the ultimate match of the tour which will decide the champions. Who will end win today and claim the ODI series this time?

 

VENUE STATS:-

Since 2015, 13 matches have been played here in which nine have been won by the teams batting first and four by the team bowling first. So could we expect the team winning the toss to bat first?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and England at this stadium, have played four ODI's in which England have won three out of it.  

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 
Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We are gonna bowl first. It looks like a good track and won't change for the course of 100 overs. It is the series decider and we have played some good cricket on the tour, we took the learnings from the last game. We bowled well in the limited overs , hopefully, we can restrict them today to a reasonable target. Bumrah has a niggle, so Siraj comes in."
 
Jos Buttler, England Skipper: "We would have looked to bat. It is a little muggy and there might be some swing early on, but will get better for batting as the game progresses. It is great for the series as it is 1-1 coming into this game. Lots of positives, we scrapped with the bat to get a defendable total in the last game. We are unchanged."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

England- 66/3 (6.6 rpo, 11x4, 0x6) || India- 43/3 (4.3 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

England- 148/4 (4.9 rpo, 7x4, 6x6) || India- 188/2 (6.3 rpo, 20x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 
England- 45/3 (7.7 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)  || India- 30/0 (13.8 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)
 
 
The series decider will not get a better ending than this for the Indian fans as the team wins the match (by 5 wickets) and also seals the series (2-1)! India once again won the toss and elected to bowl first. M Siraj took back-to-back wickets in the second over and imposed pressure straight away on the English team. The partnership between J Buttler (60 off 80) and M Ali (34 off 44) was worth 75 runs and the team put up a total of 259 runs. H Pandya was impressive with the ball as he took a four-wicket haul! In the chase, the English bowler R Topley dismissed the top three batters of India within the powerplay. R Pant (125* off 113) and H Pandya (71 off 55) paired up for 133 runs and steered the team to one of the memorable victories in the history!
 
Rishabh Pant is the Player of the match
 
Rishabh Pant: Hopefully I remember this knock for the rest of my life. I was focusing on one ball at a time when I was batting. When your team is under pressure and you bat like that, something I aspire to do. I always enjoy playing in England, at the same time enjoy the atmosphere and the situation. The more you play the more experience you gain. It was a good wicket to bat on and the bowlers did a commendable job to restrict them, they were brilliant not only today but for the entire series."
 
 
Hardik Pandya is the Player of the series
 
Hardik Pandya: "White ball is something close to me. We all know such a good team England is. For us, as a team, it was important for us to come here, set out the plans what we'll bowl. Important for me to stop the runs, bowl as many dot balls. They were cruising at one point. I love short balls. Don't fancy people taking me on. Gets me into the game. Don't mind getting hit for six sixes also if I can get a wicket. The partnership changed the game for us. The way he finished the game was also special."
 
 
Jos Buttler, England Skipper: "I thought we were short. Needed a good start which we got actually. Throughout the whole summer so far we haven't batted our best. Topley has been brilliant. Delighted to see him doing so well. It's been a tough schedule. Half-chance with Pandya as well, along with the stumping. If we took our chances, with India's tail, could've got hold of the game. I've found it absolutely fine to be honest. Missed a chance but don't think it's got anything to do with captaincy."
 
 
Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "Very pleased. Wanted to achieve something as a group in white ball. We were here last time and were beaten, I remember that. Not an easy place to come and win games. It was a good pitch, but we do understand it's not going to be easy if we lose wickets upfront. Positive side of it, these guys haven't batted much in the middle overs. Today we got to see that with Hardik and Rishabh. At no point we felt they were panicking. They backed themselves and played cricketing shots. To be honest, the wicket didn't have much. We played some not so good shots. Still back those guys to come out good. One of those series where top order hasn't come to the party. Have got nothing more to say because I know the quality they bring to the team."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF WEST INDIES ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the first ODI of the three-match series of India tour of West Indies. The match takes place at the Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain, Trinidad. The Indian team is to be headed by the experienced Shikhar Dhawan and this is a young squad that will be featuring here. The Indian team successfully completed its white-ball mission on a high in England, whereas the opponents recently played against Bangladesh and the team got whitewashed. Who will turn victorious today and start the series with a positive momentum?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

In the previous 4 years, the two teams have played 15 ODIs against each other and India has dominated the West Indies on 11 games and the opposition has managed to win only two. West Indies has not won an ODI bilateral series since 2006.

 

TOSS:-

West Indies won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "We are gonna have a bowl first. It's a nice feeling, better feeling to win the toss, very happy to be here in front of my home ground. We spoke about it, batting in partnerships, gaining momentum, it's been tough for us, but we are up for the challenge. Every game we will try to improve. Jason Holder has Covid so he misses out. It's pretty much the same guys who played in the series against Bangladesh."

 
 
Shikhar Dhawan, Indian Captain: "We were thinking of batting second, the weather looks like it will rain later on and the wicket is sticky but we are happy to bat first. I'm a very cool captain and like to guide the team, I will love to take the right decision but importantly make sure the process is right, we are focussing on the process and make sure we get the right result. The boys got a lot of exposure, it's a great opportunity for all to showcase our talent. There's Surya, Shreyas, Sanju all the boys are quite good - even myself."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 73/0 (7.3 rpo, 11x4, 2x6) || West Indies- 52/1 (5.2 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 175/4 (5.8 rpo, 12x4, 6x6) || West Indies- 167/4 (5.7 rpo, 9x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 60/3 (6.0 rpo, 3x4, 2x6) || West Indies- 86/1 (8.6 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

 

The series opener started off well with an edge-of-the-seat thriller with India winning the match by 3 runs. After the Indian team was forced to bat first, the skipper S Dhawan (97 off 99) led the team from the front along with his partner S Gill (64 off 53). Then, S Iyer at number three carried the momentum forward by scoring 54 runs. In the end, the Indian team posted a total of 308 runs. In reply, K Mayers (75 off 68) paired up with S Brooks (46 off 61) for 117 runs and provided a solid start. B King's 54 runs were crucial in the middle after which the quick cameo from R Shepherd (39* off 25) almost took the team over the line but the Indian bowlers held their nerves and Siraj (2/57) defended 15 runs on the final over and the team has begun their tour with a victory!

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "Feels like a win for us. Bittersweet, but yeah we keep talking about batting fifty overs and everyone saw what we are capable of and hopefully we can go strength to strength from here. Looking forward to the rest of the series. It was a good batting track and our bowlers did a commendable job to restrict them. We need to believe in each other and I keep telling everyone that we will have our challenges, but important to focus on the positives."

 

Shikhar Dhawan is the Player of the match

 
Shikhar Dhawan, Indian Captain: "Disappointed not to get the 100, but it was a good effort by the team. We got a good score in the end. There were nerves in the end and didn't expect it to turn that way. We kept our cool and one small change in the end where we pushed the fine leg back and that really helped us. The discussion was to use the bigger side as much as we can and we want to keep on learning and make ourselves better for the rest of the competition."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF WEST INDIES ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second ODI of India tour of West Indies which takes place at  Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain, Trinidad. The series starter was as enthralling as it could get as the match was headed till the last ball which ended in the favour of India who defended the target by 3 runs. This result will decide the fate of the series. Hope we could witness an exciting contest today!

 

TOSS:-

West Indies won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "Will bat first, it's the same wicket. Anything over 250 will be challenging here. We need to build partnerships, we need to show up again and do the same thing again. One forced change, Motie is out - Hayden Walsh is in."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Indian Captain: "I feel it's a good wicket. It gets slower and offers some turn. After the last game's experience we wanted to bat first again. We gave few runs in the field, we need to work on that. We are well prepared and looking forward for a good game. Prasidh Krishna is out and Avesh Khan comes in - he is making his ODI debut today."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

West Indies- 71/1 (7.1 rpo, 11x4, 1x6) || India- 42/0 (4.2 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

West Indies- 147/2 (4.9 rpo, 8x4, 5x6) || India- 170/5 (5.7 rpo, 10x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

West Indies- 93/3 (9.3 rpo, 4x4, 6x6) || India- 100/3 (10.0 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)

 

The second match of the series also went on till the last over and the Indian team once again claims victory by chasing the target by 2 wickets and also the trophy is clinched by the Indian team! West Indies won the toss and elected to bat first. The opener S Hope scored a wonderful century on his 100th ODI appearance and he was supported by the West Indies skipper N Pooran (74 off 77) as they partnered for 117 runs together. With a target of 311, S Gill (43 off 49) started steadily and Shreyas at number three scored consecutive half-centuries and built the score along with S Samson who got his maiden fifty today. In the end, after the West Indies bowlers took crucial wickets, it was Axar Patel who played a crucial knock of 64* from 35 and took the team over the line in style with a six!

 

Axar Patel is the Player of the Match

 

Axar Patel: "I think this is a special one. It came at a crucial time and also helped the team to win the series. We just needed to remain calm and keep the intensity up. I am playing an ODI after 2017. I would want to continue performing like this for my team."

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "Definitely, the last couple of overs we didn't hold our nerves. Last 6 overs, we lost the game.We just needed one wicket to seal the game but Axar played really well. We did an exceptional job with the batting group. We tried to compete really hard. We want to win really bad."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Indian Captain: "It was a great team performance. The boys didn't lose the self-belief, that is amazing. Iyer, Sanju, Axar everyone was amazing, Even Avesh came out in his debut game and scored those 11 important runs I felt that we bowled nicely. They got off to a good start. Hope and Pooran batted well. We knew that we could do it. We started a little slow. The Iyer-Samson partnership made a huge difference. Boys are learning. Thanks to the support staff as well. They have been doing a tremendous job."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF WEST INDIES ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third and final ODI of India tour of West Indies which takes place at  Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain, Trinidad. Both the matches went on neck to neck and India were better and won both - one by chasing and one by defending. India have sealed yet another series at West Indies. Will we see other new youngsters getting a chance today? Will India whitewash West Indies today? Let's wait and watch the exciting contest!

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Indian Skipper: "We will bat first. We will like to post a good score. The best thing is everything is performing, nice to see that. I feel that intent is important, but at the same time, you need to be smart. Dravid is doing a good job, the more the players will play, the better they will get. We got one change. Prasidh comes in for Avesh Khan."

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Skipper: "The first two games, we were heartbroken. We are motivated today, we need to get over the line. We spoke about batting 50 overs, but we need to be more consistent. We will get to see the result eventually. Holder, Keemo, and Carty are in. Alzarri, Rovman, and Shepherd are out."
PostMatchCommentary:
The third and the final ODI of the India tour of West Indies comes to an end as India clean sweeps West Indies. After winning the toss and electing to bat first, the openers S Dhawan (58 off 74) and S Gill (98* off 98) provided a solid start! S Iyer who came at number three made 44 runs off 34 balls. The play was interrupted twice due to rain and the overs were reduced. S Gill missed his maiden century by just two runs. In the end, the Indian team had a score of 225/3 in 36 overs. The target was revised due to rain and West Indies were to chase 257 in 35 overs by DLS calculation. In the chase, M Siraj plunked pressure on WI batters straight away by taking two wickets in the second over of the innings for no runs on the board. B King (42 off 37) and N Pooran (42 off 32) tried to revive the innings but were dismissed at the right time. Then the Indian bowlers took over the game and dismissed all the batters of WI for 137 runs and won the match by 119 runs (DLS method). Y Chahal accounted for 4 wickets for just 17 runs and S Gill was rightly awarded the Player of the match for his innings with the bat.

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "It was a tough one for us. We did a lot of right things in the first two games. I think we tried up our best, the boys performed well. As a batting group, it was going to be a challenge with DLS coming into play. We did get some partnerships, but not as many as we wanted, that cost us the game. There are a few inexperienced players, still figuring out how to play ODI cricket. The bowlers bowled well in the powerplay, they didn't get wickets, but that's fine. The guys are getting more confident with every game. Very excited with our T20 team, looking forward to the game on Friday."

 

Shubman Gill is the Player of the Match and Series

 

Shubman Gill: "Was hoping to get a hundred, but that was not under my control. Was very disappointed with how I got out in the first two ODIs. I tried to play according to the ball and let my instincts take over. I wanted only one more over, was hoping for that. The wicket played fantastically in all three games. The ball was gripping a bit after 30 overs. Happy with my performance."

 
Shikhar Dhawan, Indian Captain: "I feel the boys are young, but they played maturely. The way they handled themselves on the field, really proud of them. Very good signs for us. I am quite pleased with my form, I have been playing this format since a long time. I was happy with the way I played that knock, in the first ODI. The way all the boys responded, it was pretty amazing. We feel lucky to come here, we are thankful to the crowd. I am proud of our bowling unit, they gave their hundred percent. The way Siraj took those two wickets, and the way Shardul and others bowled."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF WEST INDIES T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of the 1st T20I between India and West Indies at the Brian Lara Cricket Stadium in Trinidad. The Men in Blue head into the series on the back of a 3-0 ODI series victory against West Indies, and will look to continue their domination in the shortest format of the game. Rohit Sharma, Rishabh Pant, and Hardik Pandya are back after being rested for the ODI series and with the marquee T20 World Cup 3 months away, India will look to lock their squad and head into the event with momentum on their side.

 

TOSS:-

West Indies have won the toss and elected to field.

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "Ready to go. Good to have some time off. Pretty excited to get back and get things underway. First international game being played here, good to see the fans coming in large numbers. Will have to look at how the wicket plays. Quite excited to get underway."

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "Going to bowl first. Maybe there's something in the pitch, nice to know what you're chasing. Looking forward to this series. We enjoy the format and like to entertain. One spinner and Alzarri Joseph making his debut. Shimron Hetmyer is also back into the team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6):-

India - 45/2 (7.5 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || West Indies - 42/3 (7.0 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15):-

India - 86/3 (9.6 rpo, 10x4, 1x6) || West Indies - 56/4 (6.2 rpo, 2x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (Overs 16-20):-

India - 59/1 (11.8 rpo, 4x4, 3x6) || West Indies - 24/1 (4.8 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

India put on a stunning display with both bat and ball to go one up in the 5 match T20I series as they defeated West Indies today by 68 runs. After being put in to bat first, the Men in Blue posted 190 on board which is the highest T20 score at this venue, courtesy of a half-century from the skipper Rohit Sharma and a quickfire knock from Dinesh Karthik in the end. India continued the momentum into the second innings and picked up three wickets inside the Powerplay, after which the spinners chipped in wickets to restrict West Indies to 122/8 at the end of 20 overs.

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies skipper: "The players are feeling dissappointed, but it's the first game of the series and we are looking to bounce back. 18 overs it was 150 I guess and then they took the momentum away from us, we just have to work on our discipline. The spinners did well and we have to look at some of the combinations going ahead."

 

Rohit Sharma, India skipper: "We knew it was gonna be slightly tough, the shot-making wasn't easy at the start. The guys who are set need to carry on for longer and the way we finished off the first innings was a great effort. When we finished the first 10 overs, we didn't think we could get to 190. It was a great effort from the boys and a great finish. We want to try certain things and all in all I thought it was a great effort. Certain pitches will not allow you to do that and we need to assess how we go about it. It is all about backing your skills and strengths. I love playing here in West Indies. Indian team always receives great support from the Indian crowd coming in from the USA and also the local crowd here, quite superb to get such support."

 

Dinesh Karthik is the Player of the Match

Dinesh Karthik: "It was sticky and not an easy wicket to bat on. Important to assess the wicket and what kind of shots you need to play, and that comes with practice. It's a very interesting role, you need the backing from the coach and the captain and that really helped."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF WEST INDIES T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second T20I of India tour of West Indies which takes place at Warner Park, Basseterre, St Kitts. The first T20I was won by India by displaying a dominating performance. This is the second of the five-match T20I series. With India leading the series 1-0, the team would look to claim a victory early on and on to seal the series. 

 

Update: The match is rescheduled at 23:00 PM IST!

 

VENUE STATS:-

Since 2021, from the CPL data, 17 matches have been won by the teams batting first and 16 by the teams chasing the target. Would the toss impact today's game?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

Both the teams have clashed 21 times and India are way ahead in the contest with 14 victories and WI are with 6 wins.

 

TOSS:-

West Indies won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "We will bowl first, wickets look nice and we will try and use our experience. We want to forget that game and believe in our process and execute our plans. Different conditions today and the guys are looking forward to whatever attack they have. We have two changes. Keemo Paul and Brooks are out and Brandon King and Devon Thomas are playing"

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "It was quite pleasing for us, the way we played the first game. We stuck to our plans and executed it really well. It's another opportunity for us and we are looking to repeat what we did in the first one. We want the guys to be flexible, there are two ways to look at it depending on certain players. We probably read the pitch well in the first game and thought as a team we made the right call to go with three spinners. The dimensions are different here and wanted to get an extra seamer here. Bishnoi misses out unfortunately and Avesh Khan comes in."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 56/3 (9.3 rpo, 2x4, 5x6) || West Indies- 46/0 (7.7 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-

India- 53/2 (5.8 rpo, 0x4, 2x6) || West Indies- 55/3 (6.1 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 93/5 (6.2 rpo, 2x4, 1x6) || West Indies- 40/2 (9.2 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)

 

The second match of the five-match T20I is now balanced (1-1) with West Indies getting the better of the Indian team and winning the match by 5 wickets. After winning the toss and forcing India to bat first, the WI bowlers took three wickets within the powerplay. The quickfire innings from R Pant (24 off 12) and the anchoring partnership between H Pandya (31 off 31) and R Jadeja (27 off 30) guided the team to a total of 138. In the chase, B King (68 off 52) - the opener steered the team from the front and D Thomas towards the end played a quick cameo of 31* from 19 balls and took the team across the line with still 5 wickets and four balls remaining. O McCoy was awarded the man of the match for his wonderful six-wicket haul (6/17). 

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "Firstly, there weren't enough runs on the board. We didn't bat well. The pitch was playing nicely but we didn't apply ourselves. But this can happen. When you are doing something as a batting group, you might not always succeed. But we will learn from this. It is all about giving opportunities to these guys. Unless you give chances to guys like Avesh and Arshdeep you'll never know. But it is just one game. They have the skills and the talent and it is all about backing them. I am really proud of the bowlers and the team. I thought the guys executed the plans and really happy with the way the guys bowled. We have to look at some things in our batting."

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Skipper: "I can finally breathe now. It has been a tough summer for us. We lost a few close games and nearly made a mess of this as well. Obed was fantastic and all the guys just used the pitch and the conditions well. A win is a win. I believe in T20, better batsmen have to bat long. King should have won the game for us with the way he was batting. But hopefully he will learn from this. Thomas returned back for us after injury and came out trumps on his home ground. Obed is a bit of a freak and today he was just fantastic. He just kept picking up wickets for us."

 

Obed McCoy is the Player of the Match

 
Obed McCoy: "This is for my mom. The first ball wicket put pressure on the batsmen. I always look for wickets in the powerplay. I went in with a clean mind. In the previous game, I was overthinking a bit. It gives me a challenge and I am just thankful for all the experiences and the challenges."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF WEST INDIES T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third T20I of India tour of West Indies which takes place at Warner Park, Basseterre, St Kitts. The men in blue dominated West Indies in the opener and in the second match which took place yesterday, it was West Indies who won the match in the last over and leveled the series 1-1. There are still three T20I remaining on the tour and this win would put the team on a better position. Will India win tonight and lead the contest?

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper - "We will field first, not looking at the conditions, but this is what we prefer to do. We want to capitalize on the powerplay, this is a small ground, a six hitting ground, the average score isn't big and we need to keep that in mind as well. The guys have been given the chance to express themselves, so the high-risk shots come into play, but we do understand that. Just one change, Jadeja has been rested, Hooda is in."

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Skipper - "We wanted to bat first as well, this is a ground where chasing is the preferred option. But now we need to put up a good score on the board and defend it. Credit to the bowling group, they performed well as a unit, they did come hard at us, but we stuck to our task. We did speak about the left-arm option, we spoke about it during the team meetings. That's why we have one change today  Dominic Drakes is in and Odean Smith is out."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

West Indies- 45/0 (7.5 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || India- 56/0 (9.3 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

West Indies- 63/2 (7.0 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) || India- 80/2 (8.8 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

West Indies- 56/3 (11.2 rpo, 3x4, 4x6) || India- 29/1 (7.3 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

India wins the third match comfortably and again possesses the lead 2-1 in the five-match series. India won the toss and decided to chase. The opener K Mayers fired today with 73 runs off 50 balls and the other top four batters of the side contributed 20 odd runs each and took the team to a total of 164. In reply, the Indian opener S Yadav splendidly constructed his innings and scored 76 off 44 deliveries. R Pant in the end smashed 33* runs off 26 balls and finished off the match in style. This is also the highest ever score chased at this venue. Will India seal the next match on Saturday and claim the series or will West Indies fight back? Let's wait and watch the action.

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "Felt we had to get early wickets. Didn't do that. We felt like we had enough. India bowled well. The wicket was on the slower side, felt it was difficult to keep scoring on it. Would've been a different game had we got early wickets. We kept losing wickets in the middle overs. We lost the game but did a lot of right things."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "I am okay at the moment. How we bowled in the middle overs was crucial. I thought we used the conditions well. Used the variations well. Was very clinical how we chased. Surya batted brilliantly, good partnership there with Iyer. The pitch had something in it for the bowlers, not an easy target. Was important to pick the right shots, right balls on a ground like that."

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Match

Suryakumar Yadav: "Really happy with the way things went. We saw yesterday what happened in the second innings. Was important for someone to bat deep and win the game, that's what I've focussed on. Just backed myself and enjoying it."

GroundName: Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground
TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF WEST INDIES T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the fourth T20I of India tour of West Indies which takes place at Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground, Lauderhill, Florida. India won the previous match after a loss in the second one and lead the contest by 2-1. India would be keen to win the contest tonight as they would seal the series whereas West Indies would look to take the decider match to the final one tomorrow. Let us see whose plans get executed well tonight and who will get their favorable result.

 

TOSS:-

West Indies won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Skipper: "We will bowl first. The ground has been covered and there should be some moisture, we'll look for early wickets. Take the game as deep as possible and then win the key moments. We are playing some good cricket so far, the boys are looking forward to today's game."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We were also looking to bowl, not sure how the pitch will play, we will now have to get the runs on the board. It's important from the team's perspective to find answers, we'll try and put our best foot forward. We are building towards the WC, the guys need to be tested in certain aspects of the game. Three changes for us - Ravi Bishnoi, Axar Patel, and Sanju Samson are in. They replace Hardik Pandya, Ravi Ashwin, and Shreyas Iyer."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 65/2 (10.8 rpo, 4x4, 5x6) || West Indies- 61/3 (10.2 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 81/2 (9.0 rpo, 8x4, 1x6) || West Indies- 55/5 (6.1 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 45/1 (9.0 rpo, 2x4, 2x6) || West Indies- 16/2 (3.8 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

 

India gets the better of the West Indies team by 59 runs and clinches the series 3-1. After the Indian team was put to bat first by WI, the openers Rohit and S Yadav played explosively and recorded 65 runs in the powerplay. R Pant who carried forward the innings in his style scored 44 runs off 31 balls! Samson (30* off 23) and Axar (20* off 8) provided runs swiftly in the death and the team reached a good score of 191 runs. In the chase, Avesh Khan picked up early wickets in the powerplay and imposed pressure. With a high score to chase, the WI batters tried to play explosively and lost wickets at regular intervals. Arshdeep Singh accounted for three wickets and the team was all out for 132 runs in the first ball of the last over!

 

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: "We know they got off to a flying start, but I was happy with the way our guys came back. Unfortunately, we didn't get a partnership, it was a par score. Not ideal to get run out, it changed the game. Akeal was brilliant with the ball. The others too need to find their rhythm and find the game. But having said that, congratulations to India. As a unit, we want to win games and tomorrow is an opportunity to take it. It is all about building up to that World Cup and finding that balance."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "I think it was pleasing how we played the game. The conditions were not easy but we got a good score. A lot of thought went into how we batted and it was pleasing to see. The pitch was quite slow which our bowlers used to their advantage. I thought 190 was a good score, but with the kind of batting that WI have, no score is good. We played good cricket to get the win today. The batters were really smart and the bowlers bowled in pairs to get wickets. It put the brakes on their scoring. I would also like to thank all the people who came in."

 
Avesh Khan is the Player of the Match

 

Avesh Khan: "I feel really good because I didn't do well in the last two games. I just focussed on my strengths today, bowling the hard lengths. My coaches and my captain told me that they were backing me.I am focussing on the next match that is left now. The ball was stopping a bit on the wicket and so I was just mixing my slower deliveries with the hard lengths, which gave me the results. Happy that the crowd came to see us."

GroundName: Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground
TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF WEST INDIES T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Fifth and final T20I of India tour of West Indies which takes place at Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground, Lauderhill, Florida. India has been impressive so far and has managed to wrap up the series in the fourth game itself. A collective effort has been the reason for Team India's success down in the Caribbean. Rohit Sharma has been spot on in using his resources and has tried to give an opportunity to almost everyone in the squad. The positive approach has translated into the team's performance as every player has been up to the task whenever offered with a chance to express. West Indies will play for pride whereas the Indian team would like to end things on a positive note. It will be interesting to see what the side looks like and which youngster gets a chance to play the game. But one can be assured of a run-fest between two teams with power pact performers.

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

Indian Skipper, Hardik Pandya: We want to bat as the wicket slowed down yesterday. We want to bat on a fresh wicket. We are like we are not playing at Miami. 99 percent of the fans are supporting India. No matter what happens, we have set some standards for the Indian cricket team. We need to go out there and showcase our skill set. Obviously, the coach, the captain and senior members have done a trmendous job. 4 changes to the team: Hardik Pandya, Ishan Kishan, Shreyas Iyer and Kuldeep Yadav.

 

West Indies Skipper, Nicolas Pooran: We wanted to bat first too. We have four changes. Brooks, Walsh, Odean Smith and Keemo Paul have come in. We have to prepare for the upcoming World Cup. This is a fresh group and India is a great team as well. The venue was small at St. Kitts and hence Hayden Walsh wasn't in playing 11.
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 53/1 (8.9 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  || West Indies- 38/3 (6.3 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 88/2 (9.8rpo, 8x4, 4x6)   || West Indies- 62/5 (6.9 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 47/4 (9.4 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)  || West Indies- 0/2  (0rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 

 

Team India has won the 5th game and also the series agianst West-Indies by 4-1. The stand in Skipper Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first. Shreyas Iyer who came in as an opener smashed 64 runs of just 40 balls and also stitched together a 76 run stand along with Deepak Hooda who scored 38 at a strike rate of 152. The team set a target of 189 for the West Indies and thereafter it was the Sipnners that sealed the game with utmost ease. Ravi Bishnoi registered his career-best figures of 16/4 in his 3 overs while Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav accounted for 3 wickets each. The West Indian side was bundled out for just 100 runs in the 16th over of their innings.

 

India Skipper, Hardik Pandya: "It's very special feeling to get a chance to lead your country. Obviously on then winning the game means a lot to me. The kind of talent the players we have and the freedom we're getting, this is the New India. I can see players playing with freedom and not worrying about failing. Preparation wise team is ready for the World Cup but as a team we learn from every game. So it's about learning with each game".

 

West Indies Skipper, Nicolas Pooran: "We were just not good enough. We didn't learn from our mistakes. We just weren't up to the challenge, just didn't put enough partnerships. To come up against tough teams, we need to be good in execution. Be it in the batting group or bowling group, we have a lot of catching up to do. I just hope that we as a team learn from these losses".

 

Player of the Match is Axar Patel: 

 "I was just focussing on keeping things simple, instead of trying too many things. Was just looking to use the surface to my advantage. The surfaces (in this series) have been helpful for me, so that has proved advantageous to me.I don't mind people calling me just an all-rounder, if I do well with the ball, I'll be a bowling all-rounder, if with the bat, then a batting all-rounder".

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ZIMBABWE ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Men in blue will take on the hosts Zimbabwe in the first of the three ODI series at Harare Sports Club. All eyes will be on KL Rahul who returns to the side and will also lead alongside Shikhar Dhawan as his deputy. The two teams have encountered 63 times in ODIs, out of which 51 have gone Team India's way and 10 have gone in favour of Zimbabwe. Team India is traveling to Zimbabwe after six years and will definitely get some valuable game time ahead of the important Asia Cup and tournaments to follow.It will be interesting to see the playing combination as Deepak Chahar returns after recovering from an injury and also whether Rahul Tripathi makes his debut. India appears as the clear favorite and will look to keep the good record in Zimbabwe intact.

 

TOSS:-

India has won the toss and elected to field.

 

Team India Captain, KL Rahul - "We will field first. Looks like a good wicket, it's an early start, so could have a bit of moisture that can be exploited. Good opportunity to bowl first and take advantage of the first hour. A lot of guys have got opportunities, good chance to challenge themselves and their skills. Looking forward to a good show". 

 

Team Zimbabwe Captain, Regis Chakabva - "We would have bowled first as well, but this looks like a good wicket and will stay the same for the rest of the day. Want the middle order to take responsibility to avoid collapse. We've got Ngarava and Marumani coming in".
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Zimbabwe- 31/3 (3.1 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)   || India- 43/0 (4.30 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Zimbabwe- 157/6 (5.23rpo, 16x4, 2x6)   || India- 149/0 (7.15 rpo, 16x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

Zimbabwe- 1/1 (2.0 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 

Team India had Zimbabwe in all sorts of problems after sending them to bat first. Deepak Chahar was lethal with the new ball picking up three wickets in the powerplay. Prasidh Krishna and Axar Patel scalped three wickets each and made sure that the Zimbabwe team was restricted to a meager score of 189. Thereafter, It was the Indian openers who took care of the rest. The duo managed to chase down the total in just over 30 overs with Gill and Dhawan getting 82* and 81* respectively. Another dominating win for Team India which also happens to be the 13th consecutive win against Zimbabwe!

 

Deepak Chahar is the player of the match!

Deepak Chahar: "The landing was a little hard and when you play a international game after six and half months, obviously you will be a little nervous. Before coming here I played at least 4-5 practice games and the body and mind wasn't working together in the first few overs, but it got better after that. I'm fine and the body is fine as well".

 

Regis Chakabva, Zimbabwean skipper: "The Indian bowlers bowled really well, put the pressure on us and we lost our way after the first 4-5 overs. It was good to see Richi (Ngarava) and Brad give us that partnership at the end. We needed to have one or two big partnerships, but it didn't happen today. Our bowlers tried to come hard at them, but obviously they batted really well and took the game away from us".

 

KL Rahul, Indian skipper:  "There was a bit of swing and seam movement, but it was good to see the bowlers stay disciplined and pick up those wickets. For a few of us, it is great to be back in the Indian dressing room. As a team, we have been in good form, good to see that all of us are getting enough game time. Feels good to be out there".

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ZIMBABWE ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
India will take on the hosts Zimbabwe in the second of the three ODI series at Harare Sports Club. India won the first ODI comprehensively, by 10 wickets and lead the series 1-0. Credits to the bowlers for wrapping up the Zimbabwean batters quickly and making the job very easy for the batters. Team India is the clear favorite today as well. Will they go ahead and win the series today or will the dark horses win and level the series? Let's find out!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

The two teams have encountered 64 times in ODIs, out of which 52 have gone Team India's way and 10 have gone in favor of Zimbabwe.

 

TOSS:-

India has won the toss and elected to field.

 

KL Rahul, India skipper: "Looks a little better, looks a lot harder than the previous surface, and obviously bowling first there's something in the wicket, hopefully, we get early wickets. I would have taken 180-190 at the start, we bowled really well and there was no dropped catch or missed chance, just that they batted really well. Just one change - Deepak Chahar misses out, Shardul Thakur comes in." 

 

Regis Chakabva, Zimbabwe skipper: "Looks a good wicket and we will try to put a good score on the board. The boys are very much aware of that and the process we are going through and we will come out and give our best effort. The top order has to see off the new ball and set it up for the middle order. We have two changes - Kaitano and Chivanga come in."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Zimbabwe- 26/1 (2.6 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  || India- 75/2 (7.5 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs):- 

Zimbabwe- 135/9 (4.8 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)  || India- 92/3 (5.9 rpo, 9x4, 4x6)

 

Team India once again comes out on top winning the game by 5 wickets with almost 25 overs to spare. It was the bowlers who bundled out Zimbabwe batters for a small total of 161 with Shardul Thakur being the pick of the bowlers accounting for three wickets. Shikhar Dhawan and Shubman Gill made 33 each and laid down the foundation for the side. Thereafter, it was Sanju Samson who took India home in style making an unbeaten 43 of just 39 balls. India has clinched the series and will enter the third game of the series with the intent of a clean sweep.

 

Regis Chakabva, Zimbabwean captain: "I think we had a really good fight. Last few games we struggled to pick up early wickets and we managed to do that. Today we were short with a few runs. We were up for the challenge, the bowlers hit their lengths really well."

 

KL Rahul, Indian captain: "Good for some of the guys to get time in the middle. "They do have some quality bowlers, I saw that in the previous series against Bangladesh as well. The bowlers came strong at us, a good challenge for us. We are here to play good cricket and win, every opportunity is an honor so we want to do out there next time also to enjoy ourselves and put a good performance. Wherever we travel, we get good support from Indian fans, very thankful for their support."

 

Sanju Samson is the Player of the Match

 

Sanju Samson: "How much ever time you spend in the middle, it makes you feel good. Even more special to do it for the country. Really enjoying keeping and batting. I think the Indian bowlers were bowling really good areas, a lot of balls came nicely to me."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: INDIA TOUR OF ZIMBABWE ODI SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live Commentary of the third and final ODI between Zimbabwe and India taking place at the Harare Sports Club. India has already sealed the series 2-0 and will look to give some game time to the bench strength which is waiting for their opportunity to express themselves in the middle. While Zimbabwe, the home team on the other hand will play for pride and will try to put an end to the win streak of the Indian Team against them. It will be interesting to see India's playing combination going ahead in the third game.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

Both the teams have encountered 65 times out of which 53 games have been won by India while Zimbabwe have managed to seal 10.

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

KL Rahul, India Captain: "We'll bat first inorder to challenge ourselves. I've been short of playing time so I'm eager to get some runs and spend time in the middle. A couple of changes - Siraj and Prasidh miss out, Deepak Chahar and Avesh Khan come in."

 

Regis Chakabva, Zimbabwe Captain: "With the ball we need to try and take early wickets today, and then try to deliver with the bat. A couple of changes for us. Happy to be doing something different today that is bowling first."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 41/0 (4.1 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  || Zimbabwe- 49/1 (4.9 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 169/2 (5.6 rpo, 19x4, 1x6)  || Zimbabwe- 146/6 (4.9 rpo, 12x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 79/6 (7.9 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || Zimbabwe- 81/3 (8.1 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

 

It was the first occasion in this series when Team India decided to bat first after winning the toss. The openers started cautiously and thereafter it was the 'Shubman Gill show' that helped India get to a total of 289. Gill scored 130 of just 97 balls and was also involved in a 140 run match winning partnership along with Ishan Kishan who scored a well-composed fifty. The Zimbabwean middle order kept the match alive courtesy of some fine hitting from Sikandar Raza who made 115 of 95 balls but eventually succumbed to the pressure. Avesh Khan was the pick of the bowlers scalping three while the spinners Kuldeep and Axar contained the opposition picking 2 wickets each. Zimbabwe fell short by just 13 runs in the end. Team India complete a clean sweep and continue their winning streak against Zimbabwe!

 

Regis Chakabva, Zimbabwe Captain: "Firstly congratulations to India. They played really well. Raza and Brad gave a good fight, but India held their nerves. Huge positives from the bowling. The boys fought hard in the field. We came back strongly from a tough situation. We definitely take a lot of positives from the series."

 

KL Rahul, India Captain: "Feels good, we came here with a good ideas. We wanted to be out in the middle and use this time. The players have been very professional, very happy with the result. They took the game deep, we would have liked to finish the game earlier. The bowers were tested and they held their nerves.Shubman Gill showed great temperament and is pleasing to the eyes when he is in this kind of form. Happy with the overall outcome."

 

Player of the Match and Player of the Series 

 

Shubman Gill: "I was just trying to minimize my dot ball percentage. I tried to hit the gaps as much as possible. When I went in, there were a couple of bowlers bowling good. It was crucial to get through that. Once we were settled, we knew we could attack. The bat was pretty good. That's why I changed it after my 50, I wanted to save it. Definitely special on hitting his maiden international ton. (Playing in this team) It feels great, great bunch of players. Feels good when you are with the same bunch. I dedicate this award to my father."

GroundName: Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium
TossDetails: Australia won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: AUSTRALIA TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the first of the three T20s between India and Australia at Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium, Mohali. The two teams have met each other 23 times and it is Team India that has gotten the better of the opposition. The Men in Blue have come out victorious on 13 occasions while 9 matches have been won by Australia. After a decent outing in the Asia Cup, Team India would be looking to set the right template for the upcoming World T20 in Australia. It is a full-strength Indian side, especially with Jasprit Bumrah and Harshal Patel returning to th,e squad. Both the teams would want to get a settled playing combination in place before the T20 World Cup in less than 3 weeks' time. A thriller of a contest awaits between Ranked 1 Indian team and the World Champions Australia.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Australia have encountered 23 times in T20 Internationals out of which 13 times it was Team India that came out on top while 9 of the matches were clinched by Australia.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Aakash Chopra: "It looks like a good batting track. One can expect a lot of runs. The team batting first should be able to reach 180-190, and that could be chased down as well with the dew coming into the picture later on during the game.
