Virat Kohli and Glenn Maxwell are my top picks for this game to do well. Spin would have a very small impact here."

 

TOSS:-

Australia won the toss and has elected to field first!

 

Aaron Finch, Australian Captain: "We're going to have a bowl first. It is about building up to the World Cup, and about getting some information about our boys. Really excited. You expect to be tested, hopefully some dew comes out. The pitch looks hard and flat. We have one change from out earlier XI. Cameron Green will open the batting.."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "It is an opportunity to test ourselves. Every game is a big game to learn. We got to learn so much in the last six-eight months on how to win games. This series will be no different for us to express ourselves. Looking at what happened in the Asia Cup, we had a chance to reflect on where we went wrong. This gives us an opportunity to correct ourselves as a group. Nothing changes in terms of our approach. Unfortunately, there are some injuries in the squad"
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 46/2 (7.6 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)   || Australia- 60/1 (10.0 rpo, 10x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 95/2 (10.5 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)  || Australia- 88/4 (9.7 rpo, 8x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 67/2 (13.4 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)  || Australia- 63/1 (15.0 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

 

India lost two early wickets in the powerplay after being sent in to bat by Australia. But a fine partnership of 68(42) between KL Rahul and Suryakumar Yadav brought India back in the game. KL Rahul finished with 55 runs at a strike rate of 157 while SKY scored 46 of just 25 balls. But it was the late onslaught from Hardik Pandya that took the Indian tally to 208. Pandya remained unbeaten on 71 off just 30 balls. In reply, Australia got off to a flying start courtesy of Cameron Green who amassed 61 at a strike rate of 200. India came back into the game in the 12th over where Umesh Yadav scalped two crucial wickets. Axar Patel was the pick of the bowlers with 3 wickets against his name conceding just 17 runs. But it was Matthew Wade who took the game out of India's grasp in no time. The left handed wicket Keeper batter made an unbeaten 45 off just 21 balls to take his team home with 4 balls to spare.

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "I don't think we bowled well. 200 is a good score to defend, and we didn't take our chances in the field. It was a great effort from our batters, but bowlers were quite not there. There are things we need to look at, but it was a great game for us to understand what went wrong. We know this is a high-scoring ground. You can't relax even if you get 200. We took wickets to an extent, but they played really well."

 

Aaron Finch, Australian Captain: "It was a good contest, wasn't it? We had some really good partnerships, there were some good contests between the bat and ball. They came hard at us. You expect the run rate to slow down if you lose wickets. The batters tried to change the momentum of the game. That's what we play for, we still try to instill all the processes leading into the World Cup"

 

Cameron Green is the Player of the Match

"It was a good experience opening the innings alongside Finch. I enjoyed Hardik Pandya's batting too. Loved the way he connects the ball.  It was kind of good to watch them bat, and that gave us an idea about how to go about while chasing"

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: AUSTRALIA TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
IT WILL BE AN 8-OVERS GAME!

 

Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of the second T20I between India and Australia which takes place at Vidarbha Cricket Association Stadium, Nagpur. The first match was a high-scoring thriller where Hardik Pandya for India and Cameron Green for Australia shined with the bat and the match ended in the favour of the visitors where they chased down the target in the last over. The Indian team would be all set to reply back with a win tonight and to null the series to take the decider to the final one on Sunday.

 

PITCH REPORT

Ravi Shastri: "Pretty overcast and it is very humid. This pitch looks tacky. Normally teams winning the toss bat first. With the rain around, teams might want to do otherwise. There is a darkish look to the pitch which suggests that the covers have been on. It is dry as well. It looks two-paced as well. The ball will hold up and turn. The par score is 150, and it shouldn't change much."

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "We're going to field first. It is nice to get a game. These games are challenging because you don't know what to do. You just have to go out and express yourself. Hopefully, we can put up a good show. Since it is an eight-over game, we had to make two changes: Bumrah comes in for Umesh Yadav."

 

Aaron Finch, Australian Captain: "We would have bowled first as well. Chasing in a small gave would have been good. We're happy with the way we played and the execution. Two Changes Ellis is injured and Sams comes in. Sean Abbott comes in for Inglis."
PostMatchCommentary:
India showcased fireworks in the eight-over thriller by chasing down the target of 91 and taking the team home! The match was delayed and reduced to eight overs due to the wet outfield. After winning the toss, India put Australia to bat first. A Finch (31* off 15) provided a good start early on and M Wade finished the match well with 43* off 20. In the second innings, the skipper Rohit Sharma led the team from the front by hitting 46* runs. The team in the end chased the target and equaled the series. The final match on Sunday will be the decider! 

 

Aaron Finch, Australian Captain: "Rohit played brilliantly and two overs of Axar made the difference. Wade is a calm customer at the back end and he has grown into that finisher's role. Zampa was good too. We just got out-executed a little bit towards the back end. But we got close."

 

Rohit Sharma is the Player of the Match

Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "I was quite surprised as well actually. Didn't expect to hit it like that, glad it came off. For the last few months I have been playing like that. The bowlers had something to bowl to and we bowled well. Glad DK could finish well. Been a while since he had some time in the middle. There was this thought if we should get Rishabh in but I thought Sams is going to bowl off-cutters, so I thought let DK come in and he is playing that role anyway for us."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: AUSTRALIA TOUR OF INDIA T20 SERIES 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of the third and final T20I between India and Australia which takes place at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium, Hyderabad. We have a cracking contest ahead of us as this game would be the decider of the series. Both teams would look to emerge victorious and be crowned the winners of the series. The first match was a high-scoring thriller where Hardik Pandya for India and Cameron Green for Australia shined with the bat and the match ended in the favour of the visitors where they chased down the target in the last over. The hosts replied in style in the second match, in the game that was shortened due to rain, with Jasprit Bumrah returning to the XI and our skipper Rohit Sharma leading us from the front. Not a lot to separate these two teams. Let's find out what happens in this blockbuster game.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

The two teams have met each other 25 times and it is Team India that has gotten the better of the opposition. The Men in Blue have come out victorious on 14 occasions while 10 matches have been won by Australia.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Murali Kartik and Ajit Agarkar: "It's a fairly large surface with even-sized boundaries on both sides of the square. It's another good batting surface, the grass has been well rolled. Dew wouldn't be a factor tonight, but the captain winning the toss could still be looking at chasing down the score. Defending wouldn't be easy as the ball could come onto the bat even better under lights."

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "It's important to maintain your momentum in this format of the game, so it was a good win for us in Nagpur. Australia has always been challenging, they bring in a different kind of challenge. We need to keep doing the basics right if we have to get success. The last win helped us gain confidence and I hope everyone steps up today. One change for us - Bhuvi is in for Rishabh. We needed only 4 bowlers in the last game, so he, unfortunately, missed out."

 

Aaron Finch, Australian Captain: "We would have fielded as well, it looks like a good wicket though. We always want to perform against the best sides. In that sense, this is a very important game for us. One change for us. Josh Inglis replaces Sean Abbott."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Australia- 66/2 (11.0 rpo, 9x4, 3x6) || India- 50/2 (8.3 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

Australia- 57/4 (6.3 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || India- 93/1 (10.3 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

Australia- 63/1 (12.6 rpo, 3x4, 5x6) || India- 44/1 (9.1 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

 

And breathe! India emerge victorious in this series after India win the nail-biting game by 6 wickets, in the last over! Australia started the game in a very hasty manner with Cam Green starting the innings with 52 off just 21. Then the spinners were introduced into the attack who did their job very well and stabilized the innings. Then Tim David finished the innings in style with a quick-fired 54 off 27 and helped Australia reach an above-par total of 186! As the men in blue walked in to chase, India lost her openers soon but Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav were involved in a match-winning 104-run stand, with each of them scoring a half-century. Hardik Pandya provided the finish that India needed to win the game, as India finished the game with 6 wickets and a ball to spare. India wins the series 2-1.

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "It was a great occasion. We wanted to put up a show, and we did that well. The biggest positive was different individuals stepping up with the ball and bat. When you are sitting back and watching all of that happening, you feel nice as a management. Sometimes you can err in doing a lot of things. This is T20 cricket, and the margins of error are very small. I thought we took our chances, we were brave. Sometimes it didn't come off, but that is a learning we will take."

 

Aaron Finch, Australian Captain: "It was a really good series. We held our nerves well in the middle overs. The series Green had was big as well. We thought it was a decent total, it got a bit dewy, and we knew we had to get wickets. You can't rely on containing India. At times we were a bit sloppy in our execution. To be able to play three games against a world-class side has been great for this side."

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Match

Suryakumar Yadav: "I have always wanted to express myself. That's how I practice in the nets. Just loving at No.4. A lot of challenges and responsibilities as well. You can't shy away from expressing yourself."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India T20 Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the First T20I between India and South Africa. Both teams will clash against each other in three T20Is and three ODIs. This series will be nothing short of entertainment. India are on a high after beating Australia in the T20I series on home soil. While their opponents South Africa comes back after a T20I series victory against England at England. As the ICC T20 World Cup is approaching, both teams will look forward to gaining momentum from here on! Let us wait and watch who starts the series with a victory!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

Both the teams have squared off against each other 20 times and India are ahead in the contest with 11 victories and SA are with 8 wins.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Pommie Mbangwa and Ajit Agarkar: "Lovely stadium. Weather pretty good. As far as the dimensions are concerned the longest hit is straight - 76m. It's around 64 to 66m square of the wicket. Nice even covering of grass, but it's very very firm. Lots of runs scored on Indian pitches and this is no different. Because there is grass there might be some help with the new ball for pacers up front and there is a bit of dew, so the captains will have a watch."

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 
Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "We will bowl first. It was a good wicket when we played here last time. Bit of green covering but it's gonna be a good batting track. Very healthy atmosphere in the group and we also want to make sure to tick all the boxes and so far we have been doing good and we just want to continue to do that. Pant, Arshdeep come in along with Deepak Chahar and Ashwin."
 
Temba Bavuma, South Africa Captian: "We probably would have fielded first as well. Good going over the last couple of months. This is an important series for us and we want to continue all the good work. Guys always enjoy the India trip, the energy of the guys is up again and nice to be back in action after a couple of months."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

South Africa- 30/5 (5.0 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) || India- 17/1 (2.8 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

South Africa- 53/2 (5.8 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || India- 74/1 (8.2 rpo, 2x4, 6x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

South Africa- 23/1 (4.6 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)  || India- 19/0 (11.4 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

 

The curtain-raiser match of the India vs South Africa T20I series is cleanly dominated by the hosts. After winning the toss and electing to bowl first, the Indian bowling pace unit was extraordinary as they dismissed half the batters of the South African side within the powerplay! The innings from K Maharaj was the reviving one for their team as he scored 41 runs off 35 balls! South Africa was restricted to 106 runs in 20 overs. In reply, South Africa contained team India for a score of 19 runs in the powerplay! The 93* run stand between KL Rahul (51* off 56) and Suryakumar Yadav (50* off 33) took the team over the line in the 17th over!

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Skipper: "As a batting unit we failed to apply ourselves in those conditions. We didn't expect the pitch to play this way. Seamers needed runs behind them to defend. They tried their best and supported by spinners as well. I thought we fought well late with the bat. That's a positive."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "The wicket was tricky. You learn a lot playing such a game. You understand what the team needs to do in tough conditions. Both teams were in the contest and the team that played better won the game. We started well, got 5 wickets in quick time and that was the turning point. Perfect showcase of how to bowl when there is help for the pacers. We knew it wasn't going to be easy. Got to respect the conditions. Lost two wickets and that partnership between KL and Surya got us home."

 

Arshdeep Singh is the Player of the Match

Arshdeep Singh: "In the first over, Deepak Chahar set the tone and we knew there was plenty of help from the surface. The plan was to keep it simple and bowl in the right areas. I enjoyed Miller's wicket as I thought he was expecting an outswinger but I bowled an inswinger instead."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India T20 Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
After a clinical performance on a tricky track at Thiruvananthapuram, the Men in blue march on to Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati for the second T20 International. South Africa will look to bounce back after their dismal performance where they lost 5 wickets with just 9 runs on board. Deepak Chahar and Arshdeep Singh ran through the batting order and there was no answer to their fine swing bowling.Looking at the batting side of things, KL took charge to steady the ship while Suryakumar Yadav led the onslaught from the other end to take India home with ease. India lead the 3 game series 1-0 and will look to clinch the series today itself while Temba Bavuma's men will fight to stay alive in the series.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ajit Agarkar and Murali Kartik: "Only the third T20I played here. There have been low-scoring games here and the average score is 145. There are a few cracks and the groundstaff have left a bit of grass as well. It looks very dry as well. Bowling first would be an advantage and might get easier for batting in the second innings."

 

TOSS:-

South Africa won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Temba Bavuma, South Africa Captain: "We are gonna bowl first, manage our energies really well. This one looks like a different pitch. We want to do the job with the ball and then the batters to finish it off. We had a few positives from the first game. Just one change. Ngidi comes in for Shamsi"

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "Yes we would have fielded as well. Just want to come out, play some good cricket and entertain the crowd. We have never beaten these guys here and it's gonna take a lot of effort from everyone to do that and we have come out prepared and pretty much ready for the game. Not too sure how the conditions will be. When I touched the pitch there was some stickiness and we gotta be a little cautious at the start."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 57/0 (9.5 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)  || South Africa- 45/3 (7.5 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 98/2 (10.9 rpo, 9x4, 5x6)  || South Africa- 98/0 (10.9 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 82/1 (16.4 rpo, 7x4, 6x6)  || South Africa- 78/0 (15.6 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)

 

India got off to a flying start after being asked to bat first. KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma added 96 for the first wicket and that set the platform for the other batters to follow. Thereafter, it was Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav's turn to take charge. The duo added 102 runs off just 42 balls taking the match away from the opposition. Yadav's 61 of 22 balls with vital contributions from the top order helped India put up a huge total of 237 on board. In response, the African batters struggled against the new ball bowling of Arshdeep Singh and Deepak Chahar which set the momentum in India's favor. But an onslaught from Miller and QDK in the latter half of the innings brought South Africa back in the game. They managed to put up 174 off just 84 balls between them but fell short by 16 runs in the end. India takes an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series and will look to continue the winning momentum at Holkar stadium in Indore. 

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Captain: "It probably wasn't our best performance with the ball. Different conditions and different plans were needed. Execution of our plans is where our conversation is going to be. With 220, we were thinking as batters would be good. But 240 was too high. It shows why David Miller is one of the best T20 batters going around. He is looking good, feeling good and we can draw a lot of confidence from his performance today."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "It is something that all of came together and said was what we wanted to do as a team. It might not come across at times, but we want to stick to it. What I have seen in the last 8-10 months is individuals putting their hand up and getting the job done for the team. Guys without too much experience did this as well. The team wants to play and bowl in a certain way and we want to give them that confidence"

 

KL Rahul is the Player of the Match

" It is important as an opener to understand what is required on a day and give it your best. It is the mindset I have always played in and will continue to do the same. Satisfying to test yourself in different conditions. Quite honestly, after the first two overs, the chat between me and Rohit was that the pitch was gripping. We thought 180-185 would be a good target. But the game surprises us. I am surpirsed I am getting the Man of the Match award, Surya should have gotten it."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India T20 Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
After a run fest at Guwahati, India and South Africa move on to the Holkar Stadium at Indore. India put up a humongous total of 237 courtesy of some expressive batting from the likes of Suryakumar Yadav, and KL Rahul. Virat Kohli coming back to form is a big plus for the side ahead of the global tournament end of the month. Now that the series is in the bag already, Men in Blue will focus on filling the void of their pace ace Jasprit Bumrah who has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup. With Virat Kohli and KL Rahul rested, Shreyas Iyer walks into the side and we might see some new face in the bowling attack too.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ajit Agarkar and Pommie Mbangwa: "First thing to draw your attention to, it's a small stadium. 63 metres in the off side, 60 metres on the leg side. It's always a good pitch in Indore, this is one of the surfaces where the bowler's wouldn't want to bowl at. There are a few cracks that could help them, but the size of the ground is a worry. Even a few mishits could end up out of the ground. The team winning the toss will want to chase here."

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We're going to field first. It's a very high-scoring ground, I feel the pitch won't change a lot so nice to know what target is in front of us. Three changes for us, Kohli and KL are out, and Arshdeep misses out for some issues with his back. It is precautiounary, nothing serious. We've got Shreyas Iyer, Umesh Yadav and Siraj in."

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Captain: "Wasn't too sure on what to do today, not too fussed about losing the toss. As a leader, these are the kind of games you want to contribute. Hopefully, I can repay the team today. The series is out of our reach but this is our last opportunity we have to acheive a few objectives ahead of the World Cup. One change today - Dwayne Pretorious comes in for Nortje, just to give an extra option with a change of pace."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

South Africa- 48/1 (8.0 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  || India- 64/3 (10.6 rpo, 7x4, 4x6) 

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

South Africa- 106/1 (11.7 rpo, 7x4, 9x6)  ||  India- 78/5 (8.6 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

South Africa- 73/1 (14.6 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  ||  India- 36/2 (10.9 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)

 

South Africa came out all guns blazing after being asked to bat first. QDK led the attack and made sure that the team capitalized in the powerplay. QDK scored 68 off just 43 balls and also gave good support to Rilley Rossouw from the other end. Rossouw took a few deliveries to get in and thereafter was difficult to contain. He smashed an unbeaten century off just 48 balls and displayed clean striking throughout the innings. India in response, lost its way early on by losing 3 wickets in the powerplay. Dinesh Karthik was the top scorer with 46 runs off just 21 balls. The team fell short by 49 runs while chasing a target of 228.

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Captain: "A win like this is good for confidence. Our bowling wasn't best in the last game, but we were clinical today. A lot to take from this game. We didn't turn up with the bat in the first game. In the second game, we couldn't execute our plans. We were a lot clear in the field today, it was a lot more clinical performance today."

 

Rille Rossouw is the Player of the Match

"It's something that every cricketer goes through, lucky for me, tonight was my night. We had a discussion out there, and he (de Kock) said you be the guy scoring. They are a world class side. I am glad that I could contribute for the winning side tonight."

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Series

 "The thought process was the same, I just wanted to enjoy. I had to take a step back and build a partnership with him. Didn't work today. DK needed some game time, and I think the way he batted, my number 4 is in trouble. I haven't thought much about it, but I am looking forward to it."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "As a team we said at the beginning, no matter what happens with the result - there's always room for improvement. We want to keep getting better as a team. Teams have been quite challenging, they can challenge in all departments. Something we have been talking about at length. We need to look at lot of things. We need to work on our bowling. We played against two quality sides, we came across tough challenges. We need to see what better we can do. We are working towards that, guys need a lot of clarity, it's my job to make sure it happens."

GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India Odi Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the First of the three ODI Series between India and South Africa. One can expect rain to play spoilsport in the first ODI scheduled to take place at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Stadium, Lucknow. After suffering a defeat in the T20 series, Temba Bavuma and his men would be looking to gain some winning momentum before the T20 world cup which is about to begin in less than 3 weeks' time. They will also look to capitalize on the fact that India will field a relatively inexperienced lot as most of the players have already flown to Australia for T20 WC preparations. But this side under the leadership of Shikhar Dhawan has played together before and showed their mettle in tough situations. The team is no short of talent and it would not be wrong to say that the players are waiting for opportunities to express themselves in the middle. Indian Squad has included a lot of new faces like Rahul Tripathi, Rajat Patidar, Mukesh Kumar, Ruturaj Gaikwad and Shahbaz Ahmed who might get a chance to debut for India.  

 

Revised Rules: It is a curtailed game with 40 overs a side. The powerplay will be between overs 1 to 8. A bowler is allowed to bowl a maximum of 8 overs.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and South Africa have faced each other on 87 occasions in ODI. Out of which, Men in blue have won 35 games whereas the visitors have come out victorious 49 times.

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Shikhar Dhawan, India Captain: "We would like to field first. There is a bit of moisture on the wicket and we want to exploit that. We got 6 batters and 5 bowlers playing. Ruturaj is making his debut today. 2 spinners and 3 pacers"

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Captain:"We would have liked to bowl first as well. We have a job to do with the bat and we need to adapt accordingly after the first few overs. You gotta be able to adapt to different formats quickly and we still want to keep those T20 skills in check. Every game for us is a big opportunity. "
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-8 Overs) :-

South Africa- 28/0 (3.5 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  || India- 18/2 (2.3 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Middle overs (9-32 Overs) :-

South Africa- 151/4 (6.3 rpo, 13x4, 2x6) || India- 136/3 (5.7 rpo, 13x4, 1x6)

Death overs (33-40 Overs) :-

South Africa- 70/0 (8.7 rpo, 4x4, 3x6) || India- 86/3 (10.8 rpo, 12x4, 2x6)

 

The first match of the India vs South Africa ODI series turned out to be a close game in which the visitors got the better of the hosts. Nonstop rain in Lucknow had the match reduced to 40 overs a side. After winning the toss and electing to bowl first, the Indian bowling unit was great as they dismissed the top order for 110 runs! It was the match-winning unbeaten partnership between Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller of 139 runs that took South Africa to 249, setting a target of 250 for the men in blue in 40 overs! In reply, South Africa contained the Indian top order for a score of 51 runs in 17.4 overs with the loss of 4 wickets! With a Herculian task ahead, Shreyas Iyer and Sanju Samson got going. Iyer was dismissed at 50, after which Shardul and Samson put up a 93 runs stand which brought India much closer but still couldn't achieve the given target. Sanju Samson was unbeaten on 86 while Lungi Ngidi was the pick of the South African bowlers who clinched 3 wickets! The visitors lead the 3-match series 1-0.

 

Shikhar Dhawan, India Captain: "Very proud of the way the boys played. It's tremendous the way Shreyas, Samson and Shardul played. I thought 250 was too many runs, because the wicket had turn and seam. It'll be a good experience and learning for the young boys"

 

Temba Bavuma, South Africa Captain: "A good fight at the end, obviously Sanju pushed us at the end, but the boys stood firm and took us to the win. There wasn't much grass on the surface, we lost a couple of wickets in the middle overs, myself and Aiden, but the boys knuckled down. Miller and Klaasen played positively, stung together a partnership and took us to a good score. Bowling upfront was good, in the first 15 overs by KG and Parnell. I thought we lost our way in the middle overs, gave away far too many runs, but in the end, the result did go our way and I'm happy with that."

 

Heinrich Klaasen is the Player of the Match

Heinrich Klaasen: "The ball was moving a lot and was spinning just before I walked out to the middle. But we have worked hard in the nets, I do have a good record against India and looking forward to the rest of the games."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India Odi Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the second of the three ODI Series between India and South Africa happening at the JSCA International Stadium Complex,  Ranchi. After suffering a defeat in the 1ST ODI, in the rain-reduced game, the men in blue will be looking forward to winning the game to equalize and stay alive in the series. At the same time, the Proteas will be looking to gain another victory to make their qualification progress for the ICC World Cup 2023 simpler. We have an exciting game on the cards today! 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and South Africa have faced each other on 88 occasions in ODI. Out of which, Men in blue have won 35 games whereas the visitors have come out victorious 50 times.

 

TOSS:-

South Africa have won the toss and have opted to bat

 

Keshav Maharaj, South African Captain: "We are gonna have a bat, looks like a good wicket. Shamsi and Temba didn't wake up feeling too well this morning. Lungi Ngidi is also out. So, Reeza Hendricks, Anrich Nortje, and Bjorn Fortuin are coming in for them. Hopefully, we can try and utilize the conditions, assess it up front, and play it from there."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Indian captain: "We would have bowled first actually, there is going to be dew in the second innings and we are gonna take advantage of that. Two changes for us. Washington Sundar coming in and Shahbaz Ahmed is making his debut today. Ruturaj and Ravi Bishnoi are out."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs):-

South Africa - 40/2 (4.0 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || India - 55/2 (5.5 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs):- 

South Africa - 181/3 (6.0 rpo, 17x4, 4x6) || India - 181/1 (6.0 rpo, 14x4, 7x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs):-

 South Africa - 57/2 (5.7 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || India - 46/0 (7.5 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

 

Shreyas Iyer and Ishan Kishan shine as India win the 2ND ODI match of the series at JSCA International Stadium Complex, Ranchi by 7 wickets. India started off good with the ball but Reeza Hendricks and Aiden Markram put up a great stand of 129 runs with Aiden Markram scoring 79 and Reeza Hendricks scoring 74. But the Indians came back stronger with the ball by restricting South Africa to 278 by only conceding 57 runs in the last 10 overs with just 4 boundaries. South Africa started off well by picking up 2 early wickets but Shreyas Iyer and local boy Ishan Kishan built a match-winning partnership of 161 runs. Ishan Kishan was dismissed right before he could score a ton, after which Shreyas Iyer and Sanju Samson successfully chased the target in 45.5 overs. The series is now evenly poised as India equalized today. The 3RD ODI in Delhi will be the decider. 

 

Keshav Maharaj, South African Captain: "I think we didn't expect the dew to play such a big part, that's why we opted to bat after we won the toss. But credit to Shreyas and Sanju. We expected it to get slower and lower but after 20 overs the pitch got better."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Indian captain: "The toss worked perfectly, I am glad. Thanks to Keshav that he chose to bat. I must say that Ishan and Shreyas, the way they created that partnership was great to watch. The ball was coming on nicely but it was keeping low. So our plan was to take on the bowlers in the first ten overs. But once the dew came into the picture, it was skidding on. So the back-foot shots were easy to execute. I am very pleased with the bowlers, especially Shahbaz, the way he bowled in the first ten overs and got us the breakthrough."

 

Shreyas Iyer is the man of the match!

Shreyas Iyer: "When I went into bat, felt that the wicket was playing good. The talk between me and Ishan was to play the ball on merit, and build a partnership. Tomorrow is going to be a travel day, and then the match. Let's see what is in store for me. I'm not someone who changes according to the bowler. I am someone who changes on instinct and believing in myself."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: South Africa Tour Of India Odi Series 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the Third and final ODI between India and South Africa. After a convincing win in the previous encounter, the series stands at 1-1 and both teams would be looking to take the series home. South Africa would be eyeing those precious points for the ICC Men's Cricket world cup super league. Both teams would look to emerge victorious and be crowned the winner. Shreyas Iyer and Sanju Samson have been in good touch in this series and would be wanting to continue their good form in this decider. After a crunch contest in the first ODI South Africa came out victorious and the Indians replied in style during the second encounter. Not a lot to separate these two teams. Let's head to this ODI and find out what happens in this blockbuster.

So, South Africa have a new captain for every encounter in this ODI series.    

 

TOSS:-

 

India won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Shikhar Dhawan, India Captain: "I feel there is some moisture on the wicket and we would want to explore that. The boys played well under pressure. We are going with the same team."

 

David Miller, South Africa Captain: "It is always a privilege to be the skipper. We would have bowled first. We have three changes. Few guys have fallen sick. Maharaj fell sick. Shamsi and Bavuma are down as well. Marco Jansen, Andile Phehlukwayo and Lungi Ngidi are in for this encounter."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs):-

South Africa- 26/3 (2.6 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || India- 53/1 (5.3 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs):- 

South Africa- 73/7 (4.3 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || India- 52/2 (5.7 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

 

India wins the third and final ODI against the Proteas to clinch the series! South Africa were outplayed comfortably today. It seemed a damp wicket and South Africa were put to bat first. Siraj struck early and then the spinners continued to do the damage. Klaasen did well to hold one end up but he fell as well. South Africa in the end were bundled out for 99, thanks to the spinners who picked up 8 out of the 10 wickets, with Siraj picking up the other 2. The men in blue chased the given target in just 19.1 overs, with ease. The series started off on a close note before India widened the gap on South Africa. Iyer and Kishan were dominating in the second ODI and today, it ended on a good note for the Indians.

 

David Miller, South Africa Captain: "It was very tough. Didn't help scoring just 99. Disappointing result today, to finish off the series in that way. There was a bit of spin, and it was two paced, it was tacky as it was under covers due to the rain. We were really good in certain areas, we managed to find our feet. We just need to extend the good periods when it comes to ODIs."

 
Player of the Match is Kuldeep Yadav
Kuldeep Yadav: "Feeling very happy, to be honest. Getting the Player of the Match award, the wicket was perfect and I am enjoying my bowling. I am not thinking too much about the result, just focusing on the process and focusing on my rhythm. I am trying to bowl in good areas. Not thinking too much, my next target is to perform well in Syed Mushtaq Ali tournament."
 
Player of the Series is Mohammed Siraj
Mohammed Siraj: Performing against a good team gives you a lot of confidence. I had to take responsibility. I try to figure out the right lengths at the start of the innings. As a fast bowler, you need that fire and passion inside you. Happy with my performance, and happy to get this Player of the Series award.
 
Shikhar Dhawan, Indian captain: I am proud of the boys, the way they played in the series. The way they carried the responsibility and showed maturity. Would like to thank the support staff. We showed a lot of character in the first game, we dropped a few catches, but we never really put pressure on ourselves. We tried to stick to the process. I am enjoying the journey, I'll try to keep performing well for my team. The boys showed great character on such tough batting pitches. The bowlers were clinical today.

ICC T20 World Cup Warm-up Matches 2022

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ICC Mens T20 World Cup 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the ICC T20 World Cup 2022 super 12 fixture between India and Pakistan happening at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.The biggest rivalry and the most awaited game of the year. Both India and Pakistan will look to kickstart their world cup campaigns with a win. India almost always had the last laugh in World Cup fixtures against Pakistan, winning 12 out of 13 games against them in World Cups across all formats and winning 5 out of 6 in ICC World Cup T20. However, Pakistan got the better of the men in blue in the most recent World Cup game that happened between these two nations, and the men in blue would definitely be looking to avenge that, as the wounds are still raw. King Kohli averages 67.7 in 9 T20Is against Pakistan, scoring 3 fifties in 4 T20 World Cup encounters. He also averages 64.4 in Australia, with a strike rate of 144.6. Like always, he will have all eyes on him today. Regardless of the result, with 100,000 fans watching from the stadium and almost the whole world watching the game from their homes, we have an absolute blockbuster ahead of us!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Pakistan have faced each other on 11 occasions in T20I. Out of which, Men in blue have won 8 games whereas Pakistan have come out victorious thrice.

 

TOSS:-

India have won the toss and have opted to field first

 
Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "Looks like a good pitch, it's always nice to bowl with overcast conditions. Think the ball will swing around a bit, and we need to take advantage. Preparations have been good. We played a couple of practice games in Brisbane. Time to come out and enjoy ourselves now. We were expecting nothing less than this, hopefully, we'll entertain the crowd. We have seven batters, three seamers, and two spinners."
 
Babar Azam, Pakistan Captain: "We would have liked to bowl first as well. We'll try to post around 160-170. We have prepared well, and we are ready for this big game. We had a T20 series back home and we played a tri-series in New Zealand with similar conditions, so we are prepared. We have three fast bowlers and two spinners."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Pakistan- 32/2 (5.3 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || India- 31/3 (5.2 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):-

Pakistan- 74/3 (8.2 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)  || India- 69/1 (7.7 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):-

Pakistan- 53/3 (10.6 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || India- 60/2 (12.0 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

 

It's quite easy to summarize this game in two words: "VIRAT KOHLI". Cometh the hour, Cometh the man. Knocks like this are the foundation of becoming a legend! When India needed 48 runs off 3 overs in a fairly low-scoring game and yet, amidst the chaos, 1.38 billion people had hope. Why? Because of Virat "King" Kohli, who played one of the greatest T20 knocks ever! 1.38 billion people can go to bed peacefully because of this man's brilliance today! On behalf of the whole nation, THANK YOU!

 

 

India wins a nail-biting thriller by 4 wickets and kickstarts this World Cup campaign with a victory against Pakistan, at Melbourne. After winning the toss and choosing to bowl first, the men in blue started off the innings strong by dismissing both the openers for single figures but Pakistan came back strong when Ahmed (51 off 34) and Masood (52* off 42) fought back with a partnership. However, after the dismissal of Iftikhar Ahmed, wickets started tumbling again and Pakistan ended up with 159 runs on the board for the fall of 8 wickets, with Hardik and Arshdeep picking up 3 wickets each. Coming in to bat, to chase 160, the men in blue did not have the start that they would have desired as they were 31/4 right after the powerplay! Then Kohli and Pandya kept India alive with their 113 run stand, which was broken only in the last over. And after a dramatic last over, India won the thrilling contest and registered yet another World Cup win over rivals Pakistan, thanks to Kohli's heroics.

 

Babar Azam, Pakistan Captain: "A tight game. We started well in our bowling, and then all credit to Hardik Pandya and Virat Kohli. They shifted the momentum and finished the game well. It's not easy with the new ball, with a little bit of swing and seam. We had a chance, and we just asked the boys to believe in themselves, but again credit to Virat Kohli. We needed a wicket, that's why we utilized our main bowlers [and kept Nawaz for the end]. A lot of positives. The way Iftikhar played, the way Shan played and finished the innings was good for us."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian captain: "I have no voice left. We were always wanting to make sure we stayed in the game as long as possible. We've been talking constantly about it. No matter what the situation, you've got to believe you can pull through, and that partnership changed the game for us. There was good carry, and good swing as well, and we utilized that well upfront. That was good to see from the bowling perspective. They batted well in the middle. We knew it would not be an easy target on that pitch. We knew we would have to bat out of our skins. Virat and Hardik are experienced guys. Staying calm and taking it as deep as possible was critical, and they did that. It's good for our confidence to get off the mark in our first game, and the way we won is more pleasing for us, the way we came back. Hats off to Virat. It has to go off as not one of his best, but the best innings he has played for India."

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match

Virat Kohli: "I honestly am out of words. Hardik kept telling me, just believe we can stay till the end. I'm lost for words. Well, I think when Shaheen bowled from the Pavilion end, I told Hardik we have to take him down. The calculation was simple. Nawaz had one over to bowl, so if I could take Haris down, they would panic. It came down to 16 off 6. I'm kind of lost for words. The sixes off Rauf was just instinctively. I saw it, told myself to stay still. The one at long-on was unexpected, it was a back-of-a-length slower ball. The fine leg one, I just threw my bat at it. Till today I said Mohali was my best T20 innings. Then I got 82 off 52, today I got 82 off 53. Both are just as special."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ICC Mens T20 World Cup 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the second match of India in the ICC T20 World Cup where they square off against Netherlands at Sydney Cricket Ground, Sydney. This is the first time that India and Netherlands will face each other in a T20I. India started off their campaign with a thrilling victory against Pakistan on Sunday. Thanks to the innings of King Kohli which led the team to score their first points. Whereas the opponents Netherlands suffered a loss against Bangladesh in their first group match. Will India register a win today and top the table?

 

VENUE STATS:

Since 2019, 23 BBL and International matches have been played at this venue and the teams winning the toss elected to field in 19 matches. 11 matches have been won by the teams chasing and 11 by the teams batting first. The Par score considering these 23 matches is 176 runs.

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "We will bat first. Morale is really high. Winning a game like that takes your confidence to the next level but at the same time, we understand we need to stay calm, just the first game of the tournament and, plenty of things to happen.We want to keep improving no matter what the results are, it always keeps you in good stead when you are thinking like that. It is important for us to keep ticking those boxes. We are playing with the same XI."

 

Scott Edwards, Netherlands Captian: "We would have batted first as well, but happy to bowl first. Our bowlers have been sensational all tournament, hopefully we can continue that and our batters can come out and perform today. Batting is the obvious one to improve, just need to get some scores together. We will be playing with the same side."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 32/1 (5.3 rpo, 2x4, 1x6) || Netherlands- 27/2 (4.5 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 82/1 (9.1 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) || Netherlands- 54/3 (6.0 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 66/0 (13.2 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || Netherlands- 42/4 (8.4 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

 

India register their second victory in the T20 WC this year and top the table in group 2. After winning the toss and electing to bat first, the Indian skipper Rohit Sharma scored 53 runs after which Virat Kohli scored his back-to-back fifties today. The match-winning partnership of 95* runs from just 48 balls between Virat (62* off 44) and Suryakumar Yadav (51* off 25) pushed the team to an above par total of 179 runs. With the ball, Bhuvneshwar Kumar started with two maiden overs and the wickets fell from both ends meanwhile. It was a complete team performance from the Indian team which led them to a victory with a margin of 56 runs!

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Match

 

Suryakumar Yadav: "I was just trying to express myself when I went in to bat. The situation was very simple, I just had to up the tempo at that time. Very happy with the way things went. Really enjoying batting with Kohli, the thoughts are very clear when we both are batting.If I get few boundaries earlier then our partnership needs to be stretched and that's what we are doing."

 

Scott Edwards, Netherlands Skipper: "We came here to win and put on a good performance, but against these sort of sides you have to be on the money or the make you pay. The way those two batters played in the end and took them to 180, it was always going to be tricky. We bowled reasonably well but if you don't get the wickets and with the batting order they have, it was always going to be tough to restrict them. It gets bigger and better, Looking forward to it and hopefully we can put up a better performance."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "I thought it was a clinical win. Looking at the way they have qualified for the Super 12s, credit to them. We however always looked to what we can do with ourselves, not bother about the opposition. To be honest, this was a near perfect win. Yes, we played a little slow at the start but that was the conversation between me and Virat, we had to wait on that surface to play the big shots. At the end of the day, it is about keeping the confidence up."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ICC Mens T20 World Cup 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the third league match of India in the ICC T20 World Cup where they clash against South Africa at Perth Stadium, Perth. After two consecutive victories, India are at the helm whereas their opponents South Africa have won one match and the other one was affected by rain, hence they are at third place with three points. Who will win today and claim the top spot in the table?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and South Africa have faced each other on 23 occasions in the T20I. Out of which, the Men in blue have won 13 games whereas the opponents have come out victorious 9 times.

 

PITCH REPORT:- 

Shaun Pollock: "The pitch has been rolled a couple of times but conditions won't change much. The square boundaries are 82 meters on one side and 77 on the other. Down the ground, it's 75 meters."

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We will bat first. It's a good surface, we know what to expect and what to do on this pitch. This is an important game from where the tournament is, we just have to follow the routine and trust the process, just stay calm and execute the plans. We have one change: Deepak Hooda replaces Axar Patel"

 

Temba Bavuma, South African Skipper: "Big game for us, had a good start to the tournament, it's a big opportunity to test our skills against a strong Indian team. We would have probably batted as well, could be slightly tough to bat under lights, but we now need to bowl well and restrict them to a low score. We also have a change Shamsi misses out and Ngidi comes in"
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 33/2 (5.5 rpo, 1x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 24/3 (4.0 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 68/3 (7.5 rpo, 5x4, 3x6) || South Africa- 71/0 (7.9 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 32/4 (6.4 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) || South Africa- 42/2 (8.4 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

 

South Africa beats India by 5 wickets and tops the Group-2 table! The toss turned down in the favour of India and forced the opposition to bowl first. After India lost their top three batters early, Suryakumar Yadav (68 off 30) started building the innings and took the team to a total of 133 runs. Lungi Ngidi and Wayne Parnell were the top performers with the ball for their side with four and three wickets respectively! In reply, Arshdeep Singh took two early wickets and cooked pressure straight away. After losing three wickets in the powerplay, Aiden Markram (52 off 41) and David Miller (59* off 46) constructed a match-winning partnership of 76 runs and took the team over the line! 

 
Lungi Ngidi is the Player of the Match
 
Lungi Ngidi: "It was pretty nerve-wrecking when games get down that close, as a bowler you can't do much and just have to believe in the boys. This is one of my biggest dreams, to get something like this at the World Cup and help the country win a game, will cherish it for a long time.  After the 10-over break, Markram moved the game forward and David followed him. That partnership brought us close and then David finished it off."
 
 
Rohit Sharma, India captain: "We expected that the pitch will have something in it. We knew that there'll be a lot of help for the seamers, that's why it wasn't an easy target to chase. We fell a little short with the bat. We fought well, but South Africa were better today. That was a match-winning partnership from Markram and Miller. We were a little poor in the field, we gave so many chances and we weren't clinical. We were just not good enough. We need to keep our heads high and take learning from this game."
 
 
Temba Bavuma, South African captain: "The discussion was to try and up the intent. When you do that, that's when opportunities come your way. Fortunately things did go our way and we were able to get that momentum. Our batting line-up is in good form barring myself. It's a batting unit that's been together for a while. To come through in pressure moments will boost the guys' confidence. The variable bounce assisted us. We backed our execution, fortunately it came off for us. It's important we keep improving and that's exactly what we are doing."

TossDetails: Bangladesh won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ICC Mens T20 World Cup 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the Asian derby clash between India and Bangladesh in the ICC T20 World Cup. The match takes place at Adelaide Oval, Adelaide. After back-to-back victories, India experienced their first loss in this campaign against South Africa at Perth. Both the teams are at four points currently and this victory would be very crucial for the teams. The team winning today will top the table. Virat has his highest number of centuries at this venue (all formats) and would be exciting to see his batting today. Let us wait and watch the action!

 

VENUE STATS:

Since 2020, 23 matches have been played here and the teams chasing the target have won 9 times and 14 times by the teams batting first. The par score at this venue is 170.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Bangladesh have played a total of 11 T20I matches. India has come out victorious on 10 occasions and Bangladesh has a solitary win.

 

TOSS:-

Bangladesh won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh Skipper: "We will bowl first. We don't know what is a good score on this wicket. Big game. We are well prepared today. The Boys are gelling well. We have been playing with this side for some time. We need to continue doing the good things. We have one change, Sarkar is not playing and Shoriful Islam comes in."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We would have batted first. Runs on the board would matter. We would look to bat well. All games are important in this format. Hopefully, we can play some good cricket and get those two points. Axar is in for Hooda."
PostMatchCommentary:
That was a nerve-wracking thriller that ended in India's favour! After India was put to bat first by Bangladesh, KL Rahul started steadily and went on to accelerate the innings and scored his half-century. Suryakumar Yadav played a quickfire 30 off 16 along with Virat Kohli who built up the innings beautifully and scored 64* off 44. The total at the end of 20 overs was 184 runs. In the chase, Litton Das (60 off 27) played a crackling innings and the team scored 60 runs in the powerplay, after which the rain interrupted play. The target for Bangladesh was revised due to the delay and it was 151 runs required from 16 overs! The most crucial wicket of Litton was taken by an amazing fielding effort by KL Rahul. The equation started to widen up and the bowlers held their nerve despite the striking of Nurul Hasan (25* off 14) and defended the target.  

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match

Virat Kohli: "Pretty close game. A good day with the bat. When I went in there was a bit of pressure. As soon as I knew the WC is in Australia, I was grinning from ear to ear. Good cricketing shots will be the key here is what I know. Hitting through the line is what I do in every format. It is just an extension for me. I love playing at this ground. This makes me feel at home. When I come to Adelaide, I am meant to enjoy myself and keep batting."

 

Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh Captain: "It's been the story when we play against India, we are almost there but we don't finish the line. Both teams enjoyed it, it was a great game and that's what we wanted. At the end someone has to win and someone has to lose. Litton Das is our best batter going around. The way he batted in the powerplay gave us a lot of momentum and gave us the belief that we could chase this with the short boundaries here. We have one more match to go and we want to concentrate on that."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "I was calm and nervous at the same time. It was important for us as a group to stay calm and execute our plans. With 10 wickets in hand it could've gone either way but after the break we did well. There was a choice betweeen Shami and Arshdeep but we backed someone who did the job for us previously. Our fielding was brilliant, some of the catches we took was great to watch. It's a high-pressure game, to take those catches shows the ability of our guys and honestly I never had any doubts about our fielding."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ICC Mens T20 World Cup 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of the last league match in the ICC T20 WC between India and Zimbabwe which takes place in Melbourne. For the last three weeks, it has been full of entertaining cricketing action and there were complete twists and turns. India became the first team to qualify for the semis in group 2 and it has been an incredible campaign for the team. India would look to enter the knockouts with a winning momentum whereas the opponent's Zimbabwe would want to end their campaign with a victory. 

It is the 50th T20I match for Rohit Sharma as a captain!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:

Both the teams have squared off against each other 7 times in T20Is and India has been victorious on five occasions.

 

TOSS:

India won the toss and elected to bat first.

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "We will bat first.  We just want to bat first and give a chance to our bowlers to defend. One change, Rishabh Pant plays instead of Dinesh Karthik, he is the only guy who hasn't played a single game on this tour, we wanted to give him a game."

 

Craig Ervine, Zimbabwe Captain: "We wanted to bowl first. The ball might skid through in the evening under lights. We have two changes, Wellington and Munyonga are in, Milton has struggled a bit and we wanted to give Tony a chance. Luke Jongwe has an injury and we wanted the spin of Wellington Masakadza."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 46/1 (7.7 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || Zimbabwe- 28/3 (6.7 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 61/3 (6.8 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)  || Zimbabwe- 76/3 (8.4 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 79/1 (15.8 rpo, 8x4, 4x6) || Zimbabwe- 11/4 (5.0 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

 

A stupendous overall performance from team India claims the victory against Zimbabwe by 71 runs. After winning the toss and electing to bat first, KL Rahul at the top provided an amazing start and scored his consecutive fifty today. Virat Kohli went on to make 26 runs after which the fireworks of the 360 player Suryakumar Yadav were lit. He constructed his innings beautifully and made 61* runs off just 25 balls with a strike rate of 244. With the target of 187 for Zimbabwe, the Indian bowlers started their part with a wicket on the very first delivery. The 60-run partnership between S Raza(34 off 24) and R Burl(35 off 22) was the highlight of their innings but then the Bowlers of India dismissed all their batters within the18th over. Ashwin was the highest wicket-taker with three wickets in the second innings.

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Match

Suryakumar Yadav: "I think the plan was very clear when I and Hardik were batting together. He said we should take a positive route and we started hitting the ball and never stopped. My plan has always been clear, I do the same thing in the nets, I practice the same shots. I bat according to the situation and what the team needs. It's good to see people come out, let's see how it goes in the next game."

 

Craig Ervine, Zimbabwe Skipper: "We could have changed a couple of plans, Surya did extremely well in the back end and countered Richie's wide yorkers. He came out and changed the game. Leading into the tournament, we had some positiveness with the bat. Last couple of games, we went away from that fearless cricket and we went into a shell.We did good work to get into the Super 12s. We'll be building on that. The boys fought really hard throughout the World Cup."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "It was a good all-round performance, something that we were looking for. Before the game, we were qualified but was important to come out and play the way we wanted to play. What SKY's doing for the team is remarkable. Playing and taking pressure off others it's quite important.This is something we expect from him. The key for us will be to adjust to the conditions as quickly as possible. We've played a game there but England will be a good challenge for us. Two teams going at each other, it'll be a great contest. We need to play well. If we do play well, we have a good game ahead as well. The fans have been brilliant, coming and watching us. Hats off to them, on behalf of the team I want to thank them."

TossDetails: England won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ICC Mens T20 World Cup 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second Semi-final match in the T20 WC where India lock horns with England at Adelaide Oval, Adelaide. It has been an amazing journey for both teams to step into the knockout stages. India won four matches out of the five they played and it is the maximum number of wins by a team in both the groups of the Super 12 stage. However, it all has come here for today where the team which wins will face Pakistan on Sunday in the grand finale. This is going to be a nerve-wracking thriller here and let us wait and watch the exciting match.

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of six matches have been played here at this venue in T20 WC this year and four have been won by the teams defending the target and two by the teams chasing. 157 is the average score here at this venue considering these six matches. India won their only match played here and England plays here for the first time in this T20 WC. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and England have squared off against each other 22 times in T20I and India have an edge over the opposition with 12 wins. The last five T20I results also have come in the favour of India with four victories.

 
PITCH REPORT:- 
Pommie Mbangwa and Shane Watson: "Looks a good track and there could be some swing upfront. We're bang center today and Adelaide Oval is known for long-straight boundaries. And short square boundaries. Looks to be an absolute belter. There is a cover of grass that should help the surface to hold together and the best part is that it's a rock-hard surface. The average score here has been 157 but this looks a high-scoring track." 
 
TOSS:-
England won the toss and elected to field first!
 
Jos Buttler, England Skipper: "We will bowl first. It is a great atmosphere here. Dimensions are different, we will have to adapt.There are two changes Malan and Wood are out with injuries, Salt and Jordan replaces them. Looks like a good wicket. Hope it stays well the whole game."
 
Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We would have batted first anyway. We've played some good cricket, another opportunity for us to play the same way we have all tournament. Important to hold the nerve and take the game till the end. We've played these guys a fair bit in recent years and know what strengths-weaknesses they have. Important to stay calm and do what we want to do. Same team for us."
 
 
Jos Buttler, England Captain: "I think the character we have shown has been amazing. We came here very excited, there was a very good feeling. Everyone stood up today. We always want to start fast and aggressively. Hales used the dimensions well and he has shown his form. He was brilliant today. I think we need to give special credit to Jordan, to bowl 3 overs at the death coming into the semi-final, it was a tough job."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 38/1 (6.3 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || England- 63/0 (10.5 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 62/2 (6.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) || England- 93/0 (10.3 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 68/3 (13.6 rpo, 8x4, 5x6) || England- 14/0 (14.0 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)

 

England beats India by 10 wickets and enters the final of T20 WC 2022 to face Pakistan. After being forced to bat first, the Indian batters started steadily in the powerplay. Virat Kohli made his fourth half-century in this T20 WC and Hardik Pandya accelerated the innings swiftly and scored 63 off 33 runs. India scored 168 runs at the end of 20 overs. Chris Jordan accounted for three wickets and his bowling was the highlight for England. In the second innings, the English openers Jos Butler(80* off 49) and Alex Hales(86* off 47) batted extremely well and finished the match without losing a wicket.

 

Alex Hales is the Player of the Match

Alex Hales: "Huge occasion, India in a semifinal of a World Cup, really happy with the way I played and it is as special as it gets. This is one of the best grounds to bat in especially in the powerplay, a really good surface and great value for good cricket shots, this is a ground I have good memories of, and enjoy batting here. I never thought I would play in a World Cup again, so to get the chance is a very special feeling."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "Pretty disappointed how it turned up today. We batted well at the backend to get that score. We were not upto the mark with the ball, we couldn't turn up today. It's all about handling the pressure in knockout games. All these guys have played enough to understand that. I thought it swung a bit in the first over, but not from the right areas. I thought we held our nerve and kept executing our plans. Couldn't do that today."

 

Jos Buttler, England Captain: "I think the character we have has been amazing. We came here very excited, there was a very good feeling. Everyone stood up today. We always want to start fast and aggressively. Hales used the dimensions well and he has shown his form. It's important to enjoy this, it was a brilliant performance from us. I think we need to give special credit to Jordan, to bowl 3 overs at the death coming into the semi-final, it was a tough job."

CompetitionName: India tour of New Zealand T20 Series 2022-23

TossDetails: New Zealand won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India tour of New Zealand T20 Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 2nd match of the T20 series between India and New Zealand at Bay Oval stadium, Mount Maunganui. Right After the ICC T20 WC, the Indian team has toured to New Zealand for a three match T20I and ODI series, where in the 1st T20I rain played as a spoilsport. Both teams will be very keen to go out there and express themselves. Let's just hope the weather gods are considerate but let me tell you there has been a slight downpour today morning. So will this affect the playing 11, will India play 1 spinner or 2 spinners or no spinners at all ? We will have to just wait for the toss and find out the playing combination.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and New Zealand have squared off against each other 20 times in T20I and India have an edge over the opposition with 11 wins.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ajay Jadeja: "Normally it's dry, brown and hard. But there seems to be extra grass on the pitch. So maybe a bit of grip and spin as well with the moisture in there. Pitch is going to stay the same. I think it's a bat first pitch".

 

TOSS:-

New Zealand won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Kane Williamson, NZ Captain: "On his decision to bowl, Little bit of both - It's been under covers for a large part, and also potentially some weather around. Adam Milne comes in. Great opportunity for him. Other than that we're unchanged from the last one. Always a great occasion when you get to play against India."

 

Hardik Pandya, India Captain: "To get a game, a proper 20-over game, is exciting. We still need to assess the conditions and see how the wicket is behaving. If the wicket doesn't help you, and you try playing shots and lose wickets, and it doesn't rain, you might be in a difficult position. But you have the skillset to cope up with it in international cricket."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 42/1 (7.0 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  || New Zealand- 32/1 (5.3 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 77/2 (8.5 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || New Zealand- 66/4 (7.3 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 72/3 (14.4 rpo, 6x4, 5x6) || New Zealand- 28/5 (7.3 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

 

A stupendous overall performance from team India claims the victory against New Zealand by 65 runs. After winning the toss, New Zealand elected to field first. India got off to a decent start with Ishan Kishan being the aggressor as India got to 42 within the powerplay. New Zealand were later greeted with a Surya special where he brought up his 2nd T20I century. Tim Southee too claimed his 2nd T20I hat trick in the last over of the first innings. The New Zealand batters were kept at a hold throughtout the 2nd Innings as they kept losing wickets at regular intervals with Deepak Hooda being the stand out bowler picking up 4 wickets for 10 runs in his 2.5 overs. 

 

SuryaKumar Yadav is the Player of the Match

 

SuryaKumar Yadav: " The plan was clear when I went into bat. At the 12th/13th over, we thought about batting deep and getting around 170-175 was a par score. Secret (behind his freak shots) is about the intent and you need to enjoy yourself. It's also about the work you do in the practice sessions. It's a great feeling coming here, having a full game and going 1-0 in the series feels good. I feel that I didn't think too much about what was happening. Just had my gameplan and it worked well."

 

Kane Williamson, New Zealand captain: "It was not our best effort. Surya's innings was out of this world. One of the best knocks I've ever seen. Some of those shots, I've never seen before. We didn't get momentum with the ball, didn't get enough wickets and didn't get momentum with the bat either.  Again, I'll say about Suryakumar, his innings was the difference. It did swing a bit (in the chase) and India did well to get some swing. Important to look at those few areas and improve. Need to look at the small margins. Surya is the best player in the world."

 

Hardik Pandya, India captain: "Can't get any better than this. Everyone chipped it but it was surely a special innings by Surya. We would have taken a score of 170-175. Bowlers did well and everyone had an aggressive mindset. The conditions were very wet, so credit to the bowlers. I have bowled a lot, going forward I want to see more bowling options. Not always that this will work but I want more batters to chip in with the ball. I expect them to be professional, which they are. Give them the opportunity to enjoy themselves. It's about creating an environment where they are all in a happy space. I see many times in this team that all the players are happy for each other's success. And that's important. I'd like to give everyone in the squad a chance but it's just one more game, so it's a bit tough."

TossDetails: New Zealand won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: India tour of New Zealand T20 Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 3rd and final match of the T20 series between India and New Zealand at Napier. So, India lead this T20 series 1-0 after the first match got abandoned at the Sky stadium in Wellington due to rain and India winning the 2nd T20 convincingly at Bay Oval stadium, Mount Maunganui. Just like the previous T20, rain is predicted today too but let's just hope that the weather gods are kind on us and we have a cracker of a game. Kane Williamson is rested for this game so who do you think will lead the Black Caps today? Both teams will be very keen to go out there and have some action, especially India, who would want to finish the series with a clean sweep.

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of five matches have been played here at this venue out of which 3 have been won by the chasing team and the average 1st innings score is 171.  

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ajay Jadeja and Anjum Chopra: "The pitch has been under covers for the last couple of hours. It looks like a belter, it's a hard pitch and not a lot of moisture in it. Side boundaries are really small. The grass covering is even, so we could expect spongy bounce and that'll help the spinners to grip. The captain winning the toss would want to chase."

 
TOSS:-
New Zealand won the toss and elected to bat first!
 
Tim Southee, New Zealand Captain: "We will bat. Looks like a pitch where we can put the runs on the board. We can't really control the weather, but the history of this ground suggests good batting conditions. Our bowling the other night wasn't the best, but credit to SKY. Mark Chapman comes in straightaway. You look back at places where we can improve as a team."
 
Hardik Pandya, India Captain: "We wanted to bowl first anyway I think the pitch will remain the same for the entire 40 overs, but with the grass on it, there could be some lateral movement for our pacers. We do keep the dimensions in mind, but we do have the skill-set in our bowling line-up. We can't think too much about the conditions - One change, Harshal comes in place of Washington Sundar."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

New Zealand- 46/2 (7.7 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || India- 58/3 (9.7 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

New Zealand- 83/0 (9.2 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-

New Zealand- 31/8 (6.2 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

 

The rain gods were kind on us for most part of the day but it started pouring heavily during the 9th over of the 2nd innings and that was it, play had to be stopped and we could not resume as the outfield was too wet to continue according to the umpires. So this match has ended in a tie as India are on par with the DL score, that means India take home this  T20 series 1-0. New Zealand and Tim Southee, after winning the toss chose to bat first, which came as a surprise to many. New Zealand lost Finn Allen early but Devon Conway and Mark Chapman did manage to get the hosts off to a decent start but lost Chapman's wicket right on the brink ending the powerplay. Devon Conway and Glenn Phillips had a fantastic partnership in the middle where both batters brought up their 50's but once they were out, it was all India picking up the last 8 wickets within 30 runs, courtesy of Siraj and Arshdeep who cleaned up the NZ batting and picking up 4 wickets each. In retrun, India lost 3 wickets in quick succession but the innings was resurrected by Hardik and Surya. Hardik Pandya and Deepak Hooda were on the crease when the rain took charge of the match.

 

Tim Southee, New Zealand skipper: "It was disappointing even with the bat. We wanted to get out there and and give everything we could, take early wickets. We knew once we take early wickets, anything could happen, but unfortunately the weather came in. You don't know until both sides batted on it, would have been an interesting game but hasn't gone to the full. Little bit of uncertainty around the scoreboard whether it was a tie when the rain came in. Could have gone either way. Nice to be back in some ODI cricket against a quality side like India. Hoping for a good crowd in Auckland."

 

Hardik Pandya, India skipper: "Would have liked to win the game by playing the full overs. At some point, I felt attack is the best defence on this wicket. We know the kind of bowling attacks they have, it was very important to get those 10-15 runs extra even though we lost a couple of wickets. A game like this could have given us an opportunity to test some of the players, but having said that, weather is something we cannot control."

 

Mohammad Siraj is the Player of the Match

Mohammad Siraj: " The wicket wasn't easy to bat and I was prepared to bowl hard lengths which gave me the rewards. I prepared myself to bowl hard lengths and had so much practice during World Cup and I just executed my plans. I always keep it simple. Just bowl the hard lengths. The weather is not in our hands, happy with the series win."

 

SuryaKumar Yadav is the player of the series

SuryaKumar Yadav: "Really happy with the way things have gone till now, would have loved a full game here. The pressure is always there and at the same time I'm enjoying my batting, just going there and expressing myself. Not carrying any baggage out there. The intent and approach will remain the same. We can just go out and express ourselves, would have loved a full game, but that's okay."

TossDetails: New Zealand won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India Tour of New Zealand ODI Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 1st out of the 3 ODI matches to be played in this series.We are here at the Eden Park in Auckland where India will be playing New Zealand for the 4th time with a span of just 2 weeks since the end of the T20 world cup 2022, in a 2nd format, across 4 cities. New Zealand are without Martin Guptill, Trent Boult and Ish Sodhi. It also remains to be seen if Kane Williamson, who missed the third T20I, will be available for the opening one-dayer. Heavy rains on Thursday would leave the outfield significantly wet. Even as a lot of rain isn't expected on the match day, cloudy conditions are likely to be on offer. India on the other hand, will be without Hardik Pandya, who is set to miss the ODI series where Shikhar Dhawan is expected to take lead. India would be looking forward to start the ODI series with a win given their convincing series win over the Black Caps in the T20I series. What action have both the teams have for us, we will just have to wait and watch.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and New Zealand have faced each other 110 times in ODI and India have an edge over the opposition with 55 wins and the New Zealand winning 49 of those. 

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of 79 matches have been played here at this venue out of which 44 have been won by the chasing team and 30 have been won by the team batting first. The average 1st innings score is 220 and the average 2nd innings score is 195. 

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Murali Kartik and Anjum Chopra: "It's a drop-in surface. It's been under covers for more than a day. We see an even covering of grass. The surface might dry up as the game progresses. There's something in it for the seamers. India will be tempted to chase but it's about countering the swing." 

 

TOSS:-

New Zealand won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Kane Williamson, New Zealand Captain: "We are gonna have a bowl first. New surface here. Most teams will have a lot of ODI cricket now. Each game is an opportunity to build as a side.
