It is unique, there has been a number fantastic games here. The guys are looking forward to this series. We are going with 4 seamers, a slightly different attack given that Neesham has a niggle - Lockie, Milne, Southee and Matt Henry - along with Santner."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, India Captain: "It's an amazing place, I enjoy playing over here. No issues batting first, I would loved to have bowled first as well. I feel the wicket is a bit sticky but the sun is out and it should dry out soon. With this team, we have played a few series earlier as well. It's a good opportunity for all the youngsters to perform and show their talents. We are very fortunate that we've got Indians all over the world and they keep supporting us, we are grateful for it. Arshdeep Singh and Umran Malik will be making their debut today."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 40/0 (4.0 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || New Zealand- 46/1 (4.6 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 170/4 (5.7 rpo, 17x4, 4x6) || New Zealand- 195/2 (6.5 rpo, 19x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 96/2 (9.6 rpo, 7x4, 4x6) || New Zealand- 68/0 (9.5 rpo, 7x4, 4x6)

 

Right, the Indians came into this match feeling very confident after winning the T20 series previously but were outplayed by the sheer brilliance of Tom Latham who scored a terrific hundred with ample support from his skipper who anchored this innings with his brilliant 94*. The rain wasn't a factor in this ODI like all the T20's. So after winning the toss, Kane Williamson elected to field first and India got off to a brilliant start with Dhawan and Gill sharing their 4th century stand. Later, Shreyas Iyer and Sanju Samson steadied the innings and were set for a grand finish when Sanju perished. Washington Sundar made sure India surpassed the 300 run mark with his brilliant finish. With the ball in hand, India rocked the hosts down to 88/3 when in walked Tom Latham and then onwards it was just an excellent display of batsmanship by Latham and Williamson. The partnership between them was 221*. In the previous 6 encounter between India and New Zealand in the ODI format, NZ has won 5 of them and 1 match ended as a tie due to rain. this was New Zealand's 13th consecutive wins in ODI at home, their longest run. We will see you next on the 27th where these two teams will face off in the 2nd ODI at Hamilton. Until then, goodbye and have a great time.

 

Tom Latham is the Player of the Match

Tom Latham: "It was just one of those days when everything came off well. Built a partnership with Kane and had a bit of fun. It's about being in strong positions and react to what they were bowling. Was able to find the gaps. The preparation has been ideal, it's been nice and was able to hit the ball right today. Sundar was getting some turn, found a bit hard to play against him. It's a small ground and we could capitalize at the end."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, India Captain: "We felt good about the total. First 10-15 overs the ball did a lot. Today we've bowled short of length and Latham attacked us there. That's where he took the game away from us especially in the 40th over. Really enjoy playing here. Would've been happier if we won but that's part and parcel. They're all young boys and lots of learning for them. Bowling side and fielding side as well (what areas need improvement?). We need to implement our plans more wisely and make sure we don't make the batsmen play on their strength."

 

Kane Williamson, New Zealand Captain: "At the halfway stage I thought it was a competitive total. The wicket was starting to turn a bit. But as we know on this ground if you build partnerships you can chase anything. Incredible knock by Latham. We're talking in the middle about getting through this over and that over. And then he just flicked a switch. Incredible innings. On this ground with the drop-in pitch, if you bowl nice and straight, it can be hard to get the ball away a little bit. It was an over or two where he flicked a switch. We got that big over and he just kept going. One of the more special ODI knocks I've seen. It was a very good wicket. It was nice to make a contribution."

TossDetails: New Zealand won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India Tour of New Zealand ODI Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 2nd out of the 3 ODI matches to be played in this series. We are here at the Eden Park at Seddon Park in Hamilton. New Zealand would be pretty confident going into this match after an amazing batting effort by them in the 1st ODI to chase down a 300+ run mark with ease. India would be wanting to cut loose and get a win to their name. We have a mixed weather forecast for the day with rain and sun gracing out present. New Zealand are expected to play with the same side as they looked very balanced in their previous clash. James Neesham who had a slight niggle during the 1st ODI is expected to be ready for selection for this ODI. As with India, we will have to wait and watch if they will have any changes in thier XI as they went in with just 5 bowling option in the 1st ODI which proved them costly. New Zealand are on a red-hot winning form in ODIs at home and they would like one more tonight to nip out a series win against a side they haven't lost against since the 2019 World Cup. Seddon Park is usually a high-scoring venue and India will be well aware of that fact before devising their bowling plans. Let us wait for the toss to see the combination both these teams will be playing with.

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of 46 matches have been played here at this venue out of which 26 have been won by the chasing team and 18 have been won by the team batting first. The average 1st innings score is 239 and the average 2nd innings score is 210.

 

Update from Hamilton:

Toss delayed by 10 minutes & will take place at 02.10 PM (Local Time) - 06.40 AM IST. 

No change in scheduled start of play - 02.30 PM (Local Time) - 07.00 AM IST.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ajay Jadeja and Ashish Nehra: "It's a drop-in surface once again. Looks like a very hard deck, can sense 300 again. Maybe a little bit of moisture early because the covers have just come off. It's a good wicket and unlike start-stop nature of this surface, there's enough covering of grass which means it could come on nicely onto the bat. Win the toss and bowl first, I reckon."

 

TOSS:

New Zealand won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Kane Williamson, New Zealand Captain: "We are gonna have a bowl. The surface has been under covers a little, so hopefully our seamers can extract whatever little help they can get. We are playing the extra spinner today in Michael Bracewell in place of Adam Milne. Southee is racking up the numbers in all formats and breaking a few records along the way, great achievement and a very special player for us. India batted well and got a competitive total on that surface, but I certainly liked the intent from the bowling attack, so hopefully we can start strong again and build on from the last performance."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, India Captain: "We would have bowled first as there's moisture in the wicket. Even in the last game, the wicket was seaming for the first 10-15 overs, we got to keep the positive intent and go for the runs. We have 2 changes today. Deepak Chahar comes in, in place of Shardul Thakur and Deepak Hooda comes in, in place of Sanju Samson. We only need 10 percent of improvement and it makes a huge impact and especially in the death bowling, we got to be a bit more smart this time."
PostMatchCommentary: It was shaping up to be an interesting match but then, nature had it's say. Pity we could not get a game today. But this was always on the cards as we had rain predictions for today. There were 12.5 overs possible today and Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav gave a good account of themselves despite the surface aiding pace and swing. Surya struck three sixes in his 25-ball 34, while Gill remained unbeaten on 45 off 42. As much as highlights go, that's all we have for you today with rain frustrating all the way. So, India cannot win the series anymore. All to play for to draw this series for India in Hagley oval at Christchurch on the 30th where the teams will lock horns for the last time in this series. Until then, cheer and goodbye.

TossDetails: New Zealand won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India Tour of New Zealand ODI Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third and final match of the ODI series between India and New Zealand at Hagley Oval, Christchurch. With India claiming the T20 series, the ODI matches started five days back where the hosts won the first fixture by 7 wickets. The second match was washed out by rain. Will India win this match and null the series or will it be New Zealand who retaliates and win the ODI series after losing the T20 series or will it be the rain that is predicted to play the spoilsport? Let us tune into the action!

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of 22 matches have been played here at this venue out of which the teams have won an equal number of times batting and bowling first. The average first innings score remains at 247.

 

PITCH REPORT:

Ashish Nehra and Murali Kartik: "It looks quite green. It is a firm surface but there is a lot of live grass on this. Cloud cover is on and definitely there will be a lot in it for the pacers."

 

TOSS:-

New Zealand won the toss and elected to field first!

 

Kane Williamson, New Zealand Captain: "We'll bowl first. Obviously the overhead conditions and green tinge.  The surface here generally has a lot of bounce. It was a good team performance in the first ODI, we were put under pressure and we responded well. Adam Milne replaces Michael Bracewell this match."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Indian Captain: "You always go with the mindset of winning. We are relaxed in the dressing room and are switching on whenever needed. We're just sticking to the processes. More grass on this surface, would have liked to bowl as well but we need to bat well. Last game I thought it would seam a lot, but it played well. It's about being positive and creating momentum. We are playing the Same team."
PostMatchCommentary: And it is a wrap now as the rain has played the spoilsport and the match has been called off! India was put to bat first once again in this series and was restricted to a total of 219 runs with Washington Sundar(51 off 64) and Shreyas Iyer(49 off 59) scoring the maximum runs for the team. Adam Milne and Daryl Mitchell accounted for three wickets each. In the second innings, until the 18th over we witnessed the witty batting display of the Kiwi openers Finn Alen(57 off 54) and Devon Conway(38* off 51) and they were 104/1 after which the rain stopped play permanently. With the last two matches ending without any result, the New Zealand team which won the first match claims the ODI series.

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: India Tour of Bangladesh Test Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the live commentary of the first Test between India and Bangladesh at Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium, Chattogram. We are back with the red ball after five long months as India played their last test against England in July. These points are crucial for the teams as this would be considered for the World Test Championship. After an ODI series loss against Bangladesh, the Indian team would want to maintain their winning Test record against the opponent while Bangladesh would want to continue their momentum and register their first Test victory against India!

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

Both the teams have played 11 Tests against each other and India has a great record as they won 9 matches and the remaining two ended in a draw.

 

VENUE STATS:-

Since 2018, Six Test matches have been played here and all the teams have chosen to bat first. The results are equal as the teams batting first and bowling first have won two each and the remaining two matches have been drawn. 

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Sanjay Manjrekar: " I am Surprised with the look of this pitch. There's a decent covering of grass, not to be confused with a green top. That's to ensure that the cracks don't get bigger. India will likely play three seamers. There's enough roughness for the spinners to make an impact from day three. Captain winning the toss will want to bat first."

 

KL Rahul, Indian Captain: "We will bat first. Looks a good wicket, put runs on the board. There have been a few injuries but that gives opportunities to other guys. Kuldeep will play, there are 3 spinners and two medium pacers."

 

Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh Captain: "We would have batted first. History says more wickets falls on the first day than the last day. We're playing a Test match after 5 months, but we have prepared well. This is an important series hopefully we can put some WTC points. We're playing, two seamers, three spinners and seven batters. "
PostMatchCommentary:
Day 1: India-278/6 (90 overs, 3.1 rpo, 35x4, 2x6)

Day 2: India- 126/4 (43.5 Overs, 2.9 rpo, 8x4, 4x6) || Bangladesh-133/8 (44 Overs, 3.02 rpo, 16x4, 2x6)

Day 3: Bangladesh- 17/2 (11.5 Overs, 1.4 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India-258/2d (61.4 overs, 4.2 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) || Bangladesh-42/0 (12 Overs, 3.5 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Day 4: Bangladesh-230/6 (90 Overs, 2.6 rpo, 21x4, 2x6)

Day 5: Bangladesh-52/4 (11.2 Overs, 4.6 rpo, 7x4, 5x6)

 

After five days of proper Test action, we have finally arrived at a result as India defends the target by 188 runs. After winning the toss and electing to bat first, the Indian team put up 404 runs in the first innings with Pujara scoring 90 runs off 203 balls and Shreyas Iyer contributing 86 runs. The 92-run partnership between R Ashwin(58 off 113) and Kuldeep Yadav(40 off 114) were crucial to bring up the score. The spinners Taijul Islam and Mehidy Hasan Miraz each picked four wickets and they were the pick of the bowlers. With the ball, the Indian bowlers bowled extremely well and dismissed all the batters for 150 runs with M Rahim being their top scorer scoring 28 runs. The Left-arm wristy recorded his third fifer.

 

India got the privilege to impose follow on but the team opted to bat again and the prodigy Shubman Gill proved his worth in the team by constructing his maiden Test Hundred along with Pujara(who fell short of scoring a century in the first innings) as he registered his quickest Test ton! With a huge target of 513 runs, the Bangladesh openers N H Shanto(67 off 156) and Zakir Hasan(100 off 224) provided a solid start partnering for 124 runs. The Indian bowlers came back in after breaking the partnership and took wickets at regular intervals. With the match heading to the final day, Bangladesh needed 241 runs with still four wickets remaining. Their skipper Shakib Al Hasan fought hard striking 84 runs but it was the Indian bowlers who took authority and bowled out the opposition. Axar Patel was the pick of the bowlers in the second innings as he dismissed four batters!

India wins the match with a margin of 188 runs and heads to the final Test on 22nd Dec!

 

Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh Skipper: "It was a really good wicket to bat on but we didn't bat well in the first innings. Lot of credit to India for the way they bowled. They bowled in partnerships and created pressure. Zakir Hasan has been scoring a lot of runs in domestic runs, that's why we picked him. Hopefully, he scores a lot more centuries for Bangladesh. We have to play good cricket for all five days. We have to play four good innings to be able to get a result, especially against India."

 

Kuldeep Yadav is the Player of the Match

Kuldeep Yadav: "To be honest I am happy with the performance, both with bat and ball. There was some pace in the first innings, but the second innings was very challenging. It was slower. so I was trying to work on my rhythm and bowled quicker. Probably more revs on the ball make it challenging for the batters and it is difficult to step down and drive as well. The action is the same, just trying to be aggressive in the rhythm."

 

KL Rahul, Indian Skipper: "Hard-fought Test match and we had to really work hard for this win. Really happy we did that. It did flatten out, didn't worry us. Looked like the batters were batting comfortably. Getting runs was hard for the first three days. The way their openers batted, we had to work hard. Our intensity was really high. We batted well in the first innings as well. It was a job well done by Shreyas and Puji, even Pant's counter-attack. Very pleased with the way we bowled. The pitch wasn't really assisting the bowlers, but they found something. Umesh bowled a couple of great spells and brought us back into the game. I am not going to worry about what we could have done better."

TossDetails: Bangladesh won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: India Tour of Bangladesh Test Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the live commentary of the Second Test match between India and Bangladesh at Shere Bangla National Stadium, Dhaka. India won the first match by a margin of 188 runs at Chittagong and if India wins this fixture, they will maintain their winning record against Bangladesh as they have not bet India in a Test match. Will we see any changes in the squad or will India play the same XI? Will India win the final match of the year and whitewash the opponents or will Bangladesh register their first victory? 

 

VENUE STATS:-

Considering the seven Test matches played here at Dhaka since 2018, the teams which won the toss elected to bat on all the occasions as the results have favoured them five times, and the teams bowling first won two Tests. The average first, second and third innings score is 370, 282, and 192 respectively. So will the team win the toss bat first?

 

TOSS:-

Bangladesh won the toss and elected to bat first!

 

Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh Skipper: "We will bat first. It will be challenging for the first two hours but if we can manage that, we can score well. Fast bowlers get some help here but it is generally good for batting. We have two changes as Mominul is replacing Yasir and Taskin in for Ebadot."

 

KL Rahul, Indian Skipper: "We'd have done the same. To be honest, on seeing the surface, not sure what to make of it. There is some grass that you can see, but it's generally good to bat here. There is generally some bounce here and some help for both pacers and spinners. It does seem damp and we need to get early wickets. We made one change as Kuldeep comes in for Unadkat."
PostMatchCommentary:
Day 1: Bangladesh - 227/10 (73.5 Overs, 3.1 rpo, 28x4, 3x6) || India - 19/0 (8 Overs, 2.4 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)

Day 2: India - 295/10 (78.3 Overs, 3.8 rpo, 32x4, 7x6) || Bangladesh - 7/0 (6 Overs, 1.2 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

Day 3: Bangladesh - 224/10 (64.2 Overs, 3.5 rpo, 21x4, 1x6) || India - 45/4 (23 Overs, 1.9 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Day 4: India - 100/3 (24 Overs, 4.2 rpo, 10x4, 2x6)

 

India win a thriller in Dhaka to seal the series 2-0 and retain the second spot in the WTC table! The Men in Blue started with the momentum in the match, picking up 10 wickets inside the first day courtesy of 4 wickets each from Ashwin and Umesh Yadav, dismissing Bangladesh for just 227. On the second day, it was all about Rishabh Pant and Shreyas Iyer, who scored fifties and stitched up a 159-run partnership to help India take a sizable lead of 87 runs, after which India continued their brilliant display with the ball picking up 10 wickets in a day again and bundling out Bangladesh for 231. With a target of 145, India were in a spot of bother losing 7 wickets for just 74 runs, but Shreyas Iyer continued his purple patch with the bat and put on a 71* run partnership with Ashwin for the 8th wicket, taking India past the finish line and maintain their unbeaten record against Bangladesh in Tests!

 

Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh captain: "Everyone contributed. We always knew that we had a chance in Dhaka. Very good Test cricket on the whole, that's what the crowds love to see. Credit goes to Shreyas and Ashwin, they absorbed the pressure well and built a partnership. We had 70-odd runs to play with, just needed one wicket. We can think of several ifs and buts, but I'm proud of the way we fought. We had our moments this year but hopefully, next year will be much better for Bangladesh."

 

KL Rahul, India captain: "You trust the guys in the middle, we've played enough cricket to realize that someone will put their hand up to win us the game. But I'm not going to lie, there was a lot of tension in the dressing room. It was a tough wicket to bat on, they put us under pressure in both innings. It was a matter of who played the new ball better, once the ball got softer, it was easier to score runs. We did lose a few more wickets than ideal but we got the job done. Will take the win. Wherever we've gone overseas in recent years, we have done the job."

 

Ravichandran Ashwin is the Player of the Match

R Ashwin: "We didn't have much batting left. It was one of those games where we let the game drift whenever we could have shut it off. Sometimes in these situations you feel like you have to get ahead of things, they bowled good lines and I felt that we didn't trust our defenses enough. Loved the way Shreyas batted. The pitches are quite good here, but I thought the ball got soft really quickly. Credit to Bangladesh, they put us under real pressure at certain moments."

 

Cheteshwar Pujara is the Player of the Series

Cheteshwar Pujara: "It's been a competitive series. I have been working hard on my game. Played a lot of First Class cricket and then worked a lot on my game, that's what helped me score these runs. Sometimes there is enough gap between Test matches, and it helps you prepare. I think playing First Class cricket is really important for improving. You need to be mentally prepared and I believe that if you are strong mentally, and prepare well, you'll be good."

TossDetails: Sri Lanka won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Sri Lanka tour of India T20 series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
A warm welcome and a Happy New Year to each and every one. We are here geared up for the first match of the year (For India and Sri Lanka) as the Indian team hosts the Sri Lankan team for three T20I and three ODI matches. With a lot of exciting cricketing events we are about to witness this year, the action kicks off here at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai. Both the teams look strong on paper and the Indian team will be led by Hardik Pandya. Will the hosts commence the year with a victory? Let's wait and watch!!

 

VENUE STATS:-

Since 2021, 31 IPL matches have been played here and 24 times the teams opt to chase the target as the results have favoured them 19 times. So will the team that wins the toss choose to bowl?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

Out of 26 T20I matches India and Sri Lanka have squared off, India has won 17 matches with Sri Lanka winning just 8. Will the domination from the Indian team continue in this format this year?

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ajit Agarkar and Deep Dasgupta: "Historically this has been an absolute belter for the batters. Small boundaries is one factor. Won't get a better venue to start the year in T20Is. Even bounce and pace on this surface. Will be a tough night for bowlers. The threat of dew will make defending difficult" 

 

TOSS:-

Sri Lanka won the toss and elected to bowl first!

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lankan Skipper: "We will bowl first. There will be Dew factor later. We were doing well in T20Is except for the World Cup. We are following the routines. Got the same batting line-up we had previously."

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "Always been excited to play for the country, but obviously leading now makes it more special. Excited to see how this new bunch of guys express themselves. We were thinking of batting first as well. Yes, this is a chasing ground but we want to put ourselves in more difficult situations generally in bilaterals. Two debutants today - Gill and Mavi."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 41/2 (6.8 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || Sri Lanka- 35/2 (5.8 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 60/3 (6.7 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) || Sri Lanka- 75/4 (8.3 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 61/0 (12.2 rpo, 3x4, 5x6) || Sri Lanka- 50/4 (10.0 rpo, 1x4, 4x6)

 

This is a good start for the Indian team as they claim the first victory of the year in their first match. After being put to bat first, Ishan Kishan from one end held his position and stroked 37 runs of 29 balls, while the Sri Lankan bowlers came back in with the wickets of the middle-order Indian batters. Deepak Hooda(41* off 23) and Axar Patel(31* off 20) fired 61 runs in the death overs with a run rate of 12+ runs and partnered for 68* runs off just 35 balls. This led the team to a decent total of 162 runs. In the second innings, the debutant S Mavi picked two wickets in consecutive overs within the powerplay that cooked pressure on the SL batters (after which he ended his spell with four wickets). The Lankan Skipper D Shanaka constructed 45 runs off just 27 balls along with W Hasaranga(21 off 10) who played a cameo by taking the team nearer to the target. C Karunaratne fought hard with his 23* off 16 but the Indian bowlers held their nerve and won the match by 2 runs.

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka captain: "Really disappointing with the way we finished. In Wankhede, you need the batsmen to help you cross the line. We used the matchups really well and that's the reason we restricted India to 162. It is still the first game and the batters are a really good bunch of youngsters, and they will come good."

 

Deepak Hooda is the Player of the Match

Deepak Hooda: "I try my best to practice according to the number I bat. We were discussing it is a matter of 2-3 hits and that we will get with some momentum. I want to contribute in every manner."

 

Hardik Pandya, India captain: "I want to put this team in difficult situations because it will help us in big games. Bilaterals we are very good at and this is how we are going to challenge ourselves. To be honest, all the young guns got us out of the situation today. The conversation was very simple, I have seen Mavi bowl well in the IPL and I know what are his strengths, just back yourself and don't worry about getting hit."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Sri Lanka tour of India T20 series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Second match of the T20I series between India and Sri Lanka. We are here at Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune after a day's break, and all the Indian guys are geared for the match, as a victory today will claim another bilateral Trophy in the kitty. The New Year has begun well for the Indian cricket team with a young and daring squad under the fresh captaincy of Hardik Pandya. He will look to start his first mission of the year with a victory and can he confirm it today? Meanwhile, the visitors also fought till the end in the first match and lit up the competition. Will the Lankans retaliate tonight and nullify the series for now? What will be the changes seen on the Indian XI as Jitesh Sharma replaces the injured Sanju Samson? Will he debut today? There is a lot to answer, catch up with the live action from 7:00 PM! 

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of 20 International and IPL matches have been hosted at this venue since 2018 out of which almost all the teams have opted to chase (except thrice). However, the results have favoured the sides who have Batted first (13 times). The Average score stands at 177 runs. Will the team winning the toss follow the trend or will the Indian team under the brave skipper put themselves in challenging situations as he mentioned? 

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Deep Dasgupta: "The Pitch is almost in the center of the square, so no biases to any side. It's nice and firm. Because of the openness of this venue, it's quite windy, which also helps seamers. There's very little dew factor as well. One of those rare venues where you want to bat first".

 

TOSS:-

Hardik Pandya calls right and India will field first!

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "We will bowl first. Thought that the dew might come later, and the wicket looks good and shouldn't change. Happy with the way we bowled and fielded. At the Wankhede to defend 160, bowlers did a great job. Forced change as Tripathi replaces Samson and Arshdeep is fit and comes back in place of Harshal"

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka Skipper: "We would have batted first. Yes, we played a great game and had lot of positives from the previous game, and was disappointed not to go over the line. But hope to do well tonight and get the win. This is a good batting first ground. No changes for us."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

Sri Lanka- 55/0 (9.2 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || India- 39/4 (6.5 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

Sri Lanka- 74/4 (8.2 rpo, 3x4, 5x6) || India- 100/1 (11.1 rpo, 5x4, 8x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

Sri Lanka- 77/2 (15.4 rpo, 3x4, 7x6) || India- 51/3 (10.2 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

 

After a disappointing loss in the first game of the T20I series, the Sri Lankan team has made a comeback today by winning the match by 16 runs! The series is nullified now and the final action heads to the third match on Saturday! After winning the toss, the Indian team put the opposition to bat first. P Nissanka(33 off 35) partnered with K Mendis(52 off 31) for 80 runs. C Asalanka came at number four and put up 37 off just 19 deliveries after which the Lankan Skipper D Shanka lit the fireworks scoring 56* runs off just 22 balls. With a huge target of 207 runs to chase, the Sri Lankan bowlers bowled confidently and dismissed the top three batters of the Indian side for single digits. S Yadav started steadily and accelerated further and scored his 13th T20I fifty and A Patel's maiden T20I fifty came just off 20 deliveries. Their 80 run-stand almost took the team closer but the Sri Lankan bowlers defended the target and won the match by 16 runs!

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Captain: "Both bowling and batting powerplay hurt us. We made basic errors which we shouldn't do at this level. Learning should be the basics we can control. You can have a bad day but shouldn't be going away from basics. Surya had a fantastic run at four."

 

Dasun Shanaka is the Player of the Match

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lankan Captain: "We could've done well in the middle overs. The Game was set by the openers. Need to play well in the middle order to allow finishers to finish well. It's not the dew factor, it's the skill of Indian batters. They took the game away from us but still, we managed to hold our nerve. Really good to defend the total, especially against India in these conditions."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: Sri Lanka tour of India T20 series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Final T20I match of the series between India and Sri Lanka which takes place at Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Rajkot. The series has been amazing and competitive as the first match was won by India closely and the second one was bagged by Sri Lanka. All eyes are on today's match as this will decide the ultimate champion of the bilateral T20I series. India has not lost a bilateral series at home since 2019 and indeed it is a great record, but will the Sri Lankan team beat India and create history by winning their first-ever bilateral series against the hosts in India? Will we see any changes in the playing XI?

 

VENUE STATS:-

Considering the 16 domestic and International matches played at this venue since 2019, 10 times the teams have opted to bat first but the results have favoured the teams(10 times) bowling first. The average score here at this venue is 167.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Deep Dasgupta and Kumar Sangakkara: "It's a bigger venue - 66m and 65 m square boundaries, large sized pockets, and a 76m straight boundary. There is a greenish tinge of grass, but that will only allow the ball to come onto the bat nicely. There is a bit of tackiness and the side winning the toss might want to bowl first. It's a good pitch, but don't think it is a high-scoring ground nor is it bouncy and pacy, dew might not be a factor."

 

TOSS:-

India won the toss and elected bat first!

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Captain: "We will bat first. Looks like a good track, the last time we played here, the ball did a bit, we might get more swing in the night. We just need to focus on playing good cricket in this game. We were not at our best in the last game, but we still stretched the match. No changes for us."

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lankan Captain: "We would have batted first as well to set the tone first up. We changed the approach to the game, we talked a lot of positive things, and its about applying them in the middle. We got one change Avishka Fernando comes in for Bhanuka Rajapaksa."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 53/2 (8.8 rpo, 6x4, 3x6) || Sri Lanka- 51/2 (8.5 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 111/1 (12.3 rpo, 6x4, 8x6) || Sri Lanka- 74/5 (8.2 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 64/2 (12.8 rpo, 7x4, 3x6) || Sri Lanka- 12/3 (7.2 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

With this victory, India equals England's record for most victories (19) against an opponent in the T20I format!

The Indian team continues their bilateral winning streak since 2019 and adds another trophy to their cabinet after beating the Sri Lankan team 2-1 in the series! In this crucial decider tonight, Hardik called right at the toss and opted to bat first! S Gill and R Tripathi registered their highest T20I scores of 46 and 35 runs after which it was all Suryakumar Yadav who took the team on his shoulder with his third T20I century in just 45 balls! Axar Patel's quick cameo of 21* runs from just 9 deliveries took the team to a mammoth total of 229 runs. With a huge advantage, the Indian bowlers bowled confidently and took 5 wickets in the middle overs! The final three wickets were taken in 10 balls and bundled out by the Sri Lankan team in 16.4 overs! India won the match by a huge margin of 91 runs and seals the series! 

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka Skipper: "I wasn't in form before coming here and I got good form from here. Happy with my own performance. lots of positives with the boys fought in this series. Wishing the Indian team well, especially Surya who was too good. In the field, I want to keep calm and let the boys learn. When I come to bat, it's a different game."

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Match

Suryakumar Yadav: "It's really important to put pressure on yourself when you are preparing for a game. If you do that in practice, it gets a little easier while playing the game. There is a lot of hard work involved but it's about doing quality practice sessions. The boundaries behind are like 50-60 meters, so I was targeting them. There are some shots that are pre-determined but you need to have other shots too so that if the bowler changes his plan, you can have an answer."

 

Hardik Pandya, India Skipper: "I think SKY has been surprising everyone every inning that he is batting. He is just telling us that batting is so easy. Special mention to Rahul Tripathi - the ball was doing something but he showed great intent. I'm really proud of Axar, the way he is batting down the order and hitting. This will give a lot of confidence to him and the team as well. My motto in life as captain has been that I'll back my players. The way we played in the series is pleasing."

TossDetails: Sri Lanka won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Sri Lanka tour of India ODI series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 1st ODI match of the series between India and Sri Lanka which takes place at Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati. This is the 1st ODI to be played in India after October last year. With the 2023 ODI World Cup just a few months away, India, being the hosts, would be looking to get a firm grip in the format going forward. Meanwhile, we will have to wait and watch on how Sri Lanka turn up for their next challenge, given that they were quite competitive in the T20 series. Rohit Sharma is fit again and is back to lead the Men in Blue in the ODIs. On paper, India are definitely the heavyweights, especially in home conditions. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India and Sri Lanka have clashed against each other in 162 ODI matches out of which 93 have been won by India and 57 Have come out in the favour of Sri Lanka. Will India continue their domination against the equally strong Sri Lankan side? 

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Deep Dasgupta: "It's a venue where batters enjoy as it's a high-scoring venue. The pitch is on the drier side, and there are a few cracks. Dew might come into play tonight. The team fielding second will have a tough time because it will be tough to grip the ball. The pitch looks a good one to bat on, but chasing will be easier here. The Captain winning the toss might elect to bowl first."

 

TOSS:-

Dasun Shanaka from Sri Lanka calls right and they will field first!

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka Captain: "We are bowling first. A lot of dew around in the evening so we will have a bowl first. It is a good boost to the way we played the T20s coming into this ODI series. There are a couple of changes from the T20s, Dunith Wellalage comes in for Maheesh Theekshana and Dilshan Madushanka is making his debut."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We would have liked to bowl as well, it's a good challenge. The ground was flooded with dew yesterday. There will be times when we need to bowl under dew, we got to be ready for that with the World Cup around the corner. It's about doing the basics right, it's important to do things differently at times. We need to keep moving in the right direction. Had a great time playing an ODI here last time, hope we'll have another memorable game today. The team setup is - myself and Gill are opening. Virat, Shreyas, KL, Hardik and Axar in the middle and lower order. Three seamers in Shami, Umran and Siraj."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 75/0 (7.5 rpo, 12x4, 2x6) || Sri Lanka- 38/2 (3.8 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 219/3 (7.3 rpo, 11x4, 4x6) || Sri Lanka- 146/6 (4.9 rpo, 21x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 79/4 (7.9 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) || Sri Lanka- 122/0 (12.2 rpo, 11x4, 2x6)

 

After registering a victory tonight, the Indian team leads the three-match series 1-0. After being put to bat first, the openers Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill set the momentum with a 143-run stand! After Rohit and Gill got out for 83 and 70 runs respectively, it was Virat Koli who set the stage on fire scoring consecutive centuries. KL Rahul contributed 39 runs off 29 deliveries and India put up a huge total of 373 runs on board! Kasun Rajitha accounted for three wickets but was also the most expensive bowler. In reply, P Nissanka(72 off 80) right at the top held one end despite the Indian bowlers kept striking early. Dhananjaya De Silva scored 47 runs and the Sri Lankan Skipper constructed a ton (108* off 88) but the huge total made the difference and Sri Lanka was 67 runs short of it! Umran Malik was the pick of the bowlers as he took three wickets!

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lankan Skipper: "I think the start their openers gave, we didn't use the new ball well, unlike their bowlers who got it to swing. We did have a plan, but the bowlers didn't execute the basics right. We didn't use variations during the first 10 overs. I think I'm doing the basics well, I think I should bat higher in the T20Is, but the team needs me to bat at 6."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We started off well with the bat, it was a great effort from all batters. The platform was set for all the batters, I thought we could have bowled better. Don't want to be too critical, as the conditions were not easy. It wasn't easy to bowl under the lights especially when dew comes in. Everyone needs to come to the party if you want to win, but we bowled well in upfront. You got to be in the game to take those half-chances. All eleven members need to put in an effort collectively."

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match

Virat Kohli: "I don't think there was anything different. My preparation and intent always remain the same. I thought I was hitting the ball nicely. I tried to understand the conditions in the second half. Tried to get a comfortable total for us on the board. The one thing I learnt was desperation doesn't get you anywhere. You do not need to complicate things. You go out there and play without any fear, I can't hold on to things. I am in a happy mind and enjoy playing here"

TossDetails: Sri Lanka won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: Sri Lanka tour of India ODI series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 2nd ODI match of the series between India and Sri Lanka at the famous Eden Gardens in Kolkata. In a quick recap of what happened in the first ODI, the Rohit Sharma-led Indian team performed well with Virat Kohli registering consecutive centuries and putting up a huge score of 373 runs. Dasun Shanaka retaliated with a century but the Indian team restricted the team and won the match by 63 runs. With still two matches on the cards, will the Indian team seal the series with a victory here or will Sri Lanka take the series result to the final one like the recently ended T20 Series between the duo?

 

VENUE STATS:-

In the 21 List A and ODI matches played here since 2017, most of the times (17) the toss-winning teams have elected to bowl first but in contrast the results have favored 13 times for the teams batting first. The average score here is 253. What will the team that wins the toss would do?

 

PITCH REPORT:

Deep Dasgupta and Russel Arnold: "One of the features of this venue is the lightning-quick outfield. This venue isn't that big which doesn't help the bowling side. Looks like a belter. Hard ground to defend. Batters will love it. The spinners will have to vary their pace and so will the faster bowlers."

 

TOSS:-

Sri Lanka once again wins the toss and elects to bat first!

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka Captain: "We will bat first. Looks like a good wicket and we want to put the runs on the board. Nothing much has been said to the boys. We need to start well. Pathum Nissanka and Dishan Madushan are out and Nuwanidu Fernando and Lahiru Kumara are replacing them."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "Wanted to bat first because of how we played last time, but looking at this ground, I wanted to field. Overall, improvements are as a team, nothing in particular. What we've done in the past is in the past, we need to look ahead and keep doing better. I love playing here, the crowd is also energetic and that motivates me always. One forced change for us, Chahal in the last game put in a dive and hasn't recovered well today, so Kuldeep Yadav makes way for him."
PostMatchCommentary:
The low-scoring thriller comes to an end with India getting the better of the opponents. With this victory, India leads and seals the series. After opting to bat first, the Sri Lankan debutant Nuwanidu Fernando scored his half-century partnering for 73 off 66 with Kusal Mendis who scored 34 runs. As soon as the ball was handed over to Kuldeep Yadav(3-51), he broke the crucial partnership and brought the team into a dominating position with three wickets in his first four overs. After which, the Sri Lankan team couldn't bounce back. In the chase, both the openers started well but Sri Lanka did not allow them to settle. After losing quite a few wickets in quick succession the partnership of 75 runs between Hardik(36 off 53) and Rahul(64* off 103) was valuable. Rahul stayed till the end and guided the team to victory!

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka Captain: "We did not put enough runs on the board. We got a good start with the bat and then lost a few wickets. We discussed that it was a very flat deck. 300 was the score to set, but Kuldeep bowled really well in the middle phase. We had a chance because the ball was moving. I asked the fast bowlers to stick to their basics and move the ball."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "It was a close game but games like these teach you a lot. KL has been batting at five for a long period of time now and it gives us depth. Gives you confidence as well at the top of the order for us to go and bat freely. It was a good display of batsmanship. There are 3 ODIs coming up against New Zealand as well, so we need to keep the guys fresh. We've got a long season now and we need to keep everything in mind. If needed, we'll make some changes. For Kuldeep Yadav to come back and play the game he played today, it was fantastic. Literally got us back in the game"

 

Kuldeep Yadav is the Player of the Match

Kuldeep Yadav: "I am happy with my performance. Whatever opportunities I get, I try to do my best and back my abilities. When you play, you have to be focused while you can be relaxed when you arent in the playing eleven. At the moment, Im really enjoying my bowling. However, team combinations are important, I dont think too much about it, just focused on doing my best when the chances come."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: Sri Lanka tour of India ODI series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the final match between India and Sri Lanka in the MasterCard ODI Series. The action moves down south as we head to Thiruvananthapuram with the series in the bag for the Men in Blue. This will also be Virat Kohli's 50th ODI match against Sri Lanka!

 

PITCH REPORT:-

Kumar Sangakkara: "There's a middle square today, with equal boundaries on all sides. The pitch looks really good, no grass on it, but there could be moisture underneath. Spinners have taken wickets here and there have been low scores in the past. It looks like a good batting track, but in the Vijay Hazare games here five out of eight times the teams were all out. Could be a tricky pitch. If I were Sri Lanka, I would choose to bowl first considering the dew that would come into play during the evening"

 

TOSS:-

India have won the toss and Rohit Sharma has confirmed that the Men in Blue will bat first!

 

Rohit Sharma: "We will bat first. Looks like a good pitch, have to make the most of it. Still a lot of areas we can keep improving, and today gives us a chance to perfect those. We want to play close to a perfect game, we'll never have the perfect game. Hardik and Umran are rested, Washington and Suryakumar are in."

 

Dasun Shanaka: "Environment here feels very similar to Sri Lanka. We have been good at the start but batsmen haven't been able to capitalize after that, that's something we have to improve on. Ashen Bandara is in for Dhananjaya De Silva and Jeffrey Vandersay is in for Dunith Wellalage."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs):-

India - 75/0 (7.5 rpo, 10x4, 3x6) || Sri Lanka - 39/5 (3.9 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs):-

India - 199/2 (6.6 rpo, 16x4, 3x6) || Sri Lanka - 34/4 (2.8 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs):- 

India - 116/3 (11.6 rpo, 6x4, 8x6)
 
India defeat Sri Lanka in a comprehensive manner to whitewash them in the series! India won the toss and elected to bat first. It looked like a tricky wicket initially but once the openers settled, India never looked back! India put a mammoth total of 390 on board, thanks to the two centurions Virat Kohli (166*) and Shubman Gill (116). Skipper Rohit Sharma and Shreyas Iyer played a good hand as well. Kasun Rajitha and Lahiru Kumara picked two wickets each, but all Sri Lankan bowlers were expensive! Sri Lankan batsmen walked in to bat with a herculean task ahead! Sri Lanka lost 5 wickets in the powerplay, with Siraj picking up 4 wickets for the first time in his ODI career! They lost the remaining wickets in the remaining overs with Kuldeep and Shami picking two each. Sri Lanka were wrapped up for 73 runs and India posted the biggest victory ever in an ODI game. Several records were broken today by the men in blue! The series couldn't have ended on a better note. Next up for the men in blue are the kiwis. 
 
Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka captain: "It's disappointing. Not a game we wanted. It happens. We need to learn how to manage the start. Bowlers should learn how to take wickets on these decks and the batters should learn to score. Playing positive cricket is the more important thing. If the boys show intent, the bowling would have been different. Congratulations to the Indian team for this performance."
 
Rohit Sharma, India captain: "I thought it was a great series for us. We bowled pretty well, got wickets, and breakthroughs when we need. Batters throughout the series piling up those runs were good to watch. Was good to see how Siraj was bowling and deserved the slips. The way he is swinging the ball, he is a rare talent. And in the last couple of years, we have seen him go from strength to strength. We tried all sorts of things to help him get five. But the confidence is there and we can see in the way he is running. He is working on a few tricks. Haven't given much thought about New Zealand. We'll get there and see and there will be a change in combination with what we saw today. We want to work as we did in this series to get the result we want."
 
Virat Kohli is the Player of the match and series:
Virat Kohli: "It is the by-product of the intent I have. The mindset is to help the team and put the team in a strong position. I have played for the right reasons and that has helped. Ever since I came back from the break, I am feeling good and I don't have the desperation to get to a milestone. I want to continue doing that and am content. Today I was happy to be batting out there and in that space, I end up playing good cricket. I am in a nice space right now, just be organic. Shami has always been there for us with the new ball. But the way Siraj has come in and done with the new ball has been fantastic. He picks wickets in the powerplay, which was an issue in the past. It is a great sign for us heading into the World Cup."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: New Zealand tour of India ODI Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the curtain raiser of the ODI series between India and New Zealand. Just after wrapping up the series with a world record for the highest margin of victory in ODI's the Indian team is geared up for a fresh series at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad for the first faceoff here against New Zealand who also comes back strong after a series victory against Pakistan 2-1. There are quite a few changes from the Indian squad and it will be interesting to see who will fit in the final XI. Will the hosts dominate their opposition or will the Blackcaps start their campaign here with a win?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

India has an edge over the opposition with 55 wins out of 113 ODIs while New Zealand has won 50. The previous time the two teams met, New Zealand bagged the series at their home. Will India showcase their supremacy now?

 

VENUE STATS:-

Out of the 15 ODIs and List A matches played at this venue since 2015, the results are neck to neck with 8 matches being won by the teams batting first. 281 is recorded as the average score here. Will the team that wins the toss opt to bat first?

 

PITCH REPORT:-

Murali Kartik: "Either side of the square is 63 metres and downtown 70 metres. The pitch looks like a nice straw-coloured surface, light grass but pretty evenly rolled. Batting first or batting second is immaterial. The curator says it's pretty cold in the evenings which is what we saw in the last two days. There's not enough dew to suggest that batting second is an option. It's up to the team's makeup on what they want to do."


TOSS:-

Rohit Sharma has called it right at the toss and India will bat first.

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We will bat first. We want to make sure we want to bowl under lights and defend the score. We did well against Sri Lanka, but this is a different challenge. Important for us to keep the momentum going. The spirit in the team is really good. Three changes. Hardik is back, Shardul is back. SKY and Ishan are playing as well."

 

Tom Latham, New Zealand Captain: "We would have bowled first. We are missing a couple of key guys from the Pakistan series, but it's an opportunity for the other guys. We love coming to India and experiencing all that the country has to offer. Most of the squad has pretty much played a good number of games. Three seamers and two spinners today."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 52/0 (5.2 rpo, 8x4, 2x6) || New Zealand- 42/1 (4.2 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 199/5 (6.6 rpo, 22x4, 2x6) || New Zealand- 205/5 (6.8 rpo, 23x4, 7x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 98/3 (9.8 rpo, 1x4, 5x6) || New Zealand- 90/4 (9.3 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)

 

India gets the better of New Zealand and leads the three-match ODI series. The toss in this series starter was won by India and they elected to bat first. It was a one-man show from the prodigy Shubman Gill as he continued his form from the previous match and hit consecutive centuries. Yet he was not settled with it and converted it to his highest score and also became the youngest player to score 200. The score at the end of 50 overs was 349 runs. In reply, Finn Allen made 40 runs after which it was all Michael Bracewell's show who fought single-handedly making 140 runs off just 78 deliveries. Mitchell Santner's 57 off 45 was also vital but it was the Indian bowlers who held their nerve and defends the target by 12 runs. The local lad Mohammed Siraj was the pick of the bowlers with four crucial wickets giving just 46 runs in his quota of ten overs.  

 

Tom Latham, New Zealand Captain: "It was an amazing innings from Bracewell. From 131/6, to come and play an innings like that, for him to put our team in a situation to win the game, it's outstanding. Obviously disappointing we couldn't get across the line but it was special. When you're chasing and coming at a pressure situation, to give us a chance to win that game was special. I think it probably gripped a bit more under lights, India used a lot more cutters into the wicket and it worked."

 

Rohit Sharma, India captain: "To be honest, the way Bracewell was batting and the way it came on to the bat nicely, it was clean ball-striking. We knew that if we bowled well, we would be okay unless we really slipped up with the ball. Unfortunately, that's what happened. I did say at the toss that I'd like to see us challenge ourselves, not quite the situation I expected but that's how it is. Gill is going really well. Siraj has been brilliant, not just in this game but in the red-ball, T20 format and now ODIs. Really good to see what he does with the ball."

 

Shubman Gill is the Player of the Match

Shubman Gill: "I was waiting eagerly to go out and do what I want to do. With wickets falling, at times I wanted to unleash and I'm glad I could do it at the end. Sometimes when the bowler is on top, you need to make them feel pressure. Need to avoid dot balls, show some intent and hit hard into the gaps. Wasn't really thinking of 200, but once I hit sixes in the 47th over, I did feel that I could. Before that, I was playing what was coming to me. Definitely a sense of satisfaction."

GroundName: Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Cricket Stadium
TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: New Zealand tour of India ODI Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the live commentary of the 2nd ODI match of the series between India and New Zealand at Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium, Raipur. We are still yet to recover from the mind-blowing innings from Shubman Gill who carved his name in the records for being the youngest person to score a double century in ODIs. Will we see another brilliance today or will the other batters step up today? The previous match turned out to be a close one and in the end, it was India who stamped their victory. With still two matches remaining, can the visitors take this down to the final one or will India seal the series?

 

VENUE FACTS:-

Venue stats? - Nah! We present you the Venue facts here as Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium at Raipur hosts its first ODI match since its inauguration in 2008. With the first match being held here, this will become the 50th venue in India to host an ODI. This venue also bears the fame of being the third largest ground in India considering its capacity of seating 65000 odd people.

 

PITCH REPORT:-

Murali Kartik and Grant Elliot: "Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium at Raipur becomes the 50th venue to host an ODI in India. The square and straight down the ground are huge boundaries. The pitch is hard and firm and has an even covering of grass. This will help the seamers with pace and bounce but this pitch is good for the batters too. Dew is a factor here and the team winning the toss will opt to bowl here." 

 

TOSS:-

Rohit Sharma calls heads and heads it is! India will field first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "I forgot what to do as he we had a lot of discussions about the toss. We want to challenge ourselves under tough conditions so we are bowling first. I knew once the lights come on we wanted to bowl more. Michael Bracewell played well and we bowled well to win there.  There was a bit of dew during the training sessions, but we've heard from the curator that it will not play a role on game days. We will play with the same XI."

Tom Latham, New Zealand Skipper: "We would have bowled first as well because it's the first international match here. Not really sure what the wicket will do. It was a great game in the previous one, we were put under pressure but we did well in execution. It is about the new guys getting the experience, we want to improve game by game. Ish Sodhi is not fit and we will play unchanged."
PostMatchCommentary:
Another bilateral series and another feather added to the cap! This is the seventh series at a streak that has been bagged by India against the Blackcaps at home. Rohit decided to bowl first and the Indian seamer M Shami(3/18 in 6 overs) provided the team a wicket in the very first over after which each bowler who was given the ball accounted for at least a wicket. The 47-run stand between G Phillips(36 off 52) and M Santner(27 off 39) looked reviving but it was shortlived and the team succumbed to a total of just 108 runs in 34.3 overs! With the bat, the Indian batters Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill did their part and chased the target with overs 29 odd overs remaining.

 

Tom Latham, New Zealand Captain: "Yes, batting up top and losing 5/1 was not a good performance. India was tight in their bowling and they deserve this win. The surface was two-paced with tennis ball bounce. We didn't apply ourselves with the bat. We did not build out a partnership and the score was not enough. We haven't adapted well to the conditions and that's why we lost the series."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "Bowlers have really stepped up today and in the previous games. You don't usually see this type of seam movement in India. These guys have some serious skills, they work really hard and it's great to see them being rewarded. We trained yesterday and the ball was nipping around under lights. We knew that if they had two fifty, it might have been challenging for us but that was the point of opting to chase. We batted first last game, so the idea was to challenge ourselves. I'm trying to change my game a bit now, have been trying to take the bowlers on and I think that's important."

 

Mohammed Shami is the Player of the Match

Mohammed Shami: "I just focus on maintaining the right lines and lengths. But it does happen sometimes that you bowl well and yet don't get wickets. I feel that the more you work with the ball in practice, the more success will come. I never thought I'd get to have a proper seam position and it gives me happiness to see the seam upright as it goes in the air."

TossDetails: New Zealand won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: New Zealand tour of India ODI Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and we welcome you to the live commentary of the 3rd and the final ODI match of the series between India and New Zealand at Holkar Cricket Stadium, Indore. The first two matches turned in the favour of India and the Indian team registered its seventh consecutive bilateral series victory against the visitors and once again it is clear that the hosts are unbeatable in a bilateral series here. Will we see a clean sweep from India or will the Blackcaps retaliate today and win this match for their pride? Will we see the benched players in action today?

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Danny Morrison and Ajit Agarkar: " This is not the biggest stadium. Sixty meters on the sides, Sixty nine meters straight, and just fifty-four behind the stumps. It is going to be tough for the bowlers. There is an even covering of grass through the middle of the pitch to hold it together and as the evening progresses, the ball will only skid on. The pitch looks very firm and good for batting. Might hold on a bit in the start of the innings, but it will only keep getting better and it's a batting day."

 

TOSS:-

New Zealand won the toss and opts to field first!

 

Tom Latham, New Zealand Captain: "We choose to bowl first. It is a good surface and it will get better under the lights. We have had good performances in the past and will look to play here as well. It will be a high-scoring match and the nature of the boundaries are too short. Jacob Duffy replaces Henry Shipley."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We will be happy to bat first as this gives us an opportunity to create pressure on the opposition. We want to keep testing ourselves and see what we can do. We are looking to give a game to the other players who didn't get a chance. Whenever we have come here we have got a big score. We have got two changes. Both the seamers are out. Siraj and Shami are out. Umran and Chahal comes in."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 82/0 (8.2 rpo, 10x4, 5x6) || New Zealand- 73/1 (7.3 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 216/5 (7.2 rpo, 16x4, 10x6) || New Zealand- 207/8 (6.9 rpo, 15x4, 8x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 87/4 (8.7 rpo, 7x4, 4x6)  || New Zealand- 15/1 (11.3 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

 

With this victory, India climb up the top of the throne and is the number 1 ODI team in the ICC rankings!

Another series and another clean sweep for India in bilateral ODIs. A pleasing effort from the Indian team and this results in a 90-run margin victory against the opponents. India was forced to bat first and the openers Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill raced for their centuries and successfully did so. Till the 27th over when the first wicket fell, there were no stoppage of boundaries and the batters were on a roll. The New Zealand bowlers came back with a few wickets and Hardik Pandya finished well with a fifty! With a huge total of 386 runs to chase, the Kiwi opener Finn Allen was dismissed on the very second ball of the innings with a stunner from Hardik. The batting was steadied with the 106-run stand between Henry Nicholls and Devon Conway! Conway made his way all toward his third ODI century and achieved it. But in the end, the target was a huge one and the visitors succumbed within the 42nd over! Shardul Thakur and Kuldeep Yadav were pick of the bowlers with three wickets each!

 

Tom Latham, New Zealand Captain: "The start with the ball was not great but we did well to hold them to 380. And then to be bowled out in 40 overs didn't go right for us. It's our last experience in India before the World Cup so the guys are exposed to these conditions in the three games and hopefully it'll be helpful in October. We're building depth in the squad. Hopefully we can take the learnings for the T20 series."

 

Shardul Thakur is the Player of The Match

Shardul Thakur: "I am liked very much by my teammates. All are here to play cricket and the opponents come after you it's important to stay in the moment and go ahead. You got to be ready for different situations. Everyone enjoys batting in the modern day of cricket."

 

Shubman Gill is the Player of The Series

Shubman Gill: "Feels nice when you bag the series and when you perform well. I don't think my approach has changed after the double hundred. It's all about getting a start and converting every score. Just being in the situation and looking to score helps convert those starts for me. Our bowlers bowled great on this wicket and happy to be on the winning side."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "I thought in the last six games we played we did most part rights and we were consistent - that is the key in this format. We wanted to give chances to people on the bench. We wanted to see how they react under pressure. I don't think any score is safe here. Shardul has been doing it for a while. People call him a magician in the squad. Gill's approach is quite similar. I've been batting well, so it was just about going that extra mile. The pitch was good today and I am very happy with the century."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: New Zealand tour of India T20 Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Right after the clean sweep performance in the One Day International series, now the Indian team is all set to clash against the Blackaps for three T20 International matches. The first T20I will be held at the JSCA International Stadium Complex, Ranchi. The T20I side will be headed by Hardik Pandya like before. Few new faces are introduced into the T20I squad of India. It will be interesting to see the first XI that the Indian team would play. After a whitewash in the ODI series, will New Zealand bounce back here or will the Indians continue their bilateral domination here too?

As the Indian men are geared up to face NZ here, The Indian U19 women have made us proud by entering the final of the inaugural ICC U19 T20 WC edition after beating the New Zealand U19 Women! Let us all congratulate and wish them luck for the ultimate match on Sunday (29/01/2022)!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

Both the big guns have locked horns with each other 22 times and India has an edge over the opposition with 12 wins. 

 

VENUE STATS:-

A total of three T20I matches have been played at this venue with the average score being 156. The teams which chased the target won two matches with one being won by the team which batted! India has been unbeatable at this venue.

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Danny Morrison and Ajit Agarkar: "This is a beautiful ground and the average score here is 156. Not a big scoring venue. The Square boundaries are 60m and the straight boundaries are 70 odd meters, in the corner around the player's pavilion it's only 57 and 59 meters. The pitch looks excellent, there is even a covering of grass and there might be some help with the new ball. There is a lot of talk about the dew. The ball will skid on nicely, but looks like a good pitch for batting,".

 

TOSS:-

Hardik calls right and India will field first!

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "We will bowl first as it looks like a good track and as the dew will come in to play. We just want to go out there and play the best cricket we know. It is a young team. We will focus on playing good cricket. Playing the ODIs before T20Is makes it easy to pass on. Chahal, Jitesh, Mukesh and Prithvi are missing out for today's game."

 

Mitchell Santner, New Zealand Skipper: "We were challenged in the ODI series. It provides a great experience to play against India at home. It gives the youngsters a chance to step up with the World Cup happening here. The pitch looks good. We would have fielded first as well. Putting runs on the board and defending will be a challenge today. Tom and Nicholls will not play with Ish and Chapman coming into the side."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

New Zealand- 47/2 (7.2 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || India- 33/3 (5.5 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

New Zealand- 70/1 (7.8 rpo, 9x4, 1x6) || India- 77/2 (8.6 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

New Zealand- 59/3 (11.8 rpo, 2x4, 5x6) || India- 45/4 (9.0 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)

 

New Zealand retaliates and beats the Indian team to lead the series 1-0! After New Zealand was put to bat first by India, the Kiwi openers D Conway(52 off 35) and Finn Allen(35 off 23) provided a solid start then D Mitchell(59* off 30) took the team on his shoulders and accelerated forward! In the last over, Mitchell hit 27 runs and maximized the score to 176 runs. With a competitive total, the Indian batters lost early wickets. Suryakumar Yadav tilted the momentum in India's favour with his 47 off 34 but once he got out, the wickets started falling! Washington Sundar fought till the end making his maiden fifty but the batters fell short of 21 runs!

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "Both the teams were surprised as no one even thought how the wicket would play. But they played better cricket on this and that's why the result end up like that. Actually the new ball was turning more than the old one and the way spun, way it bounced it caught us by surprise. It is a young group and we will only learn from this. The way he bowled, batted and fielded, it was Washington against New Zealand today."

 

Mitchell Santner, New Zealand Skipper: "It was shocking to see how much it spun in the second innings. After lots of runs in the ODI series, it was nice to see the ball turn. Mitchell batted really well. We thought of a bowl in the toss as it was easy for chasing. We know the ball was spinning in the powerplay and when it was harder, it was doing a lot. It was good for us, for the guys to chip up with the wickets."

 

Daryl Mitchell is the Player of the Match

Daryl Mitchell: "It's always nice to contribute to the team. The way the boys bowled was fantastic. Just kept it simple and trusted my skills. Not every time it works in the T20 format but happy to contribute tonight."

GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
TossDetails: New Zealand won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: New Zealand tour of India T20 Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the live commentary of the second T20I fixture between India and New Zealand at Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow. The opening match was sealed by the visitors with a wonderful display of spin bowling. India needs to win this match so that they can null the series and take the final result to the last T20I on February 1. Can Hardik Pandya and the team lead India to another bilateral victory or will the blackcaps claim the series by winning today?

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Danny Morrison and Ajit Agarkar: " This is one of the bigger grounds in India. 69m square on one side, 67m on the other side and 77m down the ground. It has a tacky look to it and it is a red soil pitch. If there is grip or movement off the pitch it will be quick and the batter will not have time. Team batting second would be hoping for dew."

 

TOSS:-

New Zealand wins the toss and goes with the venue trend of batting first!

 

Mitchell Santner, New Zealand Captain: "We will bat first. Just going with the trend here and so we opt to bat. It was nice to come back after a tough ODI series. Different guys stepping up at different times. It's never easy to beat India at home. There were times when we thought we were ahead of the game but they bounced back with the partnership between Surya and Hardik. We will play with the same XI."

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Captain: "We also wanted to bat first but it is fine. This is a fresh team, but we have spoken about getting into the challenge and having to do difficult things. It can't get more difficult than this in a bilateral series, losing the first game and then two games on the line. Looking forward to this game. We all should remember that we started playing this sport to enjoy, so I just want to pass that message to the team. We have made a change - Chahal comes in place of Umran."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

New Zealand- 33/2 (5.5 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) || India- 29/1 (4.8 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

New Zealand- 38/3 (4.2 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || India- 44/3 (4.9 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

New Zealand- 28/3 (5.6 rpo, 1x4, 0x6) || India- 28/0 (5.8 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

The fixture gets more interesting now with India leveling the series and taking the result to the final on Wednesday! Going by the advantage of 100% victory by the batting first teams at this venue, the New Zealand skipper opted to do so. The pitch showcased some serious spin-friendly scenes there and all the spinners of the Indian team accounted for a wicket piling up the pressure on Kiwis. Arshdeep Singh was given the ball in the 18th over and he got two scalps. The wicket was too slow and New Zealand could only make 99 runs for the loss of eight wickets in the full quota of 20 overs. The ball spun the same way in the second innings but the Indian batters played sensibly holding the wickets and chasing down the target taking the match to the penultimate ball! Suryakumar Yadav scored well and finished making 26 runs with the skipper Pandya scoring 15.

 

Mitchell Santner, New Zealand Skipper: "It was a great game of cricket. To get it close, it was a great effort from the bowlers. If we'd got a few extra runs that could have made the difference. Surya and Hardik played calmly and got them over the line. With the bounce out there, it looked challenging. 120 would have been a good score here."

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "I always believed we will finish the game but it went quite deep. It is important to not panic on such games. We rotated the strike well instead of taking risks. This is a shocker of a pitch. Even 120 would have been a winning total here. We kept to our plans, we made sure they will not rotate the strike. Dew didn't play much of a role."

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Match

Suryakumar Yadav: "Adapting to the situation was very important, so you might have seen a different SKY. I had to make sure I batted till the end. It was a challenging wicket we had to adapt well. We just needed one hit in the end, and it was very important to calm ourselves down. Both of us kept motivating each other and it was helpful."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: New Zealand tour of India T20 Series 2022-23
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the ultimate match of the T20I series between India and New Zealand at Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad. It has all turned down for today's match after both the teams won one fixture against each other in the series 1-1. With the ODI series being claimed by India, New Zealand would look to go back home with a victory in the T20I series for which they need a win here, while the Indian team would play hard to maintain their Bilateral winning streak. Who will win this final and crucial match?

 

VENUE STATS:-

Six T20I matches have been hosted by this grand venue and the results while batting and bowling first have equally favoured the teams (3)! The average score at the venue is 174 and we could expect a high-scoring thriller tonight!

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Danny Morrison and Ajit Agarkar: "This is an outstanding ground. 67 meters one side, 71 on the other and 72 down the ground. There have been a couple of pitches where the batters have had to work hard, but this clearly looks good. There might be a few brown spots on the pitch but they will only get better. Because of the nice even covering of grass the ball will come on and as the evening progresses will keep getting better. it is a bowl first pitch considering the dew around."

 

TOSS:-

Hardik Pandya wins the toss and opts to bat first!

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "We'll bat first. Want to put some runs. Looks like a good wicket. Tough on the batters in the last two games, but credit to them for the approach they have shown. This is what as a unit we strive for, we are going to get tested but we will learn from it. These kind of knockout games teach you a lot. We have one change  with Umran Malik coming in for Chahal as the surface looks to help the pace bowlers." 

 

Mitchell Santner, New Zealand Skipper: "We wanted to bowl first. Looks like a good surface. We are up for chasing in this wicket. We have to adapt ourselves to these big boundaries This is my first time at this venue. With the series on the line, I think the boys are really fired up. Ben Lister replaces Jacob Duffy."
PostMatchCommentary:
The Indian records in the Bilateral series and in those decider matches have always been tilted on the side of the Indian team and this result is also one which proves the fact. In a crucial decider, where the pitch was said to favour the chasing side, the Indian skipper opted bravely to bat first. After the early wicket of I Kishan, Rahul Tripathi(44 off 22) chipped in and set up the perfect start for a huge total. S Gill stood tall from the others and was unstoppable till the end of his unbeaten knock of 126* off just 63 deliveries. The cameo of 30 runs from just 17 balls from the Indian Skipper Hardik helped the team to post a huge total of 234 runs. With a massive target to chase, the NZ batters tried to attack from the start and once again it was Hardik who opened the bowling with a wicket in the very first over. Arshdeep Singh claimed two scalps in the second over of the match and the batters were cramped. Apart from the double-digit scores of D Mitchell and M Santner, all the other batters were dismissed for single-digit. Hardik Pandya was the pick of the bowlers with four wickets having an economy of just 4.0rpo. 

With this victory, India adds another feather to the cap, and also this match's 168-run margin of victory by India is the highest in T20Is.

 

Mitchell Santner, New Zealand Captain: "It was disappointing definitely but credit to India, they played well. Some of their guys are in great touch at the moment. It is tough to win when you lose five wickets in the powerplay. It can be challenging when the ball is swinging. If you look at the way India played, they took their time early on and when it got flat, they really had a go at us. I guess that time of the year there will be some dew around, most teams might bowl first.
