TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India Tour of West Indies ODI Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome back to the limited format cricket of the Indian team as they are all set to face the West Indies at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, Barbados. After winning the Test series 1-0, we are here for the first of the three ODIs. With the World Cup coming up in a few months, all the ODIs played will be used to assess the positives and negatives of the teams and can be used to set the ideal XI. Whereas the West Indies team will not be participating in this World Cup. India played their last ODI series in March against Australia where they suffered a 2-1 loss. Who will start the series with a win today? 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

Both the teams have clashed against each other 139 times with India leading the tally with 70 wins and WI with 63 wins!


VENUE STATS:-
A total of 45 ODIs have been played at this venue in which the teams batting first has won 19 times and the teams batting second have won 25 times. 
Average Scores by Innings:
1st innings - 230
2nd innings - 200

Can we expect the teams to win the toss and elect to bowl first?

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Samuel Badree and Shakera Selman: "The game will be played on pitch three. The square boundaries are around 65 meters and the straight boundaries are around 70 meters. It is generally a dry surface and the pitch might have a bit of a spongy bounce."

 

TOSS:-
India wins the toss and elects to field first!


Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We will bowl first. No particular reason, we want to try a few different things. We want to get into the World Cup with a clear mindset. We are going to try out different players. The results are also important. We have got four seamers and two spinners. Mukesh makes his debut."


Shai Hope, West Indies Skipper: "Every series is important for us. We've got to play to win. Now is a good opportunity to do so against a top team. We have got some good spinners as well. We will try to put up a good score on the surface. There will be a bit of moisture and we need to be bat careful in the beginning to score big."
PostMatchCommentary:
Excellent start here for India as they show their supreme domination with the ball! On winning the toss, India elected to bowl first. The Indian pacers opened the wicket tally after which the spinners Jadeja and Kuldeep Yadav accounted for 3 and 4 wickets respectively. The West Indies skipper Shai Hope was the highest scorer of the innings with 43 runs. They were all out for 114 runs. With a considerably low target to chase, the Indian batting order was tested as Ishan Kishan opened with Gill on the other end. Ishan successfully scored his fourth fifty but few wickets were taken by the WI bowlers to impose pressure. However, the target was chasable easily and it was done with 5 wickets remaining. With this win, India go 1-0 in the series! 


Kuldeep Yadav is the Player of the Match


Kuldeep Yadav: "The fast bowlers bowled really well with Mukesh making his debut well. Jaddu and I were brilliant, we hit the right lengths which was necessary on this wicket. I'm just focusing on my rhythm, hitting the right lengths and it has been very nice. I thought it will be a seamy paradise, we are happy to get wickets from our side. It was spinning a bit, and there was a bounce as well. It's always good to have competition. We enjoy each other's company."


Shai Hope, West Indies captain: "We didn't play the way we needed to. We need to find ways to score on difficult pitches like this. I'm not making excuses. Seales is a quality bowler, we can invest on him and I hope he grows from strength to strength. The Indian bowlers did well on this surface, but we didn't bat well."


Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "I never thought the pitch would play like that. The pitch had everything for seamers and spinners, our guys did well to restrict them to that score. We wanted to give game time to the guys who have come in. We knew we could try these guys and give them a go. I don't think they'll get many chances like this. Mukesh was brilliant, he can swing the ball at a good pace. Good to see what he can offer. No matter the conditions, we need to bowl in the right areas to restrict them and I thought our bowlers did brilliantly. And then Ishan was good with the bat as well."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India Tour of West Indies ODI Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live Commentary of the second match of the ODI series against the West Indies at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, Barbados. West Indies suffered a big loss in their first match as they got all out for 114 runs which was then chased by India in 23 overs. Will we see any changes in their XI? Will the pitch be the same way as the first ODI? Can India seal the series today? A lot to answer here today!

 

PITCH REPORT:

Daren Ganga and Shakera Selman: "This is the same pitch as the last game. The wicket is usually hard but there is a hard length area and the bowlers can extract some turn and bounce. There will be variable bounce and a high amount of turn that was there in the first match and things can be challenging."

 

TOSS:-

West Indies won the toss and elected to field first!


Shai Hope, West Indies Captain: "We opt to bowl firs. We knew what happened here in the last game. The conditions will assist the bowlers. We got to win this one to stay alive in the series. Have to play on the same surface. We got to bowl first and put them under pressure. Powell and Drakes are out. Alzarri Joseph and Keacy Carty replaces them."


Hardik Pandya, Indian Captain: "We wanted to bat first. We want to see how much we can score on this pitch which is a bit up and down. Rohit and Virat have been playing constant cricket, so they are resting in this game. I think when you get someone out for 115, it's a good effort from the bowlers. Our catching was impressive, but we can improve in certain areas. Instead of losing five wickets, we could have lost only two. Sanju Samson and Axar Patel comes in for Rohit and Virat."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 49/0 (4.9 rpo, 7x4, 0x6) || West Indies- 64/2 (6.4 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 131/9 (4.3 rpo, 11x4, 1x6) || West Indies- 118/2 (26.4 overs, 4.4 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 1/1 (0.5 overs, 1.2 rpo, 0x4, 0x6) 

 

West Indies takes revenge for losing the previous match at the same venue here two nights back. The hosts won the toss this time and opted to field first. The opening partnership between I Kishan (55 off 55) and S Gill was worth 90 runs until the 17th over when Gill was dismissed for 34 runs. The West Indian bowlers never left the momentum fall and were accounted for wickets often. Both G Motie and R Shepherd scalped 3 wickets each putting the Indian team's batting to an end for 181 runs. In the second innings, Shardul Thakur went for a couple of wickets in the same over but the stand between the skipper S Hope (63* off 80) and K Carty (48* off 65) steadied the ship and neared the target. They both stayed till the end and finished the job for their team.

The series stands 1-1 now and the third and final ODI will be an exciting decider.


Hardik Pandya, Indian Captain: "We did not bat the way we wanted to. The wicket got much better than in the first innings. Disappointing, but got to learn many more things. The way the openers batted was brilliant. Shardul kept our hopes alive. Hope batted very well, they held their nerves and got over the line. I have to bowl more overs to get ready for the World Cup. The next game will be exciting for the viewers as well as the players."


Shai Hope is the Player of the Match
 

Shai Hope, West Indies Skipper: "I am happy to have contributed and when the team wins. You got to find ways to score quickly on that wicket, especially against a quality bowling attack like India. Got to win the next game to take the series. The guys are going to come hard again. We need to be more consistent with the bat and ball. The surface was challenging, but the bowlers and batters did well. We want to be the winning side and if we tick all the boxes, I am pretty sure we can achieve that."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India Tour of West Indies ODI Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of the final and the exciting decider of the ODI series clash between West Indies and India at the Brian Lara Stadium, Tarouba, Trinidad. The previous two matches at Barbados turned out to be low-scoring encounters where India won the first match and the second match was sealed by West Indies to null the series. The winner of today's match will bag this series. The stalwarts Rohit and Virat may be back for today's game, so who do you think will make way for them? Who will claim the trophy today? 

IT IS ALSO WORTH MENTIONING THAT THIS WILL BE THE VERY FIRST MEN'S ODI PLAYED HERE!!

 

TOSS:-

WEST INDIES WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD FIRST!

 

Shai Hope, West Indies Captain: "We will bowl first and get as much as we can from the surface. We are not changing our winning combination. Looks like a good surface and expect the ball to come on. It is all about the process and we need to be more consistent with the results as well."

 

Hardik Pandya, India Captain: We have two changes - Ruturaj replaces Umran and Unadkat comes in place of Axar. The boys are pumped up for the decider and looking forward to the game. The surface Looks good. Batting first gives a good opportunity for us to set a good total. Hoping for that."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 73/0 (7.3 rpo, 11x4, 0x6) || West Indies- 34/3 (3.4 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 174/4 (5.8 rpo, 12x4, 7x6) || West Indies- 117/7 (25.5 overs, 4.6 rpo, 12x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 104/1 (10.4 rpo, 5x4, 7x6)

 

India clinch the 3-Match ODI series 2-1 by winning the third match comprehensively by 200 runs. India were put into bat by West indies after they won the toss. Initially, The Indian openers got of to a positive start by putting a 143-run stand. Ishan Kishan and Shubman Gill scored (77 & 85)runs respectively. After losing Ishan and Gill in quick successions, Hardik Pandya and Sanju Samson's innings of (70 & 51) runs respectively helped to continue the momentum. This Helped India to score a mammoth total of 351 in 50 overs. West Indian Openers could not tackle the Indian pace attack and lost the wickets in continuos intervals. The way Mukesh Kumar bowled in the initial overs was outstanding by taking 3 quick wickets. Then it was a collapse for the host's middle order. Kuldeep and Unadkat doing the damage. The West Indies had a good 8th wicket partnership of 55 Runs from Motie and Joseph. Shardul Thakur picked up 4 wickets with his top quality bowling. It was a valiant effort from the Indian team which help them win this contest by a huge margin.  
 

Shubman Gill is the Player of the Match

Shubman Gill: "Very special on my first half-century on this tour. I was hoping to get a big score for my team maybe a century but that did not happen the match was on our hands. It was a good track to bat on but things changed when the ball got older. It is all about playing by the situation and pre-meditating it as soon as possible. As an opener, it's your duty to do give a  headstart to the team and luckily I was able to do the same. I thought in the last match I was settled I was trying for a big score and trying to put pressure on the opponent. That's the way this format works as well.  I don't think who is playing and who is not. I always try to do my best."

 

Ishan Kishan is the Player of the Series

Ishan Kishan: "Not so happy with the finishing that I gave. I should have scored big after getting a good start. That’s what I’ll try next time. I was thinking of taking it one ball at a time. Shubman Gill is a tremendous player. Seeing him hitting it out of the middle gives me a lot of confidence. The learnings from these games are important. We were looking to get early wickets. Everyone is looking very positive. I’ve played a few tournaments here and I know how the wickets play here."

 

Shai Hope, West Indies skipper: "We restricted them well enough seeing how the pitch behaved before. We can look back and change many things but we have to accept it. We didn't give them a challenge with the ball at the start. 350 was a gettable total on that wicket. We gotta believe that we can win. The consistency in attitude and the key is to get the guys together and turn some of these losses into wins."

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "As a captain, I look forward to these types of games where something is at stake and not just an international match. The way the boys came out and expressed their character and at the same time enjoyed, that's the thing I want this team to possess. In these kinds of pressure situations, they have to be used to it but also enjoy it. Kohli and Rohit are very important part of this team. So providing youngsters the kind of exposure and making sure that if we need to check something, we can do that. The pitch was doing well. I was just waiting my time and once I got the flow I could get the rest. The ball was doing a bit initially. When you are chasing a total of 350, batters will feel the difficulty. A couple of good catches by Gill as well.  West Indies woke up late with that partnership and took the game till the 34th over but the game was over in the powerplay phase itself. This is one of the nicest stadiums that I have played on."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: India Tour of West Indies T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the first of the five-match T20 series between India and West Indies. The match is set to take place at the  Brian Lara Stadium, Tarouba, Trinidad which has hosted just one T20I before today's encounter. Men in Blue would be high on confidence after a good outing in the Test and ODI series and would look to continue their form in the T20 format as well. Hardik Pandya will lead the side in this match which also happens to be Team India's 200th T20I. Team India played its first T20I match back in 2006 against South Africa. A young and fresh-looking Indian Unit under the leadership of Hardik Pandya would be looking to leave a mark against a side that usually enjoys playing the shorter format. The Two times World Champions would be hoping for a change in their fortunes against a side that lacks experience but is no short of talent. Team India would be without the services of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in their 4th straight T20 series which means that the young guns would be having loads of chances to express themselves out in the middle at the highest level. 

 

VENUE STATS:-
There has been only one T20I played at Brian Lara Stadium which was also between India and West Indies. Team India posted 190 while the hosts managed to score just 122.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
Two teams have clashed 25 times out of which 17 have been won by India while 7 results have gone to the Windies.

 

PITCH REPORT:
Denesh Ramdin: "Looks like a good pitch, 350 runs were scored in the ODI played here. The Wicket is not expected to change much in the course of the game. The team winning the toss would fancy batting first to have some runs on the board."

 

TOSS:-
West-Indies wins the toss and elect to bat first!

 

Rovman Powell, West-Indian Skipper: " We will have a bat. Looks like a dry wicket. India is playing a lot of spinners, let's see how we cope against them. The boys are confident. It's not a complete change in strategy. We are still boundary hitters and we will try to run hard."

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: " Since we play the T20 World Cup here, we have made plans accordingly. Some players might get a chance to play here. By the time we come here next time, we'll be prepared thoroughly . I try to keep things simple. For me, it's about improving. I focus on processes. You might have some losses and failures, but I am okay with it. It's all about challenging ourselves. Umran, Bishnoi miss out. We are playing three spinners."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

West Indies- 54/2 (9.0 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || India- 45/2 (7.6 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)  

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

West Indies- 53/2 (5.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)  || India- 68/2 (7.6 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

West Indies- 42/2 (8.4 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)  || India- 32/5 (6.4 rpo, 2x4, 1x6) 

 

A good start to the T20 series for the hosts. Defending 150 was never going to be easy, especially against a formidable Indian batting unit. Akeal Hosein bowled a tight spell in the powerplay but a partnership of 39 (27) between Suryakumar Yadav and Tilak Varma kept India in the hunt. Another steady partnership between Skipper Hardik Pandya and Sanju Samson had India in the driver's seat until the 16th over bowled by Jason Holder which saw the back of both the set batters. A maiden over accounting for two wickets proved to be the turning point in the match. India fell short by 4 runs in the end. 

 

 

 

Rovman Powell, West Indian Skipper: " It's a very good feeling to start on a positive note. They didn't have a set batter and I was confident going in the final over. After watching the Indians bowl, I thought we were one spinner short. It was difficult against spinners. We knew the new ball was going to give runs. This series will be decided on how West Indies batters bat against Indian spinners. Once you get a start, it's easier. Jason Holder was fantastic today."

 

 

Jason Holder is the Player of the Match

Jason Holder: "The amount of cricket I've been playing is quite a lot. Much needed break from the ODIs. I was happy just I stuck with my plans. I wanted to make them work hard for their runs and didn't want to give any easy runs. The 16th over was the turning point as the game was getting close. The guys stuck together and total team effort saw us through."

 

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: " We were right to chase. We made some errors that cost us the game. A young team will make mistakes. We will learn. Good four games ahead. In T20 cricket, if you lose wickets, it becomes difficult to chase. A couple of hits can change the momentum. When we lost a couple of wickets, that halted us."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: India Tour of West Indies T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the second of the five-match T20 series between India and West Indies. The match takes place at the National Stadium, Guyana. After a comfortable victory from the hosts in the first T20I, the visitors are keen to clinch the second T20I and keep the series in balance. What will be the plans of the young Indian lineup for this encounter? Let's wait & watch!!

VENUE STATS:
MATCHES IN NATIONAL STADIUM, GUYANA: 11
WON BAT FIRST: 3
WON BAT SECOND: 5
The average 1st innings score here is 123 runs.

 


PITCH REPORT:
Ian Bishop and Shakera Selman: "The boundary dimensions are 66m, 64m on the sides, and 77m down the ground. There is a bit of light grass on the wicket which may assist the pacers early on. It is also quite hard. Any score above 150 is a good one. Slower balls will be vital in the second innings." 



TOSS: 

INDIA WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT   FIRST.


Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "We choose to bat first as the surface looks good. We will try to put a good score on the board. We did lose a couple of wickets during crunch moments. I don't think we did much wrong in the last game other than that, we spoke about it and the focus is to learn and keep going ahead. Kuldeep got injured on the hand yesterday in the nets so Ravi Bishnoi comes in place of him."

 

Rovman Powell, West Indies Skipper: "The wicket looks a pretty good surface and hopefully gets better as the game progresses. We did not lose wickets in clusters in the previous game which was good. it is about continuing to do the right things for the team and keep improving as a batting unit. We are playing with the same team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 34/2 (5.7 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)  || West Indies - 61/3 (10.2 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-

India- 72/2 (8 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || West Indies - 66/3 (7.3 rpo, 2x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-

India- 46/3 (9.2 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)  || West Indies -  28/2 (5.8 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

 

The 2ND T20I was a fairytale ending for the West Indies, going down the wire and the tailenders helping the hosts to cross the line with a boundary. With India opting to bat first, the team lost two crucial wickets of Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav in the powerplay but the partnership of Ishan Kishan and Tilak Varma steadied the innings. Tilak scored his maiden T20I half-century. Hardik hit two sixes and India managed to put 152 Runs on the board. In the second innings, Hardik picked 2 wickets in the very first over putting pressure on the opposition! Pooran and Powell put up a vital partnership for 57 runs. Hetmyer played according to the situation as the run rate required was achievable. Indian spinners came back and shifted the momentum in their favor, but Akeal Hosein and Alzarri Joseph finished things and helped Windies go 2-0 in this Five match series.

 

 

Nicholas Pooran is the Player of the Match.

Nicholas Pooran: "I am very Satisfied that I performed well. Something that I have been looking for the last couple of years, so be there and finish the game. I look to be consistent. I have been working on it so hard, I have made a lot of mistakes and lost a lot of games for the teams I have played. It's about being positive and confident at the same time."


Hardik Pandya, Indian Captain: "That was a not a pleasing batting performance, we could have batted better. 170 would have been a decent total. The way Pooran batted, took the game quite into their hands. We have to trust our top seven batters to come good and hope the bowlers win you games. We have to make sure we have the right balance but at the same time, batters need to take more responsibility. Tilak batted well and a Left-hander coming at 4 gives us variety. It doesn't feel like it's his second international game."

 

Rovman Powell, West Indies Captain: "It is a very good position to be in. Since 2016 we have not won the T20 series. It was important to change the bowlers constantly and give an over spell, especially fast bowlers because it is very hot conditions here. When you are batting against wrist spin it is difficult. To restrict Chahal, Kuldeep, and Bishnoi we need to have left-handers. To have Pooran and Hetmyer is important to counter the attack."

TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: India Tour of West Indies T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the most crucial game of the five-match T20 series between India and West Indies at the same venue as the previous one - Providence Stadium, Guyana. The first two matches were won by the hosts putting the visitors in a challenge today. To stay alive in the series, India needs to register a win today here. With India losing two of their games, will we have any changes in the side to change the fortune?

 

PITCH REPORT:

Daren Ganga: "It's a little bit cloudy today. It's the same pitch. 66m on one square, 67m on the other, and 77m down the ground. The pitch looks good but it's a bit drier and hard than the previous game. Spin will play a little more here."

 

TOSS:

WEST INDIES WON THE TOSS ELECTED TO BAT FIRST!

 

Rovman Powell, West Indies Skipper: "We will bat first as this looks like a slow wicket. Holder picked up a niggle to his knee so Roston Chase comes in. Guys are excited, we are on the doorstep of history by beating India in a T20 series. They have such quality players, have to keep them on their toes. If you become predictable, they will destroy you."


Hardik Pandya, India Skipper: "We don't mind chasing but we wanted to bat first seeing the surface. It might get slower. Pooran has been batting very well. We have made two changes as Yashasvi makes his debut Ishan Kishan and Kuldeep come in for Bishnoi."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

West Indies- 38/0 (6.3 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)  || India- 60/2 (10 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

West Indies-  68/4 (7.6rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || India-  75/1 (8.3 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

West Indies- 53/1 (10.6 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)  || India-  29/0 (10.2 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

 

India won the 3rd T20I and keep the series alive. After the hosts won the toss and put themselves to bat, The Windies had a decent powerplay by putting in 38 runs with no loss of wickets and they went on to score 55 runs in the first wicket partnership. After the Indian spinners started taking wickets especially Kuldeep Yadav picking 3 wickets. The middle order from hosts namely Pooran and Powell played a good knock (20 & 40) respectively. The West Indies went on to score 159 Runs in 20 overs with the loss of 5 wickets. West Indies had a positive start by taking Jaiswal out in the first over but Surya started retaliating against the West Indian bowlers from the first ball. Surya and Tilak had an amazing partnership of 87 from just 51 deliveries where Surya scored 83 off just 44 balls which helped India to gain an advantage to win the match. Hardik Pandya joined with Tilak Varma (49 Runs) to put on a winning partnership and the skipper finished the match with an amazing sixer.

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Match
 

Suryakumar Yadav: "It was really important to be myself when I went in to bat. The team management also wanted me to do the same. I have practised these strokes a lot and I love doing that. Me and Tilak understand how each other bats and the way he batted it gave me a lot of confidence. It was a superb innings from him. Our captain said someone needs to put their hand up and win the match, glad I was able to do that."

 

Hardik Pandya, Indian Skipper: "Very important to win this game. We spoke as a team that all these three matches will be important. Two losses or wins will not change the long-term plans. We have to show we are ready when it comes to such must-win games. Pooran didn't come out to bat and that allowed us to keep our fast bowlers back, also allowed Axar to bowl his quota of four overs. If Pooran wants to hit, let him hit and that was the plan we talked about, I enjoy such kind of competition. As a team, we have decided to bat with seven batters and we have to take responsibility. As Surya said, they play together and spend time together, good to have someone like SKY in the team and when he takes responsibility it sends a nice message to the others in the team."

 

Rovman Powell, West Indies Captain: "We were short by 10-15 runs. Credit to the batting unit especially the opening partnership, that's the kind of start we needed. We wanted to give Charles an opportunity, we know what Pooran can do and what kind of form he is in. We bowled with too much pace on the ball and that made it easy for the Indian batters. We have a few days gap and we have to come up with better plans."

GroundName: Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground
TossDetails: West Indies won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: India Tour of West Indies T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 4th T20I of the series between India and West Indies. The action shifts to the United States as the series stands at 2-1. Can India continue the momentum and level the series tonight?

 

West Indies won the toss and will bat first

 

Rovman Powell, West Indies Captain: "We will bat first. It looks a very good surface, we want to put up some runs on the board and try to defend it. I think it is an opportunity for us to win a series against a big team like India. Jason Holder is in, Shai Hope comes in for Johnson Charles and Odean Smith comes in for Roston Chase."

 

Hardik Pandya, India Captain: "We would have also batted first. I think the boys turned up very well, they were excited, and at the same time, they realized that they have to show some more hunger as well. Same team for us. Our spinners have that wicket-taking knack, which I like. For us, we keep things simple, and we don't let the intensity drop."

 

PITCH REPORT:

Samuel Badree: "It is 65 metres hit to one side, the opposite is 67 metres, and down the ground is 70 metres. There isn’t any grass on the surface but it has a nice sheen to it. The average score on this ground is 165. We are in for a high-scoring game."
PostMatchCommentary:
POWERPLAY (1-6 OVERS):-
WI - 55/2 (9.2 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) || IND - 66/0 (11.0 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

MIDDLE OVERS (7-15 OVERS):-
WI - 66/4 (7.3 rpo, 3x4, 3x6) || IND - 91/0 (10.1 rpo, 5x4, 4x6) 

DEATH OVERS (16-20 OVERS):-
WI - 57/2 (11.4 rpo, 2x4, 4x6) || IND - 22/0 (11.0 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

 

India comes back from 2-0 down and level the series 2-2 at Florida. After West Indies choosing to bat, Arshdeep Singh struck twice in the Powerplay to remove both the openers after which Kuldeep Yadav removed both of Nicholas Pooran and Rovamn Powell in a single over putting pressure on the Windies. Shimron Hetmyer struck from one end with a half-century but some brilliant death bowling from Mukesh Kumar ensured that West Indies finished their innings on 178/8. The chase for one for the record books, as Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill stitched together the joint-highest partnership for India in T20I's, helping India ease the chase and get across the line with 3 overs to spare!

 

Rovman Powell, West Indies Skipper: "It's a pretty good batting surface and we were maybe 10-15 runs short. We didn't stick to our plans. We didn't bat well in the middle overs, if we can improve against spin we can do well."

 

Hardik Pandya, India Skipper: "There are more Indians here and the way they have been supporting, they make sure that we give them some entertainment. Going forward, we'll have to take responsibility as batters and help our bowlers. Shubman and Yashasvi were brilliant. All these games give us a lot of confidence. We had to pull up our socks and play good cricket, and that's exactly what the boys did. Tomorrow we turn up and do exactly what we did today. 

 

Yashasvi Jaiswal is the Player of the Match.

Yashasvi Jaiswal: "I am happy to go out there and perform. I try to play how the team needs. I try to score quickly in the powerplay. Reading the wicket, reading the situation, everything is important. I have played a lot of balls against Holder and McCoy. Gill was really amazing and batted really well. I want to thank everyone for coming here and supporting us."

GroundName: Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground
TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
