CompetitionName: India Tour of West Indies T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the decider of the 5-match T20I series between India and West Indies in Florida, USA. The Men in Blue have come back from 2-0 down and will aim to become the first team to come back from 2-0 down to win a 5-match T20I series.

 

TOSS:

Hardik Pandya has called it right at the toss and India will bat first

 

Hardik Pandya, India Skipper: "We will bat. We should challenge ourselves. It was a good track and it played better than last year. You need to be courageous on these types of wickets. Arshdeep has a big heart, even if you can make a good comeback in the last two balls, it makes a difference. We are playing with the same team."

 

Rovman Powell, West Indies Skipper: "We would have bowled first. Back-to-back wins put a smile on the faces of our people. I think it is a good surface. Joseph, our premier bowler is back for McCoy and Chase also comes back in."
PostMatchCommentary:
POWERPLAY (1-6 Overs):-
IND - 51/2 (8.5 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || WI - 61/1 (10.2 rpo, 3x4, 6x6)

MIDDLE OVERS (7-15 Overs):-
IND - 61/2 (6.8 rpo, 6x4, 3x6) || WI - 71/1 (7.9 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

DEATH OVERS (16-20 Overs):-
IND - 53/5 (10.6 rpo, 2x4, 3x6) || WI - 39/0 (13.0 rpo, 1x4, 4x6)

 

West Indies win by wickets and take the T20I series 3-2. After opting to bat, India lost both their openers inside the Powerplay but Tilak Varma scored 19 runs in the final over of the Powerplay to help India to 51/2 after 6 overs, after which a half-century from Suryakumar Yadav took India to 165 after 20 overs. In the chase, Arshdeep Singh removed the dangerous Kyle Mayers early but a brilliant half-century from Brandon King and an attacking 47 from Pooran helped West Indies chase the target and seal the series 3-2

 

Romario Shepherd is the Player of the Match

Romario Shepherd: "Makes me feel happy that we ended up on the winning side. Thanks to Pooran and the team. The plan was especially to take wickets. We have been through hard times in the last few months and this means a lot to us."

 

Hardik Pandya, India Captain: "We lost the momentum when I came in and couldn't capitalize on the momentum. We try to get better. On the positive side, we have got a lot of learnings. The boys showed character and credit to them. Every youngster who is coming in is showing character and I can't be more happy when I see a youngster coming in and putting his hand up."

 

Rovman Powell, West Indies Captain: "The people in the Caribbean were longing for something nice. Credit to the coaching side, we could have easily panicked after the loss. I am very big on individual performances and if one can perform, the team will benefit. Credit to the bowling unit, they controlled this powerful batting lineup from India. A lot of credit has to go to the fans, when the chips were down they supported us. Thanks to everyone for supporting us."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India Tour of Ireland T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of the first of the three T20I series between India and Ireland. A new look Indian Unit will take up the Irish Challenge under a new leader in Jasprit Bumrah. The wait is finally over as the Indian Pacer returns to International Cricket after 327 days in order to have some valuable game time before the Asia Cup which starts later this month. Ruturaj Gaikwad will be his deputy while Shivam Dube makes a comeback in the Indian Colours after three years. Prasidh Krishna who returns to competitive cricket after sustaining a back injury might make his T20I debut while the likes of Rinku Singh and Jitesh Sharma too can be seen in the blue outfit this series. The hosts Ireland under the leadership of their new Skipper Paul Stirling would look to register their first win against the Men in blue as they have fallen short on all 5 occasions in the past while the Indian Unit full of exciting talents would look to make an impression before the Asia cup and an all Important World Cup. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
These two teams have faced each other five times, and The Men in Blue have come out victorious on all five occasions. 

 

VENUE STATS:
Average 1st innings Score: 184/6
Par Score at the venue: 212
Highest Total: 225/7 (by India vs Ireland, 2022)
Lowest Total: 70 All-Out (Ireland vs India, 2018)

India has gone past 200 every time they batted first at the Venue.

 

PITCH REPORT:
Rohan Gavaskar: "We will get some pace, bounce, and runs too. There is a night sprinkling of grass which means it will seam around giving the overcast conditions. But if batters can get their eye in, they can score big runs. The average first innings score is around 170, but you'll need at least 180-85 to be competitive on this surface." 
 

 

TOSS:-
India wins the toss and elects to field   first!

 

Jasprit Bumrah, Indian Skipper: " We'll field first. I am very happy to be here. The weather seems lovely. I feel good, looking forward to playing some cricket after a long break. You realize what you have been missing when you are away from it, very happy to be back. We expect nothing short of a fight from Ireland. As a fast bowler, I hope the pitch does something. Looks like it will. We have two debutants today, Rinku Singh and Prasidh Krishna."

 

Paul Stirling, Ireland Skipper: " Looking forward to going out there and get going. We have had a good run in Scotland, let's see what we can showcase today. This is the beginning of the road to 2024 and the World Cup for us. We're bringing Craig Young for today's game, excited to see what the extra pacer can do on this track."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

Ireland- 30/4 (5.0 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) || India - 45/0 (7.5 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

Ireland- 56/2 (6.2 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) || India- 2/2 (2.4 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

Ireland- 53/1 (10.6 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) 

 

Rain plays spoilsport in what could have been an exciting run chase. Nevertheless, the Indian Team would be happy with the fact that they were 2 runs ahead of Ireland on the DLS before the interruption occurred. It proved to be a good toss to win and bowl first for Team India as the Irish top order was back in the hut within the powerplay. Jasprit Bumrah playing a game after 327 days looked in good rhythm while Prasidh Krishna managed to scalp two on his T20 Debut. Ravi Bishnoi too chipped in with crucial wickets. A partnership of 57(44) for the 7th wicket helped Ireland get to a respectable total of 139 in the end. In response, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Ruturaj Gaikwad started well scoring 45 in the powerplay which put India ahead of the opposition. India takes the lead in the series and will play the next T20 on Sunday, 20th of August. 

 

Jasprit Bumrah is the Player of the Match

 

Jasprit Bumrah, Indian Skipper: " Felt very good out in the middle, so many sessions I did at the National Cricket Academy, didn't feel I missed out a lot or was doing something new. Credit to the support staff, they kept me in good spirits. There was some swing upfront so we wanted to use it and luckily we won the toss and it was coming out fine. There was some help due to the weather as well. In every game, you would want more. They played well, after a crisis, they played well to stitch a partnership. Credit where it is due. Even when you win, there are areas to improve on. Everybody is very confident, they are very well prepared."

TossDetails: Ireland won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: India Tour of Ireland T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the second T20I between India and Ireland at The Village, Dublin. Rain Gods played spoilsport in the first T20I where the Indian Unit managed to win the game by 2 runs on the DLS. Indian Unit which is full of new faces would be eager to have a full game of Cricket to express themselves in the middle while the Hometeam which did have a few good moments in the first match would be looking to put up a good fight on their own soil.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
These two teams have faced each other six times, and The Men in Blue have come out victorious on all six occasions.

 

VENUE STATS:
Average 1st innings Score: 184/6
Par Score at the venue: 212
Highest Total: 225/7 (by India vs Ireland, 2022)
Lowest Total: 70 All-Out (Ireland vs India, 2018)

India has gone past 200 every time they batted first at the Venue.

 

Pitch Report:
Rohan Gavaskar: "Overcast conditions are no longer there, the pitch looks dry, good for a game of cricket. Sun is out and runs are out. I think the batters will make merry on this pitch."
 

 

TOSS:-
Ireland wins the toss and elects to first!

 

 

Paul Stirling, Ireland Skipper: " We gonna have a bowl. Looks like a good surface, hopefully, it plays well throughout. Usually, a lot of runs are scored here, hoping we can restrict them. We are playing the seam team."

 

Jasprit Bumrah, Indian Skipper: " We would have batted first as well. The weather is a little better today and we wanted to put runs on the board. The body is good, was a little careful in the beginning, and then after that kept on building confidence and it was good. We are going in with the Same team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 47/2 (7.8 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)  || Ireland- 31/3 (5.1 rpo, 3x4, 0x6) 

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 82/1 (9.1 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)  || Ireland- 84/2 (9.3 rpo, 3x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 56/2 (11.4 rpo, 1x4, 5x6)  || Ireland- 37/3 (7.4 rpo, 0x4, 4x6)

 

A clinical performance by Team India to go 2- Nil up in the three T20 series. Jaiswal and Ruturaj Gaikwad came out all guns blazing after India was asked to bat first by the hosts. Gaikwad then formed a crucial partnership with Sanju Samson to steady the ship in the middle overs. The stylish opener went on to score 58 while Samson scored 40 at a strike rate of 153. Rinku Singh provided the impetus that was required at the back end of the innings smashing 38 at a staggering strike rate of 181. Chasing 186 Ireland lost 3 of their top four within the powerplay and never really recovered from that point. Andy Balbernie scoring 72 (51) was the only batter who put up a fight against a competent Indian bowling attack. Jasprit Bumrah picking 2 wickets for just 15 runs was the pick of the bowlers while Prasidh Krishna and Ravi Bishnoi chipped in with two wickets. Ireland was bundled out for 152 falling short by 33 runs. 

 

 

Rinku Singh is the Player of the Match

Rinku Singh: "I am feeling good. I was trying to do the same things that I did in the IPL. I was very confident and tried to stay positive. It is a nice feeling that things have been good. I have been playing for 10 years and my efforts are paying off now."

 

Paul Stirling, Ireland Skipper: " We had our chances but didn't quite take it. We had positives for the entire 40 overs. I think we just let them get away in the last few overs. Their batters got in and were difficult to bowl at. We have areas to work on. We can turn it around in the last game and hopefully get a win."
 

 

Jasprit Bumrah, Indian Skipper: " I am feeling good. Today was a little drier. We thought it would get slower and hence batted first. It is very pleasing when things go your way. It is tough to pick an XI where there is so much talent. Great headache to have to be honest. Everyone is eager and wants a chance. Everyone is confident as well.  If you play with the baggage of expectations, you are under pressure right from the start. You have to keep those expectations aside and focus on the task at hand."

CompetitionName: India Tour of Ireland T20 Series 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the third T20, I between Ireland and India taking place at The Village, Dublin. India having taken an unassailable 2-0 lead has already sealed the series. Indian batting and bowling have been top-notch as youngsters have come good in the opportunities this series provided. We might see Skipper Jasprit Bumrah make a few changes to the playing eleven giving a chance to players who have not taken the field so far.  

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
These two teams have faced each other 7 times, and The Men in Blue have come out victorious on all seven occasions. 

 

VENUE STATS:
Average 1st innings Score: 184/6
Par Score at the venue: 212
Highest Total: 225/7 (by India vs Ireland, 2022)
Lowest Total: 70 All-Out (Ireland vs India, 2018)

 

 

Jasprit Bumrah and Paul Stirling have shook hands.  The match has been called off due to rain. That means India win the T20I series 2-Nil.

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third game of Asia Cup 2023. The arch-rivals India and Pakistan will go head to head at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium in Sri Lanka. The last time the two teams faced off in an ODI was in the 2019 World Cup in England where the Men in blue got the better of the opposition. It is a treat for the fans that India and Pakistan might meet three times in the tournament. Pakistan will enter the contest on the back of a win against Nepal but will not take anything for granted against a full-strength Indian Unit. The weather is expected to be a factor in this high-octane encounter but the rain has eased since yesterday and we do have a game on our hands between the Asian heavyweights. 

 

Key battles to watch out for: 

Shaheen Shah Afridi vs Rohit Sharma

Haris Rauf vs Virat Kohli

Kuldeep Yadav vs Babar Azam

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
India and Pakistan have clashed in 132 ODIs.  India has won 55 games whereas Pakistan has come out victorious on 73 occasions. Four of the matches have ended in No result.

 

PITCH REPORT:
Sanjay Manjrekar: "A high quality and unique looking pitch. Fast bowlers can get some seam movement, the spinners will get some turn as well, and a good batter can also score a century on this wicket if he gets his eye in. With DLS in consideration, the captain winning the toss might prefer to field first." 

 

TOSS:-
India wins the toss and elects to bat  first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: " We are going to bat. There is a bit of weather around, but can't think much about it. You have to play good cricket, you need to embrace the challenge, embrace the situation. We had some time off after the West Indies series. Everyone was up for those drills and challenges in Bangalore. Let's see what we can achieve in this tournament. It's a quality tournament with quality opposition. At the end of the day, we need to see what we can achieve as a team. Shreyas Iyer comes back, Jasprit Bumrah is back and we have three seamers. Got two spinners - Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja."

 

Babar Azam, Pakistan Skipper: " We would have batted first, but the toss is not in our hands. We have played a lot of cricket here, so we know the conditions. Top teams are playing so Asia Cup is good. We'll try to do our best. We are playing with the same combination, with no changes. Performing well always gives you confidence, we'll try to capitalize. It's a high-intensity match, we'll try to be calm and composed."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 48/3 (4.8 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 173/2 (5.8 rpo, 15x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 45/5 (4.5 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

 

The Match referee Javagal Srinath has called it off and the Players of both teams are shaking hands. Rain plays spoil sport in what could have been an exciting game of Cricket. This means that both teams get one point each and Pakistan advances to super fours. It is unfortunate that we got to see just one innings in this highly anticipated clash between India and Pakistan. India will now face Nepal in a couple of days' time on the 4th of September.

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of game five of Asia Cup 2023 which will take place at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium between India and Nepal. Men in Blue will play against Nepal for the first time in International Cricket. A win today will confirm a spot for Rohit Sharma and Co. in the super four whereas the Asia Cup debutants Nepal on the other side would look to pose a tough challenge after their spirited performance against Pakistan in their series opener. 

 

Key Milestone:

Virat Kohli needs 98 runs to complete 13000 ODI runs!

 

PITCH REPORT:
Sanjay Manjrekar and Matthew Hayden: "The same Wicket India played Pakistan. The pitch looks really flat. Around a good length, it falls away a little bit and then rises up, that's why the pacers are getting variable bounce on this surface. The spinners will have some assistance too. It looks nice and dry. Bowlers like Kuldeep Yadav who throw it up will get bounce and extract some turn as well."

 

TOSS:-
 wins the toss and elects to field first !

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: " We are gonna field first. No particular reason. We batted first in the last match. We want to see what the bowlers have to offer for us. I don't know about the weather. We just want to have the bowlers to have a game under their belt. The way we batted under pressure, Hardik and Ishan batted brilliantly. Ishan showed a lot of maturity and took the game on as well. Good signs for us. It's another important game for us. One change. Bumrah is not available, we've got Shami in place for him."

 

Rohit Paudel, Nepal Skipper: " We were looking to bowl as well due to the overhead conditions. Today is the biggest day for Nepal cricket. Great opportunity for us. One change, In place of Aarif Sheikh, Bhim Sharki comes in."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Nepal- 65/1 (6.5 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)  || India- 31/0 (6.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) ) (1-5 Overs DLS)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Nepal- 119/5 (3.9 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)  || India- 102/0 (7.8 rpo, 6x4, 6x6) (6-18 Overs DLS)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

Nepal- 46/4 (4.6 rpo, 0x4, 2x6)  || India- 14/0 (6.7 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) (19-20.1 Overs DLS)

 

 

A clinical performance by the Men in Blue in the 5th game of the Asia Cup winning the game with 10 wickets remaining. Nepal Openers got off to a decent start compiling 65 in the first powerplay but thereafter the Indian bowlers brought things under control chipping in with wickets at regular intervals. Aasif Sheikh 58(97) and Sompal Kami 48(56) top scored for Nepal getting the team total to 230. Ravindra Jadeja picking 3 wickets for just 40 runs was the pick of the bowlers. It was just 2 overs in the run chase when it started drizzling and the revised target of 145 from 23 overs was in front of the Indian Batting Unit. Skipper Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill showcased an array of shots taking the team past 145 without any loss! Sharma making 74 at a strike rate of 125 and Gill scoring 67 at 108 sealed the game with ease! 

 

Rohit Paudel, Nepal Skipper: " Our Openers did a good job for us, the middle order could have done a bit better, we were around 30 runs short and if the middle order had done well then we could have reached 260+. Our lower order has been doing a great job and contributing in the last four to five months. The conditions were really hard but our bowlers bowled well as the ball was not gripping that much. But overall we are happy with the way we have played against top sides"

 

Rohit Sharma is the Player of the Match

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: " Not really happy with the way I played, there were some nerves to start with but once I got my eye in wanted to take the team home. When we came here we knew what our World Cup 15 was going to be like, the Asia Cup was not going to give us a picture because it was only two games. But luckily we got to bat in the first game and bowl in this game, which made it a complete game for us. A lot of guys coming back from injuries and they need time to get back into the groove, we do understand that. Hardik Pandya and Ishan Kishan were very good in the last game to get us to that score against Pakistan. The bowling was okay today but the fielding was below par, we need to improve on that and look into it."

TossDetails: Pakistan won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to Cricket fans around the world.  vs  The third encounter of the Super Fours in the Asia Cup will be held at the R Premadasa Stadium between the Asian Heavyweights India and Pakistan. The arch rivals' previous encounter was washed away due to rain but this Super Four round does have a reserve day in place for the fans to have another chance to cherish this epic clash.  India come into the game after a clinical performance against Nepal whereas Pakistan on the other end won their previous Super Four encounter against Bangladesh in their own backyard. One can expect a turning track at Colombo where even the batters can showcase their shot-making abilities. All in all one can expect a thriller of a contest between the Men in Blue and Men in Green in the all-important Asia Cup encounter. Let's Go! 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
India and Pakistan have clashed in 133 matches  Out of which India has won 55 whereas Pakistan has come out victorious on 73 occasions. Five matches ended without a result.

 

PITCH REPORT:
Sanjay Manjrekar and Waqar Younis: "The sun is out, and there is not any grey cloud in the sky. The curators also watered the wicket, so that is an indication that the weather might have changed. We've got a bit of grass cover on this track as well. The pitch might have a little for the Pace bowlers with the new ball, and the spinners will get a little purchase because of the moisture underneath."

 

TOSS:-
Pakistan wins the toss and elects to field first !

 

Babar Azam, Pakistan Skipper: " We will field first. I think there is a bit of moisture which will help our bowlers, we need to use that early on. Always, India Pakistan is a high-intensity contest, but we will take it match to match. As a team, we are playing good cricket, we are focused on this one too. No changes for us"

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: " Was looking to bat. There will be a challenge upfront with the new ball, but the way we guys batted last time around gives us confidence. Every game is important for us, but one thing at a time to focus on. we had a break due to rain but that's the nature of the sport, it gave us a good time to prepare and now we'll look to play well. Two changes to the side Jasprit Bumrah is back and one forced change is Shreyas Iyer who just got a back spasm so KL Rahul comes in for him."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 61/0 (6.1 rpo, 12x4, 1x6)  || Pakistan- 43/1 (4.3 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 190/2 (6.3 rpo, 16x4, 5x6)  || Pakistan- 85/7 (2.8 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 105/0 (10.5 rpo, 9x4, 4x6)

 

A match which got completed in the course of two days ended in the best manner for Team India. All the boxes ticked outclassing Pakistan in all three departments. Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill were quick to get off the blocks while Virat Kohli and KL Rahul were simply magical to watch. A 233-run stand between the duo demoralised the Pakistani attack putting Men in Blue in the driver's seat. A target of 357 was never going to be an easy task on a wicket that had assistance for both seamers and spinners. Indian Pacers started well keeping the scoring in check but the damage was done in the second powerplay where almost every second ball was going past the outside edge of the Pakistani batters. Hardik Pandya getting the ball to cut off the surface proved to be a tough nut to crack for the opposition. Just when the seamers made the going tough for the batters, Kuldeep Yadav using his variety of tricks ran through the middle & lower order singlehandedly. The wrist-spinner accounted for 5 wickets for just 25 runs from his eight overs. Pakistan eventually was bundled out for just 128 runs falling short by 228 runs which is the highest margin defeat for them against the Men in Blue! 

 

 

Babar Azam, Skipper: " Weather is something that is not in our hands but we tried our best. Batting and bowling today were not up to the mark. Indian openers had plans for our bowlers and started well which was followed up by Virat Kohli and KL Rahul in the middle overs. New ball bowlers bowled well in the first powerplay swinging the ball both ways which made it tough for our batters.

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " We just wanted to get out on the field, to get some match time. A lot of guys have not had that. That could only happen thanks to a great effort from the groundsmen. I know how tough it is to cover and remove covers from the whole ground. On behalf of the entire team, we would like to thank the ground staff. Considering our batting,  Fantastic performance, right from yesterday. When we started, we knew the wicket was good and we had to adjust to the rain, The two experienced guys Kohli and Rahul knew they'd take time to get their eyes in and then we could get going. Jasprit Bumrah looked good, he swung it both ways and he's worked really hard for the last 8-10 months. He is only 27, so for him to miss games isn't ideal but the way he bowled showed what he is all about. Looking at how we batted, there were lots of positives with the openers and then Kohli and KL. Virat's innings was brilliantly paced. And then KL, to get back from injury and then to know 5 minutes before the toss he's playing, to play that way shows the mindset of the player."

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match

 

Virat Kohli "I was going to ask you to keep the interview short, I'm very tired. I'm always prepared to help the team in different ways. Today, KL got a great start and my job was just to rotate strike. I take a lot of pride in trying to push for easy runs, pushing for a double is as easy as they come. (On the reverse ramp boundary) Because I crossed the 100, there was a bit of respect for that shot. I don't play shots like that and I looked very bad playing it. Me and KL are both conventional cricketers, We don't try fancy stuff but we can get a lot of purchases through good cricket shots. A great partnership and a good sign for Indian cricket. Very happy for him to come back to ODI cricket in that manner. About playing tomorrow,  I was pushing for those runs and happy for it, but I was thinking I need to play at 3 p.m. tomorrow. Luckily, we are Test players, I've played over 100 Tests so I know how to come back and play the next day. It was really humid out there, I'm 35 in November so I need to be taking care of that recovery as well. A big shout-out to the groundsmen from my side, I think they did a fabulous job."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the fourth Super Four match of Asia Cup 2023 which will take place at the R Premedasa Stadium between and . Both teams come into this contest on the back of wins in their respective games. Sri Lanka went past Bangladesh while the Men in Blue handed a heavy defeat to Arch Rivals Pakistan in the previous match. Winning against a top side in Pakistan will definitely boost India's confidence but the challenge here is the recovery from the game played yesterday and maintaining the same fitness levels is a task in its own. The fact that all the departments were at their best will make Rohit Sharma a happy captain. All the batters looked in good nick of things while the bowlers too were on top of their game. The men in blue have never shied away from challenges and the current squad has players that thrive under pressure in tough scenarios. Winning this game against Sri Lanka which is the home team would put India in a comfortable position in the race to the finals of the Asia Cup 2023. 

 

Head to Head:
India and Sri Lanka have encountered in 165 ODIs.  Men in Blue have won 96 matches whereas Sri Lanka has come out victorious on 57 occasions. While 11 matches ended without a result and 1 match ended in a tie.

 

VENUE STATS:
Average 1st innings Score: 253
Highest Total: 375 
First wins: 76
Bat second win: 55
In Asia Cup 2023 at Colombo
first wins: 2
Bat second wins : 0

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Sanjay Manjrekar & Matthew Hayden: " We are back at the Premadasa. Whenever rain has not been around, cricket has been attractive and spectacular to watch because of the pace. When you look at the bounce in all the venues it is pretty high and has a similar kind of bounce, there's no low and slow bounce. The impact of pacers in this Asia Cup is huge as they have picked 70 percent of the wickets. The Wicket today is looking a lot different from the India-Pakistan pitch that was used yesterday. No grass on this one. This track looks a lot like the Premadasa of the old years. This has no grass and I have a feeling it will have an abrasive effect on the ball." 

 


TOSS:-
India wins the toss and elects to first!

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " We are going to have a bat. Playing on successive days is tough but that's the challenge you come across as a sportsman, different challenges thrown at you as a player and as a team. We ensured everyone got into the pool after the game last night for much-needed recovery. They are fresh as we had five days off before these two games. The last game was good for us, we batted well and then came out to defend the total with some good bowling. But again this is a new day and a fresh match. The pitch looks different, looks a lot drier and there's no grass hence we bring in Axar Patel for Shardul Thakur. It might assist the spinners but we also have three quality pacers."

 

Dasun Shanaka, Skipper: " We would have batted first as well. They are a pretty strong side compared to us but we have to play a good game to reach finals, and we will definitely try to win the game. We are going with an unchanged side."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 65/0 (6.5 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)  || Sri Lanka- 39/3 (3.9 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 115/7 (3.8 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)  || Sri Lanka- 131/4 (4.3 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 33/3 (3.3 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)  || Sri Lanka- 2/3 (0.2 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 

A low-scoring thriller at R Premadasa which was convincingly clinched by Team India eventually. Sri Lanka spinners made the most of the turning track by bowling tight spells. 20-year-old Dunith Wellalage getting 5 out of the top 6 was the pick of the bowlers. This was the first occasion when the men in blue lost all their wickets to spin in an ODI. Skipper Rohit Sharma making 53 top-scored for India while KL and Ishan Kishan made vital contributions. 214 seemed like a below-average score but the way the Indian Seamers started made things difficult for the home team. The top order was back in the pavilion with just 25 runs on the board. Thereafter it was the spinners that not only kept the scoring in check but also kept chipping in with wickets at regular intervals. Wellalage and De Silva kept the Sri Lankan hopes alive but ultimately succumbed under pressure conceding the game by 41 runs.  has made it to the Finals of Asia Cup 2023!

Sri Lanka's 13-match winning streak in ODI has ended and the Indian Team makes it to the finals of the Asia Cup for the 10th time!

 

Dasun Shanaka, Skipper: "  We didn't expect this kind of a track, I thought it was a batting wicket but we adjusted well, especially Wellalage, De Silva, and Asalanka. We have the luxury of two genuine batters who can roll their arms if needed, They have been bowling in the nets and I know their real potential, today I had the option of using them today. Seeing the last game against Bangladesh I knew he Dunith Wellalage would do something special today, he took Virat Kohli's wicket and I was pretty sure it was his day and would take a few more wickets."

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " "It was good to play a game like that under pressure. Challenged a lot of aspects of our game. We definitely want to play on tracks like this to see what we can achieve. Hardik Pandya has worked hard on his bowling over the last couple of years, and it's pleasing to see how he bowled that spell. Not an easy target to defend, to be honest. The pitch got slightly better towards the end so we had to hold our nerve and bowl consistently. Kuldeep Yadav for the past year or so has been bowling really well. He's worked hard on his rhythm and you can see the results in the last 10-15 ODIs he's played. He gives us a lot of options. So going forward this is a pretty good sign."

 

 

Dunith Wellalage is the Player of the Match

Dunith Wellalage: "First of all I want to congratulate the Indian team. They have so many experienced players, unfortunately, we lost the game. But we have another game and we want to put up a good show. Kuldeep is a great bowler, I tried to play my normal game with a positive intent. I want to thank my teammates and my coaching staff for giving me great support."

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of the final match of the Super Four stage where the Indian team takes on Bangladesh after which India will head to the final against the hosts Sri Lanka at the same R. Premadasa Stadium, Colombo. Bangladesh after getting promoted to the Super Four stage, couldn't get any rhythm and lost their two matches whereas the Indians have ticked all their boxes winning both their super four matches. Will the Indian team test their bench strength today or will they continue to give more games to the core XI? Let's wait and find that out!

 

Head to Head:
and  have encountered in 39 matches ODIs. India has won 31 whereas Bangladesh has come out victorious on 7 occasions. One match ended without a result.

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Deep Dasgupta & Matthew Hayden: " The pitch that is going to be used is the same one that was used for the India vs. Pakistan match. If you look at the numbers, spin bowlers have done better under lights taking 19 wickets at an average of 21.1. It has a lighter colour pitch as compared to the one beside it. It's a very hard surface with lots of grass cover. There will be good bounce as well. Spinners will play a part but it really looks like a good wicket to bat on. India got 356 in that game but expect seam movement under lights." 
 

 

 

TOSS:-

INDIA WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIRST!!

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " We are gonna field first. It is something we have not done in the tournament, we haven't done it under lights so it gives us an opportunity to bat under lights too. The wicket honestly has got everything for everyone. Pacers who bend their back in the daytime have also got movement and there have been assistance for the spinners. You have to be brave enough to play your natural game. We got to give some match time to some other guys who haven't played. We have made 5 changes. Virat, Hardik, Siraj, Bumrah and Kuldeep miss out. Tilak Verma makes his ODI debut. Mohammaed Shami and Prasidh Krishna also come into the side. Suryakumar Yadav too gets a game."

 

Shakib Al Hasan, Skipper: "  I was a bit confused as to what to do and it's not a bad thing for us to bat first. The guys haven't played much and they will get opportunities. Tanzim is making his debut, so very excited for him. This is an eye-opener for us and we want to do our best in bore World Cup."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Bangladesh- 44/3 (4.4 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  || India- 42/2 (4.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Bangladesh- 144/3 (4.8 rpo, 10x4, 6x6)  || India- 146/4 (4.9 rpo, 8x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

Bangladesh- 77/2 (7.7 rpo, 9x4, 1x6) || India- 71/4 (7.2 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)


The final match of the Super Four stage ended on a victory note for the Bangladesh team. With India making many changes for the game today, they put their bench strength to the test today. With winning the toss and electing to bowl first, the Indian pacers performed brilliantly picking three wickets in the first powerplay. The 100-run partnership between the skipper Shakib (80 off 85) and T Hridoy (54 off 81) revived their innings after which the lower order of Bangladesh contributed well to take their score to 265 runs. In the second innings, the Bangladesh bowlers put pressure on their opposition by taking two crucial wickets in the first powerplay. One end was tightly held by Shubman Gill who went on to register his 5th ODI ton. With the team reaching closer to the target,  Mahedi picked the key wicket of S Gill. Then Axar played his part making 42 runs but couldn't finish it off well. India will next face the hosts Sri Lanka in the most awaited final of the Asia Cup.


Rohit Sharma, India Skipper: "We wanted to give some game time to the boys. Get in some players who are likely to play in the World Cup. Not compromising on how we wanted to play this game. Axar batted brilliantly, he showed a lot of character. But couldn't finish. Credit to the Bangladesh bowlers. Gill's hundred was extraordinary, he exactly knows how he wants to play."

 

Shakib Al Hasan is the Player of the Match:-

Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh captain: "We gave the guys a chance who did not get to play. After the last couple of games here, we thought spinners will do well. It was a challenging wicket. It was seaming a bit and it got easier when the ball got older. It wasn't an easy time to bowl, Mahedi came to bowl and got us the breakthrough. Also, Tanzim bowled well at the start and took two wickets. We have got a very good team. I think we will be a dangerous side in the World Cup."

TossDetails: Sri Lanka won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: ASIA CUP 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of the Asia Cup Finals between India and Sri Lanka. The two successful teams in the tournament's history face off again in another final. This will be the Men in Blue's 10th Asia Cup Final and they will look to add to their tally of 7 Asia Cup titles. This will also be skipper Rohit Sharma's 250th ODI and will look to make it a memorable outing. There are a couple of injuries in each camp, with Washington Sundar coming into the squad for Axar Patel and Sahan Arachchige replacing Maheesh Theekshana for the Lankan Lions

 

WE HAVE A DELAY IN THE START OF THE MATCH DUE TO RAIN AND PLAY WILL START AT 3:40 PM!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:

Both teams have won 10 matches each in the history of the Asia Cup but India has the edge coming into the final winning the most recent encounter and 4 of the last 5 matches.

 

VENUE STATS:

The Batting First teams have won 4 of the 5 matches played so far this tournament. The Average 1st Innings score this tournament is 269 with both the pacers and spinners picking up 50% of the wickets. Will we see the team winning the toss opt to bat first again?

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Sanjay Manjrekar, Dominic Cork: "A Fresh pitch for the final. The pitches here have generally been useful for the spinners. It is a dry surface with hardly any grass on it and 70m boundaries in all directions. It'll be better to bat first and then hope for some turn at night."

 

SRI LANKA HAVE WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT!

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka Skipper: "We will bat first. Seems like a good wicket and there will be some turn in the afternoon. I am very pleased with all the youngsters, Wellalage, Pathirana, and Samarawickrama. It is a good team and the results are there to show. This is a good boost for the World Cup. We have one change, Theekshana misses out, and Dushan Hemantha comes in."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Skipper: "We would have batted first too but we are confident of chasing down whatever Sri Lanka put on the board. This is a good chance to be aggressive with the ball and see what the surface has to offer. The crowds here have been brilliant and hopefully, they get to witness a good final. Everyone's back after the rest. Axar is injured so Washington Sundar comes in for him."
PostMatchCommentary:
POWERPLAY (1-10 Overs) :-
SRI LANKA - 31/6 (3.1 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || INDIA - 51/0 (8.3 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

MIDDLE OVERS (11-40 Overs) :-
SRI LANKA - 19/4 (3.6 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

 

India claim their 8th Asia Cup title  and the fireworks start at Colombo, after the Men in Blue top off with a dominating performance in the final. After being put on the field, the new ball pair of Bumrah and Siraj breathed fire, with Bumrah picking up a wicket in the 3rd ball of the match, after which it was carnage from Siraj as he picked up 4 wickets in an over, 5 wickets in just 16 balls and ended with 6 to his name. Hardik Pandya picked up 3 wickets in the end to bundle out Sri Lanka for 50. In the chase, Ishan Kishan was sent out to open alongside Shubman Gill and the duo completed the chase in 6.1 overs, to register India's highest victory margin by balls remaining in ODI's.

 

Mohammed Siraj is the Player of the Match

Mohammed Siraj: "Have been bowling well for a long time and was missing the edges earlier. The wicket was seaming and there was swing also today. Thought I could bowl fuller because of the swing. This cash prize goes to the groundsmen. This tournament wouldn't have been possible without them."

 

Kuldeep Yadav is the Player of the Series

Kuldeep Yadav: "Been working on my rhythm for the last one and half years. It's not about wickets but just about the lengths and have worked hard on that. Credit goes to Rohit Sharma, he encouraged me to work on my speed."

 

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka Captain: "Tough day for us at the office. I thought it'd be a good pitch for batters, but overcast conditions played a part. Lots of positives in the tournament. The way Sadeera and Kusal batted against spin, and also the way Asalanka batted. I would like to thank supporters who came in numbers and for the great support."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "To come out and play like that in the final shows the mental character. Great start with the ball and a clinical finish with the bat. It was good to see that. Siraj has to be given a lot of credit, rare for seamers to move the ball in the air and off the pitch. We did everything we could achieve as a team in this tournament. The way Hardik and Ishan batted in that pressure situation against Pakistan, and then KL and Virat getting hundreds, the way Gill has been batting. The guys have stood up at various stages."

GroundName: Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium
TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Australia Tour of India ODI Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of the first of the three ODI series between and . The first game will take place at Mohali while the second and the third will be held at  Indore and Rajkot respectively. The hosts India enter this contest on the back of a successful Asia Cup campaign while the Aussies suffered a 3-2 defeat against South Africa in an away series. With the World Cup just around the corner, this series will serve as a perfect platform for both sides to test their bench strength and find the right balance on Indian pitches. The men in Blue will be without the service of Skipper Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Hardik Pandya, and Kuldeep Yadav in the first two matches which means KL Rahul will lead the side alongside Jasprit Bumrah as his deputy. The Kangaroos will welcome the back of Steven Smith, Pat Cummins, and Glenn Maxwell to the side while all eyes will be on Ravi Ashwin who might play an ODI after 18 months in the blue colours. All in all an exciting contest awaits on a belter of a wicket at Mohali which has a lot of runs on offer with some assistance for the slower bowlers. 

 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

and have encountered each other in 146 matches in ODI.  India has won 54 whereas Australia has come out victorious on 82 occasions. 10 matches have ended without any result.

Since 2017 India has won 13 out of the 23 ODIs betwen the countries.

 

 

PITCH REPORT:
Murali Kartik and Brad Haddin: "Mohali is a high-scoring venue, it’s going to be the same this time around as well. Apart from hitting fours and sixes, it will also be important to find singles and doubles in the deep pockets. The team winning the toss will probably want to bowl first. The wickets seem quite hard, very consistent and a skiddy bounce can be expected. Batters who get their eye in will enjoy batting here."

 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to  first!

 

KL Rahul, Indian Skipper: " We’ll field first. Historically a good chasing ground, that’s the only reason. There are a few boxes that we need to tick and the boxes that we’ve ticked we need to keep doing it better. Playing Australia is a challenge, best team in the world so good to play against them leading up to the World Cup. They are a very competitive team so we’ve enjoyed playing against them. It's always a great challenge."

 

 

Pat Cummins, Australian Skipper: "  Good to be back, it's been a while since I’ve been back here. Mitchell Starc and Glenn Maxwell are not quite ready for the game. Would’ve bowled first as well but don’t really mind. It’s nice and sunny out here. Warner and Marsh will open the batting. Smith, Marnus, and Inglis to follow."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Australia- 42/1 (4.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)  || India- 66/0 (6.6 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Australia- 145/4 (4.8 rpo, 11x4, 3x6)  || India- 157/4 (5.2 rpo, 15x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

Australia- 89/5 (8.9 rpo, 9x4, 3x6)  || India- 58/1 (6.9 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

 

It was a good toss to win and bowl first for KL Rahul and co. as Shami got rid of Marsh in the first over of the innings. The bowlers kept things tight giving nothing away and were successful in drying out the boundaries. Shami delivered whenever the ball was thrown to him, getting the wicket of a set Steve Smith proved to be the turning point in the first innings. The pacer went on to register his best ODI figures getting 5 for just 51. In response to 276, The new opening pair of Gill and Gaikwad played some delightful strokes using all their elegance and class. The duo put together 142 for the first wicket and set the platform for the middle order to follow. Gaikwad accounted for 71 while Gill scored 74 at a strike rate of 117. Australia did come back picking 3 wickets in the middle-over phase but a partnership of 80 between Skipper KL Rahul and Suryakumar Yadav had India in the driver's seat. India sealed the game in the 49th over with 5 wickets remaining. India is now free of the Mohali Curse as they beat Australia after 27 years at the venue. 

 

Pat Cummins, Skipper: "  Personally, happy to come back. A few guys batted well and a few guys bowled well. The guys who are injured will probably not be ready for the second game, maybe the third game. Maxwell has just arrived in India. Smith and Davey were brilliant. Good to see them out there together. We've got one eye on the big tournament, but you want to set the standards early and build a good rhythm."

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: " I think the intensity in the afternoon was great, after Colombo this felt like heaven in the start but it was really hot and humid. It gets tough and physically challenging, but we've all worked on our fitness and that's showing on the field. We only played five bowlers, so they had to bowl 10 overs. After Shubman Gill got out, it was a bit tricky with the set batter out. But managed to build a good partnership with SKY. We kept talking about hitting good cricket shots, rotating the strike and this is something all our batters are working on. We didn't want to get bogged down, we were always on par so we wanted to take it deep."

 

 

Mohammad Shami  is the Player of the Match

Mohammad Shami: "It depends on the Skipper and the game situation when he wants you to bowl, but despite the heat, you feel like bowling 4-5 overs at least, with the new ball. I enjoyed the wicket of Mitchell Marsh, that's a different feeling when you get the outside edge when you control your swing nicely early on. It was important to hit the right lengths on this wicket. The bowling attack is good, especially alongside Bumrah We've played together for a long time, so we know what needs to be done. Always enjoy when we bowl well in tandem like this"

TossDetails: Australia won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: Australia Tour of India ODI Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of the second of the three ODI series between   and  which will take place at the Holkar Stadium in Indore. The Men in Blue come into this contest on the back of a 5 wicket in the first game of the series. The team ticked all their boxes as 4 of the batters scored half-centuries while Mohammad Shami stood out with a fifer. A piece of good news for the Indian management as all their players are in good form right before the all-important World Cup. Australia will have their task cut out against a confident-looking Indian Unit if they want to stay alive in the series.

 

VENUE STATS:-

                                                                                                                             

 

India has an unbeaten record at Indore winning all 6 ODIs.

The average first innings score at the venue is 327 (last five games)

 

Ground Dimension:

 

                                                                                                                              

 

PITCH REPORT:
Sanjay Manjrekar and Brad Haddin: "Speaking about Dimensions the side boundaries are in the early 60s, that's pretty short. For batters batting behind square, we are getting into the 55-metre zone. We've got a consistent surface. A little bit on the drier side than the last match but quite hard. We will see a very high-scoring encounter. It's going to be tough work for the Pacers. It's a beautiful, even track, we can see a lot of sixes. If you put a big total on the board, your spinners can come into play."

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                                                                                             

 

 

Steve Smith, Skipper: "  We'll bowl first. It's pretty warm. Looks like a nice wicket to chase. If the dew comes in, that too will help while chasing. We want to win but we also want to try out different combinations before the World Cup. We've got a few changes."

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: " We would have bowled first as well considering the size of the ground. Good wicket to chase, and now we have a good challenge to put runs on the board. We only have one change from the last game. Jasprit Bumrah is rested, Prasidh Krishna comes in. Good for all our batters to spend some time in the middle."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 80/1 (8.0 rpo, 10x4, 2x6)  || Australia- 49/2 (6.1 rpo, 9x4, 0x6) (1-8 overs) DLS

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 216/2 (7.2 rpo, 14x4, 9x6)  || Australia- 156/6 (8.2 rpo, 13x4, 9x6) (9-27 overs) DLS

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 103/2 (10.3 rpo, 7x4, 7x6)  || Australia- 12/2 (10.0 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) (28-33 overs) DLS

 

Clinical performance by the Indian Unit winning the second ODI by 99 runs (DLS) and also clinching the ODI series with one game remaining. It was Shubman Gill once again who laid the foundation after India was asked to bat first by the Aussie Skipper Steve Smith. The Prince of Indian Cricket went on to register his fifth ODI ton also being involved in a match-winning partnership of 200 with Shreyas Iyer who himself looked in his elements. Iyer smashed 105 from 90 deliveries hitting 11 fours and 3 maximums. Skipper KL Rahul and Ishan Kishan also contributed with the bat but the finishing touch was provided by Suryakumar Yadav who made 72 from just 37 deliveries dismantling the Aussie bowling attack to pieces. were already on the backfoot as India registered their highest ODI total of 399 and losing 2 wickets on consecutive deliveries of Prasidh Krishna did not make things easy. David Warner did get to a fifty but lacked support from the other end. Indian Spinners especially R Ashwin gave nothing away and also kept chipping in with Wickets at regular intervals. Sean Abbott who came in 8 did strike a few out of the park but could not get the job done. Ashwin and Jaddu picked 3 wickets a piece and summed up the Aussie innings at a deficit of 99 runs (DLS).

 

Steve Smith, Skipper: "  When we came here it looked like a good pitch. Credit to them, Shubman Gill and Shreyas Iyer batted beautifully and took that game away from us. The way KL Rahul and SKY batted was brilliant to watch. After the rain, it got sticky and it started to spin as well. We have lost quite a few matches in a row, in South Africa and here. We need to sort out a few things, hopefully, we turn it around in the next game. We have a few off days now, we are working towards the WC. Hopefully, we'll turn it around in the third game."

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: " When I saw the wicket in the morning, I didn't think it would turn so much. Putting 400 on the board gives you immense confidence. It's not really our decision to make.  Everyone who gets picked in the eleven needs to focus on their job. Everyone has gone through this, you need to keep getting better and wait for the opportunities. We have dropped a few catches, but fielding under lights is challenging physically. The coaches are doing their best to keep the guys fit. Sometimes these mistakes happen. The commitment is always there and we'll learn from it, brush it off, and get better in the next game. With the World Cup only a couple of weeks away, guys will want to get into it. They need to get used to the challenges, they will be keen to get back on to the field."

 

 

Shreyas Iyer  is the Player of the Match

Shreyas Iyer: "It was a rollercoaster ride and I am feeling fantastic. My teammates, friends, and family were there to support me. I was seeing the matches on TV, I wanted to be out there and participate in the matches. Grateful to be believing in myself. The pain and niggles kept on coming, but I knew what I was aiming for. Glad that I was able to execute my plans perfectly tonight. Basically, when I went in to bat, I didn't want to complicate things. I wanted to get my eyes set, that's how I give confidence to myself. I am flexible, ready to bat any position, whatever my team needs to do".

TossDetails: Australia won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: Australia Tour of India ODI Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of ODI three between INDIA and AUSTRALIA at Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Rajkot. The Men in Blue have already won the series ticking all their boxes right before the all-important World Cup. The good news for the side is that Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Kuldeep Yadav return to the side eyeing a whitewash against a competitive Australian Unit which might see their star players like Glenn Maxwell, Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins return to their lineup. Indian side which is now the number one ranked side across all formats would like to create history by registering their first-ever Whitewash against the Aussies in the ODI format. This match will most likely serve as a perfect rehearsal for both sides before the 2023 World Cup. 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Brad Haddin and Sanjay Manjrekar: " Looks like a lush green outfield. With 66m and 67m being the square boundaries 79m hit down the ground. "Beautiful covering of grass and it's very even. It's an even surface which is a lot harder than the previous games. The average first innings score is 311. I think there will be a lot more skid than spin." 

 

TOSS:-
AUSTRALIA  wins the toss and elects to first!

 

 

Pat Cummins, Australian Skipper: "  We will have a bat. Looks like a good track, not sure how it’ll change in the 100 overs. Good to get game time for everyone, don’t want to go into a World Cup cold. Results haven’t gone our way until now but good day to change that. Different conditions here but we have played a lot over here so no surprises. We’ve made five changes, Starc and Maxwell are back. Tanveer Sangha is making his ODI debut."

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: " Conditions are much better here, the weather looks good. Decent temperature as well, we’re just looking forward to this game. The breaks are more important from a mental perspective than a physical one. Very happy with how we played in the series, almost everything we wanted to do we got it done. Gives us a chance for us to see what we want to do. Looks a bit dry, it’s going to play slightly better under lights, we wanted to chase anyway. Let's see if we can make use of the two new balls. Myself, Virat Kohli, and Kuldeep Yadav are back. From the last game, Ravi Ashwin misses out, and Washington Sundar is in. Ishan Kishan is not well, he’s down with viral fever so he misses out."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Australia- 90/1 (9.0 rpo, 11x4, 5x6)  || India- 72/0 (7.2 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Australia- 196/4 (6.5 rpo, 22x4, 3x6)  || India- 179/6 (5.9 rpo, 12x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

Australia- 66/2 (6.6 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)  || India- 35/4 (3.5 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

 

 

Australia ended their losing streak but India clinches the series 2-1. The Australian openers came out all guns blazing after winning the toss and deciding to bat first. Mitchell Marsh and David Warner added 78 runs for the first wicket going at a brisk rate. Thereafter Steven Smith and Mitch Marsh continued on the momentum adding 137 ( 119) for the second wicket taking the game away from the Indian bowlers. Marsh top scored with 96 while Steve Smith and Marnus coming in at no.3 & 4 added 74 & 72 respectively. India had a huge ask ahead of them in order to get past a total of 352 which happens to be the highest total at the venue. Skipper Rohit Sharma took the attack onto the opposition smashing 81 from 57 deliveries but none of the other batters could cope up with the asking rate. Glenn Maxwell getting the key wickets of Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Shreyas Iyer was the pick of the bowlers. The all-rounder accounted for 4 wickets conceding just 40 runs from his 10. Australia eventually won the game by 66 runs. The two teams will once again clash in their first World Cup game which will take place on the 8th of October in Chennai. 

 

Pat Cummins, Australia Skipper: " I must say I'm quite happy to bowl in the night than in the heat during the day. Both Maxwell and Starc have not played much, Maxi picking four-fer and Starcy bowling in great rhythm is a good sign. Travis Head won't be fit for the start of the WC. I will be pretty worried about opening the bowling against a pair like Warner & Mitch Marsh. Ashton Agar is back home with a calf injury and Head won't be fit for the next couple of weeks. Happy as it was the first hit where we have had almost a full-strength team."

 

 

Glenn Maxwell  is the Player of the Match

 

Glenn Maxwell: "Not too bad, is it? It has been a lot of hard work, to be honest. The South Africa tour was a bit of a setback for us. After the injury got back home and got an injection. I don't have any travel issues, unlike the others. I feel fresh. It's nice to chip in, if Mitch Marsh was there on the field, we would have chopped and changed in the bowling. Since he was not there, had to bowl more. That will be the role of the allrounders in this WC. We are all trying to be as flexible as possible. We have a super flexible list and it's good to get some momentum before the World Cup."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: " I'm pretty happy of course I would like to go all the way along but if I'm hitting like that I'm pretty happy. In the last 7-to 8 days we have played really well, we have been challenged under different conditions and by different teams, and I thought we responded to that challenge quite well. Unfortunately, not the result we wanted today. About Jasprit Bumrah I'm pretty happy, more importantly how he feels body-wise, he has got so much skill, one bad game can happen to anyone. How he feels mentally and body-wise is key for us and that's looking good for us. When we talk about the 15 we are very clear about what we want. We are not confused, we know where we are headed as a team. It's a team sport and we want everyone to come and play their part, that's how we win championships. It's about looking after the body and trying and stay fresh for the next one and half months."

ICC MENS WORLD CUP 2023 WARM-UP MATCHES

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to bat
TossText: won the Toss and elected to bat
CompetitionName: 19th Asian Games Men Hangzhou 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of the Quarter Finals Clash between India and Nepal. The Men in Blue earned a direct ticket into the semi-finals being a high-ranked side while Nepal made their way after convincing wins against Mongolia and Maldives in the group stage of the Asian Games 2023. The team from Nepal will enter the contest on the back of winning momentum but it would be a daunting task against the Ruturaj Gaikwad-led Indian Unit which possesses some exciting T20 Talent. Batters like Yashasvi Jaiswal, Tilak Varma, Rinku Singh, and Rahul Tripathi have showcased their striking capabilities in the IPL and one can expect India to score big on a ground that is not the biggest. The Bowling Unit comprising of Pacers Arshdeep Singh, Mukesh Kumar, and Avesh Khan; Spinners Ravi Bishnoi, and Washington Sundar can cause troubles for any batting unit let alone Nepal which lacks experience in facing tougher opposition. Will India sail through or Nepal will pose a tough challenge, we shall know just in a bit, let the game begin! 

 

 

Venue:

Pingfeng Campus Cricket Field, Hangzhou

 

 

TOSS:-
India wins the toss and elects to first
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 63/0 (10.5 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  || Nepal- 46/1 (7.7 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 75/3 (8.3 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)  || Nepal- 82/4 (9.1 rpo, 2x4, 7x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 64/1 (12.8 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)  || Nepal- 51/4 (10.2 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)

 

India enters the Semi-Finals of the Asian Games 2023 on the back of a 23-run win against a courageous Nepal side which had its moments in the game. Gaikwad's decision to bat first came off as Yashasvi Jaiswal took the attack onto the opposition from the word go. A 100-run stand between the openers set the right platform for the middle order to follow. Jaiswal accumulated a brilliant 100 from 49 balls with 8 fours and 7 sixes. The finishing touch was provided by Rinku Singh who smashed an unbeaten 37 at a strike rate of 246. 203 was never going to be easy to chase especially after not being able to make the powerplay count. Nepal batters were not allowed to score freely as the score was just 46 in six overs. The batters did comeback in the middle overs scoring at 9 r.p.o but kept losing wickets at regular intervals. Ravi Bishnoi's googlies and sliders left the Nepal batters baffled. The leggie accounted for 3 scalps for just 24 runs. A good second spell from Avesh Khan and Shivam Dube managed to restrict the scoring rate at the death. Nepal showed heart and played competitive cricket but fell short by 23 runs in the end.

TossDetails: India won the Toss and elected to Field
TossText: won the Toss and elected to Field
CompetitionName: 19th Asian Games Men Hangzhou 2022
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the Live commentary of the Semi-Final clash between India  and Bangladesh . After a thumping victory against Nepal in the Quarterfinal match, India are through here whereas their opponents Bangladesh encountered a nail-biting match that ended in their favour against Malaysia. The young Indian team is of full confidence in getting the gold medal for the team and are just two steps away from achieving it. The previous match witnessed the heroics of Y Jaiswal and who's chance will it be to score big today? Who will get through to the Gold medal match tomorrow?

 

TOSS:-

INDIA WON THE TOSS AND OPTS TO FIELD FIRST!!
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-

INDIA QUALIFIES TO THE GOLDEN GAME! India opted to bowl first and once the spinners were given the ball, the course of the game changed. Sai Kishore broke-opened the Bangladesh lineup and went on to pick three wickets! Jaker Ali was their team's highest scorer with 24 runs and R Hasan's 14 off 6 gave the team to post a total of 96. In the second innings, the previous match's star Y Jaiswal was dismissed for a duck but the skipper R Gaikwad's 40* off 26 and T Varma's 55 off 26 helped the team to chase the score in less than 10 overs.
