PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and a warm welcome to the live commentary of the Gold medal  match between India  and Afghanistan  at Pingfeng Campus Cricket Field, Hangzhou. It is a wonderful battle between bat and ball. India won their first match defending the target by 23 runs and their second match yesterday by chasing the target in less than ten overs. In the same way, Afghanistan beat the mighty teams Sri Lanka and Pakistan in their Quarter and semi-final clashes by chasing one and defending one. Who do you think will be better in the present day and take the Gold medal home?

 

TOSS:-

INDIA WON THE TOSS & ELECTED TO FIELD!!
PostMatchCommentary: INDIA MEN'S CRICKET GETS THE GOLD!!  Just a week back, the Indian women created history by bagging the Gold medal, and now the boys have also made the nation proud by getting Gold. The toss being won by India, they chose to bowl and when the team was 112/5 in 18.2 overs, the rain struck. Then it got heavier and now the match has ended without a result. However, the Gold medal was awarded to India as they were the higher-seeded team in the match.

TossDetails: Australia Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of India's curtain raiser in the 2023 ODI World Cup against 5-time champions Australia at the M.A.Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. The last time a World Cup happened in India Dhoni finished it off in style, and with the last 3 World Cups being won by the host nation, the Men in Blue will have their eyes on the prize. Since the 2019 World Cup, the two teams have met 12 times and have won 6 matches each, however, India has the momentum leading into the contest winning the 3-match series against the Aussies just before the World Cup. Can they start off their campaign with a victory today?

 

VENUE STATS:

The average 1st innings score here in the last 5 ODIs is 273 and teams batting 1st have won 3 of those contests.

Pitch Report, Harbhajan Singh and Ravi Shastri: "It will be a slowish surface and might be two-paced looking at the color. I have seen Chennai pitches being harder and flatter but this will be a little bit on the slower side, if you bowl back of a length and don't give pace then it won't be easy."

 

                                                                                                                     

 

 

Ground Dimension:

 

 

                                                                                                                       

 

TOSS:

Australia have won the toss and elected to bat .

 

                                                                                                                            

 

Pat Cummins, Australia Captain: "We will bat first, looks like a good wicket. The sun is out and looks like a good afternoon to bat. We are in a really good spot, we have played quite a lot of cricket and got a good balance of giving guys game time and keeping them fresh. Travis Head, Abbott, Stoinis, and Inglis miss out."

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "The conditions are there for the bowlers and the ball will turn as the game goes on. We played two good series before the warm-up games and we have covered all bases. Unfortunately, Shubman Gill hasn't recovered in time, and Ishan comes in to replace him."
PostMatchCommentary:
POWERPLAY (1-10 OVERS):

AUSTRALIA - 43/1 (4.3 rpo, 7x4, 0x6) || INDIA - 27/3 (2.7 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

MIDDLE OVERS (11-40 OVERS):

AUSTRALIA - 113/6 (3.8 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || INDIA - 155/1 (5.2 rpo, 11x4, 1x6)

DEATH OVERS (41-50 OVERS):

AUSTRALIA - 43/3 (4.5 rpo, 2x4, 1x6) || INDIA - 19/0 (14.3 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

 

India win by 6 wickets against Australia and start their World Cup campaign with a victory . Australia and Pat Cummins called it right at the toss and opted to bat first, after which Bumrah got an early breakthrough for the Men in Blue removing the dangerous Mitchell Marsh, and later on in the innings the Indian spinners used the conditions perfectly, and picked up wickets in the middle overs to restrict the run-flow, bundling out Australia for 199. In the chase, the Aussies breathed fire  with the ball, picking up three wickets inside the first two overs and dismissing three of the Indian top 4 for ducks, after which the chase master Virat Kohli and KL Rahul stitched together a 165-run partnership, with both of them scoring half-centuries to ease the chase and helping India get off the mark in the World Cup .

 

Pat Cummins, Australia Skipper: "At least 50 short with the bat, it was tough trying to defend anything under 200. Their spinners made it tough to work out there. Hazlewood is a class bowler and possesses a lot of questions, stays in that area and was fantastic today. Just one game out of nine, not too much to ponder about but there are some areas we need to get better."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Skipper: "Good feeling to come out on top, it was a good game to start the tournament. Our bowlers used the conditions perfectly, the spinners bowled in the nice areas and all in all, it was a great effort. Credit to Virat and KL on how they went about the chase. That is going to be a challenge for us as a team, moving to different conditions and adapting, and whoever suits the conditions will have to come and do the job. Chennai never disappoints, they love their cricket, and for them to sit in that heat and come out and cheer the team says a lot."

 

KL Rahul is the Player of the Match
KL Rahul: "I was just trying to get my breath back. Virat said there’s a bit in the wicket, so play like Test cricket for a while. There was a bit of help for the pacers with the new ball and then the spinners also. In the last 15-20 overs, dew played a part and that helped quite a bit. It was a good cricket wicket, that’s what you get in the south of India, especially Chennai."

TossDetails: Afghanistan Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second match of India  where they clash against Afghanistan  at Arun Jaitley Stadium, Delhi. The World Cup Campaign for India started off with a marvelous victory against the Aussies in Chennai. We witnessed batting masterclass from Virat Kohli and KL Rahul and won the match in a high-pressure situation. Afghanistan, in their first match lost to Bangladesh in a low-scoring encounter. Who do you think will win the battle of blues today? 

 

VENUE STATS:-

 

                                                                                                                     

 


Arun Jaitley Stadium, Delhi:-
 

In last 5 ODIs, Teams won 
First - 4
First - 1
Average Score - 261
Pacers Average 32.1, Spinners Average - 26.8

The last match here turned out to be the highest World Cup score ever! Are we going to witness another high-scoring clash today?

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Sanjay Manjrekar & Gautam Gambhir: "It looks a belter, fabulous wicket. 350 should be a par score. Going to be tough for off-spinners with these dimensions. If India bats first they should get 350."

 

TOSS:-

Afghanistan won the toss and elected to bat  first!!


Hasamatullah Shahidi, Afghanistan Skipper: "We opt to bat first as this looks like a good batting surface. We have a good bowling attack and hope we can defend. We want to get in form with the bat. We are enjoying ourselves. This is a good chance to showcase our talent. We don't have any changes."


Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We wanted to bowl first as we observed the amount of dew last evening. Don't think the wicket will change much. We were under pressure to start with in the first game, but Rahul and Kohli batted well. We take a lot of pride in our performance. Hopefully, we can repeat that and keep the momentum going forward. Shardul replaces Ashwin today."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Afghanistan- 48/1 (4.8 rpo, 8x4, 1x6) || India- 94/0 (9.4 rpo, 11x4, 4x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Afghanistan- 163/3 (5.3 rpo, 11x4, 5x6) || India- 179/2 (7.2 rpo, 17x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

Afghanistan- 61/4 (6.1 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)


BACK TO BACK VICTORIES FOR !! WHAT A GAME THIS WAS! The toss favoured the Afghanistan team and they opted to bat first in this belter of a wicket. The skipper H Shahidi scored 80 off 88 along with A Omarzai (62 off 69) who partnered for 121 runs. J Bumrah was the highest wicket-taker of the innings with a four-wicket haul. In the chase, the opening partnership was worth 156 runs between the skipper Rohit Sharma who registered his 7th WC century, and Ishan Kishan who made 47 runs! Virat Kohli added 55 runs to victory and the team chased this target in 35 overs. India won this match by 8 wickets!

 

Rohit Sharma is the Player of the Match:-

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "This was a good pitch to bat on. Backed myself to play my natural game. It feels special to get a World Cup century. Some of the shots are premeditated. You go by instincts sometimes. I know it's my responsibility to give the team a good start as much as possible. It's something I've done for a while and love. It's important to keep the mindset positive."


Hashmatullah Shahidi, Afghanistan Skipper: "We had a target of above 300 in mind, considering India's strong line-up and this was a good pitch to post a big score. Unfortunately, we lost back-to-back wickets in the middle. Looking forward to the seven more games. Hope to work on the issues and come back positively."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the biggest rivalry of the sport where the Indian team clashes against Pakistan in the ICC World Cup. Not only does the history between the teams make this clash the biggest, but also at present the two teams are the top two ranked in the ICC ODI rankings. Both India and Pakistan have won their previous two clashes and are unbeaten in the tournament, So who will remain victorious at the end of the day? Rohit Sharma and Mohammad Rizwan's centuries in their previous games lit the tournament to a big level. All set for the fearless clash between the bat and the ball!

 

VENUE STATS:-

 

 

                                                                                                                        


Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad 
In the last 5 ODIs,

Teams won 
First - 2
 First - 3
Average Score - 247
Pacer's Avg - 29.7 ; Spinner's Avg - 34.7

 

PITCH REPORT:-

Irfan Pathan and Sanjay Manjrekar: "Black soil pitch. A lot of rolling has been done, so we will get a lot of runs. A 72m straight boundary while the cover region is around 76m, 60m square boundaries. A little bit of moisture. No grass and it is going to get harder. With the kind of humid conditions, the ball tends to swing in the air. having a fast bowler will add to the advantage."

 

TOSS:-

INDIA WINS THE TOSS AND OPTS TO BOWL  FIRST!!


Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "We choose to bowl first. Extraordinary atmosphere and it cannot get bigger than this.  It's a good track, Dew could be a big factor so we want to bowl first. We want to come out there and give our best in every game. Keeping the atmosphere in the team relaxed is the most important thing in a tournament like this and luckily we have got a few guys like that. Gill replaces Ishan. Unfortunate for Ishan to miss out, he stepped up when we needed him. Gill has been a special player for us over the past year or so we wanted him back."


Babar Azam, Pakistan Captain: "We would have also bowled first. We have had a good two wins. Our momentum and confidence is really high. It's a jam-packed stadium and we will enjoy it. We want to be good in the field, we had good practice sessions. No change for us."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Pakistan- 49/1 (4.9 rpo, 8x4, 0x6) || India- 79/2 (7.9 rpo, 10x4, 4x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Pakistan- 138/7 (4.6 rpo, 18x4, 0x6) || India- 113/1 (20.2 Overs, 5.5 rpo, 8x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

Pakistan- 4/2 (2.5 overs, 0.8 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)


The biggest clash of the tournament comes to an end with the hosts India easily winning this match in 31 overs. With the toss favouring India, they opted to bowl first here considering the dew factor. After the two openers were sent back to the pavilion, the 82-run partnership between Babar Azam (50 off 58) and Mohammad Rizwan (29 off 69) was threatening until Siraj and Bumrah bowled them over. Then wickets started falling one by one in close intervals. It was a complete bowling performance as Bumrah, Siraj, Hardik, Jadeja & Kuldeep each picked two wickets to all out the opponents for 191 runs in 42.5 overs. In the second innings, the openers started off aggressively with Rohit (86 off 63) scoring his half-century! Shreyas Iyer (53* off 62) then finished the match off in style!   

 

Jasprit Bumrah is the Player of the Match:
 
Jasprit Bumrah: "It felt good. We realized the wicket was on the slower side so we wanted to bowl hard lengths. We were trying to make it as difficult as possible.  I like to read the wickets and try a lot of options. I count my slower ball as a spinner's slower ball, one of those days where it came off. There was a little phase in there where there was reverse swing, so got Shadab's wicket."


Babar Azam, Pakistan Skipper: "We started well with the bat. Good partnership there. We just planned to play normally and build partnerships. There was a sudden collapse and we could not finish well. The total was not good. We were not up to the mark with the new ball. Rohit played an outstanding innings. We just tried to take wickets, but that didn't happen."


Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "The bowlers set the game up for us. I don't think it was a 190 pitch as we were looking at 280. Whoever gets the ball does the job and that is something we pride ourselves in. My job as a captain is important there as well. Have to read the conditions and figure out who's the right guy to do the job. We were very clear about what we wanted to do. All in all, it's looking good. Want to keep my fingers crossed. Want to stay balanced. You have to play well on that particular day, and that's what we're looking at."

TossDetails: Bangladesh Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 17th match of the ICC CWC 2023 where the Indian team takes on Bangladesh at Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune. This week is full of twists and turns with Afghanistan beating England and Netherlands getting the better of South Africa. In the last four matches when these two teams faced, it was Bangladesh who won three of them including the Asia Cup. It's a sweet time for India to reply back with a World Cup victory!! India are going strong with a hat-trick of victories and Bangladesh lost their previous two games! Who will turn victorious today? 

 

VENUE STATS:-
Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune
In the last 5 ODIs,
Teams won 
First - 3
 First - 2
Average Score - 299

 

PITCH REPORT:

Sanjay Manjrekar and Irfan Pathan: "It's a good pitch and has a history of lot of runs. It's a pitch where the seamers could get help. Not a turner. You can bat really well. If you are a quality fast bowler, you get something out of it as well. It's a black soil pitch. High-scoring pitch. You can use the bouncer regularly on this pitch and the batters can play on the up"

 

TOSS:-

SHANTO CALLS RIGHT AT THE TOSS AND BANGLADESH WILL BAT  FIRST!!


Najmul Hossain Shanto, Bangladesh Captain: "Feeling proud to lead the side. We will bat today. It is a fresh wicket. It'll be good for the team If we put up a good score. Shakib is struggling a bit, and Nasum replaces him. We have some great memories against India, hopefully, we continue our form. It'll be a great match. Another change as Hasan comes in for Taskin."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "I would have bowled first as well. We are planning to stick with the same plan, don't see any reason to change it. That Plays a crucial role in this WC, keeping everybody in their own space. The boys are confident and as well as enjoying the cricket. We want to continue this momentum with no change in the Playing XI."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

Bangladesh- 63/0 (6.3 rpo, 8x4, 3x6) || India- 63/0 (6.3 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

Bangladesh- 126/5 (4.2 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) || India- 186/3 (6.2 rpo, 15x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

Bangladesh- 67/3 (6.7 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) || India- 12/0 (8.0 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)


4TH CONSECUTIVE WIN FOR INDIA!! India was put to bowl first by Bangladesh and the openers of their team T Hasan (51 off 43) and L Das (66 off 82) laid a solid foundation by scoring 93 runs! After which the Indian spinners gave us the breakthrough and this changed the momentum with a few quiet overs from both ends. The finishing from Mahmudullah (46 off 36) gave Bangladesh a total of 256 runs. In the second innings, Rohit and Gill paired up for 88 runs each contributing 48 and 53 to the team. This led Virat to go with the full flow and he finished the innings in great style with a six and a ton to his name.

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match


Virat Kohli: "I wanted to help the team and be ready to help them whenever the team needs. I thought of finishing the innings and getting the win on a high note and was really hoping to convert my fifty into a hundred. Start always plays a crucial role in an innings, I was lucky to get those kinds of balls at the beginning. It gives you the confidence. It is a good track to bat on and my plan is to bring my game, find the gaps, and accelerate the innings whenever needed. The dressing room feels positive and we love each other's company and contribution. It is a special World Cup for all of us here, we need to gain and carry the momentum throughout."


Najmul Shanto, Bangladesh Skipper: "India are a very good side and a very capable team. They showed it today. I think we didn't play our best cricket. Hopefully, we'll play better in the upcoming games. Tanzid and also our bowlers batted well. The problem is we didn't finish well with the bat. Would have been a different ball game if Litton had stayed."


Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "Good win, something we were expecting. We didn't start well, but the guys pulled it back in the middle-overs and at the death. Our fielding has been superb in all these matches. The bowlers were smart and knew what lengths to bowl. Jaddu was brilliant with the ball and the catch. We're doing well as a group. The crowd is coming in big numbers, the stands are full, and they've been brilliant."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello, and a warm welcome to the Super Sunday clash between the table toppers New Zealand and India, the only two unbeaten teams in the tournament yet. New Zealand won their previous four matches with two defending and two chasing while India won all their matches batting second. It might be interesting to see if India bats first in the Dharamsala conditions. Hardik Pandya who suffered an injury in the previous game will not be available today and who do you think will replace him in the xi today? Both teams have met each other 9 times in the World Cup and New Zealand has won 5 out of it with India winning 3. But India has a better overall ODI record. Is it going to be the day of Blackcaps or the Bleedblue? Who will remain unbeaten in the tournament after this exciting encounter? 

 

VENUE STATS:-

HIMACHAL PRADESH CRICKET ASSOCIATION STADIUM, DHARAMSALA

In 7 ODI's played here,

Teams won,

Bat First - 3

Bowl First - 4

Average score - 203

 

PITCH REPORT: 

Ravi Shastri and Simon Doull: "Very less grass and this will be on the slower side. Dew will come in. It is a lot cooler here. This pitch will be on the slower side, but still a good wicket to bat on."


TOSS:-

ROHIT SHARMA CALLS RIGHT AT THE TOSS AND INDIA ELECTS TO FIELD FIRST!!


Rohit Sharma, India Skipper: "We opt to bowl first. We were here training yesterday and felt a bit of dew. Looks like a good pitch, we want to chase it. Quite important to keep the momentum going. This is one place where everyone wants to come and play, with beautiful weather and a nice stadium. Hardik is not available and Shardul is out. Shami and Surya make their way in."


Tom Latham, New Zealand Skipper: "We would have bowled first as well. Looks a good surface. We know there will be dew later. Whatever we do, we need to do well. We need to keep the momentum going. New conditions, so need to adjust to as quickly as we can. Same team - three seamers and two spinners."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

New Zealand- 34/2 (3.4 rpo, 5x4, 0x6) || India- 63/0 (6.3 rpo, 9x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

New Zealand- 185/2 (6.2 rpo, 12x4, 5x6) || India- 162/5 (5.4 rpo, 18x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

New Zealand- 54/6 (5.4 rpo, 1x4, 2x6) || India- 49/1 (6.1 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)


India remains the only unbeaten team in the tournament by registering the 5th consecutive victory here. India opted to bowl first and this became the fifth game where India chased the target and won the match in this CWC. Mohammad Shami who played his first CWC match this year was the star with the ball with a fifer. Rachin Ravindra (75 off 87) and Daryl Mitchell (130 off 127) who paired up after the departure of the openers stayed in the crease till the 34th over contributing 159 runs together. the team then got all out in the last ball of the last over making 273 runs. In the chase, the Indian openers Rohit (46 o

ff 40) and Gill (26 off 31) started the chase optimistically scoring 63 runs in the powerplay. The chase master Virat Kohli led the chase scoring 95 runs in 104 deliveries. Jadeja also contributed 39* runs to the victory and sealed the match with 12 balls remaining.

 

Mohammed Shami is the Player of the Match
 

Mohammed Shami: "I gained a lot of confidence after taking a wicket on the very first delivery. You should support your team mates when they are doing well. It was important to pick those late wickets, you always want your team to be the top. Very happy that I got wickets and India is on top of the table."

 

Tom Latham, New Zealand Skipper: "We played quiet well. We didn't capitalize in the death overs. We lagged a little out there. But credit to India. We weren't able to get the breakthrough with the ball. Rachin and Mitchell built a fantastic partnership. We have a perfect group. The bowlers did well. We just try to be proactive and focus on the matchups. We have a few days off. We have a day game here. We want to do good stuff."

 

Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: " Very good start to the tournament. Our job is half done. It is important to continue and to stay in the present. Shami took the oppurtunity with both hands, and he has the experience in these conditions. At one stage, we were looking at 300 and more. Credit to our bowlers in the death. I am enjoying my batting. Happy that we won. Kohli has done this for us so many years. Kohli and Jadeja pulled us back when we lost a few wickets in the middle. We know that fielding is something that will decide a lot of things going forward."

GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
TossDetails: England Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the 29th match of the ICC CWC 2023 where the Indian team clash against the defending champions England at Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow. India are the only unbeaten team in the tournament yet and are going really strong in their campaign. They have played five and chased the target successfully in all of those, and it'll be interesting to see India batting first today. The defending champions, who came in as one of the favourites of the tournament lost their path and are at the bottom of the table currently with just one victory in five of their games. Can England turn their tables around or will India continue their supremacy in the World Cup? Hardik Pandya remains unavailable for today's game as well. Will India play with their same XI or will we see an extra spinner coming in today?

 

VENUE STATS:-
Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow
In last 5 ODIs,

Teams won 
Batting First - 2
Batting Second - 3
Average Score - 258


PITCH REPORT:-
Ravi Shastri and Nasser Hussain: "This looks like a Mumbai track of the 80s and 90s. It’s the fourth game at this venue and we can see some wear and tear with some dry patches. Spinners will come into play. Batting will get easier under lights. India is more dangerous when there’s spin. It looks like a decent pitch."

 

TOSS:-

JOS BUTTLER CALLS HEADS AT THE TOSS AND HEADS IT IS! ENGLAND WILL BOWL FIRST!


Jos Buttler, England Skipper: "We opt to bowl first today. Nothing in particular. It's a great occasion and hopefully, today we bring our best. We want to put up a good show today. We have not played to our full potential. Playing in front of a full crowd and against India, it's a great feeling. We don't have any changes today."


Rohit Sharma, Indian Skipper: "We anyhow wanted to bat first, we had a good time batting second and we want to try this. Looks like a good pitch. It has played well for the full match. It’s quite important to play well. We have played some good cricket and it's always good to have a break. It's nice to come and get back into business. We are going with the same combination."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 35/2 (3.5 rpo, 3x4, 2x6) || England- 40/4 (4.0 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 145/3 (4.8 rpo, 14x4, 1x6) || England- 89/6 (24.5 Overs, 3.6 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 49/4 (4.9 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)


INDIA HAS CLAIMED THE TOP SPOT ON THE TABLE!!  It was a test for India today, being put to bat first by England for the first time in this World Cup. After a few initial hiccups, The Indian Skipper Rohit partnered with KL Rahul for 91 runs off 111 deliveries, with Rohit leading the team from the front scoring valuable 87 runs off 101 balls. Suryakumar Yadav's 49 off 47 took the team to a total of 229 runs. David Willey was the star with the ball in the first innings with him picking three wickets. In the second innings, the Indian pace department showcased a wonderful display taking 4 wickets in the first powerplay. The English team never came back in the game except for a few partnerships. Liam Livingstone scored 27 off 46, the highest of their team. M Shami after a five-wicket haul in the previous game, bowled splendidly today as well accounting for 4 wickets, and J Bumrah took 3 scalps.

 

Rohit Sharma is the Player of the Match

Rohit Sharma, Indian Captain: "After we lost wickets, it was really important to create that partnership with KL Rahul. It was a challenging pitch, it got better to bat on as the game progressed. Very happy with this win. I have got experience, it is only about playing my shots. I still felt we were 20 runs short. The ball got softer and it wasn't easy to rotate strike either. This was the game, a lot of character in the squad. We just wanted to get to a total we could play with it. We were not great with the bat. Losing three wickets isn't the ideal situation. When you start your innings, you have to try and get a couple of wickets to put the pressure back on the opposition. You can always rely on our seamers to come good and get those crucial breakthroughs."

 

Jos Buttler, England Captain: "We are very disappointed. At the halfway mark, chasing a score of 230, we fancied ourselves, but same old story. I wasn't sure about the dew. We bowled well. I wanted to soak some pressure and build a partnership. There wasn't scoreboard pressure. We are just falling short whichever way we are doing it. Excellent start in the powerplay, there was a bit of indifferent bounce, the ground fielding was good. It felt like today was the day, but we didn't back it up with the bat."

TossDetails: Sri Lanka Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of India's Game 7 in the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023, against the Lankan Lions as the action moves to the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Only one memory comes to the mind when the words India, Sri Lanka, Mumbai, and World Cup come together but things are a little different this time around as it is a group encounter and the Men in Blue head are undefeated heading into this contest, whereas Sri Lanka will look to improve their semi-final chances with a win. India can confirm their spot in the semi-finals with a victory today, becoming the first team to do so.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
The two Asian sides have faced each other nine times in World Cups, with both teams winning 4 each. India won both the recent encounters against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup, bundling out the Lions for just 50 in the Final. Can they continue their winning momentum today also?

 

VENUE STATS:

The two games in this World Cup had scores of 399 and 382 for the team batting first. The average 1st innings score in the last 5 ODI's at the venue is 301. Can we see another high-scoring game here at the Wankhede?

 

PITCH REPORT:
Ricky Ponting & Michael Atherton: "It is the same pitch as the England-South Africa match. 64m and 69m square boundaries, the straight boundary is at 76m. There is a bit of shine and it means that it'll not slow down as the game progresses. The challenge for the bowlers is to hit a hard length, which has proved difficult to get away."

 

TOSS:

Sri Lanka won the toss and have elected to field first.

Kusal Mendis, Sri Lanka Captain: "We are going to bowl first. The pitch will be better for batting in the second innings. Everyone did their best in the last few games, hopefully, we will continue to do the same today. One change today, Dhananjaya De Silva is not playing today, and Hemantha is playing."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We would have batted first, good pitch to bat on. Obviously, some assistance to start with but under lights there will be good assistance for our pacers. It's important for us to not get carried away by the performances we put in. No changes and same team as the last game."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-
IND - 60/1 (6.0 rpo, 11x4, 0x6) || SL - 14/6 (1.4 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :-
IND - 204/3 (6.8 rpo, 17x4, 5x6) || SL - 41/4 (4.2 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :-
IND - 97/4 (9.7 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)

 

India remains undefeated in the World Cup and became the first team to qualify for the semi-finals , after a 302-run victory over Sri Lanka in Mumbai. After opting to bowl, Sri Lanka and Madushanka struck in the first over, removing the Indian skipper, after which Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill notched up a 189-run partnership , with both of them scoring half-centuries and later a blistering fifty from Shreyas Iyer, in the end, took India to a mammoth total of 357 after 50 overs. In the 2nd innings, India's seamers took off from where they left off, breathing fire and picking up 6 wickets inside the Powerplay, helping India bundle out Sri Lanka for 55. The innings was highlighted by Shami's second 5-wicket haul this tournament , also becoming India's leading wicket-taker in ODI World Cup history in the process.

 

Kusal Mendis, Sri Lanka Skipper: "I am very disappointed with the team's performance and with myself also. They bowled really well, a little bit of seam movement under lights as well. Madushanka bowled really well and our bowlers did well in the middle overs. They bowled really well in the first 6 overs, and I think they deserve all the credit tonight. We have another 2 games and I hope we come back strong in the next game."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Skipper: "Very happy knowing that we have officially qualified now, been a good effort from the squad when we started off in Chennai. The way we approached these 7 games, it was quite clinical, everyone put in the effort and a lot of individuals have put their hand up. It was a good challenge to put runs on the board, and that's the kind of template you gotta have when you want to score that many runs. 350 on any pitch is a very good score and a lot of credit goes to the batting unit for taking us to that score. Shreyas Iyer is a very strong lad and today he did what he is known for and that is what we expect from him. Siraj has got a lot of skills when he is operating with the new ball. To put in a performance back-to-back shows the quality of the seamers and if there is something in the conditions, they are quite lethal. All in all, it was pleasing to watch and I hope they continue to do it that way."

 

Mohammad Shami is the Player of the Match

Mohammad Shami: "Our bowling is in good shape and with the kind of rhythm that we are in, everyone is enjoying and everyone is happy for each other's success. I always focus on hitting the good areas and length. It's very important to be in rhythm in white ball cricket and hit the good areas. The kind of support we get from the crowd, I want to thank each and every one of them."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of India's penultimate league fixture against South Africa at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata. A mouthwatering contest awaits us today as it is not only the clash between the top two teams in the points table but also the top 2 teams with the highest Win % in ODI's this year. The Men in Blue will look to continue their unbeaten streak this World Cup, and a win tonight will confirm their place at the top of the table. Today also marks King Kohli's 35th birthday, and he will look to make this day even more special with a win. In other news, Prasidh Krishna has been roped into the Indian squad after the unavailability of Hardik Pandya.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
In 5 World Cup games between the two sides, India have won 2 and South Africa have won 3. However, both of India's victories have come in the last two meetings between the sides at the World Cup.

 

VENUE STATS:

In the two games in this tournament so far, the first innings totals were 229 and 204. The Seamers have taken 21 wickets with an average of 19.33 and an economy rate of 4.3 in these two games whereas Spinners have picked up 10 wickets at an average of 36.30 and an economy of 4.81.

 

PITCH REPORT:
Ravi Shastri and Irfan Pathan: "It looks like a better surface when compared to the last game played here. It did turn a bit but it got better under dew. This pitch has a lot of spots at one end, but not a lot from the other end. It does look slow, there will not be a lot of bounce, and the batters need to adjust to this surface. It has got a nice tan and there is some grass on the surface."

 

TOSS:

Rohit Sharma has called it right at the toss and India has opted to bat first!

 

Rohit Sharma, India Captain: "We will bat first. It'll be a good game, two teams who have played consistent cricket and have topped the table, will be nice to win and go on top. We're playing the same team, don't think we need to change anything with the way we've been playing."

 

Temba Bavuma, South Africa Captain: "We would have batted first too, but now we need to chase, and will be a nice challenge. We know that's one area where we need to gain more confidence and bat with responsibility. We have been putting on consistent performances and we'll look to improve going forward. One change - Shamsi comes in place of Gerald Coetzee."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-
IND - 91/1 (9.1 rpo, 14x4, 3x6) || SA - 35/3 (3.5 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :-
IND - 148/2 (4.9 rpo, 11x4, 2x6) || SA - 48/7 (2.8 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :-
IND - 87/2 (8.7 rpo, 10x4, 1x6)

 

India continue their domination in this World Cup, defeating 2nd placed South Africa by 243 runs to go 8-0 and remain undefeated in the World Cup  . After calling it right at the toss, Rohit opted to bat first and took the Men in Blue to a blistering start, scoring 91 runs inside the Powerplay, after which the major headline of the day was Virat Kohli's record-equalling 49th ODI century on his 35th birthday, at the ground where he got his 1st international century , helping India post a mammoth total of 326/5 at the end of the innings. After the break, the Indian bowlers continued their turmoil with the ball, picking up 3 wickets inside the Powerplay and bundling out South Africa for just 83, headlined by Jadeja's 5-wicket haul this time. The Men in Blue confirm their place at the top of the table, have bundled out the opposition in 6 of the 8 matches, and are the only team this World Cup to not get all out. Can they continue this momentum and domination for the rest of the tournament? Join us on November 12th for India's last league game against the Netherlands at Bangalore.

 

Temba Bavuma, South Africa Skipper: "We know it was a challenge. We had had our conversations with our batters. They got 90 in the first 10 overs and we did well after that, curbed down the run-rate. We were not able to adapt unfortunately. Potentially, we might play again here in the semis."

 

Rohit Sharma, India Skipper: "If you look at how we have played in the last three games, we have adapted better. We let our instincts take over, we don't preplan anything, we just assess and play accordingly. Jadeja has been very good for us playing in every format over the years. Today was a classical case as to what Jadeja is for us, came out at the death and scored vital runs, and then picked up wickets. Not to get too ahead of ourselves has been the talk in the dressing room, a couple of big games coming up and we don't want to change anything."

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match

Virat Kohli: "It was a big game, probably playing the toughest team in the tournament. There was a motivation to do well. Because it happened on my birthday, it became special and the people made it more special for me. As the ball got older, the conditions slowed down drastically. The message was clear, to keep batting around me. I’m enjoying myself, playing cricket all over again, which is more important to me than phases. I’m just happy that God has blessed me with that enjoyment. It’s a very emotional moment for me, I know where I come from, I know the days I have watched Sachin Tendulkar on TV, and just to get that appreciation from him means a lot to me."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello, we are elated in wishing the fans of the Indian Cricket team a Very Happy Diwali  and we welcome to the live coverage of the final league fixture where India takes on the Netherlands at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. The table toppers India are the only unbeaten team in the tournament and are keen on finishing the league stage with a winning streak. As we play here in this iconic stadium, we are waiting to witness the King's 50th ODI Century in his own den. Will we see any changes today in the starting XI of India? 

 

VENUE STATS:-
M Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru
In the last 4 ODIs,

Teams won 
Batting First - 1
Batting Second - 3
Average Score - 244

 

Pitch Report from Sanjay Manjrekar and Aaron Finch: "The Side boundaries are 64 meters on both sides, and straight boundaries are 73 meters. Today's pitch looks very beautiful. There is a little bit of surface cracking in the wicket. We have seen some big scores here. You can take a little bit of time at the beginning of your innings."

 

TOSS:-

ROHIT CALLS IT RIGHT & INDIA WILL BAT FIRST!


Rohit Sharma(Indian Captain): "We are going to bat. No particular reason. Whether we have batted first or bowled first, we have done really well in all the departments. Another opportunity to play better today and check all the boxes. Hats off to the guys who have stood up the most needed times and taken responsibility. We are playing the same team."

 

Scott Edwards(Netherlands Captain): "We would have batted in this wicket as well. Looks like a very good wicket, but good place for chasing. We've had two wins. Looking to give a good performance today, give ourselves a chance. This is going to be the biggest crowd we have had this World Cup. India has been at their best, we have to be at our best. Same XI for us."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-
IND - 91/0 (9.1 rpo, 10x4, 5x6) || NED - 62/1 (6.2 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :-
IND - 193/3 (6.4 rpo, 18x4, 3x6) || NED -128/5 (4.2 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :-
IND - 126/1 (12.6 rpo, 9x4, 8x6)  || NED -60/4 (6 rpo, 3x4, 5x6)

 

India Comfortably wins this final league fixture against the Netherlands. After winning the toss, India decided to bat first. Indian batters got off to a huge start, The top 5 fired up and all the top 5 batters scored 50+ Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul scored 128 and 102 respectively and India went on to score a Huge total of 410 Runs. With the Big total on board Indians came into attack in the second innings, the dutch played really well in the powerplay by putting 62 runs with the loss of 1 wicket. The 2nd Wicket partnership involved scored 50 runs. But later on, Jadeja and Kuldeep came in and took some quick wickets led to the fall of the Netherlands Innings! Teja Nidamanuru scored half century with 6 sixes to his account. Both King Kohli and Hitman Rohit took 1 wicket each and the Indian bowling attack had a very good performance today. The Netherlands managed to put in 250 runs finally, and India won this final league fixture by a mammoth 160 Runs! We will meet on the other side in the Semifinals!

 


Shreyas Iyer  Player of the Match: "I had a deja vu. This has happened against Australia too, and I threw away my wicket and but I need to come not out this time. Wanted to grab some pills for my cramps. The scores I had in my back helped me. The wicket was a little two-paced.  I have worked a lot on these shots, especially while batting nets. I was trying to hit it straight. Get into a good position and after that, it is just my followthrough!"


Rohit Sharma (India captain): "Since we started the World Cup, it was all about one game at a moment. It is a big tournament, 11 games in total It was important to break it down into single ones and focus on each one of them. We were playing in different venues and wanted to play accordingly and that's what we did in every game. Very happy at how we have played in these nine games. Everyone took responsibility. We adapted really well in all the venues. We started the World Cup four games in a row chasing, and then we had to defend and the pacers did a very good job along with the spinners. The results will keep the dressing room lively. We are playing in India, there will be a lot of expectations. We have to enjoy each other's company."

 


Scott Edwards (Netherlands Captain): "It's a tricky situation where we want to be. We're confident with our style. The tournament was always going to be tough. India is a top side. We need to improve for the T20 World Cup next year. They showed class with the bat. Learning from that.Our team is relatively young, with many emerging talents in the setup. We have upcoming training camps to sharpen our skills. As for the fixtures, we're still in the process of finalizing them."

TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
