CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Good Noon, Indian cricket fans, and welcome to the iconic Wankhede Stadium for what promises to be a riveting World Cup semi-final clash between the mighty hosts, India, and the strategically adept New Zealand! The stage is set here in Mumbai, with perfect weather conditions complementing a pitch that promises plenty of runs and some exciting pace bowling from the pace trio. India, riding high on an undefeated streak and led by the charismatic Rohit Sharma, looks poised to continue their dream run, boasting a formidable lineup with the likes of a rejuvenated Bumrah. Meanwhile, New Zealand, known for their adaptability and resilience, bring to the field their own brand of cricketing intellect, with key players like Ravindra and Boult ready to challenge the hosts. Buckle up, as we're all set for a cricketing spectacle that's bound to be etched in the World Cup history! 

 

HEAD TO HEAD IN World Cup:
IND - 4
NZ  - 5

 

VENUE STATS:

WANKHEDE STADIUM, MUMBAI

AVERAGE 1ST INNINGS SCORE: 323
HIGHEST SCORE CHASED: 293
WICKET SPLIT 
PACE: 80.82%
SPIN:19.18%

 

PITCH REPORT:

Ravi Shastri: "There are some patches on spinners spots. The spinners will come into play As the game takes off, later on, if there is any dew, it will play well. There will be some carry for the wicketkeeper from the hard length for seamers."

TOSS:

INDIA WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO BAT!


Rohit Sharma (India Captain): "Seems like a solid wicket, leaning towards the slower side. Our last semi-final against NZ was back in 2019. They've consistently been a strong team, promising a competitive match. Today's significance is clear...it's all about performing on the day itself."
 

Kane Williamson (New Zealand Captain): "We'd have chosen to bat first too. It's a used pitch, and we're expecting some dew later on. Excited for the upcoming challenge. Anticipating a great match. Both sides have adapted to diverse conditions, and it's essentially knockout cricket now."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-
IND - 84/1 (8.4rpo, 10x4, 4x6)  || NZ - 46/1 (4.6 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Middle overs (11-40 Overs) :-
IND - 203/1 (6.7rpo, 13x4, 8x6) || NZ - 220 /3 (7.3 rpo, 18x4, 8x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :-
IND - 110/2 (11 rpo, 7x4, 7x6)   || NZ - 61 /6 (6.1 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

 

In a high-stakes semi-final of the ICC World Cup, India demonstrated their cricketing supremacy by setting a monumental total of 397/4 against New Zealand. India after winning the toss and choosing to bat first. This exceptional performance was anchored by Virat Kohli's landmark achievement of scoring his 50th ODI century, amassing 117 runs off 113 balls, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's record. Shreyas Iyer, playing at his home ground, complemented Kohli's historic innings with a brilliant 105 off 70 balls. KL Rahul's swift 39 off 20 balls further bolstered India's formidable total. New Zealand's reply, though valiant, was restricted to 327, despite a solid partnership between Daryl Mitchell who scored 134 runs, and Kane Williamson, who scored 69 runs. India's bowling was dominated by Mohammed Shami's exceptional 7-wicket haul, rendering him the chief architect of New Zealand's collapse. Ravindra Jadeja's fielding was noteworthy as well, with three crucial catches contributing to India's defensive strategy. The comprehensive victory in this critical semi-final has now propelled India into the finals of the World Cup, where they will face the winner of the upcoming semi-final between The Proteas and The Aussies. This match not only highlighted India's batting depth and bowling prowess but also underscored their readiness to compete for the ultimate prize in the tournament. The anticipation for the finals is now at an all-time high, with India emerging as a formidable contender for the World Cup title.

 

Kane Williamson(New Zealand Captain): "Firstly, congrats to India, they played outstandingly good 400 was going to be tough. but credit to the guys, a proud effort to stay in the fight till the end. Disappointing to go out of the tournament. You come in and get 400, it's a check in the box. They deserve to be here. The crowd was fantastic, unbelievable atmosphere, but special to be part of the World Cup, great to be hosted by India. We had some super contributions, Rachin and Mitchell were super special throughout the World Cup, on different surfaces. They played exceptionally well. Bowlers gave in, a lot of fight. Even if it did not go our way,  moving forward as a team, we have taken some really good steps in the right direction."

 

Mohammed Shami(Man of the Match): "I was waiting for my opportunities. I did not play a lot of ODI Cricket. My return started against Kiwis in Dharamsala. I still believe in pitching it up and getting wickets with the new ball moving. I have dropped Williamson's catch, I shouldn't have done it. I felt terrible about that. But the focus was to vary the pace and see if they were hitting it in the air. The wicket was very good to bat, lots of runs were scored. It felt amazing after these kinds of performances. Last couple of World Cups, we lost in the semis. So, we wanted to do everything for this, this is the only chance we didn't want to let go of this."

 

Rohit Sharma (India Captain): We all have played a lot of cricket here, it's not over until the final ball. We knew we would be tested. Our plan is to stay calm and execute the plan, we had some unfortunate moments in the field but we backed each other and always tried to get back on track. Williamson and Mitchell played a crucial knock. The energy went down a bit but we stuck to the plan and knew that we needed to break the partnership. Shami shifted the momentum and stepped up when mattered the most. Happy to see what our batters are capable of during these kinds of situations. Gill & Iyer with a crucial knock of 80 and 105 and Kohli added another feather to his cap. Semifinal adds a bit of extra pressure, we just wanted to repeat what we have done throughout the tournament."

TossDetails: Australia Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Icc Mens World Cup 2023
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello, Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the live match commentary of the grand finale of the ICC World Cup 2023 at the illustrious Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad! The cricketing world converges on this vibrant city, Favorites India undefeated throughout the league, faces the mighty Australians in a historic showdown.
India's journey in the tournament has been nothing short of stupendous, with each player contributing to an undefeated streak that has captivated fans worldwide. Now, the stage is set for an epic clash, where skill, strategy, and sheer determination will define the next world champion.
Adding to the excitement, after 7546 days, India and Australia find themselves facing each other in a World Cup final, reminiscent of their iconic clash in 2003. With all three previous world cups have been won by the home nation, Can't wait for this amazing spectacle!..

Buckle up your seats for this heavy-weight clash between India and  Australia – the ICC World Cup 2023 finals at the Narendra Modi Stadium promises a spectacle that will be etched in cricketing history! NUMBER 3 LOADING????

 

VENUE STATS:

Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad.
1st Innings Average Score - 240
Highest Target Chased - 283
Wicket Split
Pace - 63%
Spin - 37%


HEAD TO HEAD (ICC ODI WORLD CUPS):
India - 5
Australia- 8

 

PITCH REPORT:

RAVI SHASTRI: "It Seems pretty dry on the surface. There are some patches, especially in the spots of spinners.  Batting first and putting runs on the board is a great thing but a team like India that has all departments covered won't be bothered."

 

 

TOSS:
AUSTRALIA WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD.

 

Pat Cummins(Australia Captain): "Looks like this is a dry wicket and we chose to field first. Dew is one factor and it is quite dewy in the evening at this venue. Have been really proud of the bunch. Tough start to the tournament but they haven't looked back since. Same team for us!"


Rohit Sharma(India Captain): "I would have batted first if we would have won the toss. This is a big game and runs on the board would be the way. It's going to be superb. We have to keep ourselves calm. It's a great feeling and it's a dream come true to captain India in the final of the World Cup. We're playing the same XI!"
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-
IND - 80/2 (8 rpo, 9x4, 3x6) || AUS - 60/3 (6 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle overs (11-40 Overs) :-
IND - 117/3 (3.9 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || AUS - 165/0 (5.5rpo, 13x4, 4x6)

Death overs (41-50 Overs) :-
IND - 43/5 (4.3 rpo, 2x4, 0x6) || AUS - 16/1 (5.3rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

In this thrilling World Cup final at Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium, Australia emerged victorious against India, securing their sixth World Cup title. Australia Winning the toss and opting to bat first, India faced a formidable Australian bowling attack. Despite facing early setbacks, Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul anchored the innings with gritty half-centuries, guiding India to a competitive total of 240 runs. Australia's bowlers, led by Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood, showcased their prowess, putting up a disciplined performance to restrict India. The Indian innings featured notable contributions from Rahul, Rohit, and Virat Kohli, who scored a crucial fifty. Chasing the target, Australia encountered a masterclass from Travis Head, who played a sensational knock of 137 runs. Head's innings, characterized by 15 boundaries and 4 sixes, proved to be the turning point, earning him the well-deserved Player of the Match award. Despite India's spirited efforts, the Australian middle-order, featuring Marnus Labuschagne, played sensible cricket to secure the victory with seven overs to spare. While Australia celebrated their triumph, the final showcased the resilience of the Indian team, providing cricket fans with a riveting encounter between two cricketing powerhouses. The clash added another memorable chapter to the historic rivalry between India and Australia, leaving fans eagerly anticipating future battles on the cricket field.

 

Travis Head (Man of the Match):" What an amazing day it is! Just super thrilled to be a part of this team. It's a lot better than seeing the World Cup from home. I was a little bit nervous initially but Marnus played exceptionally well and took up all the pressure. I feel the way Marsh took the game on setting the tone and that was the energy we needed. It was a great option to bowl first and the pitch got better as the game progressed. Again, it is something that I work hard on, and nice to hold on and give it all in front of a full house crowd. "

 

VIRAT KOHLI IS THE MAN OF THE TOURNAMENT .  765 RUNS IN 11 INNINGS 

 

Rohit Sharma (India Captain): "I mean the result has not gone our way and we know that we are not 100% today. But proud of this bunch. Honestly, 20-30 runs would have been effective. I thought when Rahul and Virat were batting, we were looking at the score of 270-280 at that point and wickets fell in continuous intervals. Australia had a huge partnership after losing three wickets initially. With 240 on the scorecard, we wanted initial wickets but huge credit to Head and Labuschagne. The wicket got better to bat under the lights.  We knew under lights, it'd be better but do not want to give that as an excuse. Credit to Australian batters for that 3rd wicket partnership.

 

Pat Cummins (Australia Captain): "I think we saved our best for the final. We have been defending the totals in the whole tournament and we thought it was a great night to chase the target. Magnificent. Marnus has a cool head and Head does what he does on the huge stage, Head shows a lot of character in him. I was pretty happy throughout the bowling. If you look around it is a special moment. You have to go out there and win the World Cup, you cannot wait for this to happen."

GroundName: Dr YS Rajasekhara Reddy ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium
TossDetails: India Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Australia Tour Of India T20I Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Just three days after the completion of the World Cup 2023 we welcome you to the live Commentary of the first T20 I which is to be played between the same two nations that competed for the highest glory in World Cricket. Although the sides would miss a number of players who participated in the finals and the format is also not the same, but as they say this part of the World can never get enough Cricket and one can definitely expect a sellout at the Dr. Y.S. Rajasekhara Reddy Cricket Stadium in Visakhapatnam. The Men in Blue has a new leader in Suryakumar Yadav who will steer a young contingent in the absence of Hardik Pandya. Yashasvi Jaiswal, Ishan Kishan, and Ruturaj Gaikwad make the top order look explosive while Sky, Rinku Singh, and Jitesh Sharma are more than formidable on any given day. Axar Patel and Ravi Bishnoi will be in charge of the Spin attack while Arshdeep Singh and Prasidh Krishna minding the pace department. The Side looks inexperienced but is eager to get out there and express themselves against a very strong Australian unit that has retained quite a few of the players from the World Cup Campaign. Some big names in the Matthew Wade-led Aussie side include Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis, Steven Smith, and the man of the finals Travis Head. It will be a sheer test of Character for the more than capable Indian Stars going up against a resourceful Australian Unit which is a serious threat in any conditions. 

 


Head to Head: India and  Australia have faced each other 25 times in T20Is out of which India has won 15 while Australia has been victorious on 10 occasions. 

 

 

Pitch Report: It seems like a good hard wicket, super flat and good to bat on, there is a good sheen and the ball will come onto the bat nicely. 180 can prove to be a winning score on this track.

 

 

TOSS:
INDIA WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO

 

Suryakumar Yadav (India Captain) : "We will bowl first. The wicket looks good, the dew should come later and should make the pitch better. It's a little difficult, but there's always light at the end of the tunnel. Lots of positives and looking forward to the series. The guys have played a lot of franchise and domestic cricket, just told them to express themselves and enjoy themselves. Washington, Shivam, and Avesh are sitting out."

 

Matthew Wade (Australia Captain) : "We would have bowled first as well, looks a bit tacky and dew could come later. Always an opportunity for young players to play in India, just around 10-12 matches for the next WC and we're looking forward to it. Some WC guys are resting - Maxwell, Zampa, and Head are not playing tonight"
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

Australia- 40/1 (6.6 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)  || India- 63/2 (10.5 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

Australia- 111/0 (12.3 rpo, 7x4, 8x6)  || India- 92/2 (10.2 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

Australia- 57/2 (11.4 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)  || India- 54/4 (12.0 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

 

 

In a thrilling encounter, India clinched a narrow victory against Australia in the first T20 match. Australia, batting first, set a formidable target of 208, thanks to a spectacular century (110 off 50 balls) from Josh Inglis and a solid half-century from Steven Smith. Their innings were characterized by aggressive batting and strategic partnerships. India's response was led by a magnificent knock from Suryakumar Yadav, who scored 80 off 42 balls. His innings, filled with innovative shots and fierce hitting, earned him the Man of the Match title. Ishan Kishan also contributed significantly with 58 runs. The match came down to the wire, with India reaching the target of 209/8 in 20 overs. The last over was particularly dramatic, featuring three run-outs in three consecutive balls, adding to the match's intensity. Rinku Singh's late efforts were crucial in keeping India's chase alive. Despite some economical bowling from Australia, India's relentless batting ensured a victory in this high-scoring game. This match showcased the depth and resilience of both teams, setting a high bar for the remainder of the series. It was a memorable game for both teams, with India's batting prowess ultimately proving decisive.

 

Matthew Wade (Australia Captain): "It was a good match in the end. Inglis got us a score we thought we could defend but the Indians came hard at us. These young Indians play a lot of IPL and T20 cricket. Thought we bowled pretty well, but just couldn’t nail our yorkers, easier said than done especially on a small ground like this. A lot of positives to take out from this game. Inglis was class. We thought we did fairly well, Ellis bowled a big over for us to take it into the final over, it went down to the last ball so it shows how close it was" 

 

Suryakumar Yadav(Indian Captain | Player of the Match ) : "I'm very happy with the way the boys played and their energy. We were put under pressure, but the way everyone showed up was amazing,.Captaining India is a proud moment for me. I thought there would be a bit of dew, but there wasn't. The ground isn't big, and I knew batting would get easier. Our bowlers did really well to keep them to this total. In situations like these, I just tell myself and others like Ishan to enjoy. The atmosphere was amazing, thanks to the crowd. It was great to see how Rinku kept calm in a tailor-made situation for him. Our bowlers' performance after the 16th over was an incredible achievement."

TossDetails: Australia Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Australia Tour Of India T20I Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second match of the Australia tour of India T20I series. Just a couple of days ago, the Indian team created history by chasing their highest T20I score. Will we see another big score today? Will there be any changes in the sides? 7 times batting first teams have won and 10 times batting second teams have won. What will the teams winning the toss would do?

 

TOSS:-

AUSTRALIA WON THE TOSS AND ELECTED TO FIELD FIRST!


Matthew Wade, Australia captain: "We will bowl first as dew will come in later. We played really well the other day, India played a little better. It's just about getting good on a few things. Adam Zampa replaces Behrendorff and Maxwell comes in for Aaron Hardie."


Suryakumar Yadav, India captain: "We also would have bowled first. Chasing would be easy looking at the amount of dew that was there last night. It'll be a new challenge for us, to go out there and put a score and then defend it. The last game gave us a lot of confidence. We will carry the same momentum. Captaincy is a new challenge and responsibility, I'm enjoying it. No changes in our team."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 77/1 (12.8 rpo, 12x4, 2x6) || Australia- 53/3 (8.8 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 87/0 (9.7 rpo, 3x4, 5x6) || Australia- 96/5 (10.7 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 71/3 (14.2 rpo, 4x4, 6x6) || Australia- 42/1 (8.4 rpo, 1x4, 4x6)


India seals the second fixture of the tournament by runs. Considering the due factor, the Australian team opted bowl first. India entered the field to put up a huge score and the openers Y Jaiswal 53(25) and Ruturaj Gaikwad 58(43) started off brilliantly with a partnership of 77 off just 35 deliveries. Ishan Kishan at one down continued the momentum and scored 52 off 32. Rinku Singh then performed his role perfectly by scoring 31* off 9 balls. India put up a big total of 235 runs. N Ellis was the highest wicket-taker of the innings. The Indian bowlers kept taking wickets of the initial four batters. Stoinis (45 off 25), T David (37 off 22) and Matthew Wade (42* off 23)in the middle order scored some runs but couldn't get over the line.


Suryakumar Yadav, India Skipper: "The boys are not under much pressure. I told them to be prepared to bat first. There was a lot of dew. The composure showed by Rinku was brilliant."


Yashasvi Jaiswal is the Player of the Match
 

Yashasvi Jaiswal: "It was really special for me. I was trying to play all my shots. Was trying to be fearless. I have been asked to express myself. I am still learning. I really worked on my fitness. I am trying to develop all my shots."

TossDetails: Australia Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Australia Tour Of India T20I Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the third match of the Australia tour of India T20I series which takes place at Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati. India are leading the series with two victories in two games. Both the matches were high scoring ones and India won one batting first and one bowling first. What will India do if they win the toss? Each match has seen new heros. Who will be today's heros? Wait for the action!!

 

TOSS:-

AUSTRALIA CALLS RIGHT AT THE TOSS AND THEY ELECT TO FIELD FIRST!!


Matthew Wade, Australian Skipper: "We opt to bowl first. Dew should settle in early so I don't think it matters a lot. But it's quite wet already and could only become more wet. We were short in a couple of phases, but the boys are in good shape. Travis Head, Kane Richardson and Jason Behrendorff comes in."


Suryakumar Yadav, Indian Skipper: "We are happy to bat first. The dew willl come along early and that wont make a big difference. We just want to do the same thing, have the game plans and express ourselves. Avesh comes in place of Mukesh."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 43/2 (7.2 rpo, 3x4, 2x6) || Australia- 67/2 (11.2 rpo, 13x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 100/1 (11.1 rpo, 16x4, 1x6) || Australia- 78/3 (8.7 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 79/0 (15.8 rpo, 4x4, 6x6) || Australia- 80/0 (16.0 rpo, 7x4, 5x6)


In the 3rd T20I at Guwahati, Australia clinched a thrilling last-ball victory over India, narrowing the series deficit to 2-1. The match, saw Glenn Maxwell's electrifying century (104* off 48) steer Australia to a successful chase of India's formidable 222/3. Maxwell's heroics in the final over, needing 21 runs, epitomized his aggressive batting throughout the innings, especially crucial after early wickets had left Australia reeling. Earlier, Ruturaj Gaikwad's masterful unbeaten 123 from 57 balls was the backbone of India's innings. His knock, laden with 13 fours and 7 sixes, showcased exceptional batting finesse, propelling India to a daunting total despite losing partners like Suryakumar Yadav (39 off 29) and Ishan Kishan early. The Indian bowling attack, led by Ravi Bishnoi (2/32), initially seemed in control, especially after dismissing key players like Marcus Stoinis and Tim David. However, Maxwell's late onslaught, coupled with the dew factor, tilted the scales in Australia's favor. Australia's thrilling victory in the 3rd T20I has kept them very much alive in the five-match series against India.

 

Suryakumar Yadav, India captain: "The plan was to get Maxwell out as quickly as possible. Australia were always in the game. Axar is an experienced bowler, thought there’s always a chance for an experienced bowler even if it’s a spinner when there’s dew, that is the reason to give him th 19th over. Very proud of my boys."


Matthew Wade, Australia captain: "You dont get much better than that. Injury to Kane Richardson made me to bowl Maxi in the last over. He played brilliantly, got a 100 in his 100th T20I. Thought we were in the game at 190 after the 19th over but the last over went for thirty. All in good fun in the end. The boys are in good spirits, hopefully we can pinch another one in the next game and take it down to the last game."


Glenn Maxwell is the Player of the Match


Glenn Maxwell: "It all went pretty quickly. It was hard for them to bowl yorkers with so much dew. We didn’t really have a number in mind. Knew we would be in the game if we could take it down to the final over. Wade was brilliant out there."

GroundName: Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Cricket Stadium
TossDetails: Australia Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Australia Tour Of India T20I Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
In the upcoming 4th T20I at the Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium in Raipur, India, positioned with a 2-1 lead in the series, is eyeing a series win against Australia. The Aussies, revitalized by their recent victory, look to level the series. Notably, Glenn Maxwell, Australia's standout performer, will be absent from this match. India might introduce Deepak Chahar and Mukesh Kumar for their swing bowling prowess, while Shreyas Iyer is likely to return to the batting lineup. The pitch in Raipur, known for its balanced nature favoring pacers, sets the stage for a strategic contest. With an average first innings score of 147, the toss could play a pivotal role. The historical edge lies with India, who has won 17 of their 29 T20I encounters against Australia. This match presents an opportunity for both teams to fine-tune strategies and player roles in preparation for upcoming global T20 contests.


Pitch Report:
Murali Kartik and Matthew Hayden: "The wicket looks good, well rolled, hard and has a nice grass coverage. It's uniform 74m all around the ground. Dew should be a factor and the captain winning the toss would choose to bowl first."

 

TOSS:-

MATTHEW WADE CALLS RIGHT AT THE TOSS AND AUSTRALIA WILL BOWL FIRST!!


Matthew Wade, Australian Skipper: "We will bowl here. We have got a few changes - Marcus Stoinis, Glenn Maxwell, Jos Inglis, Kane Richardson and Nathan Ellis are all out. Everyone gets an exciting opportunity."


Suryakumar Yadav, Indian Skipper: "We would have bowled as well. But our batting unit has been firing well. First T20I here, let's see how it goes, very excited. We also have changes for us as Mukesh comes in for Prasidh, Deepak Chahar comes in for Arshdeep, Shreyas replaces Tilak and there is one more change."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

India- 50/1 (8.3 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || Australia- 52/3 (8.7 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

India- 79/3 (8.8 rpo, 3x4, 5x6) || Australia- 56/2 (6.2 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

India- 45/5 (9.0 rpo, 4x4, 1x6) || Australia- 46/2 (9.2 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)

 

India wins the match by 20 runs and also seals the series 3-1 now, with one match remaining on Sunday. Australia won the toss and opted to field first with dew being considered a factor. Jaiswal and R Gaikwad provided a platform by scoring (37 off 28) and (32 off 28) after which India lost their vice-skipper and skipper early. Rinku Singh (46 off 29) and Jitesh Sharma (35 off 19) in the middle put up 56 run partnership which led the team to post a total of 174 runs. In the second innings, Travis Head opened the innings powerfully scoring 31 off 16 but as soon as the spinners stepped in, they kept on taking wickets and put the opposition under pressure. Then wickets fell one by one! M Wade (36* off 23) fired but couldn't finish the game well. Axar Patel was the highest wicket-taker with three wickets. 


Matthew Wade, Australian skipper: "We did not play spin well. We lost a few wickets in the middle as well. The guys came in and did a good job with the ball but unfortunately, we couldn't bat well. We just want to continue to learn from the guys who are already established in the team. To have depth in the squad is really key as the T20 World Cup is around the corner."


Suryakumar Yadav, Indian Skipper: "Everything went well other than the toss. The Boys showed character and that was most important for us. We spoke in the meeting before the game to go out and express and be fearless. Axar under bowled superbly. The plan was to go for the Yorkers and then see what happens."


Axar Patel is the Player of the Match


Axar Patel: "I was trying a lot of things and it came out well today. I stuck to my strengths. To stay attacking and be mentally strong is important. During the break, I focussed on improving myself and adding new variations to my bowling."

TossDetails: Australia Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: Australia Tour Of India T20I Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
In the final showdown of the India-Australia T20I series at Bengaluru's M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, India, already having won the series, leading 3-1, will seek to conclude the series on a high note. This 5th T20I is more than a mere formality; it's a crucial juncture for Suryakumar Yadav's team to refine their strategies ahead of their tour to South Africa. This is where the road to T20 World Cup 2024 begins. Conversely, Australia will aim for a consolation victory to end the series positively.

Historically, India holds a significant advantage over Australia in T20 Internationals, with a 60% win rate in 30 games. This match presents a strategic battleground, testing India's depth and versatility against Australia's determination and skill.

The batsman-friendly pitch at Bengaluru, typically offering a flat surface conducive to high scores, sets the stage for an expected run feast. This finale is more than a contest of cricketing skills; it's a testament to T20 cricket's dynamic nature, where adaptability, strategy, and individual brilliance converge. Key players from both teams are under the spotlight, carrying the expectations of delivering impactful performances that set the tone for their upcoming international fixtures.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:

In 30 games, India - 18. Australia - 11.

 

VENUE STATS (2023):

AVERAGE 1st INNINGS SCORE: 196/6

AVERAGE 1st INNINGS WINNING SCORE: 198/7

HIGHEST SCORE SUCCESSFULLY CHASED: 212

 

PITCH REPORT:
Deep Dasgupta and Matthew Hayden: "It's a high scoring venue. It has one of the quick outfield. It is very quick and it isn't big. The Square boundaries are 66 and 65 metres, the straight one is 76 metres. It's a very good wicket to bat on. On a fullish length, it's quite dry and it tends to turn a bit. Maybe it can behave inconsistent with both pace and bounce. Don't think there'll be dew factor involved in this game. India will look to bat first, put the middle order of Australians under pressure with a scoreboard pressure because of the nature of the pitch."

 

TOSS:-

MATTHEW WADE CALLS RIGHT AT THE TOSS AND AUSTRALIA WILL BOWL FIRST!!

 

Matthew Wade, Australian Skipper: "There's some rain in the air, and the wicket seems tacky, which is why we chose to field first. Nathan Ellis is coming in for Green. It's a great opportunity for our young players to step up, especially since a lot of the World Cup players have gone home. It's an exciting time, and we're looking forward to having some stability in the team."

 

Suryakumar Yadav, Indian Skipper: "We would have loved to bowl first. I've told the team to not change anything. It's another opportunity to play in front of an amazing crowd, so the message is just to go and enjoy. For the batting unit, I've emphasized believing and executing. There's a change in our lineup; Arshdeep comes in for Deepak Chahar, who has flown back home due to a medical emergency."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 42/2 (7.0 rpo, 4x4, 2x6) || Australia- 50/2 (8.3 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):- 

India- 66/3 (7.3 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) || Australia- 66/2 (7.3 rpo, 2x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):- 

India- 52/3 (10.4 rpo, 3x4, 2x6) || Australia- 38/3 (7.6 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

 

In the thrilling finale of the India-Australia T20I series at Bengaluru, Australia won the toss and elected to field, setting the stage for a high-octane contest. India set a competitive total, bolstered by significant contributions from their batting lineup. The match reached a dramatic climax in the final over, with India's Harshadeep Singh displaying exceptional skill and nerve to defend 10 runs. His performance under immense pressure was crucial in clinching India's victory. The series concluded with India showcasing their depth and talent , winning the series 4-1.

 

Matthew Wade(Australia Captain) - "I think we bowled quite well overall. It's disappointing, though, how we performed with the bat in the last five or six overs. There's always this temptation to move up the order, particularly against the spinners. My role is to steer the team through situations like we faced tonight. We've played some solid cricket in this series. McDermott, for instance, has really bounced back. It's tough playing in conditions like these."

 

Axar Patel (Player of the Match)-"Today's match was really enjoyable for me. Unlike the first four matches where there was dew, today's wicket was just perfect for my style. It took a couple of games, but I've found my rhythm now. Bowling alongside Ravi Bishnoi, who I've played with in Gujarat, works well for us. We complement each other's styles, and I'm looking forward to seeing how our partnership develops."

 

Ravi Bishnoi (Player of the Series)-"In the first match, I didn't bowl, so I just concentrated on executing my plans effectively. My approach is straightforward - to bowl stump-to-stump. Regarding the upcoming South Africa series, it's a different wicket and a different challenge, but I'll try to adapt as quickly as possible."

 

Suryakumar Yadav(India Captain) - "Yeah, it was a great series from the start. We definitely aimed to be fearless and enjoy our time in the middle, so I'm really happy with how that turned out. Having watched numerous games at Chinnaswamy, I know that a total in the range of 160-175 can be quite tricky to chase here."

CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa T20 Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
THE MATCH IS ABANDONED DUE TO RAIN (WITHOUT A BALL BEING BOWLED)! THE WAIT TO SEE THE INDIAN CRICKET TEAM IN ACTION, IN SOUTH AFRICA, CONTINUES! STAY TUNED FOR UPDATES ABOUT THE 2ND T20I!

 

As the men in blue gear up to face South Africa in today's 1st T20I clash, the anticipation is palpable. Fresh off a commanding series win over Australia, the Indian team, now under Suryakumar Yadav's leadership, is brimming with confidence. The series against South Africa offers a new challenge and an opportunity for India to test their mettle against a formidable opponent in tough South African conditions. The match, set to take place at Kingsmead in Durban, promises a thrilling contest. The conditions at Durban, often influenced by the coastal weather, might play a crucial role in the game's dynamics. Reports tell us that it has been raining in Durban. For India, this series is not just about continuing their winning momentum but also about fine-tuning their squad composition and strategy ahead of more significant challenges like the 2024 T20 World Cup. The focus will be on young talents stepping up and seasoned players providing stability. South Africa will look to leverage their home advantage and counter India's strengths. As the teams prepare for the clash, the cricketing world eagerly awaits to see how the strategies unfold and which players rise to the occasion in this exciting T20 matchup.

Commentss: South Africa Won by 5  Wickets  (D/L Method)
TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa T20 Series 2023-24
Comments: South Africa Won by 5  Wickets  (D/L Method)
PreMatchCommentary:
Greetings and a warm reception to the live commentary of the second game in the three-match T20I series between India and South Africa at St George's Park, Gqeberha. The first match of the series was called off without a single delivery due to rain. There are rain predictions here too but will the rain gods be considerate today? With only two matches remaining in the T20 series, who will win this fixture tonight?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
India and South Africa have clashed in 24 T20 matches and India leads the series with 13 wins and South Africa with 10 victories.

 

VENUE STATS:
St George's Park, Gqeberha
Average 1st innings Score: 130
Pacer's Average: 28
Spinner's Average: 19.4
Highest Total: 179  
Bat first wins: 4
Bat second wins: 4

 

TOSS:

SOUTH AFRICA WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO BOWL FIRST!!

 

Aiden Markram, South Africa Skipper: "We decide to bowl first, considering the pitch has been covered for a large part of the day, which likely means the ball will swing. Every match is crucial for us to adjust and prepare for the 2024 T20 World Cup. We're aiming for a strong start in today's game. My role involves assessing whether any players require a break. No players are making their debut in this match."

 

Suryakumar Yadav, India Skipper: "I'm delighted to be here and excited about the cricket action. We were initially unsure of our strategy, but now we're thrilled to have the chance to bat first. This game presents an opportunity for all the players involved. With the World Cup still 5-6 months away, the key message to the team is to simply enjoy the game."
PostMatchCommentary:
South Africa chose to field first after winning the toss, considering the forecast of rain during the game. India faced early setbacks, losing both openers for zero runs. Tilak Varma, batting third, managed 29 runs from 20 balls. Then, a critical 70-run stand between Captain Suryakumar Yadav, who scored 56 off 36, and Rinku Singh, with an unbeaten 68 off 39, propelled India to 180/7 in 19.3 overs. However, rain caused a disruption, leading to a revised target of 152 runs in 15 overs for South Africa. In their innings, Reeza Hendricks scored 49 runs, and Aiden Markram added 30, bringing the team close to the target. T Stubbs and A Phehlukwayo successfully clinched the match for South Africa, with 7 balls to spare.

 

Suryakumar Yadav, Indian skipper: "Their exceptional batting initially shifted the game in their favor. It reflects the style of cricket, we want to play freely and express ourselves. Handling the wet ball was challenging, but such scenarios are likely to recur, providing us with valuable learning opportunities."


Tabraiz Shamsi is the player of the match


Tabraiz Shamsi: "Performing well under pressure against India feels rewarding. Aiden's strategic alterations were outstanding. Ever since Rob joined, he's fostered a great team atmosphere. This approach is clearly reflected in our on-field performance."

 

Aiden Markram, South Africa Captain: "We had a fantastic crowd today, and it was great to perform well in their presence. The pitch was a bit slow initially, but it picked up pace after the rain. If a particular matchup is effective, we stick with it. Reeza Hendricks has been outstanding. I'm really pleased for him. With the World Cup approaching, we're focusing on players in form. This healthy competition is very important to us."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa T20 Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the enthralling climax of the India-South Africa T20 series at the iconic New Wanderers Stadium in Johannesburg. After a rain-drenched opener and a riveting second match, the series stands evenly poised. Both teams, armed with dynamic squads, are set to battle under partly cloudy skies, with the weather gods hopefully favoring cricket today. It's a showdown not to be missed, as both India and South Africa aim to clinch the series in what promises to be a spectacular finale. Who will emerge victorious in this thrilling decider? Stay tuned for a great cricketing spectacle.

 

HEAD TO HEAD ( Last 5 T20Is )
South Africa (3) - India (1)

 

VENUE STATS
The Wanderers Stadium, Johannesburg 
Average 1st Innings Score: 173 
Highest Run Chase: 236
Bat First Wins: 15
Bat Second Wins: 17

 

PITCH REPORT

Pommie Mbangwa: "The pitch is quite dry and there's a bit of grass cover. It's been extremely hot here, so I'm anticipating a high-scoring game with plenty of sixes. This pitch looks very promising for batters, so expect a feast of runs today."

 

TOSS 
South Africa won the toss and elected to field 

 

Aiden Markram| the South African captain: We've decided to bowl first again today. The pitch is fresh, and we're confident in our ability to chase, just like we did the other night. Of course, we recognize there are areas in our game where we can improve, and this match presents a great opportunity for us to work on those aspects. I'm optimistic about our chances and looking forward to seeing how we perform tonight. 

 

Suryakumar Yadav (SKY) | India captain: "I wanted us to bat first and put a good total on the board for us to defend. The pitch looks really good, and I don't anticipate it changing much during the course of the game. We're aiming to play a fearless brand of cricket, which is what the team is focusing on. There were a lot of positives from the last game that we want to build on in this match."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

India- 62/2 (10.33 rpo, 7x4, 4x6) || South Africa - 42/3 (7 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):-

India- 82/1 (9.1 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)  || South Africa - 53/7 (5.88 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):-

India- 58/4 (11.6 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

 

India secured a resounding victory by scoring over 200 runs and successfully defending their total. The T20I series is now level at 1-1, with both teams showing competitive spirit ahead of the T20 World Cup. Key highlights include Suryakumar Yadav's excellent form, Yashasvi Jaiswal's rising talent, and Kuldeep Yadav's impressive performance. The Indian bowlers capitalized on favorable conditions, with Mohammed Siraj swinging the ball, seam movement, and spin contributing to their success in Johannesburg. This win was crucial after the first match was washed out and the second was lost to South Africa.

 

 

Aiden Markram| the South African captain: I wasn't too disappointed with our attempt to chase down 200 runs. It felt like a reachable target, albeit on the lower side. While fielding, it seemed like the batters had the ability to score freely. Although there's room for improvement, there are several positives to take from the last game. We've identified a couple of areas where we can do better and a few things that went well. 

 

Suryakumar Yadav, the Player of the Match and Player of the Series : I'm feeling great about my performance, and it's always a special feeling, especially when it contributes to a win. Our team's focus was on playing fearless cricket, and we wanted to set a target and defend it. I'm proud of the team's hard work and character on display. As for me, I'm always driven to improve; I see it as a birthday gift to myself. Understanding your own game is crucial, and I simply go out there to enjoy myself while maintaining the right balance.

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Odi Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the live coverage of the first ODI of India vs South Africa, set to unfold at The Wanderers Stadium in Johannesburg. This series opener is not just a game; it's a narrative of rising talents and strategic prowess. KL Rahul, leading India, brings a youthful yet experienced side. This presents an opportunity for emerging stars like Ruturaj Gaikwad and Sai Sudharsan to shine. South Africa, captained by Aiden Markram, boasts a formidable lineup with the likes of David Miller and Rassie van der Dussen. The addition of uncapped Nandre Burger adds an element of surprise to their bowling attack. The pitch at "Bull Ring", typically favorable for batting, might offer some assistance to bowlers due to recent rainfall, adding a twist to the tale. Reflecting on their last encounter at the World Cup 2023, both teams are well aware of the high stakes. Key battles to watch include India's young batsmen against South Africa's pace attack and the duel between Indian spinners and the Proteas' middle order.

Head-to-Head 
In ODIs, India and South Africa have faced each other 91 times. South Africa holds an advantage with 50 wins, while India has won 38 matches. Three matches ended with no result.

Venue Stats (ODIs)

Average 1st Innings Score: 241
Highest Total: 439
Bat First Wins: 23
Bat Second Wins: 30 

 

PITCH REPORT 

Pommie Mbangwa: "We're playing on a pitch that was last used a few days ago. The dimensions are notable - 77 meters straight down the ground, with the square boundaries at 59 and 69 meters. It's a dry surface, typical of a used pitch. Given these conditions, the team winning the toss would likely opt to bat first, aiming to stack up the runs early. There are a few cracks on the surface, but they haven't opened up significantly. The grass present is primarily to keep the pitch intact. On this ground, 270 runs is the average score, but in the last five ODIs, it's been around 298. Teams will want to aim higher than that, avoiding falling below these figures. The strategy should be to bat first and aim for a high total."


TOSS UPDATE 

South Africa Won the toss and elected to bat first 

 

Aiden Markram | South Africa Captain: "I'm opting to bat first, considering the wicket has been used before. "It's a fantastic day, notably the pink day, and I'm hopeful that both teams will deliver a memorable performance. We're introducing a debutant today - Nandre Burger. It's thrilling to offer opportunities to some talented players; they must seize these moments and stake their claims."

KL Rahul | India Captain: "It's the Pink ODI, a standout event in South Africa I've always admired. Eager for today's gripping game. The pitch is spin-friendly and ideal for tactical play. Excited for Sai Sudharsan's debut. Our team boasts IPL-experienced players like Ruturaj, the exciting Tilak, and Sanju. Spinners Axar and Kuldeep are ready to shine. These players, seasoned in high-pressure situations, bring invaluable IPL experience. I'm optimistic for top-notch performances today."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs):-

 

South Africa - 52/4 (5.2 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || India 61/1 (6.1 rpo,9x4,0x6)

 

Middle Overs (11-40) 

South Africa - 64/6 (3.7 rpo , 6x4,2x6) || India 56/1 (8.4 rpo,7x4,1x6)

 

India complete a dominating victory against South Africa, winning by 8 wickets to take a 1-0 series lead. Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan dominated with the ball from the start, with Arshdeep Singh taking his maiden 5 wicket haul and Avesh Khan picking up 4 wickets from the other end, to bundle out South Africa for 116. In the chase, debutant Sai Sudharsan scored a half-century and Shreyas Iyer continued his blistering form to score yet another fifty to take India past the target in just 16.4 overs.

 

Aiden Markram, South Africa Captain: "Winning the toss and batting first we would have wanted to bat well. Credit to the Indian bowlers, we were behind from the very first ball. We need to take smart options in a given situation."

 

KL Rahul, India Skipper: "Good to have a win under the belt, completely different to what we expected. The plan was to get the spinners in the game. The boys did well to stay disciplined and the ball kept moving around. Everyone is performing and trying to do well for the country. Good chance for them to get a taste of international cricket."

 

Arshdeep Singh is the Player of the Match

 

Arshdeep Singh, Player of the Match: "Loving this moment. Thankful to God and the team management. It was a little different than normal grounds as I was running out of breath. Personally, it feels good, I am enjoying my role.I guess it is about enjoying this moment."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Odi Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the second game of the ODI series between India and South Africa, taking place at St George's Park, Gqeberha. In the opening match, India clinched a comfortable victory, limiting their opponents to just 116 runs and reaching the target in under 17 overs. It remains to be seen whether the teams will stick to their previous line-ups or introduce any changes to their starting elevens today.


VENUE STATS:-
St George's Park, Gqeberha 
In last 5 ODIs,
Toss Decisions 
Batting First - 2
Batting Second - 3
Average Score - 215
Pacer's Avg - 37.7 ; Spinner's Avg - 30.4


Toss:-
South Africa won the toss and elected to field!

 

Aiden Markram, South African Skipper: "We've decided to bowl first. Want to make the most of the fresh wicket and the new ball. With the wind, we're hoping it supports our bowling. We're always keen to challenge ourselves by chasing in this format. Today's a new day, and we're ready to give it our all. We've made two changes to our lineup Beuran and Lizaad are coming in."

 

KL Rahul, Indian Skipper: "I'm uncertain about the pitch's behavior, we'll just have to observe as the game progresses. It appears to be a good wicket. With three ODIs happening in rapid succession, staying focused on the upcoming games is crucial. We have one change in our lineup as Shreyas has returned to the Test team, and Rinku is set to make his ODI debut."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 46/1 (4.6 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || South Africa- 39/0 (3.9 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 132/3 (4.4 rpo, 12x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 165/1 (5.5 rpo, 15x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 33/6 (5.2 rpo, 2x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 11/1 (4.4 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)

 

Winning the toss, South Africa chose to bowl first on a pitch expected to improve as the evening progressed. In only his second ODI, Sai Sudharsan impressively notched up back-to-back fifties, even after losing his partner Ruturaj early on. The captain, batting at number four, played a pivotal innings of 56 off 64 balls, propelling the team's total past the 200 mark. Nandre Burger emerged as the top bowler of the innings, claiming three wickets. The second innings saw a solid opening stand of 130 runs. Tony De Zorzi achieved his first-ever century, and significant contributions from R Hendricks (52 off 81) and R Van Der Dussen (36 off 51) enabled the team to comfortably reach the target with 7 overs to spare.

 

KL Rahul, Indian Skipper: "Winning the toss might have been advantageous, considering the pitch assistance in the first half. It was a tough pitch, but Sai and I were well-settled. A big century from either of us could have added 50-60 more runs, a key takeaway for future games. A target around 240 would have been ideal, but unfortunately, we lost wickets at crucial times while the pitch continued to offer help. Missing out on a catch was a setback. We aim to leave what happens in the game behind and concentrate on the upcoming matches."

 

Tony De Zorzi is the player of the match


Tony De Zorzi: "I'm okay, just feeling a bit stiff. Honestly, it was an overwhelming mix of emotions.  There were many doubters, and it feels great to prove them wrong. Rob and JP had a chat with me about their expectations for me as an opener. I consider myself adaptable, especially in adjusting to different conditions. It probably hasn't fully hit me yet.  It's a moment I'll always cherish."

 

Aiden Markram, South African Skipper: "Significantly improved from our last outing. We showed a stronger overall game. The pitch was still challenging during our chase, but our openers did a fantastic job battling through. The wind was a notable factor today. Nandre, with the wind at his back, he really fired in those deliveries. We varied our approach considerably, focusing on bowling in the right areas with excellent execution. Tony de Zorzi's performance was monumental, especially considering his limited experience. To remain not out and lead the chase is an extraordinary achievement. Today, whatever target was set, our mindset was to chase it down confidently. We're definitely a more self-assured team after this match."

TossDetails: South Africa Won The Toss And Elected To Field
TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
CompetitionName: India Tour Of South Africa Odi Series 2023-24
PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the live action of the third and final do-or-die encounter between South Africa and India at Boland Park in Paarl. Both teams have won one game each and would look to seal the series in the third game.Markram & co broke the 10-match unbeaten streak of KL Rahul courtesy of a brilliant century from Tony de Zorzi who scored 119* including 15 boundaries while for India, Sai Sudharsan was brilliant with the bat in his debut series scoring back-to-back half-centuries. It will be an interesting clash going ahead.


HEAD TO HEAD: 
In an overall 93 games played between the two teams, South Africa has an edge over India with 51 wins while the Men in Blue have managed to win 39 times. Three games have not yielded results. 
In South Africa they have played each other 39 times with India winning 11 and losing 26 games, two games ended in no result.

 

TOSS:

SOUTH AFRICA WON THE TOSS AND THEY ELECT TO FIELD FIRST!!

 

 

Aiden Markram, South Africa Skipper: "We opt to bowl first. Looks like a good wicket, doesn't seem to change too much. We want to keep challenging ourselves. We will try to take wickets regularly and restrict them to a low total. Expect to do more of the same we did in the previous game. The dimensions here are different, so running hard between wickets will be key. We are going with the same xi."

 

KL Rahul, Indian Skipper: "Not really bothered by being put to bat first. The wicket will be even for both innings. We got ourselves to a good position in the previous game but ended up losing 5 wickets for 40 odd runs. Once we get a good start, we have to make use of it. Today is another opportunity for the boys to prove themselves. This looks like a much better wicket than the previous two. Hopefully we can get plenty of runs today. We have two changes as Rajat Patidar makes his ODI debut and replaces Ruturaj. Kuldeep gets a rest and Washington Sundar comes in."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-10 Overs) :-

India- 59/2 (5.9 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) || South Africa- 62/1 (6.2 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (11-40 Overs) :- 

India- 144/1 (4.8 rpo, 10x4, 2x6) || South Africa- 136/6 (4.5 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (41-50 Overs) :- 

India- 93/5 (9.3 rpo, 6x4, 5x6) || South Africa- 20/3 (5.5 overs, 4.5 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

In today's decisive match of the ODI series, South Africa, winning the toss, chose to bowl first. Their pacers performed admirably, removing both Indian openers in the initial powerplay. However, a solid and crucial partnership of 116 runs in 136 balls between Sanju Samson and Tilak Varma (52 off 77) stabilized the innings. Sanju Samson scored an impressive 108 off 114 deliveries, marking his first ODI century. Rinku Singh's dynamic 38 off 27 helped India reach a competitive total of 296 runs. In their pursuit, R Hendricks and T De Zorzi put up an opening partnership of 59 runs. Though T De Zorzi contributed a significant 81 off 87, the standout performance was Arshdeep's remarkable four-wicket haul. India clinched the match by 78 runs and secured the series with a 2-1 victory.

 

Aiden Markram, South Africa Captain: "We were definitely geared up for this series decider, a great venue, and a supportive crowd. Sadly, we couldn't pull through in the end. We had our moments, but we just couldn't maintain momentum in our favor consistently. The pitch remained fairly consistent throughout the match, and a target of 290 seemed achievable. We performed well with the ball. I don't believe the toss had a significant impact on the game today. Looking ahead, the Test series is thrilling, with two fantastic venues for the matches here in South Africa – it really doesn't get much better than this."


Sanju Samson is the player of the match


Sanju Samson: "I'm really proud of it, especially given the outcome of the match. I've been putting in a lot of effort, not just in the past few months, so seeing the results is good. This format allows a bit more time to get a feel for the pitch and understand the bowler's strategy. Batting higher in the order gives the advantage of those extra 10-20 deliveries. The entire nation is proud of how Tilak Verma has risen to the occasion. The veterans in Indian cricket have set high benchmarks, and the younger players are stepping in and delivering."


Arshdeep Singh is the player of the series


Arshdeep Singh: "The pitch offered something all day long, with the ball occasionally gripping and halting. Our strategy was straightforward: aim for a wicket-to-wicket line to increase the chances of LBWs and bowled dismissals. We're really enjoying the opportunities we've been given. We're eager to continue giving our best in the future and strive for success."


KL Rahul, Indian Skipper: "I always love the time spent with the team. It's refreshing to return to cricket after a letdown at the World Cup. My usual advice is to enjoy the game, put in your best effort. These players are talented, but some are new to international cricket, so they need time to adapt. My role is to clarify their responsibilities, and they've all given their all. Sanju has been an outstanding performer. He hasn't had many opportunities to bat higher up the order for various reasons, so it's wonderful to see him succeed today."

PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to the live coverage of the opening match in the two-Test series between South Africa and India at SuperSport Park, Centurion. India, bolstered by their ODI series win and a drawn T20 series, steps onto the field with high spirits and a formidable lineup. The inclusion of stalwarts Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma adds significant strength and experience to the team. They aim to translate their white-ball success into the longer format and secure a historic series win on South African soil, a feat yet to be achieved by the side.

 

Head-to-Head:

South Africa and India have faced each other in 42 matches, with South Africa holding a slight edge with 17 wins compared to India's 15, while 10 matches have ended in a draw. In South Africa, the teams have clashed 23 times, with the hosts winning 12 and India clinching 4 victories.  

 

PITCH REPORT 

Shaun Pollock and Ravi Shastri observe a healthy grass cover, suggesting teams generally prefer to bat first as the pitch initially plays slower. As the Test unfolds, varying bounce might present challenges, making batting increasingly difficult. Weather conditions may tempt South Africa to forgo a spinner, but sunshine could deepen cracks and invite spin. The pitch's character isn't expected to drastically shift throughout the game. The optimal strategy is to bat first, navigate the initial sessions cautiously, and aim to be no more than two wickets down by Lunch. 

 

TOSS : SOUTH AFRICA WON THE TOSS AND ELECT TO BOWL 

 

Temba Bavuma : "We are opting to bowl first due to the wicket's moisture from being under covers, aiming to leverage it for early breakthroughs. Most of our squad is in peak condition, though Lungi is still getting there. Today, we introduce two debutants, Nandre Burger and David Bedingham, and are going with a four-seamer attack. It's always tough against India, but we're well-prepared and ready to take them on."

 

Rohit Sharma : "I wasn't entirely sure about choosing to bat or bowl, but we're well acquainted with these conditions. Our strategy is to post a competitive total and let our bowlers take over. Despite the overhead conditions and grass, we're ready for the challenge. We've come close in the last two tours, boosting our confidence in our squad's composition. We're playing four seamers and Ashwin as a spinner in place of Jadeja, who has a back spasm. Prasidh is making his debut today, alongside Shardul, Siraj, and Bumrah."
PostMatchCommentary:
DAY 1: India 208/8 (3.5 rpo, 28x4, 3x6) 

DAY 2: India 37/2 (4.3 rpo,4x4, 2x6) || South Africa 256/6 (3.9 rpo , 37x4, 4x6) 

DAY 3 :  South Africa 152/3 (3.7 rpo , 18x4, 0x6) || India 131/10 ( 3.8 rpo, 22x4, 1x4) 

 

In a challenging three-day match, South Africa clinched victory, but not without a resilient fight from India, marked by KL Rahul's commendable century. As South Africa leveraged home advantage, India showed moments of brilliance and potential for adaptation. The series moves forward with both teams looking to capitalize on their strengths, with India keen on rectifying mistakes and harnessing their positives as they head to Johannesburg.

 

 

Rohit Sharma | India Captain"It's clear we weren't good enough; despite a decent start, we couldn't capitalize. KL was exceptional, but as a unit, our batting faltered, especially in the second innings. Each player knows the demands of these conditions, yet our adaptation was inadequate. Not many positives in such a quick finish, but KL's innings stood out. I won't be too harsh on our bowlers, given their limited exposure here. We're determined to regroup and come back stronger; it's about how we rise after a tough loss. We've got to lift ourselves and move forward."

 

 

Dean Elgar | Player of the Match | South Africa Captain" This knock was pretty special. We kept things simple, which is key in a complex game. Forming good partnerships and utilizing our bowlers, including Nadre's standout performance, was crucial. The support from the Pretoria crowd was fantastic. It's just the start, and we're keen to enjoy this win before the next challenge. We aim to maintain our clinical approach, improve on fielding, and carry forward our momentum."

PreMatchCommentary:
Welcome to live coverage of the final match between South Africa and India at Newlands, Cape Town. India is coming off a heavy defeat in the opening match, having lost by an innings and 32 runs. Despite strong individual performances by KL Rahul in the first innings and Kohli in the second, the team's overall performance left much to be desired. This loss means their aspiration to clinch a series win on South African turf is postponed. India aims to make a strong comeback and draw the series. Avesh Khan is expected to make his debut, replacing Prasidh Krishna, and Jadeja is likely to come in for Ashwin, having recovered from his spasm. South Africa enters the game buoyed by their comprehensive victory in the first match. The team will miss Bavuma due to injury, and Elgar will lead in what is his final Test. South Africa is seeking to maintain their form and secure another win.

 

When it comes to head-to-head records in the 43 matches played between these two giants, South Africa has a slight edge with 18 wins compared to India's 15, while 10 matches have ended in a draw. Specifically, in South Africa, out of 24 encounters, the host country has triumphed 13 times, and India has managed 4 victories. 

 

Pitch Report : Sanjay Manjrekar:"There is grass inside the cracks, which might lead the ball to behave as it would on a barren patch. South Africa is a very unique place to bowl, and I feel that seamers will continue to get help on every day of the Test."

 

TOSS : South Africa won the toss and elected to bat first 

 

Dean Elgar : "Going to bat. The pitch looks interesting. We're in a great position. Can't win a two-match series if you don't win the first - we've crossed that hurdle. The scoreboard starts on nought. We all know that. Starting well is going to be key against this Indian side. We've got a debutant in Tristan Stubbs coming in for Temba. Ngidi comes in for Coetzee who's also injured. And Maharaj comes in." 

 

Rohit Sharma : "Would've batted first as well. Looks a good pitch. We understand the challenge of batting first on that pitch, but nevertheless, there will be enough in the pitch for the seamers, so hopefully, we'll cash in on it. It's important to forget what's happened in the past. We understand the importance of getting runs on the board, and getting 20 wickets. Didn't happen in the first game, but we're upbeat about what we can achieve here. Two changes. Jadeja comes back for Ashwin. Shardul misses out, Mukesh Kumar replaces him."
PostMatchCommentary:
DAY ONE

Session 1: South Africa- 55/10 (23.2 Overs, 2.36 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Session 2: India- 111/4 (24 Overs, 4.6 rpo, 16x4, 0x6)

Session 3: India- 42/6 (10.5 Overs, 3.9 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)    ||   South Africa- 62/3 (17 Overs, 3.6 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

 

DAY TWO

Session 1: South Africa- 114/7 (19.5 Overs, 5.9 rpo, 16x4, 2x6)

Session 2: India- 80/3 (12 Overs, 6.7 rpo, 13x4, 0x6)
 

 

 

In a remarkable turn of events at Newlands, India leveled the series with a historic win, becoming the first Asian team to conquer South Africa on this iconic ground. The Test unfolded at a breakneck pace, becoming the shortest completed match in cricket's history, concluding in just over four sessions. Opting to bat, South Africa crumbled to 55 all out in their first innings, their lowest score post-readmission, with Mohammed Siraj delivering a career-best 6 for 15. India initially steadied the ship but then experienced a dramatic collapse, ending at 153, setting a modest lead.Day 2 was no less thrilling. Jasprit Bumrah's early strikes and a collective bowling effort kept the Proteas in check. Aiden Markram stood out with a defiant century in treacherous conditions, giving South Africa a glimmer of hope. However, his dismissal signaled a swift end to their innings, setting India a target of 79. India's top order, despite a few stumbles, chased down the total with Rohit Sharma and Shreyas Iyer steering the ship home.


Dean Elgar Captain|Player of the Series : "This game was tough for us, yet I entered it feeling positive. Though I wish I could've done more here, I'm still very proud of my performance at Centurion and contributing to a win. The conditions were challenging throughout the series. It would have been great to have a 3-Test series to further challenge ourselves against top players like Bumrah, who is truly world-class and deserves recognition. I'm glad I won't have to face this bowling attack again but I'll carry fond memories. We've come a long way since I received my green cap in 2012, and I've hardly missed a series since then. It holds a special place in my heart. As for this series, while a 2-0 win would have been ideal, managing a 1-1 draw is something I'm proud of for the team. The bowlers' performance and Aiden's batting in the second innings were exceptional. The pitch was deceptive, playing very differently than expected and presented a significant learning curve for us. Though India outplayed us in that crucial first session, these experiences only add to the journey, and I'm grateful for every moment spent competing at this level."

 

 

Jasprit Bumrah | Player of the Series: "Newlands will forever hold a special place in my heart, marking the beginning of my journey and filled with fond memories. I'm elated that today went well for us. It all started back in 2018 when our bowling unit was keen to make an impact. In India, it's usually the spinners taking the lead, but our team, now in transition, sees a lot of new bowlers stepping in. Our constant message is about team spirit and resilience. We showed that fight in the last game and continued it here, which requires immense patience. It's a delight to see our efforts come to fruition in this game. The pace at which the match concluded was unexpected, and like our counterparts, we too preferred batting first. Test cricket always has its surprises, making this a fantastic series."

 

 

Mohammed Siraj | Player of the Match: "These are my best figures in my Test career. My focus was on being consistent and targeting the right areas. In the previous match, I wasn't as consistent, leading to conceding extra runs. So, I really worked hard on maintaining consistency and being relentless with my lengths. Playing alongside Bumrah, we understand each other well and quickly adapt to the pitch conditions. A big shout out to the fans — thank you so much for your constant support, please keep it coming!"

 

 

Rohit Sharma| Captain: "It's a great feat. We had a learning curve in Centurion and came back strongly here, especially our bowlers who adapted and executed our plans well. We applied ourselves with the bat to secure a significant lead, though the loss of the last six wickets wasn't ideal. We were aware it might be a short game, so every run was crucial. Siraj's performance was very special and rare. We emphasized on keeping things simple, and he, along with the pitch conditions, did the rest. Immense credit to Siraj, Bumrah, Mukesh, and Prasidh for their remarkable efforts."

PreMatchCommentary:
India and Afghanistan are all set for an exciting three-match T20I series, commencing on 11th January at the IS Bindra Stadium in Mohali. This series holds significant importance for India as it's their final T20I engagement before the upcoming T20 World Cup, scheduled to be held in the USA and West Indies later this year. The Men in Blue, are coming off a mixed tour in South Africa where they clinched the ODI series but had to settle for draws in the other formats.
A major boost for the Indian squad is the return of their seasoned campaigners, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Rohit, taking over the captaincy reins, is returning to the T20 format for the first time since the T20 World Cup in 2022.
Afghanistan, on the other side, is riding high on confidence after securing a 2-1 series victory over the UAE. However, they will face a tough challenge against India, especially in the absence of their regular skipper Rashid Khan. Ibrahim Zadran will be leading the Afghan side in this crucial series. It remains to be seen how Afghanistan, known for their love of the T20 format, will fare against a strong Indian side in these matches.


India vs Afghanistan Head-to-Head: 
Both teams have contested on five occasions with India winning four games and one game ending in no result. Afghanistan are yet to open their account.  

 

 

PITCH REPORT: Deep Dasgupta and Nick Knight - The presence of a green tinge on the grass suggests initial assistance for fast bowlers, particularly with the new ball. However, as the game progresses, the surface is expected to become more conducive to batting, allowing the ball to slide on nicely. Interestingly, fast bowlers have traditionally found this pitch challenging, while spinners have thrived. The unique style of Afghanistan's spinners, who tend to bowl quickly, reduces the reaction time for batters and can rush them into making decisions. This could be a key factor in the match. Lastly, they anticipate no dew impact on the game, as was the case last night, ensuring consistent playing conditions throughout.

 

 

TOSS: India won the toss and elected to field first.  

 

 

Rohit Sharma|India Captain: "We've decided to field first. There's no specific reason behind this choice; the pitch here at Mohali is consistent and doesn’t vary much. These three games are crucial for us, especially since we haven't played much T20 cricket in the lead-up to the World Cup. Of course, there's the IPL, but playing in international matches is a different ball game, and we're keen to make the most of this opportunity. I've had a discussion with Rahul Dravid about our team composition and strategy moving forward. Our focus is on understanding and executing our roles effectively as a unit. However, the ultimate goal remains to win."

 

Ibrahim Zadran|Afghanistan Captain: "We had also hoped to bowl first, but it's not a significant concern for us. Our main objective now is to implement our strategies effectively. This series represents a substantial opportunity for us, particularly as we prepare for the T20 World Cup. We are focusing on playing aggressive and positive cricket, which is crucial for our team's development."
PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

Afghanistan- 33/0 (5.5 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || India- 36/2 (6.0 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Middle overs (7-15 Overs):-

Afghanistan- 72/3 (8.0 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) || India- 95/2 (10.6 rpo, 11x4, 2x6)

Death overs (16-20 Overs):-

Afghanistan- 53/2 (10.6 rpo, 6x4, 2x6) || India- 28/0 (11.2 rpo, 3x4, 1x6) 


 

In a display of cricketing finesse and tactical acumen, India triumphed comfortably over Afghanistan, taking a 1-0 lead in the thrilling three-match T20I series. The match, a spectacle of high-octane cricket, saw Afghanistan post a score of 158, falling short by 25 runs from the venue's average first-innings score. India, showcasing their batting prowess, was poised for a successful chase, despite a tumultuous start.

Afghanistan's innings, had its moments of brilliance, especially the resilient partnership between Omarzai and Nabi. However, India's disciplined bowling, interspersed with moments of brilliance, kept the Afghan score in check. The Indian bowlers, adept in their craft, applied relentless pressure, thereby restricting Afghanistan to a sub-par total.

The Indian innings commenced with a moment of misfortune, as captain Rohit Sharma was run out for a duck, a victim of a communication breakdown. Shubman Gill, after crafting some scintillating shots, succumbed to his aggressive tendencies, leaving India in a precarious position. The resurgence was led by the southpaw duo of Tilak Varma and Shivam Dube, who stitched together a critical 44-run partnership, tipping the scales in India's favor. Amidst these ebbs and flows, the unwavering Shivam Dube emerged as the cornerstone of India's chase. Demonstrating a blend of steadfastness and aggression, Dube carved out boundaries with clinical precision. His innings crescendoed to an unbeaten 60, his highest score in T20Is, marked by a majestic six that sealed the game for India. Dube's innings was not just about the runs but the manner in which he accumulated them, reflecting a maturity that augurs well for India's middle-order.

This victory for India was not just about the numbers on the scoreboard but also about the statement they made. It was a testament to their depth in batting and resilience in bouncing back from challenging situations. The series opener has set the stage for an enthralling contest, with India looking to consolidate their lead and Afghanistan aiming for redemption. 

 

 

Ibrahim Zadran|Afghanistan Captain: "Reflecting on our performance, I feel we were short by about 13-15 runs. Winning the toss might have made a difference, but that's part of the game. Despite this, I'm proud of how the boys fought. Our initial strategy was to get a strong start in the powerplay, but losing early wickets derailed our plans. Ideally, one of us should have stayed at the crease for 14-15 overs, but the frequent loss of wickets put us under pressure, especially the new batters. Regarding our fielding, the second innings did see some challenges due to the dew, which made gripping the ball difficult. However, I must admit we were a bit lax in our fielding today. That's an area we need to improve. As for our batting, we will work on enhancing it too. I don't see any major concerns with our bowling. We'll focus on analyzing and learning from the mistakes we made in this match" 
 

Rohit Sharma|India Captain:"I have to say it was extremely cold out there, more than I expected. My fingers are okay now, but during the match, every time the ball hit the tip of my fingers, it was quite painful. At one point, I couldn't even feel my fingers.Looking back, there were a lot of positives from the game, especially in our bowling department. The conditions weren't the easiest, but I was really impressed with how our spinners performed. About my own dismissal, it's natural to feel frustrated because you always want to contribute and score runs for the team. I was hoping for Gill to continue his good form, but unfortunately, he got out.I'm really pleased with several performances – Shivam Dube's batting was a highlight, and the way Jitesh, Tilak, and Rinku played was also commendable. Looking ahead to the next game, we want to experiment a bit, try some new strategies with our bowlers, like how Washington Sundar bowled the 19th over today. We're open to trying different things, but not at the expense of winning the match."

 Shivam Dube|Player of the Match Talking about the game:" I have to admit it was really cold, but playing on this ground was still an enjoyable experience for me, especially since it's been a long time since I last played. Batting at No. 4 did bring some pressure, but I was determined to stick to my style of cricket. Usually, in the initial few balls, there's a bit of pressure, but once I get past that, I focus solely on the ball and avoid overthinking. I'm confident in my ability to hit big sixes in T20s, so I always feel like I can score runs in any situation."
